Earthrise, an iconic photo showing the earth rising over the moon's horizon, was taken 50 years ago, and changed the way we look at ourselves and our position in the universe. Former astronaut and ISS Commander Chris Hadfield and the crew of the Apollo 8 mission -- and the impact it had.
The Apollo 8 crew spoke with Constellation (www.constellation.earth), a non-profit organization co-founded by astronauts and dedicated to sharing their stories from space.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Best WIRED Autocomplete Moments of 2018 Feat. Liza Koshy, David Dobrik, The Try Guys & More
video:video.video:description: Julia Roberts, Dermot Mulroney, Olivia Munn, Keegan-Michael Key, John Krasinski, Margot Robbie, Saoirse Ronan, Paul McCartney, Anna Kendrick, Blake Lively, Craig Robinson, Aubrey Plaza, Liza Koshy, Nick Kroll, John Mulaney, Mila Kunis, The Try Guys and more answer the web's most searched questions about themselves.

video:video.video:title: John Cena Guesses Famous Robots
video:video.video:description:
Bumblebee star John Cena tests his knowledge on all things related to robots. Can John guess the names of some of the most famous robots in history? Can he guess which are robots and which are humans? Can John design a robot version of himself?
Bumblebee is in theaters December 21, 2018!

video:video.video:title: How Apps like Messenger are Changing the Future of Marketing | WIRED Brand Lab
video:video.video:description: BRANDED CONTENT | Produced by WIRED Brand Lab with Messenger Business | The new frontier of Marketing is here. Wired Contributor, Jakob Schiller sits down with Eric Toda, Head of Marketing for Hill City, to discuss how apps like Messenger are changing the landscape of marketing to become more 1:1.

video:video.video:title: Jennifer Lopez & Leah Remini Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: "Second Act" stars Jennifer Lopez and Leah Remini take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the internet's most searched questions about themselves. Is Jennifer Lopez from the block? Is Leah Remini Mexican? How did Jennifer get the role of Selena? How do you pronounce Leah's last name? Jennifer and Leah answer all these questions and more!

video:video.video:title: How Pixar Helped Win 27 of the Last 30 Oscars for Visual Effects
video:video.video:description: You may not have heard of Renderman, but you've definitely seen the incredible effects it has made possible. From Star Trek to Star Wars, from the Abyss to Terminator 2, and across all of Pixar's animated features -- Renderman has changed the world of special effects.

video:video.video:title: Each and Every - Every Spider-Man Movie & TV Show Explained By Kevin Smith
video:video.video:description:
Kevin Smith takes us through the history of Spider-Man in film and television, from 1978's "Spider-Man Strikes Back" to 2017's "Spider-Man: Homecoming."
Kevin's special, Silent But Deadly is available wherever you rent or buy content (On Demand, iTunes, Google Play, Playstation, Xbox)
Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse is in theaters now

video:video.video:description:

video:video.video:description: "Vox Lux" stars Natalie Portman and Jude Law take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the internet's most searched questions about themselves. What languages can Natalie Portman speak? What was Jude Law's first movie? Where did Natalie go to college? Jude and Natalie answer all these questions and more!

video:video.video:description:
BRANDED CONTENT | Produced by WIRED Brand Lab with AWS |
The future of business is here! WIRED and Amazon Web Services take a deep dive into the world of AI and deep learning to show how significant and impactful they can be for businesses.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - David Dobrik Answers the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description:
David Dobrik takes the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answers the internet's most searched questions about himself. Is David Dobrik from Slovakia? Does David own a Tesla? Who is David's best friend? David answers all these questions and more!
Snapchat: @DavidDobrik

video:video.video:description:
"Mary Queen of Scots" stars Margot Robbie and Saoirse Ronan take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the internet's most searched questions about themselves. Is Margot Robbie British? How do you pronounce Saoirse Ronan? Was Margot in a soap opera? Robbie and Saoirse answer all these questions and more!
"Mary Queen of Scots" is in theaters on December 7

video:video.video:title: Deconstructing Swiss & Japanese Movement Watches
video:video.video:description: Professional watchmaker Ryan Jewell breaks down two different Carpenter watches; one watch with Japanese movement and another with Swiss movement.

video:video.video:title: Obsessed - How a Harvard Professor Uses Toys and Origami to Transform Design
video:video.video:description: Chuck Hoberman's eponymous sphere is one of the best-loved toys of the last quarter century. But it's only one example of his incredible work in transformable design. From adaptive nanotech to flexible building materials, Hoberman has created surprising and inventive designs at every scale.

video:video.video:title: Why It's Almost Impossible to Run 100 Meters In 9 Seconds
video:video.video:description: Usain Bolt is "the world's fastest man" because he has the record for the 100 meter sprint at 9.58 seconds. But could runners go faster? WIRED's Robbie Gonzalez explores the science of extreme sprinting speed.

video:video.video:title: Wish List 2018: WIRED's Gift Guide for the Holidays
video:video.video:description: WIRED's Lauren Goode presents the WIRED Wish List -- a look at all the coolest gadgets for your family and friends.

video:video.video:title: Forgery Experts Analyze a Fake Jackson Pollock Painting
video:video.video:description: Forensic scientist Thiago Piwowarczyk and art historian Jeffrey Taylor PhD examine a purported Jackson Pollock painting and use their expertise to determine if the painting is legitimate or a forgery.

video:video.video:title: Jefferson students are Redefining Humanly Possible
video:video.video:description: Branded Content | Produced By WIRED Brand Lab For Jefferson Follow WIRED as we take a dive into the programs at Jefferson, and profile four innovative and forward-thinking students who are rewriting limits and redefining their fields.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Sarah Silverman & John C. Reilly Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description:
"Ralph Breaks the Internet" stars Sarah Silverman & John C. Reilly take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the internet's most searched questions about themselves. Is Sarah Silverman Canadian? How did John C. Reilly meet Will Ferrell? Is Sarah now a Disney Princess? John and Sarah answer all these questions and more!
"Ralph Breaks the Internet" is in theaters November 5

video:video.video:title: The Samsung Chromebook Plus Launch at WIRED25
video:video.video:description: Produced By WIRED Brand Lab For Samsung Chromebook Plus | In September of 2018, WIRED celebrated our quarter century anniversary with a four day festival in San Francisco. As part of the celebration, we partnered with Samsung and the new Chromebook Plus to explore the new world of the modern, always-on consumer.

video:video.video:title: How Self-Driving Cars Could Become a Reality
video:video.video:description:
Produced by WIRED Brand Lab for AT&T
Self-driving cars are close to becoming a universal reality and connectivity plays a vital part in their operation. The more data a self-driving car can access, the better it can learn to operate safely and efficiently. Learn how AT&T's new mobile 5g network will provide the support necessary for self-driving cars to take the next step from concept to commonplace.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Emily Ratajkowski & Aaron Paul Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description:
"Welcome Home" stars Emily Ratajkowski and Aaron Paul take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the internet's most searched questions about themselves. What is Emily Ratajkowski's diet like? Is Aaron Paul related to Millie Bobby Brown? How do you pronounce Emily Ratajkowski? Aaron and Emily answer all these questions and more!
"Welcome Home" is available exclusively now on DIRECTV and will open in theaters November 16th.

video:video.video:title: How a Crossword Puzzle is Made
video:video.video:description: New York Times crossword puzzle constructor (also known as a cruciverbalist), David Kwong, shows us how he makes a crossword puzzle.

video:video.video:title: How Pilobolus Brings Shadows to Life
video:video.video:description:
Pilobolus artistic directors Matt Kent and Renee Jaworski explain how their dancers use shadow to create almost anything imaginable.
Beholder image © Wizards 2018 You can watch new episodes of WIRED Masterminds on the free WIRED channel, available on Roku, Apple TV, Amazon Fire TV, and Android TV: https://www.wired.com/brandlab/2018/06/wired-smart-tv-app-new-way-watch-wired/

video:video.video:title: Obsessed - How Gravity Built the World's Fastest Jet Suit
video:video.video:description: Richard Browning built the world's fastest personal jet suit. WIRED spoke with him to find out about the design process and engineering of a radical new form of transportation.

video:video.video:title: How Drones Have Transformed Disaster Relief
video:video.video:description:
Produced by Wired Brand Lab for AT&T
When the unexpected happens, being connected is paramount. AT&T's "Flying Cows" or "Cells on Wings" are specialized drones engineered to operate in harsh conditions and can stay at 400 feet in the air for 24 hours straight. Learn how these machines are connecting customers and helping disaster relief efforts.

video:video.video:title: Mechanic Deconstructs a 1974 Harley-Davidson
video:video.video:description:
A mechanic from Greenpoint, Brooklyn breaks down a 1974 Harley-Davidson shovelhead motorcycle. The classic Harley is taken apart, piece-by-piece, as the mechanic explains the importance of each part.
You can watch new episodes of [De]constructed on Roku, Apple TV, Amazon Fire TV, and Android TV: https://www.wired.com/brandlab/2018/06/wired-smart-tv-app-new-way-watch-wired/

video:video.video:title: [De]constructed Episode 2 -- Trailer
video:video.video:description: In the second episode of WIRED's OTT Original, [De]constructed, watchmaker Ryan Jewell breaks down two Carpenter watches, one with a Swiss-made movement, one with a Japanese-made movement. Download the WIRED app on Amazon Fire TV, Android TV, Apple TV, and Roku today.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Julia Roberts & Dermot Mulroney Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: "Homecoming" stars Julia Roberts and Dermot Mulroney take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the internet's most searched questions about themselves. Is Julia Roberts the highest paid actress? Is she related to Emma Stone? How do you pronounce Dermot Mulroney? How tall is he? Julia and Dermot answer all these questions and more!

video:video.video:title: Why It's Almost Impossible to Skip a Stone 89 Times
video:video.video:description: Skipping stones is a fun pastime but some people take it very seriously and compete. The world record number of skips is 88! WIRED's Robbie Gonzalez dives into the physics and physicality of extreme stone skipping.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Keira Knightley & Mackenzie Foy Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: "The Nutcracker and the Four Realms" stars Keira Knightley and Mackenzie Foy take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the internet's most searched questions about themselves. Does Keira Knightley have a baby? Is Mackenzie Foy related to Claire Foy? Where did Keira Knightley grow up?

video:video.video:title: How SpotMini and Atlas Became the Internet's Favorite Robots
video:video.video:description: Boston Dynamics CEO Marc Raibert shares the backstory of his company's viral videos and how the internet's favorite robot dog, SpotMini, came to be.

video:video.video:title: Every Champion in League of Legends Explained
video:video.video:description:
As players wait to try the newest League of Legends champs out, here’s a look at every single champion in the game so far — all 141 of them, described by Riot’s Greg Street and Andrei Van Roon.
Game Capture footage by Declan Wadey of SkinSpotlights and Scott Loranger.

video:video.video:title: Hacker Breaks Down 26 Hacking Scenes From Movies & TV
video:video.video:description: Hacker and security researcher Samy Kamkar takes a look at a variety of hacking scenes from popular media and examines their authenticity.

video:video.video:title: Tech Effects: How Video Games Impact You
video:video.video:description: Can video games help improve hand-eye coordination? Can they help train your brain and improve your cognitive abilities? WIRED Senior Editor Peter Rubin tests his skills against a pro sports gamer to find out if gaming can improve your brain and body.

video:video.video:title: How Spies Use Disguises
video:video.video:description:
Former Chief of Disguise for the CIA, Jonna Mendez, explains how disguises are used in the CIA, and what aspects to the deception make for an effective disguise.
You can watch new episodes of WIRED MASTERMINDS on your smart TV.
https://www.wired.com/brandlab/2018/06/wired-smart-tv-app-new-way-watch-wired/

video:video.video:title: How Machines Have Revolutionized Medicine | WIRED Brand Lab
video:video.video:description:
Branded Content | Produced by WIRED Brand Lab for Novartis
How is machine learning helping researchers revolutionize the scientific method in the field of medicine development?

video:video.video:title: How Brain Organoids Help Scientists Battle Disease | WIRED Brand Lab
video:video.video:description:
Branded Content | Produced by WIRED Brand Lab for Novartis
How can human brain organoids grown in a lab help scientists discover the keys to diagnosing and treating neurological disease?

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - The Try Guys Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: Keith, Ned, Zach, and Eugene of The Try Guys take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the internet's most searched questions about The Try Guys and themselves. Are The Try Guys still at BuzzFeed? Are they all really friends? Do they all live in LA? The Try Guys answer all these questions and more!

video:video.video:title: How Google Cloud Uses Multi-Layer Security To Protect Businesses
video:video.video:description: Produced by WIRED Brand Lab with Google Cloud | How Google Cloud Uses Multi-Layer Security To Protect Businesses

video:video.video:description: NCT 127 use the power of Twitter to answer some common questions about K-pop. Does a K-pop star have to be from Korea? Why are some K-pop groups so large? Do K-pop bands have opening acts? Taeil, Johnny, Taeyong, Yuta, Doyoung, Jaehyun, Winwin, Jungwoo, Mark, and Haechan answer all these questions and more!

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Aubrey Plaza & Craig Robinson Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: "An Evening with Beverly Luff Linn" stars Aubrey Plaza and Craig Robinson take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the internet's most searched questions about themselves. Is Aubrey Plaza single? Was Craig Robinson on Friends?

video:video.video:title: Bill Gates Talks About 6 Moments in His Life
video:video.video:description:
Bill Gates, one of WIRED's 25 icons from its WIRED25 anniversary celebration, reflects on six important moments from his life and career, from teaching students to program in high school, to his relationships with Melinda Gates, Warren Buffett, and Paul Allen, the co-founder of Microsoft, who passed away on October 15.
This video was recorded on August 31, prior to Mr. Allen’s passing, and had previously been scheduled for release this week. Bill Gates and WIRED dedicate this video to him.

video:video.video:title: WIRED25: Accenture CTO Paul Daugherty On Reimagining The Future of Business
video:video.video:description: Accenture CTO Paul Daugherty spoke at WIRED25, WIRED’s 25th anniversary celebration in San Francisco.

video:video.video:title: WIRED25: Zipline CEO Keller Rinaudo On the Next Generation of Blood Delivery
video:video.video:description: Zipline CEO Keller Rinaudo spoke at WIRED25, WIRED’s 25th anniversary celebration in San Francisco.

video:video.video:title: WIRED25: 23andMe's Anne Wojcicki & Stanford's Stephen Quake on Big Data and Health Care
video:video.video:description: 23andMe Cofounder Anne Wojcicki and Stanford Professor of Bioengineering and Applied Physics Stephen Quake spoke with WIRED’s Cofounder Jane Metcalfe as part of WIRED25, WIRED’s 25th anniversary celebration in San Francisco.

video:video.video:title: WIRED25: Code for America Executive Director Jennifer Pahlka and Author Anand Giridharadas On Rich Techie Philanthropists
video:video.video:description: Code for America Executive Director Jennifer Pahlka and Author Anand Giridharadas spoke with WIRED’s Issie Lapowskyas part of WIRED25, WIRED’s 25th anniversary celebration in San Francisco.

video:video.video:title: WIRED25: The Future of Cryptocurrency -- MIT Media Lab's Neha Narula and Reddit's Alexis Ohanian On What's Ahead
video:video.video:description: MIT Media Lab Digital Currency Initiative Director Neha Narula spoke with WIRED’s Brian Barrett as part of WIRED25, WIRED’s 25th anniversary celebration in San Francisco.

video:video.video:title: WIRED25: CEO Susan Wojcicki On Making YouTube A Better Place
video:video.video:description: YouTube CEO Susan Wojcicki spoke with WIRED’s Peter Rubin as part of WIRED25, WIRED’s 25th anniversary celebration in San Francisco.

video:video.video:title: How Marvel Built the VFX in Ant-Man and the Wasp
video:video.video:description:
Go behind the scenes of Ant Man and the Wasp with Danielle Costa, vice president of visual effects for Marvel Studios, as she explains all the amazing ways that CGI experts made characters bug-sized, enormous, and microscopic.
Ant-Man & the Wasp is available now on digital and Blu-Ray.

video:video.video:title: WIRED25: Sebastian Thrun & Sam Altman Talk Flying Vehicles and Artificial Intelligence
video:video.video:description: Sebastian Thrun, CEO of Kittyhawk and president of Udacity, and Sam Altman, president of Y Combinator and co-chair of Open AI, spoke with WIRED’s Former Editor-in-Chief Chris Anderson as part of WIRED25, WIRED’s 25th anniversary celebration in San Francisco.

video:video.video:description: Twitter and Square Cofounder and CEO Jack Dorsey spoke with WIRED’s Editor-in-Chief Nicholas Thompson as part of WIRED25, WIRED’s 25th anniversary celebration in San Francisco.

video:video.video:description: Napster Cofounder Sean Parker and Biologist Alex Marson spoke with WIRED’s Sandra Upson as part of WIRED25, WIRED’s 25th anniversary celebration in San Francisco.

video:video.video:description: Instagram Cofounder Kevin Systrom spoke with WIRED's Lauren Goode as part of WIRED25, WIRED’s 25th anniversary celebration in San Francisco.

video:video.video:description: Intel Vice President & Senior Fellow Genevieve Bell spoke at WIRED25, WIRED’s 25th anniversary celebration in San Francisco.

video:video.video:description: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos spoke with WIRED’s Steven Levy as part of WIRED25, WIRED’s 25th anniversary celebration in San Francisco.

video:video.video:title: WIRED25: Inclusive Design -- Microsoft's Satya Nadella & Jenny Lay-Flurrie Talk Accessibility
video:video.video:description: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella and Chief Accessibility Officer Jenny Lay-Flurrie spoke with WIRED’s Editor-in-Chief Nicholas Thompson as part of WIRED25, WIRED’s 25th anniversary celebration in San Francisco.

video:video.video:description: Google CEO Sundar Pichai spoke with WIRED’s Steven Levy as part of WIRED25, WIRED’s 25th anniversary celebration in San Francisco.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - John Mulaney & Nick Kroll Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: "Big Mouth" stars John Mulaney and Nick Kroll take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the internet's most searched questions about themselves. Did John Mulaney go to college? Is Nick Kroll Canadian? Was John Mulaney in a frat?

video:video.video:title: Radical Markets: Glenn Weyl at WIRED25
video:video.video:description: Microsoft researcher and economics professor Glenn Weyl argues that we need to challenge fundamental institutions we take for granted, like private property and one-person-one-vote, to reduce inequality, increase productivity, and heal political divisions. A growing movement of entrepreneurs (especially in the blockchain space), artists, social activists, and researchers, is already helping achieve this vision of a richer and more cooperative society through what Weyl calls Radical Markets.

video:video.video:title: 15 Years of Mythbusting: Adam Savage Speaks at WIRED25
video:video.video:description: Mythbusters premiered 15 years ago. More than 200 episodes, one thousand myths and 290 destroyed vehicles later, special effects expert (and WIRED alum!) Adam Savage is back, and this time he's getting help from six junior mythbusters; incredible kids from across the country with serious STEM skills. Savage spoke with WIRED's Adam Rogers at WIRED25, WIRED's 25th anniversary celebration in San Francisco.

video:video.video:title: The Trouble with Techno-Utopianism: Anand Giridharadas & Virginia Heffernan | WIRED25
video:video.video:description: Author Anand Giridharadas has penned sharp appraisals of Silicon Valley's benevolent titans and their technocratic solutionism. At WIRED25, he spoke with WIRED's Virginia Heffernan about the colliding forces that challenge a default optimism when it comes to technology. This event was part of WIRED's 25th anniversary celebration in San Francisco.

video:video.video:title: Digital Dignity: VR Pioneer Jaron Lanier at WIRED25
video:video.video:description: At WIRED25, Jaron Lanier, Microsoft's chief technology officer prime unifying scientist, musician, VR pioneer and author or "Ten Arguments for Deleting Your Social Media Accounts Right Now" and "Dawn of the New Everything" talked to Editor in Chief Nicholas Thompson about 25 years of technology.

video:video.video:title: SpotMini & Boston Dynamics Founder Marc Raibert at WIRED25
video:video.video:description: SpotMini, the Internet's favorite robot dog, appeared at WIRED25 with Boston Dynamics founder & CEO Marc Raibert. Raibert spoke with WIRED Editor in Chief Nicholas Thompson about robots and the future of robotic design as part of WIRED's 25th anniversary celebration in San Francisco.

video:video.video:title: Alien Hunting: SETI Scientists on the Search for Life Beyond Earth | WIRED25
video:video.video:description: As part of WIRED25, WIRED's 25th anniversary celebration in San Francisco, Jill Tarter, author of "The 21st Century: The Century of Biology on Earth and Beyond," and astrobiologist Margaret Turnbull, two of the foremost authorities on search for life beyond Earth come together for a discussion on habitable planets, how life is defined and detected, and finding life in the universe outside Earth.

video:video.video:title: Decoding Robert Mueller's Russia Investigation | WIRED25
video:video.video:description: WIRED contributing editor Garrett M. Graff, who covers special counsel Robert Mueller's Russia probe, authored the magazine's June cover story about Mueller's time in Vietnam, and wrote "The Threat Matrix: Inside Robert Mueller's FBI and the War on Global Terror." Graff breaks down the investigation's status, the big outstanding questions, and where the investigation is likely to go after the midterm election.

video:video.video:title: Companies of the Future: Reid Hoffman & Joi Ito at WIRED25
video:video.video:description: Reid Hoffman, co-founder of LinkedIn and partner at Greylock, speaks with MIT Media Lab Director Joi Ito, sharing insights from their work in technology. This conversation was part of WIRED25, WIRED's 25th anniversary celebration in San Francisco.

video:video.video:title: Entrepeneurship Boot Camp: Alexis Ohanian and Jewel Burks on Starting Startups | WIRED25
video:video.video:description: At WIRED25, Alexis Ohanian, co-founder of Initialized and Reddit, and Jewel Burks, co-founder of Partpic, spoke with WIRED's Arielle Pardes as part of WIRED's 25th anniversary celebration in San Francisco.

video:video.video:title: Tinker Hatfield On His Career at Nike and His New GOAT Jordans | WIRED25
video:video.video:description:
At WIRED25, Nike's Tinker Hatfield spoke about his storied career at Nike and the new Jordans he was wearing on stage -- an unreleased sneaker he calls the GOAT Jordans -- the Greatest of All Time.
Hatfield, one of the world's most celebrated shoe designers and the creator of Marty McFly's famous self-lacing sneakers in Back to the Future, spoke with former design guru Scott Dadich (former Editor in Chief at WIRED) as part of WIRED's 25th Anniversary celebration.

video:video.video:title: WIRED25: The Future of Work With Jeff Weiner, CEO of LinkedIn
video:video.video:description: WIRED editor-in-chief Nicholas Thompson spoke with Jeff Weiner, CEO of LinkedIn about the future of work at WIRED's 25th anniversary celebration in San Francisco.

video:video.video:title: WIRED25: The Future of Work With Stacy Brown-Philpot, CEO of TaskRabbit
video:video.video:description: WIRED editor-in-chief Nicholas Thompson spoke with Stacy Brown-Philpot, CEO of TaskRabbit, about the future of work at WIRED's 25th anniversary celebration in San Francisco.

video:video.video:description: WIRED editor-in-chief Nicholas Thompson spoke with Patrick Collison, CEO of Stripe about the future of work at WIRED's 25th anniversary celebration in San Francisco.

video:video.video:description: How much has tech changed in the past quarter century? Writer Louise Matsakis spends a day doing her job using only the tech that was available in 1993.

video:video.video:title: Vehicle Stereo vs. the Opera: Which Sounds Better? | WIRED Brand Lab
video:video.video:description: Produced by WIRED Brand Lab for Lexus | We conducted an experiment to find out how the Lexus ES sound system compares to one of the most perfect acoustic environments in the world, the Santa Fe Opera.

video:video.video:description: WIRED's Lauren Goode looks at Google's brand-new line of phones, the Pixel 3 and Pixel 3 XL, and describes the new phone and camera features announced at the company's launch event.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Masterminds Series Premiere -- Trailer
video:video.video:description: In the OTT Original series WIRED Masterminds, experts demonstrate and explain key parts of their craft -- breaking down how to fool people with illusions and disguises, how to construct puzzles and codes, and how to see the world in shadow and light. In the series premiere, former Chief of Disguise Jonna Mendez takes viewers through many of the techniques the CIA used to keep its operatives safe.

video:video.video:title: [De]constructed Series Premiere -- Trailer
video:video.video:description: In the series premiere of WIRED's OTT Original, [De]constructed, motorcycle mechanic Matt Dawe breaks down a 1974 Harley Shovelhead motorcycle. Get WIRED on Amazon Fire TV, Android TV, Apple TV, and Roku today.

video:video.video:description: Joseph Herscher builds wildly fun Rube Goldberg-style machines to make his life easier. Sort of. Here's how he built a new contraption to feed him his lunch.

video:video.video:title: Why It's Almost Impossible to Jump Higher Than 50 Inches
video:video.video:description: The standing vertical jump is an important measure of an athlete's explosive power and a critical test in the NFL Combine. So who jumps the highest? And what's the limit? WIRED's Robbie Gonzalez jumps in to examine the physics and physicality of maximum leaping ability.

video:video.video:title: Out of Office with Brent Rose - GoPro Hero7 Black vs. Hero6 vs. Sony X3000
video:video.video:description:

Read more at WIRED.com: https://www.wired.com/review/gopro-hero7-black-2018

video:video.video:title: Exclusive: "Crazy Rich Asians" Director Jon M. Chu's iPhone XS Movie, "Somewhere"
video:video.video:description:
Jon M. Chu, director of Crazy Rich Asians, made this short film exclusively for WIRED using the new Apple iPhone XS Max. Chu shot and edited the film himself, shooting handheld in available light and using only the native camera app and default stabilizer, without any additional crew or equipment.
"Somewhere" Shot on the iPhone XS Max No filters, no color correction.
Director, Cinematographer, Editor: Jon M. Chu Starring: Luigi Rosado

video:video.video:title: iPhone XS & XS Max Review: Do You Need to Upgrade?
video:video.video:description:
WIRED's Lauren Goode reviews the latest iPhone models -- the iPhone XS and iPhone XS Max -- and tests the battery life, camera and video capabilities.
CORRECTION, Sept. 19, 5:05 PM EST: The video above misstated the water rating for the iPhone XS and XS Max. While the IP68 standard states that devices must be waterproof to more than 1 meter, Apple's new phones are waterproof up to 2 meters for up to 30 minutes."

video:video.video:title: Segway e-Skates: The Most Dangerous Object in the Office
video:video.video:description: In honor of WIRED's 25th Anniversary, we're bringing back an old favorite series -- The Most Dangerous Object in the Office. And in this special one-off, WIRED's Arielle Pardes tries on Segway's Drift W1 e-Skates.

video:video.video:title: How This Woman Plans to Become the Fastest Person on a Bike
video:video.video:description: Denise Mueller-Korenek set the women's paced bicycle speed record in 2016, pedaling to 147 miles per hour. Now she's ready to attempt to break the overall record of 167 miles per hour and take the title of fastest cyclist ever.

video:video.video:description: Highlights from the Apple Launch Event: three new phones (the iPhone XS, iPhone XS Max and iPhone Xr), a new watch (the Series 4), a new chip (A12 bionic), and new camera features.

video:video.video:title: How Bitdefender Box 2 Can Secure Your Home Network from Hackers | Wired Brand Lab
video:video.video:description:
Produced by WIRED Brand Lab for Bitdefender BOX
In this episode, Security Researcher Samy Kamkar explores how to safeguard your home from cyber-attacks through unsuspecting internet connected devices such as a baby monitor.

video:video.video:title: How Bitdefender Box 2 Can Protect Your Devices from Hackers | Wired Brand Lab
video:video.video:description: Produced by WIRED Brand Lab for Bitdefender BOX | Security Researcher Samy Kamkar investigates different techniques hackers can use to steal your private information through an unsecure device and what you can do to protect yourself.

video:video.video:title: Obsessed - Meet The Domino Artist Behind These Amazing Chain Reactions
video:video.video:description: 19-year-old Lily Hevesh is obsessed with dominos. She spends hours upon hours building insanely intricate designs and chain reactions before knocking them down. Sound like a strange way to spend your time? Tell that to the nearly 2 million people who've subscribed to her YouTube Channel, where she posts new domino videos every Saturday.

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - Liza Koshy, Markiplier, Rhett & Link, and Hannah Hart Answer YouTube Creator Questions From Twitter
video:video.video:description:
Liza Koshy, Markiplier, Rhett & Link, and Hannah Hart use the power of Twitter to answer some common questions about YouTube content creation.
Hannah Hart is the host of hit podcast "Hannahlyze This,” the self-help podcast that just can’t help itself. The podcast tackles candid conversations about mental health, as well as lighthearted takes on new self-help “fads” like rage rooms and suspension chambers.

video:video.video:title: What Could Happen in a World That's 4 Degrees Warmer | WIRED Brand Lab
video:video.video:description:
Produced by WIRED Brand Lab with Western Digital.
Comedian Aparna Nancherla explores how global warming and climate change will directly affect our lives 100 years from now when the average global temperature is projected to increase by 4 degrees Celsius, or 7.2 degrees Fahrenheit. Nancherla met with Professor of Atmospheric Science at UC Berkeley, Inez Fung, and Chief Data Officer at Western Digital, Janet George to to make predictions about how we’ll live in a 4C World.

video:video.video:description: Sending a robot into the icy depths and getting it back alive can be more challenging than communicating with a Mars rover millions of miles away.

video:video.video:description: Why ride on a normal personal watercraft when you could go extreme? Brent Rose splashes and crashes the Seabreacher and Jetovator, two of the wildest watercraft on the market.

From black powder to barium, music to mortars, pyrotechnics pro Jim Souza, whose company puts on the Macy's 4th of July Show in New York, explains the year-long process behind putting on a major performance.

video:video.video:title: The Entire History of World of Warcraft

Blizzard's Ion Hazzikostas, Patrick Magruder and Jimmy Lo tell the entire history of World of Warcraft. From the game's launch date, until it's newest expansion (Battle for Azeroth), Blizzard chronicles every aspect of the legendary MMO's journey.
Featuring: Ion Hazzikostas - Game Director, World of Warcraft Patrick Magruder - Lead Gameplay Engineer, World of Warcraft Jimmy Lo - Visual Development Supervisor, World of Warcraft

video:video.video:description: 'Sorry to Bother You' stars Armie Hammer, Steven Yeun, and Jermaine Fowler take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the internet's most searched questions about themselves.

video:video.video:title: Biobots: Snakebot, Batbot, and More Fantastical Machines Inspired by Nature
video:video.video:description: Nature knows what it’s doing, and roboticists are more than happy to steal evolution’s ideas to make a plethora of curious and clever machines.

video:video.video:title: Reality+
video:video.video:description: In a near future, the brain chip 'Reality+' acts on your sensory perceptions and allows you to see yourself with the perfect physique you've always dreamed of. All the people equipped with the chip can see your new appearance and you can see theirs, but the chip can only be activated for 12 hours a day...

video:video.video:title: Quantum Computing Expert Explains One Concept in 5 Levels of Difficulty
video:video.video:description: WIRED has challenged IBM's Dr. Talia Gershon (Senior Manager, Quantum Research) to explain quantum computing to 5 different people; a child, teen, a college student, a grad student and a professional.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Alison Brie & Marc Maron Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description:
"GLOW" stars Marc Maron and Alison Brie take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the internet's most searched questions about themselves.
GLOW Season 2 premieres on Netflix June 29th

video:video.video:title: Technique Critique - Forensics Expert Examines Crime Scene Investigations From Film & TV
video:video.video:description: In this episode of 'Technique Critique', crime scene analyst and investigator Matthew Steiner examines forensics investigations in crime scenes from movies and television to see how accurate they are. Crime scenes are from The Wire, NCIS, Zodiac, The Flash, The Boondock Saints, Heat, Seven, The Other Guys, How to Get Away with Murder, CSI: Miami, The Dark Knight, Dexter, Insomnia, True Detective, Bone Collector, Criminal Minds, Family Guy, Iron Man 3, Minority Report and more.

video:video.video:title: Order Up! The Burger Bot Is (Almost) Ready for Business
video:video.video:description: It slices tomatoes, it grinds meat, it even cooks a burger! A restaurant in San Francisco is using a robot to make its burgers. Is this the future of the food industry?

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Robert Pattinson & Mia Wasikowska Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description:
"Damsel" stars Robert Pattinson and Mia Wasikowska take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the internet's most searched questions about themselves. Did Robert Pattinson go to college? How do you pronounce Mia Wasikowska? Did Robert Pattinson make music for Twilight? Watch as they answer all these questions and more!
"Damsel" hits theaters 6/22

video:video.video:title: Each and Every - Every Dinosaur In 'Jurassic Park' Series Explained
video:video.video:description: Dr. Nathan Smith, associate curator in the Dinosaur Institute at the Natural History Museum of Los Angeles County, talks about every dinosaur that appears in the Jurassic Park films.

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - Riot Games' Greg Street Answers League of Legends Questions from Twitter
video:video.video:description: Riot Games Lead Designer Greg Street uses the power of Twitter to answer some common questions about League of Legends. When will teemo get deleted? Why is it taking so long to release another permanent game mode? Why are death timers so long in one for all? Why does the entire team get punished when one player rage quits? How long until a Battle Royale game mode is announced? When is LoL 2 coming?

video:video.video:title: How Technology Helped a Writer Come Out as Dyslexic
video:video.video:description: Writer Lisa Shapiro describes life with dyslexia, and seeks out new technologies that help her understand and overcome the condition.

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - Riot Games' Greg Street Answers Even More League of Legends Questions from Twitter
video:video.video:description: Riot Games Lead Designer Greg Street once again uses the power of Twitter to answer some common questions about League of Legends. Which three heroes would Greg crack a cold one with? Is Jhin based on any real life serial killers? Does League of Legends ever ban people?

video:video.video:title: Why Scoring an "Olimpico" Goal in Soccer is Almost Impossible
video:video.video:description: The "gol olimpico" or "Olympic goal" – an unassisted corner kick bent into goal – is one of the rarest in soccer. WIRED's Robbie Gonzalez straps on his shin-guards to explore the shot's perfect mix of soccer science and skill.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Best of Autocomplete: The Cast of Black Panther, Stranger Things and More Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: Jake Gyllenhaal, Ryan Reynolds, Kristen Wiig, Steve Carell, Michael B. Jordan, Samuel L. Jackson, Ansel Elgort, Suki Waterhouse, Chadwick Boseman, Lupita Nyong'o, Joe Keery, Gaten Matarazzo, Jennifer Garner, Woody Harrelson, Chris Pratt, Jennifer Lawrence, John Boyega, Kelly Marie Tran, Kristen Bell, Melissa McCarthy, John Cena, Matt Damon, Julianne Moore, John Krasinski, Cara Delevingne and more answer the web's most searched questions about themselves.

video:video.video:title: How to Get Robots to Walk (and Jump and Run) Among Us
video:video.video:description: Truly useful robots will have to be able to tackle everything humans can, so they’ve gotta have legs. Easier said than done, though.

video:video.video:title: See the Gear the CDC's Disease Detectives Use in the Field
video:video.video:description: The CDC's elite Disease Detectives investigate outbreaks of dangerous diseases like Ebola, Marburg Virus, Rabies, Anthrax and more. Find out about the equipment they use -- from protective gear to bat traps, machetes to blow guns, liquid nitrogen and more.

video:video.video:title: How One Artist Balances Form and Function with His Light Sculptures
video:video.video:description: Produced by WIRED Brand Lab for Perry Ellis. Jason Krugman is a light sculptor based in Brooklyn, NY. His lighting designs often use their physical structure to conduct electricity to the light sources, which eliminates the need for insulated wiring and connectors allowing thousands of lights to sit softly amongst minimal wire forms. Currently, he works out of the New Lab space which is a community of entrepreneurs working in advanced technology.

video:video.video:title: Obsessed - Melody Yang Makes Bubbles That Billow, Bend and Break Records
video:video.video:description: Melody Yang and her family hold numerous world records for their bubbles. She shows us how she makes some of the fun creations from their stage performance, the Gazillion Bubble Show.

video:video.video:title: Thomas Middleditch Let an AI Steal His Face to Make a New Movie
video:video.video:description: Behind the scenes with the actor Thomas Middleditch who teamed up with an artificial intelligence program called Benjamin to create "Zone Out," an entirely AI-made sci-fi film.

video:video.video:title: Toilet-to-Tap Water and Other Ideas That Could Save Us From the Next Water Crisis
video:video.video:description: Would you drink recycled toilet water? Scientists and engineers are betting on it as they look for innovative new ways to prepare for a warmer drier climate.

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - Best of Tech Support: Bill Nye, Neil DeGrasse Tyson and More Answer Science Questions from Twitter
video:video.video:description: Bill Nye, James Cameron, Ken Jeong, Neil DeGrasse Tyson, former NASA astronaut Scott Kelly and neuroscientist Anil Seth answer the most interesting science questions from Twitter. Do your guts float in space? Do aliens exist? Can you punch specific memories out of your brain? What exactly is a tractor beam? If humans evolved from monkeys, why are there still monkeys?

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Jodie Foster Answers the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: 'Hotel Artemis' star Jodie Foster takes the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answers the internet's most searched questions about herself. How old was Jodie when she filmed 'Taxi Driver'? Is she married to Mel Gibson? How many Oscars does she have? Does she have children? An accent? Siblings? Is she vegan? Is she a genius? What's her IQ? Was she ever on the show 'Bonanza'? What about "Gunsmoke"? How about "Bad News Bears"? Wasn't she on "Seinfeld"? What's her real name?

video:video.video:title: The Taxidermy Bird That Scientists Turned Into a Robot
video:video.video:description: Meet Fembot, the robotic bird that goes undercover to observe sage grouse mating behavior.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Shawn Mendes Answers the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description:
Shawn Mendes takes the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answers the internet's most searched questions about himself.
Shawn Mendes' self titled album is out Friday May 25th.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Solo Cast Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description:
'Solo: A Star Wars Story' stars Emilia Clarke, Woody Harrelson and Joonas Suotamo take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answers the internet's most searched questions about Star Wars and themselves. Is Chewbacca a dog? Can Woody Harrelson sing? Does Emilia Clarke have tattoos? How tall is Joonas Suotamo?
'Solo: A Star Wars Story' hits theaters 5/25.

video:video.video:title: Pre-Crime Policing: How Cops Are Using Algorithms to Predict Crimes
video:video.video:description: The LAPD is one of a growing number of police departments using algorithms to try to predict crimes before they happen. Proponents of these tools say they provide cops with added tools to keep their cities safe -- but critics argue it's just another form of profiling.

video:video.video:title: A Day in the Life of a Tech Influencer
video:video.video:description:
Produced by WIRED Brand Lab for Perry Ellis.
Rodney Williams is the co-founder and CEO of LISNR, an advanced, near-ultrasonic data transmission technology that enables communication between devices - all you need is a microphone or speaker. Rodney, who was born partially deaf, used his hearing disadvantage to identify a communication issue with phones early on and build this new sound technology.

video:video.video:title: Why Juggling 15 Balls Is Almost Impossible
video:video.video:description: The world's best numbers juggler can throw and catch 14 balls. Once. Has he reached juggling's limit? WIRED's Robbie Gonzalez looks into the physics and physicality of extreme juggling.

video:video.video:title: Neuroscientist Explains the Laurel vs. Yanny Phenomenon
video:video.video:description: The Laurel vs. Yanny debate is taking the internet by storm. WIRED's Louise Matsakis speaks with Tyler Perrachione, PhD, about why certain people hear Laurel when playing the now-infamous audio clip and others hear Yanny.

video:video.video:title: See the Visual Effects That Brought Black Panther to Life
video:video.video:description:
Daryl Sawchuk, Visual Effects Supervisor for Method Studios and Animation Supervisor for Black Panther, gives WIRED an exclusive look at breakdowns of the digital Black Panther and Kilmonger suits, and the final fight scene of Marvel's mega-blockbuster.
Black Panther is available on Blu-Ray and DVD May 15, 2018.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Terry Crews Answers the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description:
Terry Crews takes the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answers the internet's most searched questions about himself.
Catch Terry Crews as Bedlam this Friday, May 18th in Deadpool 2 and make sure to catch the season finale of “Brooklyn Nine-Nine” on Sunday, May 20th

video:video.video:title: Go Inside the Aerodrome, Where the Future of Flight Takes Shape
video:video.video:description: Welcome to the Aerodrome, where engineers are simulating wind conditions to teach drones to fly safely.

video:video.video:title: First Look: Google Reveals New Version of Google Lens
video:video.video:description: Google is releasing a new version of Google Lens, its computer vision technology that lets you point a smartphone camera at any object and get information on it. We take a first look at the app's most significant update yet.

video:video.video:title: Jeff Garlin and Susie Essman Race to Las Vegas in "The Bet"
video:video.video:description:
Los Angeles to Las Vegas. It’s not just when you get there, it’s how you get there. See Jeff Garlin and Susie Essman race to the Strip in the original short film, "The Bet".
Produced by WIRED with The Lincoln Motor Company.

video:video.video:title: NASA's New Mars Lander Will Give Insight Into the Planet's Make-Up
video:video.video:description: The Insight Lander, developed by NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory, will probe deep beneath the surface of the Red Planet to measure temperatures and allow study of its seismic activity. Its name is short for Interior Exploration using Seismic Investigations, Geodesy and Heat Transport.

video:video.video:title: Obsessed - These Star Wars Fans Are Building a Full-Size Millennium Falcon Cockpit
video:video.video:description: For the past six years Greg Dietrich, Jake Polatty, and a group of fellow Star Wars fans have been building a blinking, bleeping, insanely detailed full size version of the Millennium Falcon's cockpit.

video:video.video:title: To Make Better Robots, You Gotta Crash Tiny Drones Into People First
video:video.video:description: Welcome to the wild world of human-robot interaction, the quest to get humans and robots collaborating without hurting each other.

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - James Cameron Answers Sci-Fi Questions From Twitter
video:video.video:description:
Director James Cameron uses the power of Twitter to answer some common questions about the science fiction genre.
James Cameron's Story of Science Fiction premieres on AMC on 4/30

video:video.video:title: Meet the Robots on a Quest to Clean Up Fukushima
video:video.video:description: Seven years after an earthquake devastated Japan, humans and robots are still trying to clean up Fukushima.

video:video.video:title: Snap Spectacles: Are They the Face Camera We’ve Been Waiting For?
video:video.video:description: You have to give Snap credit for giving hardware another try. Its first attempt, the face-camera called Spectacles, fell short of spectacular. But they're back with a new version. The yellow rings around the lenses are gone (the company decided the LED lights were enough of an indication that users are recording video). The new model is more expensive ($150) but it's water-resistant, comes in new colors, and has enhanced imaging capabilities.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Ansel Elgort & Suki Waterhouse Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: "Jonathan" stars Ansel Elgort and Suki Waterhouse take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answers the internet's most searched questions about themselves. Does Ansel Elgort love Shailene Woodley? Is Suki Waterhouse Japanese? Is Ansel Elgort an amputee?

video:video.video:title: Astronaut Chris Hadfield Debunks Common Space Myths
video:video.video:description:
Retired astronaut Chris Hadfield helps debunk (and confirm!) some common myths about space.
ONE STRANGE ROCK airs Mondays at 10/9c on National Geographic.

video:video.video:title: Inside the Lab That Could Help Save Corals From Destruction
video:video.video:description: Scientists reach a milestone in establishing a captive coral population that could reproduce year after year, allowing researchers to perform crucial studies.

video:video.video:title: The Clever Robot That Uses Air to Grow and Steer
video:video.video:description: Vinebot is part of the first generation of advanced “soft robots,” which promise to go where no traditional robot can tread—literally.

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - Bill Nye Answers Even More Science Questions From Twitter
video:video.video:description: Bill Nye uses the power of Twitter to answer even more science questions. How does the internet work? What's the difference between a meteor, meteorite, and an asteroid? Does anyone really know how gravity works? Is water wet? Bill answers all these questions and more!

video:video.video:title: Let’s Catch Up With Pepper, the Dancing, Surprisingly Helpful Humanoid
video:video.video:description: Pepper is part of the first wave of intelligent machines that promise to not only make our lives easier, but to bring a strange new form of interaction into being.

video:video.video:title: Why It's Almost Impossible to Throw a 110 MPH Fastball
video:video.video:description: More and more pitchers are throwing triple digits. The fastest of them tops out at 105 MPH. WIRED examines why the 110 MPH fastball is almost impossible.

video:video.video:title: Mark Zuckerberg House Testimony Highlights
video:video.video:description: Highlights from Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's appearance before the House Energy and Commerce Committee.

video:video.video:title: Mark Zuckerberg Senate Testimony Highlights
video:video.video:description: Highlights from Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's appearance before the Senate Committee on the Judiciary and Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation hearing, “Facebook, Social Media Privacy, and the Use and Abuse of Data."

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - The Slow Mo Guys Answer Slow Motion Questions From Twitter
video:video.video:description:
The Slow Mo Guys (Gavin Free and Dan Gruchy) use the power of Twitter to answer some common questions about The Slow Mo Guys, The Super Slow Show, and filming in slow motion. What is their process like when coming up with new video ideas? What's their favorite video they've done? Where do they get all the food for the Super Slow Show?
The Slow Mo Guys star in the YouTube original series The Super Slow Show. Catch the final episodes April 11th.

video:video.video:title: Five Things to Watch for in Mark Zuckerberg's Congressional Testimony
video:video.video:description: WIRED's editor-in-chief, Nicholas Thompson, on the five things he'll be watching for during Facebook C.E.O. Mark Zuckerberg's testimony before Congress.

video:video.video:title: Fancy New Suspension Could Make Car Rides a Lot Smoother
video:video.video:description: It works sort of like noise-cancelling headphones, eliminating bumps with movement in the opposite direction.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - John Krasinski Answers the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: 'A Quiet Place' director and star John Krasinski takes the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answers the internet's most searched questions about himself. Does John Krasinski play basketball? Is he married to Jenna Fischer? Can John Krasinski sing?

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - John Cena Answers Wrestling Questions From Twitter
video:video.video:description: 'Blockers' star John Cena uses the power of Twitter to answer some common questions about professional wrestling. What's the most dangerous move in wrestling? What is it like working for Vince McMahon? Why don't wrestlers have body hair? John answers all of these questions and more!

video:video.video:title: The World's Fastest Drones Want to Start Saving Lives in America
video:video.video:description: Zipline has proven the concept of a drone distribution system for essential medical products in Africa and Europe. Now it wants to start flying in its home country.

video:video.video:title: Learn to Fold Five Insanely Cool Paper Planes
video:video.video:description:
John Collins, the Paper Airplane Guy, shows how to fold five amazing paper planes: the Boomerang, the Boomerang 2, the Bat Plane, the Tumbling Wing, and the World Record Plane (a.k.a. "Suzanne").
Read more about the Paper Airplane Guy at WIRED.com: https://www.wired.com/story/learn-how-to-fold-a-world-record-setting-paper-airplane/
You can also visit his website for more information: https://www.thepaperairplaneguy.com

video:video.video:title: Each and Every - Every Video Game in 'Ready Player One' Explained By Author Ernest Cline
video:video.video:description:
Ernest Cline, author of the best-selling novel 'Ready Player One,' and one of the screenwriters behind the upcoming film, deep dives into his book and explains the stories behind every video game referenced in 'Ready Player One.' From Yars' Revenge to Asteroids to Quake, Ernest goes into the history of each game and reveals why he included it in the book.
'Ready Player One' is in theaters now

video:video.video:title: Obsessed - How This Guy Folds and Flies World Record Paper Airplanes
video:video.video:description: John Collins, better known as "The Paper Airplane Guy," has devoted himself to designing, folding, and flying the world's finest paper airplanes.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Taraji P. Henson & Tyler Perry Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description:
'Acrimony' director Tyler Perry and star Taraji P. Henson take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the internet's most searched questions about themselves.
'Acrimony' in theaters March 30, 2018

video:video.video:title: The 10 Senses That Will Make Robots More Human
video:video.video:description: Robots and AI are expected to operate more seamlessly within the human world. To achieve this, scientists have begun outfitting technology with the same sensors that human beings use. Those sensors, more commonly known as the five senses, are sight, hearing, taste, smell, and touch. In this series, WIRED Brand Lab explores the senses that are being developed for technology so that these objects can better operate within the human world and humans can better interact with the virtual world.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Jeff Goldblum Answers the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description:
'Isle of Dogs' star Jeff Goldblum takes the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answers the internet's most searched questions about himself. Does Jeff Goldblum have a stutter? Where is Jeff Goldblum from? Is 'Isle of Dogs' claymation? Jeff answers all these questions and more!
'Isle of Dogs' is in theaters now.

video:video.video:title: Wired's 50 Most Searched Questions - Astronauts Answer 50 of the Most Googled Space Questions
video:video.video:description:
NASA astronauts and One Strange Rock contributors Jeffrey Hoffman, Chris Hadfield, Jerry Linenger, Leland Melvin, Mae C. Jemison, Mike Massimino and Nicole Stott answer 50 of the most Googled questions about space. Does space ever end? Can birds fly in space? How much money do astronauts make??
ONE STRANGE ROCK premieres March 26, at 10/9c on National Geographic.

video:video.video:title: Wired's 50 Most Searched Questions - Pacific Rim Uprising Cast Answer 50 of the Most Googled Kaiju Questions
video:video.video:description:
Pacific Rim Uprsing stars John Boyega, Scott Eastwood, Cailee Spaeny, Burn Gorman, and Charlie Day answer the 50 most Googled questions about Kaiju.
Pacific Rim: Uprising comes out March 23rd, 2018

video:video.video:title: Watch MIT’s Hypnotic Robot Fish Swim a Coral Reef
video:video.video:description: Researchers detail the evolution of the world’s strangest fish, and describe how it could be a potentially powerful tool for scientists to study ocean life.

video:video.video:title: Obsessed - How This Woman Rides 20,000 Miles a Year on Her Bike
video:video.video:description: Ultra-endurance bicycle racer Lael Wilcox puts more miles on her bike every year than most people do on their cars. Here's how she trains for and rides some of the toughest races on earth.

video:video.video:title: Tesla's Electric Model 3 Will Be a Great Everyday Car ... Some Day
video:video.video:description: Nearly half a million people have put down a thousand dollar deposit for a Tesla Model 3 they may not get for years. But once the early production bugs are ironed out, the Model 3 feels like it's going to be a great everyday car.

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - Blizzard's Ben Brode Answers Hearthstone Questions From Twitter
video:video.video:description: Blizzard's Ben Brode, game director on Hearthstone, uses the power of Twitter to answer some common questions about Hearthstone. What are the chances we see cards added to the classic set? Will we see any cards get buffs? What's the best way to get back into Hearthstone after some time off?

video:video.video:title: Uber’s Fatal Crash Raises Big Questions About Self-Driving Cars
video:video.video:description: On Sunday evening, a self-driving Uber struck and killed a woman crossing the street in Tempe, Arizona. The crash appears to be the first time a self-driving vehicle has killed someone, and it could alter the course of the burgeoning autonomous driving industry.

video:video.video:title: Tech Today and Tomorrow Presented by DXC Technology - How The Internet of Things Will Change Everything | Branded Content | Tech Today and Tomorrow | Episode 1
video:video.video:description: Internet-connected devices are revolutionizing the way we live and do business. In Part 1 of this series, WIRED Brand Lab looks at The Internet of Things and explores how connected devices will impact and expand our capabilities, as both businesses and individuals, for decades to come. Produced by WIRED Brand Lab for DXC Technology.

video:video.video:title: Tech Today and Tomorrow Presented by DXC Technology - How AI & Robotics Can Make Our Lives Better | Branded Content | Tech Today and Tomorrow | Episode 2
video:video.video:description: Robots, personal assistants, and other AI-powered devices are quickly becoming a staple in homes and offices around the country. In Part 2 of this series, WIRED Brand Lab will explore how AI and robotics are changing business models and augmenting our productivity as workers. Produced by WIRED Brand Lab for DXC Technology.

video:video.video:title: Tech Today and Tomorrow Presented by DXC Technology - How Technology Has Changed The Workplace | Branded Content | Tech Today and Tomorrow | Episode 3
video:video.video:description: In the past, the idea of the workplace meant an office in a high-rise building where all employees came together to run a company. In Part 3 of this series, WIRED Brand Lab discovers how the modern workplace is no longer confined to a physical space. We’ll look at how rising technologies like the cloud, Artificial Intelligence and mobile devices are creating a new type of workplace, one that can be accessed anywhere. Produced by WIRED Brand Lab for DXC Technology.

video:video.video:title: Tech Today and Tomorrow Presented by DXC Technology - Why Cybersecurity is So Critical | Branded Content | Tech Today and Tomorrow | Ep. 4
video:video.video:description: Security teams used to be able to patrol on-site to ensure their company’s premises were kept safe – now it’s about building teams that can predict potential cyber threats and sabotage from individuals, companies or even hostile nations. In Part 4 of this series, WIRED Brand Lab aims to uncover what businesses can do to evolve their security techniques within a digitally enabled business world. Produced by WIRED Brand Lab for DXC Technology.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Charlie Day Answers the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: Pacific Rim Uprising star Charlie Day takes the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the internet's most searched questions about himself. Does Charlie Day wear eyeliner? Where did he meet his wife? Does he have a PhD? Watch to find out the answers to all these questions, and more!

video:video.video:title: Six Degrees of Automation: How an Empty Parking Lot Will Change the Banking Industry | Branded Content
video:video.video:description:
Welcome to Six Degrees of Automation – a docu-series dedicated to analyzing the impact intelligent automation is having on various industries, produced in collaboration between IBM Services and Wired Brand Lab.
In our inaugural episode, we explore how intelligent automation is transforming the banking industry. Follow Bill on his journey to receive a home loan, a seemingly simple process, but one that is being transformed by automation.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Jennifer Garner Answers the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description:
"Love, Simon" star Jennifer Garner takes the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the internet's most searched questions about herself. How many languages does Jennifer speak? Does Jennifer have pierced ears? Is she related to James Garner?
LOVE, SIMON hits theaters Friday, March 16th.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - This Is Us Cast Answers the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: This Is Us stars Milo Ventimiglia, Mandy Moore and Justin Hartley take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the internet's most searched questions about This Is Us and themselves.

video:video.video:title: Dot Physics: The science behind electric cars
video:video.video:description: Dot Physics' Rhett Allain breaks down the physical forces that allow electric cars to drive.

video:video.video:title: Technique Critique - Surgical Resident Breaks Down Medical Scenes From Film & TV
video:video.video:description:
Annie Onishi, general surgery resident at Columbia University, takes a look at emergency room and operating room scenes from a variety of television shows and movies and breaks down how accurate they really are.
Correction: We misidentified the type of worm in the Grey's Anatomy episode at 5:23! It was actually Ascaris lumbricoides,not Strongyloides

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Alicia Vikander Answers the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description:
Tomb Raider star Alicia Vikander takes the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answers the internet's most searched questions about herself. How did Alicia train to become the new Lara Croft? Does Alicia Vikander have an Instagram? Is Lara Croft based on a real person? Alicia answers all these questions, and more!
Tomb Raider in theaters March 16, 2018

video:video.video:title: Inside the Lab That's Building a Robot Cat
video:video.video:description: Like most robots, Kleo the Cat has a tough time moving around. But that could change soon. That's thanks to researchers at USC who are using lessons from biology to create more dexterous machines.

video:video.video:title: The Self-Driving Truck Race Heats Up With a Driverless Test
video:video.video:description: Starsky heat up the competition for driverless trucks with its first closed road test of a completely driverless car.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Review: Samsung Galaxy S9
video:video.video:description: The Samsung Galaxy S9 smartphone is all about the camera -- dual aperture lens, 12 megapixel sensor and get this, an astounding 960 frames per second slow motion video.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Charlize Theron & David Oyelowo Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: "Gringo" stars Charlize Theron and David Oyelowo answer the Internet's most searched questions about themselves. Is David Oyelowo ACTUALLY a prince? Where did Charlize Theron grow up? Will David be the first black James Bond? Does Charlize Theron have a middle name? Charlize and David answer all these questions, and more!

video:video.video:title: Meet The Clever Robot That's Ready to Take On Your Shopping Addiction
video:video.video:description: Robots are historically pretty bad at picking things up. But that's changing thanks to startups like Kindred, which is mixing advanced AI with remote controls to create robots that can pick and sort through objects at dizzying rates.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Bruce Willis Answers the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: "Death Wish" star Bruce Willis takes the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answers the Internet's most searched questions about himself. Did Bruce Willis go to college? Was Bruce Willis in the military? Was Bruce Willis Batman??

video:video.video:title: This New Satellite Will Help Track Extreme Weather in the West
video:video.video:description: NOAA's latest GOES satellite will help researchers study, track, and predict storms, fires, floods, and other weather systems.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Google Search Team Answers the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: Ben Gomes (VP, Search Engineering) and Chris Haire (Product Manager, Autocomplete) from Google's search team take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answers the Internet's most searched questions about Google autocomplete and search.

video:video.video:title: Watch Airbus' Flying Car, Vahana, Make its First Flight
video:video.video:description: The personal air transport vehicle has achieved the milestone of "first flight", as the race to develop flying cars continues.

video:video.video:title: Go Inside The Dome That Could Give Robots Super Senses
video:video.video:description: Step inside the Panoptic Studio, a dome at Carnegie Mellon University where researchers are capturing data on human gestures, which will be used to create more lifelike and responsive robots.

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - Neuroscientist Anil Seth Answers Neuroscience Questions From Twitter
video:video.video:description:
Neuroscientist and public science communicator Anil Seth uses the power of Twitter to answer some common questions about neuroscience. How does memory work? Can we delete memories? Do blind people dream? Anil answers all these questions and more!
Featuring Anil Seth, Professor of Cognitive and Computational Neuroscience and Co-Director of the Sackler Centre for Consciousness Science, University of Sussex, UK
Twitter: @anilkseth Website: www.anilseth.com

video:video.video:title: Lab-Grown Meat is Coming, Whether You Like it or Not
video:video.video:description: Food scientists and startups are trying to make meat more ethically appealing by growing it -- cell by cell -- in a lab instead of on a farm. Even some vegans support so-called "clean" meat. But can lab grown meat overcome the dreaded "yuck factor?"

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Black Panther Cast Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: Black Panther stars Chadwick Boseman, Lupita Nyong'o and Michael B. Jordan take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the Internet's most searched questions about Black Panther and themselves.

video:video.video:title: The Old-Timey Gas-Powered Engine Ain't Dead Yet
video:video.video:description: Electric cars may be the future, but internal combustion engines aren't giving up without a fight.

video:video.video:title: Why It's Almost Impossible to Do a Quintuple Jump
video:video.video:description: At this year's Winter Olympics in Pyeongchang, we may see quad corks in Big Air Snowboarding or in Freestyle Skiing -- and we'll see quad twists and quad jumps in Figure Skating. But have we reached the limit of what's possible? To do a quad, a skater's got less than a second to turn their body four times in the air. WIRED's Robbie Gonzalez set out to find out why five...is almost impossible.

video:video.video:title: The Co-Botic Future: Robots Don't Always Take Our Jobs -- Sometimes They Save Them
video:video.video:description: At a company in Richmond, Calif., robotic painters are working alongside human workers, sanding and painting cabinets. Despite early fears from employees, the human workers have grown to embrace the "cobots" -- collaborative robots who are helping them get the job done.

video:video.video:title: All About Lidar, The Laser-Shooting Wonder Box That Could Make Self-Driving Cars Real
video:video.video:description: Also known as the spinning thing atop self-driving cars, lidar is the technology that could unlock autonomy for everybody.

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - U.S. Olympic and Paralympic Athletes Answer Olympics Questions From Twitter
video:video.video:description: U.S. Olympic and Paralympic athletes use the power of Twitter to answer some common questions about their respective Olympic and Paralympic sports.

video:video.video:title: Inside the Lab That’s Making Sure Your Weed Is Safe
video:video.video:description: As cannabis use goes recreational in California, producers are facing a reckoning: They’ll either have to clean up their act, or get out of the legal market.

video:video.video:title: How NASA Tests Shapeshifting Plane Wings
video:video.video:description: Shape memory alloys could make plane wings that flap, to reduce drag, or increase stability in supersonic flight.

video:video.video:title: The Future of WIRED is Here
video:video.video:description: Introducing the all-new Backchannel, Ideas section, and WIRED Guides.

video:video.video:title: Patton Oswalt Answers the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: Patton Oswalt answers the Internet's most searched questions about himself. Is Patton Oswalt Albanian? What college did Patton go to? Can Patton Oswalt cook? Patton answers all these questions and more!

video:video.video:title: Dot Physics: How Planes Fly (Admit it -- You Always Wanted To Know)
video:video.video:description: Dot Physics' Rhett Allain breaks down the physical forces that affect how planes fly.

video:video.video:title: Chimp, the Vaguely Humanoid Robot
video:video.video:description: Two and a half years after Chimp competed in the Darpa Robotics Challenge, it remains one of the weirdest humanoid robots on Earth.

video:video.video:title: Dot Physics: The Crazy Science of Drone Flight
video:video.video:description: Dot Physics' Rhett Allain explains the science behind how drones fly.

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - Jerry Rice Answers Football Questions From Twitter
video:video.video:description: Legendary wide receiver Jerry Rice uses the power of Twitter to answer some common questions about the game of football.

video:video.video:title: Fear Not the Robot Singularity
video:video.video:description: The robot revolution we’re in the midst of is way more interesting and way less murder-y than science fiction. Call it the multiplicity.

video:video.video:title: What We've Learned So Far About the Future of Cars in 2018
video:video.video:description: From CES to the Detroit Auto Show, car makers are showing off their vision of the future of driving with a few nods to the past.

video:video.video:title: 50 Cent Answers the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: Den of Thieves star 50 Cent answers the Internet's most searched questions about himself. Did 50 Cent go to college? Is 50 Cent a billionaire? Is 50 Cent Jamaican?? 50 answers all these questions and more!

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - Garry Kasparov Answers Chess Questions From Twitter
video:video.video:description: Chess grandmaster Garry Kasparov uses the power of Twitter to answer some common questions about the game of chess. Why do chess players point at pieces with their middle finger? Why does the knight move the way it does? What's the more valuable piece, the knight or the bishop? Garry answers all these questions and more!

video:video.video:title: CES 2018: The Smart Home of the Future Is Here
video:video.video:description: Digital assistants like Alexa and Google home have made sci-fi a reality. At CES 2018, we check out the next generation of products that will make our lives easier and more connected.

video:video.video:title: CES 2018: The Most Ridiculous VR and AR Headsets We Tried at CES
video:video.video:description: We tried on some of the best new AR and VR headsets at CES 2018 to find out if this technology is finally ready to go mainstream.

video:video.video:title: Please Don't Kick the Inventory Bot
video:video.video:description: This company wants its robot to take on the tedious and time consuming job of scanning inventory at stores. Please don't assault it while it is working.

video:video.video:title: CES 2018: Take a Simulated Ride in The Air Taxi of The Future
video:video.video:description: While engineers figure out how to make flying cars a reality, Bell Helicopter is pushing ahead with the design for the interior of an urban air-taxi service. We try out the concept at CES 2018.

video:video.video:title: Liam Neeson & Patrick Wilson Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: "The Commuter" stars Liam Neeson and Patrick Wilson answer the Internet's most searched questions about themselves. Is Liam Neeson retiring? Is Patrick Wilson related to Will Arnett? Did Liam Neeson voice Buzz Lightyear?

video:video.video:title: Musician Explains One Concept in 5 Levels of Difficulty
video:video.video:description: 23-year-old musician, composer and multi-instrumentalist Jacob Collier explains the concept of harmony to 5 different people; a child, a teen, a college student, a professional, and jazz legend Herbie Hancock.

video:video.video:title: Obsessed - The Ultimate Paper Airplane
video:video.video:description: Over the last decade, designer Luca Iaconi-Stewart has been building an incredibly detailed model of a Boeing 777, right down to the tiny seats and moving landing gear, using only paper folders and glue.

video:video.video:title: VFX Expert Breaks Down The History of Shrinking People in Movies
video:video.video:description: Downsizing VFX Supervisor Jamie Price breaks down the history of people miniaturization in movies.

video:video.video:title: What Uber Learned from a Year of Self Driving
video:video.video:description: Ride hailing company Uber took to the streets of Pittsburgh in late 2016 with self-driving cars. Here's what riders and the company learned from letting robots take the wheel.

video:video.video:title: 2018 Will Be the Year You Join the Electric Car Bandwagon
video:video.video:description: 2017 was the year that big auto makers embraced the all electric vehicle. Expect to see lots of new models on the road in 2018 from Tesla, GM, Audi, VW and others.

video:video.video:title: 2017: The Year in Culture
video:video.video:description: 2017 was a rough year for many, but there were some bright spots—including Nintendo’s Switch, powerful commentary in “Get Out,” and the super-powered performance of “Wonder Woman.”

video:video.video:title: Each and Every - Every Overwatch Hero Explained by Blizzard’s Michael Chu
video:video.video:description: Michael Chu, the lead writer of Blizzard's Overwatch, breaks down every character in the game. Michael explains the backstories for every hero in Overwatch, from how they were first designed to their in-game lore. Michael reveals where McCree's name originated from, how they found Lúcio's voice actor, the different incarnations of Doomfist and much more.

video:video.video:title: Meet the Crime-Fighting Robot That's Stirring Up Controversy
video:video.video:description: Five-foot-tall, 400-pound robots are on a mission to take a bite out of crime. The path there, though, is fraught with ethical pitfalls.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Will Smith & Joel Edgerton Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: "Bright" stars Will Smith and Joel Edgerton answer the Internet's most searched questions about themselves. What is Will Smith's IQ? Who did Joel Edgerton play in Star Wars? Who is Will Smith's best friend?

video:video.video:title: VW's Back With the All-Electric Buzz Bus, Baby!
video:video.video:description: VW's working to put the dieselgate emissions scandal behind it, with three all new, all-electric, vehicles, including one that will appeal to your inner hippie.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Owen Wilson & Ed Helms Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: Father Figures stars Owen Wilson and Ed Helms answer the Internet's most searched questions about themselves.

video:video.video:title: 2017: The Year Robots Went Everywhere
video:video.video:description: 2017 was the year that robots really broke free from the factories and labs and started roaming among us.

video:video.video:title: The Hyperloop Whooshes to a 240-MPH Speed Record
video:video.video:description: Leading hyperloop competitor Virgin Hyperloop One set a new benchmark in the Nevada desert.

video:video.video:title: Sesame Street Puppeteers Explain How They Control Their Puppets
video:video.video:description:
Ever wonder how the puppets on Sesame Street operate? The puppeteers for some of Sesame Street's most famous characters share their insights on how they bring their iconic characters to life. The puppeteers for Elmo, Big Bird, Mr. Snuffleupagus, Abby Cadabby, and Rudy explain the various functions and features of their Muppets.
You can catch Snuffy and all his friends in the new season of Sesame Street on HBO or everyday on HBO Family or PBS Kids.

video:video.video:title: Inside the Room Housing 46 Million Museum Specimen
