video:video.video:description: Only 2 percent of the California Academy of Sciences’ specimen are on display. The other 98 percent are in environmentally controlled storage. This is how they go from salvage to research specimen.

video:video.video:title: The Whirl Is Not Enough: Check Out These Wild Luxury Fidget Spinners
video:video.video:description: Why whirl a cheap plastic fidget spinner when you could twist with a premium toy made of tough titanium or milled from aerospace grade aluminum?

video:video.video:title: How Ford Built a New Kind of Supercar Engine
video:video.video:description: When Ford decided to resurrect its famed GT supercar, it needed more than a new design. It needed a new source of power, which it found in the most unlikely place, the F-150 pickup truck.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - John Cena Answers the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: Ferdinand star John Cena answers the Internet's most searched questions about himself and his character, Ferdinand the Bull. Did John Cena write his own theme song? What's his diet? What if John Cena played Minecraft? John answers all of these and more!

video:video.video:title: How Robots Are Fueling the Ascendance of the Electric Motor
video:video.video:description: Hey robot futurist! We've got one word for you: Actuators. They're the motorized joints that make robots strong, agile, and precise and they're getting better all the time.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - The Last Jedi Cast Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: Star Wars: The Last Jedi stars Mark Hamill, Laura Dern, John Boyega, Daisy Ridley, Domhnall Gleeson and Kelly Marie Tran take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the Internet's most searched questions about Star Wars and themselves.

video:video.video:title: How to Protect Yourself After a Massive Corporate Hack
video:video.video:description: It seems like every time you turn around there's a new breach of personal information. Follow these steps to minimize the damage.

video:video.video:title: Jaguar's Super Swift, Near Silent, All Electric I-Pace
video:video.video:description: Behold a new British battery car to take on Tesla, Jaguar's I-Pace. The muscular SUV should go 0-60 mph in 4 seconds. Jaguar is running final tests before it goes on sale in 2018. We ride along.

video:video.video:title: Crispr Gene Editing Explained
video:video.video:description: Maybe you've heard of Crispr, the gene editing tool that could forever change life. So what is it and how does it work? Let us explain.

video:video.video:title: The Adorable Robot That’s Helping Deaf Children Communicate
video:video.video:description: A new robot-avatar combo is helping deaf children learn to communicate during a crucial time in their development.

video:video.video:title: ‘Shape of Water’ Featurette: An Ancient Force
video:video.video:description: In Guillermo del Toro's new movie, the people are the monsters.

video:video.video:title: The Genesis of Kuri the Companion Robot
video:video.video:description: This is the story of how an adorable robot went from Lego prototype to family companion.

video:video.video:title: Expert Explains One Concept in 5 Levels of Difficulty - Blockchain
video:video.video:description: Blockchain, the key technology behind Bitcoin, is a new network that helps decentralize trade, and allows for more peer-to-peer transactions. WIRED challenged political scientist and blockchain researcher Bettina Warburg to explain blockchain technology to 5 different people; a child, a teen, a college student, a grad student, and an expert.

video:video.video:title: How a Virtual Reality Journalist Takes Viewers Inside Stories
video:video.video:description: At Nonny de la Pena's Los Angeles-based Emblematic Group real stories, from melting glaciers to solitary confinement, are made in full virtual reality.

video:video.video:title: How to Control What Alexa and Google Assistant Do With Your Voice Data
video:video.video:description: Virtual assistants like Google Home and Amazon Alexa can be amazing but what are they doing with all of your questions? Here's how to control all of that data.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Gaten Matarazzo and Joe Keery Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: Stranger Things stars Gaten Matarazzo and Joe Keery take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the Internet's most searched questions about Stranger Things and themselves. Joe and Gaten answer hard-hitting questions like, "Is Gaten Matarazzo now?" and "Is Joe Keery legit?"

video:video.video:title: The Farm of the Future Might Be Entirely Run by Robots
video:video.video:description: At Silicon Valley startup Iron Ox, the plan for agriculture, or at least leafy greens, is to automate the entire growing process indoors with robots and artificial intelligence.

video:video.video:title: Tesla Unveils New Electric Semi-Truck and Roadster
video:video.video:description: Elon Musk introduces Tesla's new all electric long-haul shipping truck and surprise, a new roadster the company says could go as fast as 250 miles per hour.

video:video.video:title: Can These Soccer-Playing Robots Kick It? Yes They Can!
video:video.video:description: The only thing more impressive than these robots’ soccer skills is how they band together as a team.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Nick Jonas Answers the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: Nick Jonas takes the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the Internet's most searched questions about himself. What kind of car does Nick Jonas drive? Has he ever been in a fight? What do his tattoos say? Nick answers all of these and more!

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - Tony Hawk Answers Skateboarding Questions From Twitter
video:video.video:description: Tony Hawk uses the power of Twitter to answer some common questions about skateboarding. Will there ever be another Tony Hawk's Pro Skater? What skateboarding trick was the hardest to learn? Are you ever too old to start skating? Tony also demonstrates how to set up a new skateboard, how to apply griptape, how to do an ollie, how to boardslide, how to do a 540° McTwist and more.

video:video.video:title: How to Lock Down Your Facebook Security and Privacy Settings
video:video.video:description: The only way to be truly secure on Facebook is to delete your account. But that's crazy talk! Here's how to lock down your privacy and security and bonus, keep targeted ads at bay.

video:video.video:title: Meet the Clever Hospital Robot That’s Helping Save Lives
video:video.video:description: Think of Tug as a self-driving car, only for the indoors. Oh, and it delivers drugs.

video:video.video:title: How a Bunch of Geeks and Dreamers Jump-Started the Self-Driving Car
video:video.video:description: A decade ago, the idea of self-driving cars on American city streets was almost unthinkable. But a series of contests spurred the development of software and hardware that have brought us to dawn of the next automotive revolution.

video:video.video:title: 8 Children Test Their Speech on Siri, Echo and Google Home
video:video.video:description:
Andy Wood and Matt Kirshen test the limits of everyday AI by using children of a variety of ages in linguistics tests designed to determine which AI is the best at understanding the most people. Featuring Google Home, Amazon Echo, and Siri.
Check out more of Matt and Andy on their podcast at http://www.probablyscience.com

video:video.video:title: Inside Keanu Reeves' Custom Motorcycle Shop
video:video.video:description: Keanu Reeves gives Wired a tour of Arch Motorcycle, where he and co-founder Gard Hollinger design and build totally custom handmade bikes with the help of virtual reality.

video:video.video:title: The iOS 11 Privacy and Security Settings You Should Set Up Right Now
video:video.video:description: Heads up, iPhone owners. iOS 11 comes with a batch of security features that merit your attention.

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - Dillon Francis Answers DJ Questions From Twitter
video:video.video:description:
DJ Dillon Francis uses the power of Twitter to answer some common questions about DJing.
Dillon Francis’ new single, Hello There ft. Yung Pinch, is available on all music streaming platforms.

video:video.video:title: This Robot Snake Means No Harm, Really
video:video.video:description: The robotic snake has 16 windpipe-constricting actuators, but this serpent bot is more likely to save your life than suck it out of you.

video:video.video:title: These Doctors Are Giving Real Pain The Virtual Treatment
video:video.video:description: Doctors are searching for non-addictive solutions to treat chronic pain. Virtual reality might soon be one of them, if the science can show it really works.

video:video.video:title: Hands On with the Meta AR 2
video:video.video:description: The Meta 2 AR headset brings virtual objects into your real world and is designed to replace your computer monitor altogether.

video:video.video:title: Inside a Tornado Modeled By a Supercomputer
video:video.video:description: Leigh Orf, an an atmospheric scientist, narrates a simulation of a superstorm tornado created by one of the world's most powerful supercomputers.

video:video.video:title: iPhone X Review: We Test the Phone While Bouncing On a Trampoline
video:video.video:description: The iPhone X is packed with some of the most cutting edge smartphone tech, including its camera. Naturally, we tested Face ID, its selfie mode and full HD slo-mo while bouncing around at a trampoline park.

video:video.video:title: The Strange Science of Screams
video:video.video:description: Few sounds grab attention like a scream, but why is that? Scientists have studied the nature of screams and their effects on the brain to better understand the human howl.

video:video.video:title: Trezor Exploit Screen Capture
video:video.video:description: A portion of a tutorial on how to hack a Trezor Bitcoin vault.

video:video.video:title: Hacking the Trezor Bitcoin Vault
video:video.video:description: Mark Frauenfelder saved 7.4 bitcoins on a Trezor electronic vault then he lost the passcode. Here he hacks the device to unlocks his funds.

video:video.video:title: Watch the 1000 mph Bloodhound Rocket Car's First Run
video:video.video:description: The Bloodhound is a truly super supercar. It's designed to punch right through the sound barrier to over 1,000 miles per hour.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Matt Damon & Julianne Moore Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: 'Suburbicon' stars Matt Damon and Julianne Moore take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the Internet's most searched questions about themselves.

video:video.video:title: Watch Neon Artist Shawna Peterson Make Bright, Buzzing Art
video:video.video:description: Inside Shawna Peterson's neon tube bending studio where puffs of air, charred wood and glass tubes meet to make brilliant signs and art.

video:video.video:title: Lay Your Eyes on the Most Bonkers Robot in the World
video:video.video:description: The Guardian GT’s 7-foot-long arms replicate human motions with incredible smoothness and accuracy. Also, each one can lift 500 pounds.

video:video.video:title: Stranger Things Cast Show Us the Last Thing on Their Phones
video:video.video:description: 'Stranger Things' stars Finn Wolfhard and Caleb McLaughlin show us the last things they did with their phones. What was the last emoji they used? The last text message sent? What was the last thing they searched?

video:video.video:title: Fiery Explosions Show Why the FAA Doesn’t Want Laptops in Luggage
video:video.video:description: There's a good reason the FAA doesn't want passengers packing their laptops in checked luggage. There they can overheat and ignite and even explode if packed with aerosol cans.

video:video.video:title: Andy Serkis Breaks Down His Motion Capture Performances
video:video.video:description:
‘War for the Planet of the Apes’ star Andy Serkis is the world’s greatest motion capture performer. His abilities are so in-demand that much of the technology behind motion capture has evolved along with his performances. Andy breaks down some of the major moments of his career along with how the filmmaking tools have changed alongside it.
'War for the Planet of the Apes' is now available on Digital, Blu-ray and DVD #WarForthePlanet

video:video.video:title: Digital Avatars and the Future of Fake News
video:video.video:description: Digital avatars and tools like Apple's new Animoji app may forever change the way we communicate. But they're also blurring the line between reality and fantasy. We take a look at how this technology works and what can be done to prevent the spread of manipulated videos in the future.

video:video.video:title: Shaping Smarter Cities - Global Solutions
video:video.video:description: We traveled around the world with Grant Imahara to discover global solutions to the challenges that most of our major cities are facing. Now it's time to discuss what we uncovered.

video:video.video:title: Zoom Through Seattle's Nearly Completed SR-99 Tunnel
video:video.video:description: Now that Bertha's done digging, the new underground highway is nearly ready for human travelers. Fly through the project from a drone's perspective.

video:video.video:title: The Blockchain Explained
video:video.video:description: The blockchain. Everyone's talking about it. But what is it, how does it work, and what's it for?

video:video.video:title: The Airbus A330-900 Neo Takes Off for the First Time
video:video.video:description: The Airbus A330-900 Neo is the European answer to Boeing's 787. The company says the jet is half as noisy as its predecessor and more efficient while carrying 10 more passengers.

video:video.video:title: This Construction Digger Drives Itself
video:video.video:description: Built Robotics, a San Francisco startup, is developing an autonomous skid-steer loader that can be set loose to dig a trench, no operator needed.

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - LaVar Ball Answers Basketball Questions From Twitter
video:video.video:description: LaVar Ball uses the power of Twitter to answer some common questions about basketball. Who has the worst attitude in NBA history? What's the least cool NBA jersey? What's with the Golden State Warriors' facial hair? Check out "Ball in the Family" on Facebook Watch. New episodes air Sundays.

video:video.video:title: Driving Design - The Technology Shaping Tomorrow's Innovation
video:video.video:description: Explore the tech moments that redefine what's possible with Designer Thomas Meyerhoffer, from the birth of the Internet to tomorrow's cutting-edge innovations.

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - Scott Kelly Answers Astronaut Questions From Twitter
video:video.video:description:
Former NASA astronaut Scott Kelly uses the power of Twitter to answer some common questions about astronauts. How fast is the international space station? Can you see the eclipse from space?
Scott Kelly's book 'Endurance' is now available.

video:video.video:title: Review: Google's Pixel 2 and Pixel 2 XL Smartphones
video:video.video:description: You Can't Buy a Better Android Phone Than the Pixel 2. In almost every way, the Pixel 2 is the iPhone of Android phones. And that's a compliment.

video:video.video:title: Robot Love: How Design Studio Elastic Built WIRED's November Cover
video:video.video:description: For WIRED's November cover about love in the time of robots the magazine turned to Elastic, the design firm behind the opening credits for Game of Thrones, True Detective, and Westworld.

video:video.video:title: Oculus' John Carmack Explains Virtual Reality in 5 Levels of Difficulty
video:video.video:description: The technology behind modern virtual reality is rapidly evolving, but what exactly helps create a better sense of realism and immersion? WIRED has challenged Oculus CTO John Carmack to explain the concept of realism in virtual reality to 5 different people; a child, a pre-teen, a college student, a grad student and a VR expert.

video:video.video:title: The First Supersonic Flight Is Still Astounding 70 Years Later
video:video.video:description: In the not so distant future we might all take supersonic flights from New York to Los Angeles. It all started seventy years ago high above the Mojave desert.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Josh Brolin & Taylor Kitsch Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description:
'Only the Brave' stars Josh Brolin and Taylor Kitsch take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the Internet's most searched questions about themselves.
'Only the Brave' premieres in theaters October 20th.

video:video.video:title: The Unrelenting Weirdness of Interacting With Robots
video:video.video:description: Welcome to the world of human-robot interaction, in which people have to adapt to the machines as much as the machines have to adapt to us.

video:video.video:title: Watch Us Build a 7,500 Piece Lego Millennium Falcon
video:video.video:description: WIRED staffers, and some family, built the largest and most expensive lego set to date, the Millennium Falcon. Of course, we made a time-lapse of us putting this behemoth together.

video:video.video:title: Inside the Studio Where Paint and Water Create Mesmerizing Photos | My Space
video:video.video:description: Kim Keever squeezes paint into a 200 gallon fish tank to make his art. The resulting photographs are vibrant odes to physics.

video:video.video:title: Watch a Heavy Lift Ship Pick Up a Navy Destroyer
video:video.video:description: Here's how a heavy lift vessel will scoop up the damaged USS John S. McCain and ferry it to Japan for repairs.

video:video.video:title: The DIY Space Suit
video:video.video:description: As a kid Cameron Smith dreamed of becoming an astronaut but his eyesight keep him out of the pilot's seat. Now he's an anthropologist in Portland, Oregon, where he's building a fully functional homemade space suit.

video:video.video:title: Visit an Audio Installation That Surrounds You With Sound
video:video.video:description: Envelop at the Midway is an experimental sound installation that promotes technology for making spatial audio. It’s also a performance space that fosters listening as a community.

video:video.video:title: Go Inside the Lab That’s Giving Robots a Sense of Touch
video:video.video:description: Go inside Syntouch, the laboratory developing a robotic finger that senses pressure, heat, and texture. This handy robot has huge implications for the world of prosthetics and product descriptions, and it may one day change the way we think about and describe our sense of touch.

video:video.video:title: Everything From the 2017 Google Pixel Event
video:video.video:description: WIRED looks at the latest and greatest gadgets unveiled at Google's Pixel 2 event.

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - Neil deGrasse Tyson Answers Science Questions From Twitter
video:video.video:description:
Astrophysicist and 'StarTalk' host Neil deGrasse Tyson uses the power of Twitter to answer some common questions about our universe. What is a quark? Is there a limit to the expansion of the universe?
Tune into 'StarTalk' airing Sundays at 11pm/10c on National Geographic.

video:video.video:title: First Look at the 2018 Ford Mustang GT's Futuristic Dashboard
video:video.video:description: Rev it up with a choice of gauge styles. The 2018 Ford Mustang GT has an innovative digital display that could be the future of dashboards.

video:video.video:title: The Zippy Microbots That Swarm to Build Structures
video:video.video:description: These tiny robots take a cue from ant colonies to cooperatively build. Some do the glue work, and some assemble scaffolding that could make for stronger 3D printing. Someday armies of microscopic bots might even roam our bodies to capture unwanted cells.

video:video.video:title: Is It Art? The Rise of Made-for-Instagram Exhibits
video:video.video:description: New pop-up exhibits like the Museum of Ice Cream and Color Factory are ditching the traditional gallery barriers and "no photography" rules for interactive, picture perfect installations.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Tom Cruise & Doug Liman Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: 'American Made' star Tom Cruise and director Doug Liman take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the Internet's most searched questions about themselves.

video:video.video:title: The Jean Jacket of the Future
video:video.video:description: Remember Marty's jean jacket from "Back to the Future"? Well Levi's Commuter Trucker Jacket with Jacquard by Google is better. We got a glimpse into what might happen when we start connecting our clothes to the internet.

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - Jackie Chan & Olivia Munn Answer Martial Arts Questions From Twitter
video:video.video:description: 'The LEGO Ninjago Movie' stars Jackie Chan and Olivia Munn use the power of Twitter to answer some common martial arts questions. Jackie also teaches Olivia how to karate chop some pieces of wood and defend herself from knife attacks.

video:video.video:title: How Brett the Robot is Learning by Failing
video:video.video:description: Brett, a robot at UC Berkeley, is learning to put a square peg in a square hole the same way that a child does. Slowly and with trial and error.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Dave Franco, Kumail Nanjiani and Fred Armisen Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: The LEGO Ninjago Movie stars Dave Franco, Fred Armisen, and Kumail Nanjiani take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the Internet's most searched questions about themselves.

video:video.video:title: The Strange Science of the Veggie Burger That Bleeds
video:video.video:description: It's called the Impossible Burger and it looks, feels, tastes and smells like ground beef, even though it's made entirely of plants. It's all thanks to science and genetically engineered yeast. WIRED explores how close it comes so to the real thing and if it's 100% safe.

video:video.video:title: iPhone 8 Review: The Best Yet, For Now
video:video.video:description: David Pierce reviews the new iPhone 8. No you can't unlock it with your face, but it's still a very nice phone with a great camera.

video:video.video:title: Blade Runner 2049: Ridley Scott Dissects His Favorite Scene from the 1982 Classic
video:video.video:description: Blade Runner director Ridley Scott dissects the scene when replicant Rachel meets Blade Runner Deckard. The original Blade Runner is now available in 4K Ultra HD Blu-Ray.

video:video.video:title: Blade Runner 2049: Harrison Ford and Ryan Gosling Talk Acting, Blade Running, and Their Pecs
video:video.video:description: Blade Runner 2049 stars Harrison Ford and Ryan Gosling on their roles as Blade Runners, physically demanding parts, and the first time they met on set.

video:video.video:title: Blade Runner 2049 Director Denis Villeneuve on Seeing the Original for the First Time
video:video.video:description: Blade Runner 2049 director Denis Villeneuve reflects on seeing the original Blade Runner on the big screen and why he still loves the voice over version.

video:video.video:title: Man Dresses as a Car Seat in the Name of Self-Driving Science
video:video.video:description: A man dressed as a car seat to fool pedestrians and drivers into believing his van was driving itself. It's hilarious, but it's all in the name of autonomous vehicle research.

video:video.video:title: Up Close and Personal With the New iPhone X
video:video.video:description: The New iPhone X packs more new stuff into any device since the original iPhone. It's the most complete redesign of the product ever, and even offers a glimpse at what the iPhone might become when the world no longer wants smartphones.

video:video.video:title: Everything From the Apple Event: iPhone X and 8, Watch, and Apple TV
video:video.video:description: All of the big announcements from the 2017 Apple event including the iPhone X, the iPhone 8, the series 3 cellular Watch and 4K Apple TV.

video:video.video:title: First Drive Review of Nissan's New Leaf Electric Car
video:video.video:description: Nissan’s new Leaf is an OK electric car—and that’s a great thing. The original Leaf was a global best seller. Now the 2018 LEAF has to compete with Chevy's Bolt and Tesla's Model 3. WIRED takes the car, and its semi-autonomous features, for a spin.

video:video.video:title: Meet Taurus, the VR Controlled Bomb Disposal Robot
video:video.video:description: This is Taurus, SRI’s tele-operated robot, which ventures where human beings dare not.

video:video.video:title: The Decade That Built the iPhone X
video:video.video:description: When Steve Jobs launched the iPhone in 2007, he said it was 5 years ahead of the competition and he was right. But after a decade, it's starting to feel like Apple needs something big again. And now, on cue, here comes something big.

video:video.video:title: Google Maps Is Upgrading Street View and You Can Help
video:video.video:description: Expect to see a new fleet of Google Street View cameras on the road. Their new images, and possibly yours, are helping the company's artificial intelligence index the world's places.

video:video.video:title: Bye-Bye, Blob! Say Hello to the New Google Emoji
video:video.video:description: Google is updating its old gum-drop shaped emoji on Android in favor of a more universal set of pictograms that will make it that much easier to say "winking tongue out face" than ever before.

video:video.video:title: 'The Current War' First Trailer
video:video.video:description: Electricity powerhouses Thomas Edison and George Westinghouse race to bring electricity to the world in 'The Current War,' hitting theaters Nov. 24.

video:video.video:title: How Nuclear Weapons Have Evolved Since the 1940's
video:video.video:description: Today’s bombs are smaller in size but more powerful. They are also more likely to be delivered via intercontinental ballistic missiles, rather than dropped from aircraft. Here's how they've evolved into weapons that could wipe out entire cities.

video:video.video:title: Why Two-Legged Robots Aren't a Total Disaster | HardWIRED
video:video.video:description: Nothing in robotics is as unintentionally hilarious as watching a biped fall. But roboticists are making progress- like with this machine named Cassie.

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - Bungie's Luke Smith Answers Destiny Questions From Twitter
video:video.video:description: Bungie's Luke Smith, design director of Destiny 2, answers Twitter's burning questions about the Destiny franchise. What if the loot cave still existed? How will characters transfer to Destiny 2? Did the wizard really come from the moon?

video:video.video:title: Shaping Smarter Cities - The Future of LA
video:video.video:description: Hunting plumbing, not cartoons with augmented reality.

video:video.video:title: Out of Office with Brent Rose - What High-Tech Gear is Best for the Ultimate Camping Trip
video:video.video:description:
Want to take your upcoming camping trip to the next level? Brent Rose packs a car full of high-tech gear and attempts to pull off the ultimate camping trip.
Correction: The jacket is actually called Eddie Bauer EverTherm Down Jacket. We regret the error.

video:video.video:title: Inside the Studio Where Aerial Photography Turns into Prints That Last Forever | My Space
video:video.video:description: Artist Justin Guariglia uses a high-tech printer to create art that documents Earth's melting glaciers.

video:video.video:title: Why It's Almost Impossible to Hold Your Breath for 24 Minutes
video:video.video:description: Spanish freediver Aleix Segura held his breath for 24 minutes and 3 seconds in 2016. How is that possible? Here's how.

video:video.video:title: HardWIRED: So, What Is a Robot Really?
video:video.video:description: Introducing HardWIRED, a new video series about the robots that are poised to take over the world. In the first episode WIRED explores what qualifies as a robot in the first place.

video:video.video:title: Technique Critique - Movie Accent Expert Breaks Down Actors Playing Real People
video:video.video:description:
Dialect coach Erik Singer takes a look at idiolects, better known as the specific way one individual speaks. To best break down this concept, Erik analyzes some actors playing real people. Just how close was Jamie Foxx's Ray Charles? What about Cate Blanchett's portrayal of Bob Dylan? Is Daniel Day-Lewis' Lincoln accurate?
Check out more from Erik here: http://www.eriksinger.com/

video:video.video:title: Here's What Humanity Will Learn from the Solar Eclipse
video:video.video:description: America just witnessed the most fantastic celestial phenomenon human eyes can witness: a total solar eclipse. It was a national spectacle, but also a huge opportunity for science.

video:video.video:title: Whistling to Direct a Border Collie
video:video.video:description: Lo: move a little clockwise Lo-High: move further clockwise High-Lo-High (fast): move a little counter-clockwise High-Lo-High (slow): move further counter-clockwise High: hold that line, slow down Two mid notes: walk on to the sheep High falling: lie down

video:video.video:title: Instagram's Bold Plan to Block Hateful Comments Using AI
video:video.video:description: WIRED Editor-in-chief Nick Thompson sits down with Instagram CEO, Kevin Systrom, to talk about the platform's bold plan to use AI to block hateful comments posted by trolls.

video:video.video:title: Watch London Workers Build 54 Escalators in a 2-Minute Timelapse
video:video.video:description: The latest stage in London's Crossrail project: getting it ready for the people.

video:video.video:title: Plankton 'Mucus Houses' Could Pull Microplastics From the Sea
video:video.video:description: Watch the jellyfish-like larvacean capture tiny floating bits of plastic, enabling the pinkie-sized critter to eliminate the plastic as waste that falls to the seafloor.

video:video.video:title: Hexa: the Fascinating Yet Unsettling Six-Legged Robot
video:video.video:description: Hexa isn’t just an extremely entertaining robot. Its maker hopes to turn it into a full-fledged robotics platform.

video:video.video:title: Shaping Smarter Cities - Urban Farming in Tokyo
video:video.video:description: How do we feed a growing population in areas where land is scarce? Produced for Mouser Electronics by the WIRED Brand Lab

video:video.video:title: Shaping Smarter Cities - Porto's Roving Hotspots
video:video.video:description: The city of the future calls for more connectivity. Porto company Veniam is leading that charge by incorporating a wifi mesh network to this old-world city. Produced for Mouser Electronics by the WIRED Brand Lab

video:video.video:title: Shaping Smarter Cities - Global Challenges
video:video.video:description: Mouser Electronics Brand Ambassador, Grant Imahara, sat down with our WIRED Brand Lab Editor to identify the global challenges that our major cities are facing. It’s these key challenges that will help dictate where Grant travels to and why. Produced for Mouser Electronics by the WIRED Brand Lab

video:video.video:title: Out of Office with Brent Rose - The Best Ways to Watch an Eclipse
video:video.video:description: WIRED's Brent Rose goes over some of the best ways to watch a total eclipse.

video:video.video:title: Living in a Shoebox Apartment? This Hi-Tech Furniture Could Help
video:video.video:description: Apartments are getting smaller and smaller. To combat this ever shrinking urban dilemma, a company called ORI is building modular, movable and totally automatic furniture for people who live in cramped quarters.

video:video.video:title: Rare Films of Nuclear Bomb Tests Reveal Their True Power
video:video.video:description: Nuclear physicists are using film scanners and computer analysis on old bomb test footage to uncover the weapons' secrets.

video:video.video:title: Reuniting With Dawn, the Ion-Powered Spacecraft in the Asteroid Belt
video:video.video:description: How did Dawn orbit two protoplanets? The same way Darth Vadar annihilated the rebel fleet. Sort of.

video:video.video:title: Wanna See the Solar Eclipse? Here's What You Have to Know
video:video.video:description: On August 21, darkness will wash over America. But in a good way, we promise. Here's everything you need to know if you want to catch a glimpse of the solar eclipse.

video:video.video:title: The Priority Continuum Onyx Is a City Bike That Doesn’t Suck
video:video.video:description: The Priority Continuum Onyx sports a continuous variable transmission hub, a grease-free belt drive and powerful disk brakes. It's the sort of solid, non-fussy town bike that turns casual riders into commuters.

video:video.video:title: This Plane is Trying to Fly to 90,000 Feet Without an Engine
video:video.video:description: The Perlan II, a specially designed glider meant to climb to higher than any plane has ever flown, is attempting to reach altitudes of 90,000 feet.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Matthew McConaughey & Idris Elba Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: "The Dark Tower" stars Matthew McConaughey and Idris Elba take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the Internet's most searched questions about themselves.

video:video.video:title: Pod Meets Tube, and Hyperloop Whooshes Closer Than Ever
video:video.video:description: Ride a pod down the Tron-like pipes of Hyperloop One, which just took a big stride toward the day it flings you between cities in near-vacuum tubes.

video:video.video:title: How to Live with Robots
video:video.video:description: Sophisticated companion robots have arrived. But we need to be very careful about how we interact with them.

video:video.video:title: Full Leaked Audio of Jared Kushner Q & A
video:video.video:description: Trump administration senior adviser Jared Kushner spoke to congressional interns in an off the record meeting, including about his work in the Middle East.

video:video.video:title: Magician Breaks Down How Illusions Work
video:video.video:description: Magician David Kwong breaks down magic into what he calls the "7 Principles of Illusion" and explains what goes into the execution of a magic trick.

video:video.video:title: Leaked Audio of Q&A With Jared Kushner
video:video.video:description: Trump administration senior adviser Jared Kushner spoke to congressional interns in an off the record meeting, including about his work in the Middle East.

video:video.video:title: Atomic Blonde Stairway Fight
video:video.video:description: An exclusive clip from Atomic Blonde.

video:video.video:title: The Tesla Model 3 Is Finally Here. Sort Of.
video:video.video:description: Tesla has just delivered the first 30 models of its most crucial car, the Model 3. The new addition to the Tesla family is supposed to be the “affordable” car, starting at $35,000. Tesla CEO Elon Musk says over half a million people have already paid $1000 to reserve their Model 3.

video:video.video:title: Elon Musk's Master Plan Culminates in the Tesla Model 3
video:video.video:description: The Tesla Model 3 isn’t just a new electric car, it’s the culmination of over a decade of careful strategic planning to achieve Elon Musk’s goal: to accelerate humanity’s transition to sustainable energy.

video:video.video:title: The Best (and Worst) Anti-Drone Weapons, From Shotguns to Superdrones
video:video.video:description: There are many ways to kill a drone. But what's the cheapest and most effective way to do it? A cybersecurity consultancy is testing various ways to defend against rogue drones.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Al Gore Answers the Web's Most Searched Questions on Climate Change
video:video.video:description: Politician and activist Al Gore answers the Internet's most searched questions about climate change.

video:video.video:title: Incredible Old-School Footage of NASA’s X-Plane Program
video:video.video:description: NASA has released gobs of archival footage to its Youtube channel for your viewing pleasure. Don't thank us, thank NASA.

video:video.video:title: How a Hacker Fired a Locked Smart Gun with $15 of Magnets
video:video.video:description: The Armatix iP1 pistol and its RFID watch, are sold as one of the most secure firearm systems available. But a hacker, who goes by 'Plore', has found flaws in the Armatix that entirely defeat its security measures.

video:video.video:title: The Full Video of a Robot Cracking a Safe
video:video.video:description: Watch this safe-cracking robot open a safe in 15 minutes.

video:video.video:title: Watch a Homemade Robot Crack a Safe in Just 15 Minutes
video:video.video:description: Nathan Seidle’s wife gave him this already locked safe as a gift with no combination. Weird present, but he loves a good challenge. So he built a safecracking robot.

video:video.video:title: The Little Robot That Supports a Paralyzed Vet
video:video.video:description: The Human Support Robot from Toyota is an advanced robot that’s been helping a paralyzed war vet at home.

video:video.video:title: Dane DeHaan Shows Us the Last Thing on His Phone
video:video.video:description: 'Valerian' star Dane DeHaan shows us the last thing he did with his phone. Luc Besson’s epic sci-fi 'Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets' comes out in theaters July 21st.

video:video.video:title: Stunt Coordinator Breaks Down 'Atomic Blonde' Fight Scene
video:video.video:description: 'Atomic Blonde' stunt coordinator and second unit director Sam Hargrave breaks down every stunt in the film's Berlin flat fight scene.

video:video.video:title: How a Son Made a Chatbot of His Dying Dad
video:video.video:description: James Vlahos' father was dying, so he set out to save his dad's memories and code them into a 'Dadbot' that lives on his phone.

video:video.video:title: What is 5G and When Do We Get It?
video:video.video:description: 5G is the next generation of high-speed wireless communication. It should speed up your phone's data service to the point that it's bonkers fast.

video:video.video:title: The Stunning Evolution of Color in Film
video:video.video:description: Before they figured out how to shoot film in color, filmmakers were painting their footage, frame-by-frame. Fast forward a century and the HDR technology available to colorists means we are to see more detail than ever on our screens.

video:video.video:title: How Climate Change Is Already Affecting Earth
video:video.video:description: Though the planet has only warmed by one-degree Celsius since the Industrial Revolution, climate change's effect on earth has been anything but subtle. Here are some of the most astonishing developments over the past few years.

video:video.video:title: Watch the Hyperloop Complete Its First Successful Test Ride
video:video.video:description: The Hyperloop is one step closer to becoming a reality. If it works, the new form of transportation could mean a journey from LA to San Francisco would take just 50 minutes.

video:video.video:title: A Timeline of Uber's Unfolding
video:video.video:description: Uber's crises have come so fast that they've piled on top of one another. We've laid out some of the companies most infamous milestones.

video:video.video:title: Inside the High-Tech Flag Football League That's Taking on the NFL
video:video.video:description: Jeff Lewis, a former Wall Street guy, is the founder of the American Flag Football League. It’s a new, teched-out version of the game and he believes it's the future of football.

video:video.video:title: Watch the Tesla Model S Fail to Ace Its Latest Crash Test
video:video.video:description: Tesla is having a rough week. The company's stock price fell 20% in just a few days and now the Insurance Institute for Highway Safety announced the Tesla Model S sedan failed to earn its best rating, the Top Safety Pick.

video:video.video:title: Meet Salto, the Tiny Robot With a Giant Leap
video:video.video:description: Salto is a tiny robot with an incredible leap and a bright future in rescue operations.

video:video.video:title: How to Stop the New York City Subway Apocalypse
video:video.video:description: New York City's subway is overcrowded and late. And that's just the beginning. Here's how the Metropolitan Transportation Authority could get the system back on track.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Will Ferrell & Amy Poehler Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: 'The House' stars Will Ferrell and Amy Poehler answer the Internet's most searched questions about themselves.

video:video.video:title: Cadillac Challenges Tesla with a Super Smart Self-Driving Sedan
video:video.video:description: Cadillac's new self-driving car isn't just watching the road, it's watching the driver. The system it calls "super cruise" is designed to crack the so-called "hand-off" problem.

video:video.video:title: How Nike Nearly Cracked the Perfect Marathon
video:video.video:description: Runners have been trying to break through the 2 hour marathon mark for decades. Here's the incredible science behind how Eliud Kipchoge came within 25 seconds in Nike's Breaking2 project.

video:video.video:title: How the iPhone Became the Everything Machine
video:video.video:description: The iPhone is 10 years old! Take a look back at how the smartphone grew from gadget to essential.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Steve Carell & Kristen Wiig Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: 'Despicable Me 3' stars Steve Carell and Kristen Wiig answer the Internet's most searched questions about themselves.

video:video.video:title: How the Internet Tricks You Into Thinking You're Always Right
video:video.video:description: A guide to busting through confirmation bias, the cognitive fallacy that's destroying our discourse.

video:video.video:title: Now Amazon's Alexa Can Show You Things
video:video.video:description: Instead of just yelling at you, Amazon's Alexa now can show you things with a new flashy screen. Here's WIRED's review of the Amazon Echo Show.

video:video.video:title: Jets, Helicopters, and Airliners Flash Their Skills at the Paris Air Show
video:video.video:description: If you’re looking for the stars of the aviation world—the biggest airliners, the fiercest fighters, the swankiest private jets, the smartest drones—pack your bags for France.

video:video.video:title: Why You Should Care About Net Neutrality
video:video.video:description: A world without net neutrality might end up meaning that you have to pay more to access the internet content that you want. But it also might crush innovation.

video:video.video:title: Techies Are Using Ketamine to Fight Their Depression
video:video.video:description: Sean Spencer is a pretty successful entrepreneur in LA's startup community but he also struggles with depression. He and many others use ketamine to help with their lows.

video:video.video:title: Watch How Hackers Took Over a Ukrainian Power Station
video:video.video:description: Watch as hackers take over the mouse controls of Ukrainian grid operators, part of a breach that caused a blackout for a quarter million people.

video:video.video:title: Watch the F-35 Fighter Jet Make Its First Public Flight
video:video.video:description: The F-35 is the most expensive weapons system, ever. After years of delays, the fighter jet just made its first public flight at the Paris Air Show.

video:video.video:title: Vsauce Answers the 100 Most Googled Questions
video:video.video:description: Michael, Kevin, and Jake from Vsauce attempt to answer the 100 most Googled questions.

video:video.video:title: The Fascinating Robot That Teaches Itself How to Grab New Objects
video:video.video:description: Researchers have loaded a robot with AI that lets it scan an object and determine how best to grab it.

video:video.video:title: Why You Can Never Argue with Conspiracy Theorists
video:video.video:description: Alex Jones is not the only guy making a career out of conspiracy theories. They are everywhere on the internet and here's why you have no choice but to ignore them.

video:video.video:title: Video Game Sounds Explained By Experts
video:video.video:description: Four video game sound designers explain the thinking behind some of the world's most recognizable video game sounds.

video:video.video:title: The Psychology Behind Video Game Sounds (1998-2017)
video:video.video:description: Four video game sound designers explain the thinking behind some of the world's most recognizable video game sounds. Featuring sounds from the Legend of Zelda, Half-Life, The Sims, Minecraft, Dota 2 and more!

video:video.video:title: Obsessed - Meet the 89-Year Old Who Built a Train in His Backyard
video:video.video:description: The future of train transportation might be pneumatic tubes and magnets. Meet the 89-year old entrepreneur who wants to disrupt the railroad with a modern twist on a very old train idea.

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - Nick Offerman Answers Woodworking Questions From Twitter
video:video.video:description: Nick Offerman uses the power of Twitter to answer some common woodworking questions. Nick's book Good Clean Fun and film The Hero are both out now.

video:video.video:title: Why We Love the New Microsoft Laptop
video:video.video:description: The Microsoft Surface Laptop is a great-looking, light and super usable notebook. Here's more about why we love it.

video:video.video:title: The Psychology Behind Video Game Sounds (1972-1998)
video:video.video:description: Four video game sound designers explain the thinking behind some of the world's most recognizable video game sounds. Featuring sounds from Pac-Man, Sonic the Hedgehog, Donkey Kong, Mario Kart, Contra, Street Fighter II, Doom and more!

video:video.video:title: Meet 4 of NASA's Newest Astronaut Candidates
video:video.video:description: Twelve new astronaut candidates just joined the ranks of those with the right stuff. Picked from a pool of 18,000 they may be among the first to journey to Mars. Four spoke with WIRED about getting the call and what they hope to accomplish.

video:video.video:title: Lamborghini Toasted the World's Toughest Track with Air Instead of Horsepower
video:video.video:description: Supercars are usually super thanks to monstrous power. The engineers at Lamborghini turned to some smart air scooping tricks to send the production Huracan around the Nurburgring track in record time.

video:video.video:title: Crispr Is Already Changing the Food We Eat | WIRED BizCon
video:video.video:description: At the WIRED Business Conference, Jennifer Doudna, Co-Inventor of CRISPR-Cas9, shared some of the ways the gene editing tool is already changing agriculture.

video:video.video:title: The One Thing the Architect of Apple's New HQ Would Change | WIRED BizCon
video:video.video:description: Ask Norman Foster what, if anything, he’d like to change about Apple’s new headquarters, and he’ll need a moment to think. The famed architect, whose firm spent the last eight years perfecting plans for Apple’s massive campus, is mostly pleased with the results. But there is one thing he'd change.

video:video.video:title: Amazon Now Considers Itself an AI Company | WIRED BizCon
video:video.video:description: Speaking at the WIRED Business Conference, Amazon SVP of Devices, David Limp confessed that if Amazon is to continue to thrive in the future, it has to consider itself an AI company.

video:video.video:title: AI Won't Replace Doctors, It'll Help Them | WIRED BizCon
video:video.video:description: Google is poised to begin a grand experiment in using machine learning to widen access to healthcare. If it is successful, millions of people with diabetes could avoid losing their sight. Lily Peng from Google Brain explained at the WIRED Business Conference how technology like this would help doctors, not replace them.

video:video.video:title: The Story Behind Google's Super Chip | WIRED BizCon
video:video.video:description: Five years ago, as its voice recognition tech took off, Google realized it would have to double its server space to handle even three minutes of speech from every Android user. Even Google couldn't afford that. So Urs Hözle and his team built a super chip to parse all that data more efficiently.

video:video.video:title: Google's Plan to Use Ads to Sway ISIS Recruits | WIRED BizCon
video:video.video:description: Yasmin Green leads a team at Google which has developed tools to help journalists stay secure in authoritarian regimes, to combat cyber bullying, and to help people before they become radicalized by extremist ideology. At the WIRED business conference, Green shared the company's strategies to sway ISIS recruits before it's too late.

video:video.video:title: Women Engineers On the Rampant Sexism of Silicon Valley
video:video.video:description: Five female engineers discuss the sexism of the tech industry and why greater diversity and inclusion makes better products for everyone.

video:video.video:title: Meet HomePod, Apple's New Siri-Enabled Speaker
video:video.video:description: Apple has unveiled the HomePod, a $350 wireless speaker with Siri baked right in.

video:video.video:title: Here's Everything Apple Announced at WWDC 2017
video:video.video:description: At Apple's annual WWDC conference CEO Tim Cook and others unveiled its most powerful Mac yet, a long-awaited Siri speaker, and tons of new software upgrades across all of the Apple platforms.

video:video.video:title: How To Battle Trolling Ad Hominem Attacks Online
video:video.video:description: An internet troll's favorite way to argue? Ad hominem, of course! This is your guide to spotting bad arguments on the internet and how to fight them.

video:video.video:title: How to Make Your Browsing Data More Private than a Thousand Incognito Windows
video:video.video:description: Thanks to an assist from Congress, your cable company has the legal right to sell your web-browsing data without your consent. This is how to protect your data from preying eyes.

video:video.video:title: Welcome to Salinas! The Farming Town Where Robots Reign
video:video.video:description: In Salinas Valley, about an hour and a half south of San Francisco, farmers and tech types are joining forces to turn this place into a kind of Silicon Valley for agriculture.

video:video.video:title: Inside the Absurd Distillery Where They Make '20-Year' Rum in Six Days
video:video.video:description: Obsessive distiller Bryan Davis invented a contraption for aging booze fast. His goal: to create highly engineered, rapidly prototyped sprits that are unlike any you've tasted before.

video:video.video:title: Worried About Your Weak Passwords? Here's How to Fix Them
video:video.video:description: Look, we get it. Remembering dozens and dozens of different passwords for different sites is next to impossible. But that doesn’t mean you should be reusing your passwords. That’s just asking for trouble.

video:video.video:title: Google's AlphaGo Notches Another Win for AI
video:video.video:description: Google's AlphaGo artificial intelligence system edged out the best human Go player for a 2-0 win. But it is also playing with and against teams of professional human players.

video:video.video:title: Time To Ditch Our Cars and Start Riding Cargo Bikes
video:video.video:description: Utility bikes really have the potential to be the future of transport in American cities. Here's why.

video:video.video:title: Out of Office with Brent Rose - Trying Stand-Up Comedy Using Only Siri, Echo, Cortana and Google Assistant
video:video.video:description: Brent Rose takes Google Assistant, Amazon Echo, Microsoft Cortana and Apple's Siri out for the ultimate test drive; which AI has the best sense of humor? How will a human audience respond to a stand-up set written entirely by smart gadgets?

video:video.video:title: Biologist Explains One Concept in 5 Levels of Difficulty - CRISPR
video:video.video:description: CRISPR is a new biomedical technique that enables powerful gene editing. WIRED challenged biologist Neville Sanjana to explain CRISPR to 5 different people; a child, a teen, a college student, a grad student, and a CRISPR expert.

video:video.video:title: Scientists May Have Finally Figured Out Why Whales Are So Big
video:video.video:description: According to a new study, whales didn't grow big just because they could. They did it because of climate change.

video:video.video:title: AlphaGo Wins First Go Game in China with New AI Architecture
video:video.video:description: DeepMind's AlphaGo artificial intelligence system beat the world's top Go player in Wuhzen, China with a new architecture that the company says is more efficient in both energy use and computing power.

video:video.video:title: Phishing Scams Aren't Just for Gullible Grandparents Anymore
video:video.video:description: Phishing scams are getting more and more sophisticated, to the point where they’re fooling even security experts. Here's how to avoid them.

video:video.video:title: Robots & Us: The Future of Work in the Age of AI
video:video.video:description: Robot co-workers and artificial intelligence assistants are becoming more common in the workplace. Could they edge human employees out? What then?

video:video.video:title: How a Bunch of Students Set a New Rocket Record
video:video.video:description: A group of students from USC have set a new rocket record and they aren't stopping there.

video:video.video:title: All the Slick Stuff From Google I/O 2017
video:video.video:description: From Google Lens to the the company's new artificial intelligence chip here are the big announcements from Google I/O 2017's first day.

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - Blizzard's Jeff Kaplan Answers Overwatch Questions From Twitter
video:video.video:description: Game designer Jeff Kaplan uses the power of Twitter to answer some common "Overwatch" questions.

video:video.video:title: Watch Steve Jobs Pitch the Cupertino City Council on Apple Park
video:video.video:description: In his last public appearance, Steve Jobs makes his pitch for Apple's new campus at a June 2011 Cupertino City Council meeting.

video:video.video:title: 8 People Test Their Accents on Siri, Echo and Google Home
video:video.video:description: Andy Wood and Matt Kirshen test the limits of everyday AI against a variety of accents in linguistics tests designed to determine which AI is the best at understanding the most people. Featuring Google Home, Amazon Echo, and Siri.

video:video.video:title: Robots & Us: The Augmented Self
video:video.video:description: Technology – from steel to server farm – has always changed what it means to be human. But what happens as we meld with ever more capable machines?

video:video.video:title: Inside LAX During the Most Ambitious Airport Move, Ever
video:video.video:description: We’re behind-the-scenes at Los Angeles’ airport, which is in the middle of five days of upheaval as 21 airlines swap terminals in the dead of night.

video:video.video:title: What is Ransomware and How Do You Deal With It?
video:video.video:description: Ransomware. It's malware but worse. It takes the contents of your device hostage and demands Bitcoin as a, you guessed it, ransom. Here's how to avoid it and what to do if your laptop gets locked.

video:video.video:title: The Wind-Slicing GT Puts Ford Back in the Supercar Game
video:video.video:description: The new Ford GT is the spiritual successor to the GT40 which dominated the 24 hours of Le Mans races in the 1960s.

video:video.video:title: Mysterious Fungi Bring a West Virginia Forest Back to Life
video:video.video:description: In West Virginia, the Nature Conservancy is bringing back forests with the help of a very special fungus.

video:video.video:title: This Is What $250 Billion Actually Looks Like
video:video.video:description: Apple recently announced that they have a $250 billion in the bank. This is what that amount of money actually looks like.

video:video.video:title: Watch the Little Robot That Taught the Big Robot Something New
video:video.video:description: Robots can learn to do tasks just fine. Getting different kinds of robots to share knowledge, though, is another challenge entirely.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Amy Schumer & Goldie Hawn Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: 'Snatched' stars Amy Schumer and Goldie Hawn answer the Internet's most searched questions about themselves.

video:video.video:title: How to Get Started with Encrypted Messaging
video:video.video:description: It’s time to start using an encrypted messaging app. Why? Using end-to-end encryption means that no one can see what you’re sharing back and forth.

video:video.video:title: Robots & Us: How Food-Bots Are Changing How We Eat
video:video.video:description: Artificial intelligence and advanced automation are everywhere including our farm fields and kitchens. How will robots change the way we grow, harvest and cook our food?

video:video.video:title: Eliud Kipchoge Almost Breaks the Two-Hour Marathon
video:video.video:description: Eliud Kipchoge fell short of running a marathon in under two hours. In a special Nike event, the long distance runner beat the current marathon world record coming in at 2 hours and 25 seconds, but because the event wasn't sanctioned it won't count. Here's how Nike controlled every variable in an attempt to break two.

video:video.video:title: What is a DDoS Hack and How Do You Avoid Them?
video:video.video:description: DDoS! It stands for distributed denial of service, a kind of attack that turns insecure, internet-connected devices into a sort of zombie army. So here's how you can avoid being part of that zombie army.

video:video.video:title: Why It's Almost Impossible to Run a Two-Hour Marathon
video:video.video:description: One of the world's finest distance runners came so close to achieving the greatest feats of athleticism in history: a sub two-hour marathon. To do it, the Eliud Kipchoge should have maintained an average pace of at least 13.1 miles per hour. So, we timed how long WIRED staffers could run at that speed. Needless to say, we didn't last long. Here's why only a handful of people in the world could ever come close to a two-hour marathon.

video:video.video:title: Meet the Cute Little Robot That'll Soon Float Around with Astronauts
video:video.video:description: The Astrobee is a brilliant little robot that'll use puffs of air to autonomously float around the International Space Station.

video:video.video:title: Robots & Us: When Machines Take the Wheel
video:video.video:description: Autonomous driving technology could make getting around safer, more efficient, and less expensive. What will it mean for the millions of people who drive for a living and is it really ready for the road?

video:video.video:title: The Unsettling Performance That Showed the World Through AI’s Eyes
video:video.video:description: Artist Trevor Paglen is best known for images of the security state – drones, spy satellites and rendition planes – For a new work commissioned by the Cantor Arts Center he's collaborated with Kronos Quartet and Obscura Digital to look under the hood of artificial intelligence and machine vision.

video:video.video:title: How NASA Visualizes Stunning Worlds Without Ever Seeing Them
video:video.video:description: Every time a new exoplanet is discovered, the announcement is accompanied by an artist’s rendering of that world. So when scientists recently discovered the seven exoplanets of Trappist-1, NASA's visual artists had their work cut out for them.

video:video.video:title: The Robot Will See You Now – AI and Health Care
video:video.video:description: Artificial intelligence is now detecting cancer and robots are doing nursing tasks. But are there risks to handing over elements of our health to machines, no matter how sophisticated?

video:video.video:title: If Robots Want to Work with Us, We Must Fix Four Problems
video:video.video:description: In the not too distant future, a robot could be working right beside you and that means human and machine need to learn how to interact seamlessly. Researchers at UC Berkeley are working on solving four fascinating problems with human-robot interactions.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Salma Hayek & Eugenio Derbez Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: 'How To Be a Latin Lover' stars Salma Hayek and Eugenio Derbez answer the Internet's most searched questions about themselves.

video:video.video:title: The Crazy Choreography of Free Fire's Massive ’70s Shootout
video:video.video:description: From mustaches to muzzle flashes, Ben Wheatley's kinetic action-comedy is a meticulously planned affair.

video:video.video:title: Lilium’s Funky ‘Jet’ Could Make Flying Car Dreams a Reality
video:video.video:description: The Lilium personal jet is the latest entry in a growing field of what are essentially flying cars. The electric vehicle could soon be ferrying passengers using distributed propulsion.

video:video.video:title: NASA Is Sending Cassini out with a Funeral Fit for Scientific Royalty
video:video.video:description: Twenty years ago, the Cassini spacecraft blasted off from earth on an epic journey to find out more about Saturn. Now that journey comes to a glorious end.

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - Bill Nye Answers Science Questions From Twitter
video:video.video:description:
Bill Nye uses the power of Twitter to answer some common science questions.
Check out Bill's new show on Netflix "Bill Nye Saves The World" premiering April 21st!

video:video.video:title: The Team That Made the Mission to the Moon Possible
video:video.video:description: 'Mission Control: The Unsung Heroes of Apollo' is a documentary film about the team that built NASA's mission control and guided astronauts to the moon.

video:video.video:title: What Can Facebook Do About Live Murders and Suicides?
video:video.video:description: Steve Stephens recorded himself murdering an innocent victim and then uploaded the footage to Facebook. The horrific act has put Facebook under immense pressure to do something, but can the company prevent broadcasting acts of violence without fundamentally changing the purpose of the social media platform. WIRED explores Facebook's limited options.

video:video.video:title: All of the Big News from Facebook's F8 2017
video:video.video:description: Everything you need to know from Facebook's F8 from augmented reality filters to messenger bots to virtual selfie sticks.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - Creating Scarlett Johansson's Computer-Generated Body Suit
video:video.video:description: Mike Seymour breaks down the visual effects from the film 'Ghost in the Shell' starring Scarlett Johansson.

video:video.video:title: 5 of the Most Iconic 'Fast & Furious' Cars From the Guy Who Built Them
video:video.video:description: Dennis McCarthy, the man behind all of the cars from the Fast and the Furious franchise, gives us his insights on five iconic cars from the films.

video:video.video:title: How Hip-Hop Producer Steve Lacy Makes Hits With ... His Phone
video:video.video:description: Steve Lacy is a pretty big deal. He's part of the band The Internet, he's a producer for J. Cole and Kendrick Lamar, and he just put out his first solo album which he made on his iPhone.

video:video.video:title: Robots & Us: A Brief History of Our Robotic Future
video:video.video:description: Artificial intelligence and automation stand to upend nearly every aspect of modern life, from transportation to health care and even work. So how did we get here and where are we going?

video:video.video:title: Inside the Plane Graveyard Training Future Air Crash Investigators
video:video.video:description: USC houses a collection of twisted, burnt, jagged aircraft wrecks in a warehouse outside Los Angeles and it's where they train students to act as detectives in helicopter and plane crashes.

video:video.video:title: The Robot That's Roaming San Francisco's Streets to Deliver Food
video:video.video:description: Hungry? But you don't want to deal with a human? If you live in San Francisco's Mission district, you can get your food delivered by a robot named Marble.

video:video.video:title: Technique Critique - Accent Expert Breaks Down 6 Fictional Languages From Film & TV
video:video.video:description: Dialect coach Erik Singer analyzes some of the most famous "constructed languages" in movie and television history. Which real-life languages inspired "conlangs" like Klingon and Dothraki?

video:video.video:title: Flight Lab - Check Out the New Far-Out Fliers of NASA's Famed X-Plane Program
video:video.video:description: For seven decades experimental X-planes have been developed and flown in the Mojave desert. NASA is now building the future of flight like an all electric plane and a quieter supersonic jet.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Anne Hathaway & Jason Sudeikis Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: 'Colossal' stars Jason Sudeikis and Anne Hathaway answer the Internet's most searched questions about themselves.

video:video.video:title: Meet Vinobot, the Rover on a Mission to Help Feed Humanity
video:video.video:description: If a ballooning humanity wants to feed itself as global warming throws agriculture into disarray, it'll need the help of robots like Vinobot.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Morgan Freeman, Michael Caine, and Alan Arkin Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: 'Going in Style' stars Morgan Freeman, Michael Caine, and Alan Arkin take the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answer the Internet's most searched questions about themselves.

video:video.video:title: After 4 Years, Seattle's Giant Tunneling Machine Finally Breaks Through
video:video.video:description: Bertha, the largest boring machine in North America, has reached the light at the end of the tunnel, after getting stuck, and sitting motionless underneath the city for two years.

video:video.video:title: A Marsupial Robot Is What You Need in an Explosive Situation
video:video.video:description: Flying a drone indoors is risky business. But a new kind of robot combines a tracked vehicle and a tethered quadcopter to explore things like decommissioned chemical plants.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Chris Evans Answers the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: 'Gifted' star Chris Evans takes the WIRED Autocomplete Interview and answers the Internet's most searched questions about himself. 'Gifted' co-star Mckenna Grace joins Chris, and together they find out that the Internet is obsessed with Chris Evans' driving skills.

video:video.video:title: Silicon Valley's Favorite Shoe Company Has Some New Kicks
video:video.video:description: Last year, the San Francisco startup Allbirds released a shoe it calls the Wool Runner. This eco-friendly, merino wool sneaker exploded in popularity in Bay Area. Now, Allbirds is unveiling its second product, the Wool Lounger.

video:video.video:title: Flight Lab - This NASA Drone Flies Over Hurricanes For Better Weather Forecasts
video:video.video:description: NASA takes retired Global Hawk military drones and sets them up to fly dangerous missions monitoring some of the most extreme storms for better weather data.

video:video.video:title: In Memoriam: Twitter Egg Edition
video:video.video:description: With the social-media platform killing off its infamous avatar, we pay our respects to the departed Twitter eggs.

video:video.video:title: Boeing's New 787-10 Takes Off, Bound for Testing Hell
video:video.video:description: The latest, longest variant of the tech-stuffed, efficiency-focused Dreamliner took off from Boeing’s new factory in Charleston, South Carolina and this is just the beginning of testing hell for the new 787-10.

video:video.video:title: Want to Build Your Own Drone? MIT Has the Tool You Need
video:video.video:description: Have you ever wanted to build your own drone? These MIT engineers are creating a program that lets anyone build the drone of their dreams.

video:video.video:title: Does Your Phone's Blue Light Dimmer Really Work? Let's Ask Science
video:video.video:description: Your phone might automatically dim its blue light at night. But does this really help you fall asleep?

video:video.video:title: Flight Lab - We Trained to Become a NASA Research Pilot and It Ain't Easy
video:video.video:description: It takes a lot of training to become an elite NASA research pilot. WIRED's Jack Stewart gets a crash course in flying and rolling F-18 jets for science, of course.

video:video.video:title: Ridley Scott Reveals the Origin of His AI Characters in the Alien Saga
video:video.video:description: Director Ridley Scott has featured several AI characters in his films. His most recent is Walter in Alien: Covenant. WIRED caught up with Ridley, his son Luke and the President of AMD to talk about AI.

video:video.video:title: The Single-Celled Stentor Could Hold the Secret to Human Regeneration
video:video.video:description: Meet the stentor, a gigantic single-celled organism that can regenerate and ink like a squid.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - 'Kong: Skull Island' - Designing the King of the Jungle
video:video.video:description: King Kong films hold a special distinction in the annals of cinema. Each new entry in the series often sets a new high-water mark for movie making special effects. Mike Seymour breaks down some the techniques used in 'Kong: Skull Island,' one of the most visually impressive films to date.

video:video.video:title: Star Wars Director Reveals the Secrets Behind Rogue One's Final Vader Scene
video:video.video:description: It could very well be the best scene in Rogue One: A Star Wars Story— Darth Vader violently pursuing rebels as they try to escape with the Death Star plans. But, as Director Gareth Edwards reveals, the scene fans saw in theaters almost didn't happen.

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - Ken Jeong Answers Medical Questions From Twitter
video:video.video:description: Ken Jeong uses the power of Twitter to answer some common medical questions.

video:video.video:title: How TV Opening Titles Got to Be So Damn Good
video:video.video:description: TV is way better than it used to be and you can say the same thing for the opening titles of your favorite series. They used to be afterthoughts, but now they’re artistic statements of their own.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Ryan Reynolds & Jake Gyllenhaal Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: 'Life' stars Ryan Reynolds and Jake Gyllenhaal waste some time with WIRED and answer the Internet's most searched questions about themselves.

video:video.video:title: Flight Lab - Inside NASA's Prototype Lab Where Model Planes Take Flight
video:video.video:description: Walk into NASA Armstrong's Sub-scale Research Lab and see the future of flight in miniature. The lab's model airplanes are used to test cutting edge aeronautical ideas like crash-avoidance and more efficient rocket launches.

video:video.video:title: What We Know About Trump's Airplane Electronics Ban
video:video.video:description: The Trump Administration has ordered nine airlines flying direct routes to the US to block passengers from carrying large gadgets into the plane cabin. The UK has followed with a similar ban. Here's what you need to know about the ban.

video:video.video:title: It Takes 60,000 Rivets and Two Robots to Build a Boeing 777 Fuselage
video:video.video:description: It’s tough work for pairs of humans who install each of the 60,000 rivets that keep Boeing's 777 from falling apart in midair, so they’re getting some help from pairs of robots on the plane production line.

video:video.video:title: Meet the Remarkable Robot That Communicates Like No Other
video:video.video:description: Iorek the robot not only understands your commands and gestures, but it asks for clarification if it's confused.

video:video.video:title: Celebs Guess Real or Fake Tech News at SXSW
video:video.video:description: It's hard to tell what's real or fake today. Celebrities at SXSW sat down with WIRED and tried their best to guess which headlines from the tech news world are real and which are fake. Sad!

video:video.video:title: Scientists May Have Solved the Secret of the Water Bear
video:video.video:description: Researchers claim to have figured out why the tiny little water bear is so darn tough.

video:video.video:title: Flight Lab - Climb Aboard a Boeing 747 That NASA Turned Into the World's Biggest Flying Telescope
video:video.video:description: To get the best space observations possible, NASA scientists fly around the world in a highly modified 747 carrying a giant telescope.

video:video.video:title: Star Wars Fans Wait for Days to See This Bonkers SXSW Poster Exhibit
video:video.video:description: Star Wars fans waited for days to get into the Mondo Gallery in Austin, for an exhibition of limited edition prints from a galaxy far, far away by artist Michael Mitchell.

video:video.video:title: SF’s Wild SoundBox Is a Symphony Like You’ve Never Heard Before
video:video.video:description: San Francisco’s renowned orchestra has turned an acoustically disastrous rehearsal space into the city’s hottest classical music venue.

video:video.video:title: Self-Driving Cars Won't Save Everyone. In Fact, They'll Kill
video:video.video:description: Self-driving cars will totally eliminate traffic deaths, right? Nope. In fact, on rare occasions they'll choose to kill.

video:video.video:title: Danny McBride and Katherine Waterston Talk 'Alien: Covenant' at SXSW
video:video.video:description: Ridley Scott returns to direct the prequel to his 1979 Alien. Actors Danny McBride and Katherine Waterston joined WIRED at SXSW to talk about the film and some of the rumors that fans are sharing ahead of the Alien: Covenant premier.

video:video.video:title: Are You Ready to Switch for Nintendo?
video:video.video:description: Nintendo's latest game machine is half living-room, half handheld. Get you a console that can do both.

video:video.video:title: Flight Lab - Suit Up and Fly High in NASA's Science Spy Plane
video:video.video:description: Suit up with a NASA high altitude ER-2 pilot as he prepares for a scientific research mission flying as high as 70,000 feet in the agency's modified U-2 spy plane.

video:video.video:title: Neuroscientist Explains One Concept in 5 Levels of Difficulty
video:video.video:description: The Connectome is a comprehensive diagram of all the neural connections existing in the brain. WIRED has challenged neuroscientist Bobby Kasthuri to explain this scientific concept to 5 different people; a 5 year-old, a 13 year-old, a college student, a neuroscience grad student and a connectome entrepreneur.

video:video.video:title: Project Fifth Mode - Episode 5: Everything is Possible
video:video.video:description: Team rLoop wins the Innovation Award at SpaceX’s Hyperloop competition.

video:video.video:title: The Shoe That Could Make a Sub-Two-Hour Marathon Possible
video:video.video:description: Meet the Nike Zoom Vaporfly 4%. It's the shoe Nike claims can make any runner 4% more efficient. The company is trying to prove this by attempting to break the last barrier in running: a sub-two-hour marathon.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Samuel L. Jackson Answers the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: "Kong: Skull Island" star Samuel L. Jackson answers the Internet's most searched questions about himself.

video:video.video:title: The Satellite That Spies on America's Lightning
video:video.video:description: The first images from a new instrument onboard NOAA’s GOES-16 satellite are giving NOAA National Weather Service forecasters richer information about lightning that will help them alert the public to dangerous weather.

video:video.video:title: Blackjack Expert Explains How Card Counting Works
video:video.video:description: There's a lot more to counting cards in Blackjack than meets the eye. Mike Aponte, former member of the infamous MIT Blackjack Team, takes us through the complicated process of counting cards.

video:video.video:title: Meet Baxter, the Charming Robot That Can Read Your Mind
video:video.video:description: You don't have to tell the Baxter robot that it's doing something wrong. You Just have to think it.

video:video.video:title: What the What Is Quantum Computing? We've Got You Covered
video:video.video:description: Thanks to the superposition principle, a quantum machine has the potential to become an exponentially more powerful computer. If that makes little sense to you, here's quantum computing explained.

video:video.video:title: Planet Earth II : Exclusive Clip From Episode 3 ‘Jungles’
video:video.video:description: An exclusive clip from the upcoming BBC America film Planet Earth II.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - How They Animated 'The Lego Batman Movie'
video:video.video:description: 'The Lego Batman Movie' uses an impressive style of animation that replicates the look of real lego bricks. These digital bricks abide by all the rules of real Lego bricks, so they cannot bend or move in an impractical way. Mike Seymour breaks down a few of the most remarkable scenes, where numerous complex techniques were used to create a believable image.

video:video.video:title: Check Out Beautiful Sonar Images of the Seafloor Near Hawaii
video:video.video:description: Scientists have mapped the seafloor near Hawaii with huge blasts of sonar. It's beautiful AND educational!

video:video.video:title: The 1955 Citroën DS Still Feels Ahead of Its Time
video:video.video:description: The 1955 Citroën DS is the auto industry's platypus: bizarre, delightful, innovative, and, if not inimitable, never imitated. WIRED's Jack Stewart took both the DS and SM for a spin.

video:video.video:title: Tech Support - Gordon Ramsay Answers Cooking Questions From Twitter
video:video.video:description: Gordon Ramsay uses the power of Twitter to answer some common cooking questions.

video:video.video:title: So Cellphones Cause Cancer, Right? That Ain't What Science Says
video:video.video:description: Your grandparents might have warned you that cellphones cause brain cancer. Well, that's not at all what science says.

video:video.video:title: Inside the World's Largest Wind Tunnel
video:video.video:description: It’s 80 feet high, 120 feet wide, that's large enough to hold a Boeing 737. Now trucking companies are using the wind tunnel to make their massive machines more efficient.

video:video.video:title: Microsoft's Surface Studio Is All Beauty and a Little Bit of Brains
video:video.video:description: David Pierce reviews the new all-in-one PC from Microsoft. It's a joy to use, especially if you like drawing with a pen on a massive touchscreen.

video:video.video:title: Meet the Little Star Trappist-1 and Its Exhilarating Planets
