video:video.video:description: Astronomers have discovered seven dwarf planets orbiting a star 40 light years away from us. Not impressed? How about this — the planets may just be able to harbor life.

video:video.video:title: This Drone is Designed to Save Lives Then Disappear
video:video.video:description: The Everfly APSARA drone is an origami-like disposable drone made to deliver essential supplies in a humanitarian or disaster situation.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - The Cast of 'Sesame Street' Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description:
Elmo, Big Bird, Count von Count, Cookie Monster, Bert, Ernie, Grover, Rosita, Abby Cadabby, and Oscar the Grouch hang with WIRED to answer the Internet's most searched questions about 'Sesame Street' and themselves.
New episodes of Sesame Street’s 47th season air every Saturday on HBO, and viewers can watch Sesame Street everyday on HBO Family and PBS Kids.

video:video.video:title: Allison Williams & Daniel Kaluuya Show Us the Last Thing on Their Phones
video:video.video:description: "Get Out" stars Allison Williams & Daniel Kaluuya gather up their courage and show us the last things they did with their phones.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - How 'Rogue One' Recreated Grand Moff Tarkin
video:video.video:description: Industrial Light & Magic used "Rogue One: A Star Wars Story" to push the boundaries of visual effects, especially in the area of digital humans. Design FX dives into the incredible techniques used to recreate one of the Star Wars universe's most terrifying figures, Grand Moff Tarkin.

video:video.video:title: UPS Has a Mother-Truck of a Delivery Drone Idea
video:video.video:description: UPS's futuristic delivery drones will be loaded inside the truck then fly out of and return to a roof port that would make any Bond villain jealous.

video:video.video:title: The Here One Buds Versus Apple's AirPods
video:video.video:description: It's gonna be an interesting race between the AirPods and the Here Ones. Both have some great pros, but they both also have some serious cons. Here's a closer look the top two wireless earphones.

video:video.video:title: Take a 360-Video Tour of a Magnus Walker's Sweet Porsches
video:video.video:description: Magnus Walker doesn't just collect Porsches, he reinterprets them. Tuning their engines, modifying their bodies, painting them in vivid racing livery, and installing bespoke tartan seat panels. So what's stopping you? Immerse yourself into his garage.

video:video.video:title: You Can Now Talk to Barbie. Oh, and She's a Hologram
video:video.video:description: Hello Barbie Hologram is a small box containing an animated projection of the doll that responds to voice commands. It combines motion-capture animation with Amazon Echo-style voice interactions. So of course we had to give it a try.

video:video.video:title: Step Into the VOID, Where VR Merges With the Real World
video:video.video:description: At the Utah-based "hyperreality" startup, they don't want to make the real world disappear—they want to bring it into your headset for a an all-new kind of adventure.

video:video.video:title: These Autonomous Wheelchairs Are the Future of Mobility
video:video.video:description: At MIT, they are creating an autonomous wheelchair that can navigate streets and buildings to allow people with limited mobility to travel without having to worry about obstructions or other hazards.

video:video.video:title: Inside the Fake News Factory of Macedonia
video:video.video:description: In the aftermath of the US elections, documentary photographer Guy Martin travelled to Veles, Macedonia to find out why this small town became the heart of the fake news scandal. These are the photos he took.

video:video.video:title: Project Fifth Mode - Episode 4: We’re Still Here
video:video.video:description: Behind the scenes with team rLoop before the Hyperloop competition.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Tracy Morgan Answers the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: "Fist Fight" star Tracy Morgan answers the Internet's most searched questions about himself.

video:video.video:title: Here’s How Fake News Works (and How the Internet Can Stop It)
video:video.video:description: Many fake news peddlers didn’t care if Trump won or lost the election. They only wanted to pocket money. But the consequences of what they did shook the world. This is how it happened.

video:video.video:title: Meet the Bird That Soars Thousands of Miles at a Time
video:video.video:description: The albatross has an 11-foot wingspan and a serious wanderlust, flying thousands of miles nonstop.

video:video.video:title: How Hyperloop Can Reshape the Future of Transportation
video:video.video:description: Hyperloop: a bunch of tubes, right? Well, that, plus some crazy engineering, magnetic levitation, giant vacuums and yep, tubes that could someday fling us around at near supersonic speeds.

video:video.video:title: Making the Astral Forms of ‘Doctor Strange’
video:video.video:description: Here’s how the VFX team behind ‘Doctor Strange’ made the movie’s astral forms.

video:video.video:title: These Futuristic Boots Will Prevent Astronauts From Tripping on Mars
video:video.video:description: Falling can be fatal when exploring another planet, that's why these MIT researchers are creating boots that help astronauts "feel" the ground beneath them to avoid any accidents.

video:video.video:title: Meet the Robot that Presses Vinyl in 30 Seconds
video:video.video:description: These machines are the next-gen record presses our 21st century vinyl revolution has been waiting for.

video:video.video:title: Here Are LG’s New Smartwatches
video:video.video:description: The Watch Sport and Watch Style from LG are the first to market with the newest improvements from Android Wear 2.0.

video:video.video:title: To Understand How a Squid Changes Color, You Gotta Get Inside Its Head
video:video.video:description: Squid use a remarkable array of skin patterns to communicate. How? It's all a matter of getting inside their heads.

video:video.video:title: Robot Queen Simone Giertz Tours Her Mad Laboratory
video:video.video:description: Swedish robotics enthusiast Simone Giertz is known for her inventive contraptions that may or may not work as intended. Simone takes us through her workshop and gives an extended look at some of her most outlandish machines.

video:video.video:title: Project Fifth Mode - Episode 3: A Matter of Seconds
video:video.video:description: How will SpaceX ’s engineers view team rLoop’s work?

video:video.video:title: The Scrappy Little Mouse That Turns Venom Into a Painkiller
video:video.video:description: The grasshopper mouse ain't like any other mouse on Earth, in the sense that it fights scorpions and turns their venom from a toxin into a painkiller.

video:video.video:title: If Tech Really Wants to Help the Homeless, It Should Hire Them
video:video.video:description: To bridge the divide between San Francisco's wealthy tech workers and their impoverished neighbors, organizations like Code Tenderloin are trying to get disadvantaged people into tech companies. They teach skills like coding and help students craft resumes, but even with all these new skills the greatest challenge facing Code Tenderloin graduates is convincing a company to take a chance on them.

video:video.video:title: Behold the Robotic Bat, Which We Promise Doesn't Bite
video:video.video:description: Researchers have developed a robotic bat that promises to transform the way search and rescue operations work.

video:video.video:title: Hey Surfers, Soon Your Wetsuit May Be Covered in Fur
video:video.video:description: MIT researchers are taking a cue from nature to develop a revolutionary new wetsuit material that could change surfing forever.

video:video.video:title: Watch the Difference 20 Years Has Made to Car Crash Safety
video:video.video:description: Watching car crash tests is horrifying and mesmerizing in equal measure. These crash tests show how much safer cars are after two decades of improved design.

video:video.video:title: How Trump's Immigration Crackdown Will Hurt Silicon Valley
video:video.video:description: Immigrants founded half of the billion dollar startups in the US. Now many worry that Trump's current travel ban and any future restrictions to work visas could hamper growth in Silicon Valley.

video:video.video:title: If the Tin Man Actually Had a Heart, It'd Look Like This
video:video.video:description: A robotic heart points the way to a future where soft robots help us heal.

video:video.video:title: Inside the YouTube-Fueled, Teenage Extravaganza That Is Beautycon
video:video.video:description: A look at the industry-shaking in real life meet up of beauty world influencers, their fans and the brands that compete for their attention.

video:video.video:title: This Robot Barista Makes a Dang Good Latte
video:video.video:description: Cafe X’s robotic baristas could be the future of java jolts. The company’s robot-staffed kiosks sling precision-made espresso drinks starting at $2.25 a cup, just don’t expect fancy latte art.

video:video.video:title: Meet America's Newest, High-Techiest Weather Satellite
video:video.video:description: The GOES-16 atmospheric satellite is a super-powered machine that can predict the future. At least as far as weather is concerned.

video:video.video:title: Ever Trip Too Long on Acid? Here's What Happened in Your Brain
video:video.video:description: After decades of research, scientists have finally figured out why an LSD high lasts so damn long. That could help turn it into a therapy drug in the future.

video:video.video:title: Boeing Blue is the Latest in a Long Line of Space Suits
video:video.video:description: Boeing Blue, the new space suit designed for the company's Starliner capsule, is the most recent update to a linage of suits that go back to the beginning of the space age.

video:video.video:title: This Company Is Turning Barn Finds Into Modern Supercars
video:video.video:description: Jack Stewart visits ICON, a controversial car restoration company that gives classic, luxury cars a complete modern overhaul.

video:video.video:title: Get Ready for a Coffee Renaissance. Thanks, Genetics!
video:video.video:description: Scientists have sequenced the genome of the coffee plant and made the data public. That means we're about to see a coffee renaissance.

video:video.video:title: Stunning 3-D Animation Reveals How a Drone Moves Air
video:video.video:description: Here's what air looks like when its swirling around a DJI Phantom 3 drone in flight. The 3D animation is more than just a cool rendering, it's purpose is to help designers create faster, quieter drones.

video:video.video:title: The Evolution of the Selfie With Nina Dobrev
video:video.video:description: In xXx: Return of Xander Cage, The Vampire Diaries star Nina Dobrev plays tech geek Becky Clearidge. So, who better to take us through the history of selfies? Using phones like the infamous Nokia brick and the modern iPhone, Nina tries her best to snap her way through camera phone history.

video:video.video:title: The Adorable Little Fish With a Suction Cup for a Belly
video:video.video:description: Meet the lumpsucker, the tiny fish that sucks at swimming but is great at suctioning.

video:video.video:title: Science of Teams: How MIT Media Lab Builds Cities Using Lego and Augmented Reality
video:video.video:description: The MIT Media Lab is using innovation to boil efficient teamwork down to a science. With an enhanced ability to communicate across teams, MIT is creating a workplace that shares ideas in unprecedented ways. The Changing Places group at MIT tackles large challenges like fighting pollution and urban modeling; the latter of which is being solved by using a combination of lego bricks and augmented reality.

video:video.video:title: Women in Tech Marched on Washington for More than Just Gender Equality
video:video.video:description: Women from Silicon Valley joined the thousands that marched on Washington DC to protest the Trump Administration. WIRED joins a group of women in tech on their journey to the Capitol to fight for science, climate change action, immigration rights and equality.

video:video.video:title: Dear Angelica Teaser
video:video.video:description: A teaser for Oculus Story Studio's new virtual reality film 'Dear Angelica,' which was made with the company's VR illustration tool, Quill.

video:video.video:title: No Matter What Trump Says, Your Gadgets Will Still Be Made in China
video:video.video:description: The massive consumer tech companies from China have come up with a plan for world domination: Make all of the gadgets used by everyone, everywhere.

video:video.video:title: Project Fifth Mode - Episode 2: It's Going to Be Worth It
video:video.video:description: As rLoop’s virtual and physical worlds come together, the team is met with various challenges – all while trying to build something that’s never technologically been done before.

video:video.video:title: 2016 Was the Hottest Year on Record. Blame Humanity
video:video.video:description: Last year was the hottest year since scientists started keeping records in the 19th century. It's no fluke---because it's humanity's fault.

video:video.video:title: Behind the Scenes of MTV’s ‘Stranded With a Million Dollars’
video:video.video:description: How do you sneakily film 10 people trapped on a remote island for 40 days? Very carefully—and with a lot of equipment.

video:video.video:title: Tour David Byrne’s Brain-Twisting New VR Experience
video:video.video:description: David Byrne, former Talking Heads frontman, gives a tour of Neurosociety, his new experimental theater meets neuroscience experience in Silicon Valley.

video:video.video:title: CES 2017 - Car Designers Remake the Steering Wheel for the Age of Autonomy
video:video.video:description: In a world where cars drive themselves, the steering wheel must go way beyond 10 and 2.

video:video.video:title: 2017: The Year Ahead - WIRED's 2017 Predictions: VR Is Coming to an Arcade Near You
video:video.video:description: It's unlikely that you'll buy a VR rig in 2017, instead you'll go 'VRing' by buying a ticket to a virtual gaming theme park or experience.

video:video.video:title: 2017: The Year Ahead - WIRED's 2017 Predictions: Drones! Drones! Drones!
video:video.video:description: Drones will go into wide commercial use in 2017. Package deliveries are a couple of years away but expect a lot more drone media coverage.

video:video.video:title: 2017: The Year Ahead - WIRED's 2017 Predictions: Drug Reform Will Beat Criminalization
video:video.video:description: WIRED predicts the biggest trends for the year ahead. In this segment, Matt Simon looks at how the drug crisis in the US is being reframed as a health problem instead of a criminal one.

video:video.video:title: 2017: The Year Ahead - WIRED's 2017 Predictions: Going Green Is Good Business, Even Under Trump
video:video.video:description: In our new series to kick off 2017, WIRED predicts the biggest trends for the year ahead. In this segment, Matt Simon explains how businesses are still going to go green, even in the face of renewed climate change denialism.

video:video.video:title: 2017: The Year Ahead - WIRED's 2017 Predictions: Self-Driving Vehicles Are Around the Corner
video:video.video:description: WIRED predicts the biggest trends for the year ahead. In this segment Alex Davies lays out the five biggest disruptions coming to the world of transport.

video:video.video:title: The 100-Foot Sea Critter With a Gnarly Sting
video:video.video:description: The siphonophore may look like a jellyfish, but it's something entirely different: a colony of clones that packs a serious punch.

video:video.video:title: From Barley to Brewski: How Beer Is Made
video:video.video:description: Brewer Liam McLachlan from Golden Road Brewing goes through the entire brewing process, from milling to packaging.

video:video.video:title: CES 2017 - Forget Phones, Blackberry Is Getting Into the Car Business
video:video.video:description: The former phone maker is taking its software expertise to the world of self-driving cars.

video:video.video:title: CES 2017 - Get Up Close With Faraday Future's Bonkers Luxury Limousine
video:video.video:description: Faraday Future revealed its luxury electric limousine at CES. The company plans to sell it for as much as a Bentley, but it has more than a few hurdles to overcome to make the transition from stunning concept to real-life road car.

video:video.video:title: This Spinach Plant Can Actually Detect Explosives
video:video.video:description: Can plants really detect explosives? At MIT, a new technology is being developed that can make dangerous chemicals in the soil easier to detect.

video:video.video:title: The Evolution of the Phone
video:video.video:description: The modern telephone is ubiquitous, but it wasn't always that way. We go through the last hundred years and take a look at how the telephone has evolved.

video:video.video:title: Struggling with Dry January? Here Are Awesome Non-Alcoholic Alternatives
video:video.video:description: After a boozy holiday season quitting alcohol for January sounds like a good idea, but it's not that easy. We've found some legitimate, non-alcoholic drinks for your beer, wine and spirit cravings.

video:video.video:title: 5 Standouts From This Year's Detroit Auto Show
video:video.video:description: Motown is still the center of the American auto industry, and it's got plenty to show you.

video:video.video:title: This Simple Paper Centrifuge Could Revolutionize Global Health
video:video.video:description: A Stanford researcher has created a groundbreaking scientific device using paper and string. It's called a paperfuge and it may be the answer to testing blood samples in places that can’t power, afford, or transport a traditional centrifuge.

video:video.video:title: CES 2017 - The Fridges of the Future Surf the Web and Take Pictures
video:video.video:description: A fridge should do more than just keep your food cold, right? Samsung and LG think so. Both companies showcased their outrageously smart fridges at CES this year.

video:video.video:title: Project Fifth Mode - Episode 1: The Future is Here
video:video.video:description: Meet the rLoop Team as they set up at TE Connectivity’s Silicon Valley facility to prepare for the SpaceX Hyperloop Competition. As the only non-University team, the various team members will share the unique story of the team’s formation and success of operating in the virtual environment.

video:video.video:title: The Fiddler Crab: One Part Giant Claw, Two Parts Attitude
video:video.video:description: The fiddler crab has one small claw and one big ol' one. Why? All the better to woo the lady crabs and throw down with the dude crabs.

video:video.video:title: CES 2017 - Lego’s Boost Kit Turns Your Bricks Into Robots. Robots!
video:video.video:description: At CES 2017 Lego just unveiled Boost, a clever kit that introduces programming and cool tech to the bricks you grew up with.

video:video.video:title: CES 2017 - Take a Spin in Hyundai's Driverless Car for the Masses
video:video.video:description: Korean automaker Hyundai is demonstrating a prototype autonomous version of its Ioniq hatchback at CES. The car could make self-driving affordable enough for us all.

video:video.video:title: CES 2017 - One Remote to Control All Your Smart Devices
video:video.video:description: The Smart Remote is an intuitive and simple solution to controlling all the smart devices in the modern home.

video:video.video:title: CES 2017 - LG's Hub Bots Are Seriously Cute AI Assistants
video:video.video:description: LG’s Hub Bots have Alexa’s super AI brains in bodies made for shaking it to your favorite tunes.

video:video.video:title: Some of the Cool Gadgets at CES 2017
video:video.video:description: CES isn’t just giant TVs and smart washing machines from big brands. Here are a few of the neatest items and accessories we’ve come across this year.

video:video.video:title: CES 2017 - Carnival’s High-Tech Cruise Wearable Knows Your Every Need
video:video.video:description: Carnival's new Ocean Medallion wearable tech is designed to anticipate a cruise patron's every need – from a margarita (if that's your thing) to suggestions for activities.

video:video.video:title: The Tiger Beetle Is Here to Murder Anything It Can
video:video.video:description: Yipes! The tiger beetle, not to be confused with teen magazine Tiger Beat!, is pretty much six-legged death incarnate for spiders, grubs, and even ladybugs. Watch out!

video:video.video:title: WIRED's Top Design Stories of 2016
video:video.video:description: Designers tackled some of the most pressing issues of our time in 2016. From equality to climate change, here are WIRED's most inspirational design stories of the year.

video:video.video:title: WIRED's Top Transportation Stories of 2016
video:video.video:description: 2016 was a wild year in transportation ¬– from self-driving cars to smarter cities – WIRED looks back at some of the biggest stories about getting around.

video:video.video:title: WIRED's Top Culture Stories of 2016
video:video.video:description: 2016 was the year of retro-mania fueled Pokemon Go and Stranger Things and the beginning of a more diverse television future. Here are WIRED's top stories from the world of movies, music and TV.

video:video.video:title: WIRED's Top Gadget Stories of 2016
video:video.video:description: 2016 was the year a lot changed in gear. We lost headphone jacks on iPhones, got Snap's Spectacles and artificial intelligence is now powering a lot of our gadgets.

video:video.video:title: WIRED's Favorite Absurd Creatures of 2016
video:video.video:description: Revisit WIRED's favorite Absurd Creatures of 2016 – the magnificent sex, food and fighting obsessed rhino beetle, the fish-bashing kingfisher bird and the aptly named peanut-head bugs.

video:video.video:title: WIRED's Top Science Stories of 2016
video:video.video:description: From gene editing and gravitational waves and the zika virus these were the top science stories of 2016.

video:video.video:title: 2016: The Year in Autonomous Driving
video:video.video:description: 2016 was the year that self-driving vehicles really took off. WIRED looks back at how much transportation is being changed by autonomous cars, trucks, and drones.

video:video.video:title: Look Inside a Pig’s Face While It Eats
video:video.video:description: Thanks to XROMM technology scientists can see moving bones inside animals in real time. It's perfect for seeing inside a repaired knee or for figuring out how dinosaurs may have moved.

video:video.video:title: Hyundai's Exo-Skeleton Makes Everyone an Iron Man
video:video.video:description: Hyundai, the car manufacturer, is getting into other forms of mobility and work with its two new exo-skeletons.

video:video.video:title: See Everything That Happens When a Package is Shipped
video:video.video:description: Ever wonder what happens to a package when it gets shipped? We stuck a GoPro in a clear acrylic box, had it filming the entire time, and got a chance to see what the package went through on its way to your doorstep.

video:video.video:title: How the Morpho Butterfly Can Be Blue But Also Not Really Blue
video:video.video:description: The morpho butterfly appears blue but it isn't actually. It looks blue not because of pigment but because of some very fancy scales on its wings.

video:video.video:title: How Alan Tudyk Became Rogue One's K-2SO
video:video.video:description: "Rogue One: A Star Wars Story" star Alan Tudyk plays K-2SO, an Imperial droid who was reprogrammed and finds himself with the rebellion. Alan explains what it was like controlling K-2SO, and how they went about making the best movie they could.

video:video.video:title: WIRED's Gift Guide for the Great Indoors
video:video.video:description: A few of WIRED's favorite gear and gadgets for homebodies.

video:video.video:title: WIRED's Gift Guide for the Outdoorsy Type in Your Life
video:video.video:description: A few of WIRED's favorite gifts to make any outdoor outing more fun.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Jennifer Lawrence & Chris Pratt Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: "Passengers" stars Jennifer Lawrence and Chris Pratt answer the Internet's most searched questions about themselves.

video:video.video:title: The Enduring Mystery of What the Hell's in LaCroix
video:video.video:description: LaCroix is the fizzy water of the moment. It's just H2O, CO2, and natural flavor. But what's "natural flavor" and is it safe to consume by the daily 12-pack? Asking for a friend.

video:video.video:title: Smosh Shows Us the Last Thing on Their Phones
video:video.video:description: Internet super-celebrities Smosh gather up their courage and show us the last things on their phones.

video:video.video:title: Out of Office with Brent Rose - Brent Rose's Ultimate Survival Bag
video:video.video:description: Bug-out bags/survival kits are a controversial topic. Everybody has a different philosophy about what makes a good one. This is Brent's. While bigger and heavier than a lot of the bags you'll see online, you can keep it in the closet by your front door or the trunk of your car, and you'll be prepared for an emergency that could last many days. Brent's kit doubles as a slick backpacking setup, so you'll get to know your gear extremely well, and you get to have fun with it, too.

video:video.video:title: How to Fight the Bad Logic of the Internet | Argument Clinic
video:video.video:description: There's a lot of bad logic out there. WIRED's Jason Tanz explains how to spot and fight the dumbest arguments online.

video:video.video:title: Meet the Blind Man Who Convinced Google Its Self-Driving Car Is Finally Ready
video:video.video:description: Google is getting serious about self-driving cars. So serious that it put a legally blind man in one that drove him around safely on his own. The successful trip means that the tech giant can now launch its own self-driving car company, which it's calling Waymo.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - The Cast of "Rogue One" Answers the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: "Rogue One: A Star Wars Story" stars Felicity Jones, Donnie Yen, Diego Luna, Riz Ahmed, Ben Mendelsohn and Alan Tudyk answer the internet's most searched questions about themselves.

video:video.video:title: Airbus' Futuristic Jet Concept Comes With Flying Spas and Bars
video:video.video:description: The Transpose concept uses modular architecture to keep life in the sky fresh and comfortable.

video:video.video:title: Surviving Family Occasions with Tips From Google's Mindfulness Mentor
video:video.video:description: Family occasions are stressful especially around the holidays.Google's Chade-Meng Tan shares some mindfulness tricks that'll keep you sane.

video:video.video:title: Mr. Coffee vs Keurig: How Do They Compare?
video:video.video:description: Which coffee maker is king? We teardown the Mr. Coffee 12-Cup automatic and Keurig K55; two coffee machines built decades apart.

video:video.video:title: Science of Teams: How Prologue Brings Its Visual Effects to Virtual Reality
video:video.video:description: Visual Effects house Prologue has worked on some of the biggest movie franchises around. The different teams at Prologue deftly work together to bring some of their most familiar assets over to the virtual space.

video:video.video:title: The Incredible Gecko That Looks Exactly Like a Tree
video:video.video:description: Meet the leaf-tailed gecko, which deploys some of the most astounding camouflage in the animal kingdom.

video:video.video:title: [Branded Content] Working Together for a Common Goal; The Science of Teams: Atlassian
video:video.video:description: Produced for Atlassian by the WIRED Brand Lab. The process of team work is all around us. From construction, to music, to food, the greatest achievements are born out of teams. On its surface, collaboration is a seemingly simple process, but there is much more underneath. WIRED teams up with the experts and uses science to showcase the mechanics behind working as a team.

video:video.video:title: How to Make Deliciously Safe Eggnog With Raw Eggs and Booze
video:video.video:description: You wish you liked eggnog more than you do, right? Well, with this recipe and a few science tricks, you'll make eggnog that is not only delicious but brilliantly boozy too.

video:video.video:title: Remembering Space Pioneer John Glenn: 1921-2016
video:video.video:description: In 1962 astronaut John Glenn became the first American to orbit the earth. The feat paved the way to US dominance in the space race and the mission to the moon. Glenn, ever a champion of human exploration, died December 8, 2016.

video:video.video:title: Rhett & Link Show Us the Last Thing on Their Phones
video:video.video:description:
Internetainers Rhett & Link gather up their courage and show us the last things they did with their phones.
"Rhett and Link's Buddy System" Good Mythical Morning @rhettandlink

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Kate McKinnon & Vanessa Bayer Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: Office Christmas Party stars Kate McKinnon and Vanessa Bayer hang with WIRED to answer the Internet's most searched questions about themselves.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - The Amazing Visual Effects of "Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them"
video:video.video:description: The Harry Potter prequel, Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them, finds Eddie Redmayne performing a mating ritual in front of a massive computer-generated beast. Using a combination of puppets and CGI, a slew of effects houses were able to craft convincing monsters to populate J.K. Rowling's imaginative world.

video:video.video:title: How to Take a Great Holiday Family Photo
video:video.video:description: Family photos can be stressful. Let WIRED come to the rescue.

video:video.video:title: How Billions of Dollars of Goods Get to You
video:video.video:description: The Port of Los Angeles is one of the busiest ports in the country, and only gets busier during the holidays. With more global shipping now that ever, new technologies are emerging that can mend choke points in the process.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Jennifer Aniston & Jason Bateman Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: Office Christmas Party stars Jennifer Aniston and Jason Bateman hang with WIRED to answer the Internet's most searched questions about themselves.

video:video.video:title: Science of Teams: How NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory Used Teamwork to Reach Saturn
video:video.video:description: NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory uses teamwork every day to accomplish incredible scientific feats.

video:video.video:title: How Oculus Designed Its Touch VR Controllers
video:video.video:description: Oculus Touch controllers are here – finally putting our hands in the same virtual space as our heads. Touch was years and scores of prototypes in the making. Watch to see how the form and function came together.

video:video.video:title: Jumping Spiders Jump Around, Jump Up, Jump Up, and Get Down
video:video.video:description: Meet the little spider that goes about life a little differently, in the sense that it actively stalks the hell out of its prey.

video:video.video:title: Scientists Create a Light-Guided Robotic Stingray Using Rat Parts
video:video.video:description: A team of scientists at Harvard created an artificial stingray out of rat parts, which can be remote-controlled around a tank using light beams as part of the team's ongoing research on how to make artificial organs.

video:video.video:title: The Scientific Secret to Making Crispy Chicken Skin
video:video.video:description: You love crispy chicken skin but you always dry the breast out, right? Here's the solution using a little science.

video:video.video:title: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond & James May Race Toy Cars
video:video.video:description: Former "Top Gear" and current "The Grand Tour" hosts Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond, and James May put their driving skills to the ultimate test...by racing toy cars.

video:video.video:title: This Radical Redesign Could Keep Gas Engines Pumping
video:video.video:description: Achates Power is reviving the century-old opposed piston layout to make gas-powered cars more efficient.

video:video.video:title: Why Banning Kratom May Make the Opioid Epidemic Even Worse
video:video.video:description: In August the DEA announced plans to ban Kratom, a herbal substance used to treat pain, anxiety and in some cases opioid addiction. A group of tenacious users got the agency to back down and extend public comment until December 1st. Now a tough decision lies before the DEA.

video:video.video:title: Behold the RC Off-Roader of Our Childhood Dreams
video:video.video:description: Meet the RR10 Bomber from Axial. The $400 RC car is a 1/10th-scale recreation of a real 4x4 and it was built for crawling across the gnarliest trails.

video:video.video:title: Meet the Arapaima, the Swimming Tank of the Amazon
video:video.video:description: What's 10 feet long, 440 pounds, and armored like a tank? The arapaima, perhaps the most peculiar fish in the Amazon.

video:video.video:title: Whether It's Farmed or Wild, Here's How to Cook Your Salmon Right
video:video.video:description: If you overcooked your pan-seared salmon, you may be tempted to blame it on the type of salmon you bought, but none of that matters if you understand the chemistry of how this colorful fish cooks.

video:video.video:title: Thermal Imaging Tech Helps Protect Endangered Wildlife
video:video.video:description: World Wildlife Fund is using thermal imaging technology and artificial intelligence to see and capture wildlife poachers as they stalk endangered animals in the dark.

video:video.video:title: Bumped Off Your Flight? Know Your Travel Rights
video:video.video:description: It's bound to happen to you— your flight is cancelled, delayed or the airline bumps you. That's why it's important to know your rights when your travel plans go astray.

video:video.video:title: What Do You Get When a Pig and a Monkey Have a Baby? A Coati
video:video.video:description: The coati is kind of a raccoon but also maybe a monkey with the nose of a pig. In other words, a critter that can’t seem to figure out what it wants to be.

video:video.video:title: Food Myths: Does Turkey Make You Sleepy?
video:video.video:description: You finish that thanksgiving feast and immediately all you want to do is sleep. Many people blame the turkey for their sudden comatose state, but that may not be 100% true.

video:video.video:title: Worried About Your Privacy Now? Here's How to Protect It
video:video.video:description: America has a new president who is, how should we say, unpredictable. There’s no telling how the NSA and the surveillance state will evolve in the next four years. So, if you’re worried about keeping your private communications private, here’s what to do.

video:video.video:title: These Self-Flying Helicopters Team Up to Fight Fires and Save Lives
video:video.video:description: Two Lockheed Martin helicopters, with help from a pair of drones, join forces to fight fires and save lives.

video:video.video:title: Snap's Spectacles Are the First Camera We Actually Want to Wear
video:video.video:description: Snap, the company formerly known as Snapchat, just released its sunglasses with built-in cameras. They're tough to get, but fun to use and they just might be the first face computer you'll actually want to wear.

video:video.video:title: Technique Critique - Movie Accent Expert Breaks Down Actors' Accents
video:video.video:description: Dialect coach Erik Singer analyzes the accents of some of Hollywood's biggest names. How accurate were they really?

video:video.video:title: How Social Media Is Shaping Activism in America
video:video.video:description: Within the space of 72 hours, Alton Sterling, Philando Castile and five Dallas police officers were shot and killed. WIRED looks the three days that shook America and the role live-streaming, video and social media played in the tragedies.

video:video.video:title: Look, Ma! I'm Flying a Plane With Only My Thoughts
video:video.video:description: Without a pilot’s license, or frankly, any experience, WIRED's Jack Stewart flew a plane using just his thoughts. Thanks to new technology developed by Honeywell Aerospace, a King Air C90 can be controlled, in simple terms, by the human brain.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Reggie Watts Answers the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description:
Reggie Watts answers the Internet's most searched questions about himself.
REGGIE WATTS: SPATIAL premieres on Netflix Dec 6

video:video.video:title: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond & James May Show Us the Last Thing on Their Phones
video:video.video:description: Former "Top Gear" and current "The Grand Tour" hosts Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond, and James May gather up their courage and reveal the last things they did with their phones.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Review: The New Macbook Pro With Touch Bar
video:video.video:description: The new Macbook Pro is great, but it isn't worth rushing to the Apple store to drop $1,800 if you don't need a new computer this minute. Here's why.

video:video.video:title: For the Lowly Dung Beetle, Life Doesn't Always Stink
video:video.video:description: Poop rules everything around the dung beetle, including its sex life.

video:video.video:title: Why Massaging Your Kale Makes It Taste Better
video:video.video:description: It sounds weird and a little creepy but science proves that massaging your kale removes the bitter taste the leaf can have. Makes sense, because who isn't a little less bitter after a good massage?

video:video.video:title: The Psychology Behind the World's Most Recognizable Sounds
video:video.video:description: Two sonic branding experts explain the thinking behind some of the world's most recognizable sounds.

video:video.video:title: Inside Facebook's Quest to Beam the Internet Via Solar Drone
video:video.video:description: A WIRED exclusive look at how Facebook will beam the internet with Aquila, a stratospheric solar-powered drone equipped with millimeter wave communications technology.

video:video.video:title: Google's New VR Headset Is Like Cardboard—Except Comfortable (and Cozy)
video:video.video:description: Daydream View, the first mobile headset of Google's new virtual-reality platform, is rock-solid VR at low cost.

video:video.video:title: Voting From the ISS Is a Cinch. Mars? Not So Much
video:video.video:description: NASA Astronauts voted from the International Space Station thanks to some nifty legislation, but what about when they are 34 million miles away on Mars?

video:video.video:title: Polaroid SX-70 vs Canon Rebel T5: How Do They Compare?
video:video.video:description: The Polaroid SX-70 was the go-to camera for instant photography, and the Canon Rebel T5 is currently one of the most popular DSLRs on the market. What's changed since then?

video:video.video:title: The Middle Class Is in Trouble, and These Numbers Prove It
video:video.video:description: The 45th President of the United States has a big task ahead. Something is happening to the middle class and it's not good.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures - These Fish Were Made for Walking and That's Just What They Do
video:video.video:description: The mudskipper is a fish marvelously adapted to terrestrial life. From it's powerful fin-feet to its googly eyes perched on top of its head, it's made for boogying across terra firma.

video:video.video:title: Nothing Is as Cool as Sequencing DNA in Space. Just Ask Kate Rubins
video:video.video:description: Kate Rubins is a biologist-turned-astronaut who's studied infectious disease in a biosafety level 4 facility and on the ground in Congo. That wasn't enough for her, so she went to space to sequence some DNA.

video:video.video:title: The Art of Designing Public Transit for Anti-Social Commuters
video:video.video:description: Subway commuters traveling between San Francisco and Oakland got tired of looking each other in eye. So, the Bay Area Rapid Transit agency redesigned their train cars to give commuters more space.

video:video.video:title: The Easter Eggs Inside the 'Mind' of Google Home
video:video.video:description: The $129 Home smart speaker plays a vital role in Google’s futuristic vision of “a Google for everyone” powered by its omnipresent Assistant. It sounds like a big deal, but we decided to have some fun with the new assistant instead.

video:video.video:title: This Robot Smokes Cigarettes So Rats Don't Have To
video:video.video:description: Researchers at the Wyss Institute at Harvard University have built a robot that can smoke cigarettes just like a human to better understand lung diseases. You're welcome, smoking lab rats.

video:video.video:title: Out of Office with Brent Rose - GoPro Karma vs DJI Mavic Pro Full Review
video:video.video:description:
*UPDATE* We have looked into the focus issues and have altered our choice accordingly. Please read the updated review at WIRED.com for the full explanation: https://www.wired.com/2016/11/gopro-karma-vs-dji-mavic-pro/
GoPro has entered the drone game, delivering a sleek, foldable device that can fit inside a backpack. Brent Rose compares GoPro's offering with the Mavic Pro; DJI's impressive new foldable drone.

video:video.video:title: How Fast Are Bats? Faster Than You Even Know
video:video.video:description: You know bats---the flighty mammals that find their way around with sonar and eat bugs. But bats have a little secret I'd like to share with you: They can be astonishingly fast.

video:video.video:title: NASA Engineers Show You How To Carve a Pumpkin
video:video.video:description: NASA can build rockets and land on the moon, but can they carve the ultimate Halloween pumpkin?

video:video.video:title: Robotics Expert Breaks Down Movie Robots
video:video.video:description: Wall-E, Terminator, Eva. Which beloved moves robots are realistic to create and which are a far stretch? Our expert breaks it down.

video:video.video:title: The Amazing Garage Where Robots Do the Parking
video:video.video:description: Parking sucks. Looking for a space, driving round and round, trying not to hit a pillar. Fear not, the robots have it covered.

video:video.video:title: Guess What Uber's Promising Now: Flying Cars
video:video.video:description: Forget self-driving cars, Uber has a new one for you... flying cars. The company calls it Uber Elevate and within a decade it’ll be a global network of on demand urban electric aircraft that take off and land vertically.

video:video.video:title: Unmasking the Secrets That Ancient Mummies Hold
video:video.video:description: Centuries ago, middle-class Egyptians buried their mummies with masks made out of recycled papyrus. Many of those sheets were covered in Ancient Greek text, which is hard to read without destroying the masks. Now a team of imagining experts are finding ways to read the texts without pulling the ancient artifacts apart.

video:video.video:title: Picking Pumpkins, The Pumpkin Harvest Process
video:video.video:description: McGrath Brothers Great Pacific Pumpkins produce over a million pounds of pumpkins a year. A McGrath Brothers farmhand takes us through a pumpkin's journey; from seed to the store shelves.

video:video.video:title: The Future of Driverless Cars
video:video.video:description: Our future may be filled with driverless cars. Here's a look at some of the ingenious ways we can make riding in a driverless car a more engaging experience.

video:video.video:title: Uber's Self-Driving Truck Delivers 50,000 Beers
video:video.video:description: A truck carrying 50,000 beers spent two hours driving itself down a Colorado highway.

video:video.video:title: Meet the Psychedelic Shrimp That Power-Lifts Starfish
video:video.video:description: The harlequin shrimp is all dressed up in a festive clown suit…a clown suit of murder.

video:video.video:title: The World's Largest Telescope
video:video.video:description: China has built the world's largest radio telescope and they're using it to observe outer space.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Movie Review: Jack Reacher, Never Go Back
video:video.video:description: Jack Reacher, Never Go Back is worth checking out if you like hammy, uncomplicated action films.

video:video.video:title: 3 Amazing Robots You’ve Never Seen
video:video.video:description: UCLA Robotics lab shows off their newest and most innovative projects, including robots who search for mines and cannot fall down.

video:video.video:title: Elon Musk Says Every New Tesla Will Drive Itself
video:video.video:description: Elon Musk wants you to take your hands off the wheel, foot off the gas, and let him do the driving. Rather, let his cars take over.

video:video.video:title: John Kerry on How the Paris Climate Agreement Could Help Fight Terrorism
video:video.video:description: US Secretary of State John Kerry discusses the ways that recently signed UN climate agreement will spur innovations in renewable energy across the globe, including terror hotspots.

video:video.video:title: Immigration in America Isn’t What the Politicians Tell You
video:video.video:description: Politicians make a lot of wild claims about undocumented immigrants in the United States. Our advice? Take a deep breath and have a look at what the numbers tell you.

video:video.video:title: NASA Explains Jupiter's Wild North & South Poles
video:video.video:description: We speak with the Juno mission's lead scientist to find out what lies under Jupiter's poles.

video:video.video:title: Secretary of State John Kerry Knows What A Messy Election Feels Like
video:video.video:description: When WIRED sat down with the United States Secretary of State John Kerry right after the second Presidential debate, he shared a few thoughts on what it's like to run for President.

video:video.video:title: Meet the Giant Robot That Builds Boeing’s Airplane Wings
video:video.video:description: Building something as large as a 737 wing takes an even bigger machine. Boeing’s Panel Assembly Line (PAL) is the 60 ton, 20 feet tall, friendly robot that always lends a rather large hand.

video:video.video:title: Musket vs. AR-15: How Do They Compare?
video:video.video:description: The Brown Bess musket was a staple during the Revolutionary War, and the AR-15 is currently one of the most popular semi-automatic rifles in the world. What's changed since then?

video:video.video:title: The Capybara May Be Chill, But It Still Says No to Drugs
video:video.video:description: Get to know the biggest, most chillest rodent on Earth (all 175 pounds of it).

video:video.video:title: Nikola Tesla and Wireless Charging
video:video.video:description: Telsa was a wacky guy with some far-fetched ideas, but many of theories about how electricity could work would eventually prove to be dead on.

video:video.video:title: Playing ‘Who Said It?’ with Issa Rae
video:video.video:description: Issa Rae loves female comedies. So we decided to quiz her on some of the funniest lines from Girlfriends, Living Single, and Sex and the City.

video:video.video:title: Tech Effects - How Does Music Affect Our Brains & Our Bodies?
video:video.video:description: In this episode of Tech Effects, we explore the impact of music on the brain and body. From listening to music to performing it, WIRED's Peter Rubin looks at how music can change our moods, why we get the chills, and how it can actually change pathways in our brains.

video:video.video:title: Issa Rae on How She Wrote ‘That’ Rap
video:video.video:description: WIRED sat down with Issa Rae following the Oakland premiere of her new HBO show Insecure to ask her about the show's writing process, Los Angeles setting, and killer soundtrack

video:video.video:title: President Obama Admits It: He's a Science Nerd
video:video.video:description: Barack Obama won't be president for much longer. But while he still is, he's seeking to cement his legacy as a booster of science and technology.

video:video.video:title: Data Reveals the American Dream Is Alive and Well—in Canada
video:video.video:description: At the White House Frontiers Conference, Raj Chetty, an economist at Stanford University described where the 'American dream' is thriving the most and seems like it's across US the border.

video:video.video:title: Exploring the Next Frontiers
video:video.video:description: Panelists from the White House Frontiers Conference discuss the new frontiers of space, science, medicine, transportation, and cities. And their must haves for frontier expeditions.

video:video.video:title: The Frontiers Issue with Guest Editor President Barack Obama - President Barack Obama on the Future of AI
video:video.video:description: President and WIRED guest editor Barack Obama discusses the future of artificial intelligence with WIRED editor in chief Scott Dadich and MIT Media Lab director Joi Ito.

video:video.video:title: The Frontiers Issue with Guest Editor President Barack Obama - President Barack Obama on What AI Means for National Security
video:video.video:description: WIRED guest editor President Barack Obama, WIRED editor in chief Scott Dadich and MIT Media Lab director Joi Ito discuss the challenges of cyber security in the age of artificial intelligence.

video:video.video:title: The Frontiers Issue with Guest Editor President Barack Obama - President Barack Obama on the True Meaning of Star Trek
video:video.video:description: POTUS is a Trekkie! WIRED guest editor President Barack Obama, WIRED editor in chief Scott Dadich and MIT Media Lab director Joi Ito discuss the original Star Trek series and what it reveals about our common humanity.

video:video.video:title: The Frontiers Issue with Guest Editor President Barack Obama - President Barack Obama on How We'll Embrace Self-Driving Cars
video:video.video:description: WIRED guest editor President Barack Obama, WIRED editor in chief Scott Dadich and MIT Media Lab director Joi Ito discuss ethical concerns around artificial intelligence used in self-driving cars.

video:video.video:title: The Frontiers Issue with Guest Editor President Barack Obama - President Barack Obama on Bureaucracy VS. Moonshots
video:video.video:description: WIRED guest editor President Barack Obama, WIRED editor in chief Scott Dadich and MIT Media Lab director Joi Ito discuss where the center of artificial intelligence research is and where it might be.

video:video.video:title: The Frontiers Issue with Guest Editor President Barack Obama - President Barack Obama on Fixing Government With Technology
video:video.video:description: WIRED guest editor President Barack Obama discusses what he’d like to see technology solve in government with WIRED editor in chief Scott Dadich and MIT Media Lab director Joi Ito.

video:video.video:title: The Frontiers Issue with Guest Editor President Barack Obama - President Barack Obama on How Artificial Intelligence Will Affect Jobs
video:video.video:description: WIRED guest editor President Barack Obama, WIRED editor in chief Scott Dadich and MIT Media Lab director Joi Ito discuss how artificial intelligence might up-end economies and how societies can adapt.

video:video.video:title: The Frontiers Issue with Guest Editor President Barack Obama - President Barack Obama Guest-Edits WIRED's November Issue
video:video.video:description: Like WIRED, our 44th president is a relentless optimist. President Barack Obama focuses on the future and the next hurdles that humanity will need to overcome to move forward.

video:video.video:title: Project Bubbles: The New Frontier of Gaming
video:video.video:description: UCLA’s Dr. Dennis Hong gives us a glimpse into a new project that could change the way we think about interactive gaming.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures - The Most Stunning Fish in the Sea Are Actually Dragons (Kinda)
video:video.video:description: The leafy and weedy seadragons might not breathe fire, but they’re every bit as majestic as real dragons.

video:video.video:title: Food Myths: Can Hot Foods Really Cool You Down?
video:video.video:description: Can eating or drinking hot things really cool you down on a hot day? WIRED investigates.

video:video.video:title: Predators: Chameleons Have Killer Fast Tongues
video:video.video:description: Chameleons are deceptively great hunters, with a tongue that can snipe prey in a split-second.

video:video.video:title: Out of Office with Brent Rose - GoPro's New Cameras (Hero5 Black and Session) Full Review
video:video.video:description: GoPro's new 4K cameras, the Hero5 Black and Hero5 Session, aim to deliver the best GoPro experience yet. Brent Rose takes them through their paces, and compares the Hero5 to Garmin's impressive Virb Ultra 30.

video:video.video:title: Step Inside Boeing’s Elaborate New 737 Test Plane
video:video.video:description: Boeing is putting its newest plane, the 737 MAX, through a grueling series of test flights. Onboard, instead of seats and a meal service, a team of engineers captures data on its performance, and eats snacks from a cooler.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Blindspot's Jaimie Alexander Answers the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: Jaimie Alexander hangs with WIRED to answer the Internet's most searched questions about herself.

video:video.video:title: Google's Self-Driving Cars Have Clocked 2 Million Miles
video:video.video:description: By this point, self driving cars are a common sight in Silicon Valley and Google’s fleet of nearly 60 autonomous cars hit a milestone: They have now clocked more than two million miles of driving on public streets.

video:video.video:title: Google's Daydream View Is a VR Eye Pillow
video:video.video:description: Google's new $80 Daydream View isn't just a more integrated VR headset for mobile devices, it's also way comfy.

video:video.video:title: Google Home Is The Assistant That Will Never Leave You Alone
video:video.video:description: Google Home is part Bluetooth speaker, part Google Assistant, all Amazon Echo competitor. For $129, it brings super-powered voice control into every nook and cranny of your house.

video:video.video:title: Google Just Got Real By Changing Its Gadget Game
video:video.video:description: The tech giant released a slew of new hardware, including two new smartphones, a VR-headset and a home assistant. Here's everything from the Google event.

video:video.video:title: Meet the Pixel, Google's Answer to the iPhone
video:video.video:description: Google enters the phone fray with the Pixel, a premium Android smartphone with all the features of an iPhone plus Google Assistant and a headphone jack.

video:video.video:title: Did NASA Find a Second Earth?
video:video.video:description: An exoplanet expert tells us if Proxima Centauri B could be another Earth.

video:video.video:title: Meet the Kinkajou, the Tree-Loving Mammal With an Identity Problem
video:video.video:description: It may look like a monkey, with its prehensile tail and predilection for chewing with its mouth open—but don't be fooled.

video:video.video:title: Food Myths: Do Oysters Make You Horny?
video:video.video:description: Rumor has it that oysters were the fuel behind Casanova’s fire, but are these slimy mollusks actually aphrodisiacs? WIRED cracks into the science behind the old wives’ tale.

video:video.video:title: NASA Creates Robots That Can Climb Walls
video:video.video:description: We take a look at some of the new robotic technology being developed at JPL's Robotics Lab, including robots that use "gecko" technology to grip walls and climb 90 degree surfaces.

video:video.video:title: Inside the Groan-Inducing World of Pun Competitions
video:video.video:description: WIRED's Peter Rubin entered a thunderdome of wordplay warfare and came out with schticker shock. This is a field guide to the weapons he deployed.

video:video.video:title: Step Inside South Park's Most Memorable Scenes
video:video.video:description: Ever wanted to be inside an episode of South Park? At the Paley Center in Los Angeles, the South Park 20 Experience lets you do just that. Taking the twenty most iconic moments of the television series, the South Park 20 Experience gives people the opportunity to take pictures and become part of South Park's best episodes.

video:video.video:title: A Scientist's Quest to 3D Scan Thousands of Species
video:video.video:description: Adam Summers is on a mission to scan all 33,000 species of ray-finned fish—and upload all of that data for anyone to make amazing 3D images, just like we did.

video:video.video:title: How Boeing Builds a 737 in Just Nine Days
video:video.video:description: Boeing's Renton plant builds 737 narrow-body jets at the rate of 42 per month, and climbing. Here's how.

video:video.video:title: NASA's Starshade Is Like a Giant Visor for the Stars
video:video.video:description: NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory has come up with an ingenious solution to take better photographs of ultra-bright stars; a baseball diamond-sized folding shade that blocks out a star's powerful rays.

video:video.video:title: The Numbers Don't Lie: America's Got a Gun Addiction
video:video.video:description: America’s gun addiction is bad. But to understand just how bad it is, you’ve got to see the numbers.

video:video.video:title: NASA Finds More Evidence of Water Plumes on Jupiter's Moon Europa
video:video.video:description: It's not aliens. So everyone calm the heck down. Using the Hubble Space Telescope, NASA caught sight of water plumes bursting out from Europa’s icy surface. If any Europeans are lurking beneath the moon's surface, they just got a whole lot easier to reach.

video:video.video:title: Building Games For Virtual Reality Storytelling | Breaking Through
video:video.video:description: Virtual Reality is the next frontier in entertainment, but it’s so new that the rules are still being written. No one knows the best way to develop, advertise, or create yet – and that’s what makes it so exciting.

video:video.video:title: Meet the Giant, Toxic Starfish That’s Menacing Reefs
video:video.video:description: Get to know the crown of thorns starfish, which grows to two feet wide and wields toxic spines that will definitely ruin your day.

video:video.video:title: Review: We Filmed This Entire Video Using the iPhone 7
video:video.video:description: The iPhone 7 Plus is touted as *the* mobile low-light camera. It’s got dual lenses, an f/1.8 aperture, image stabilization, and an even brighter flash. But how much better is it? We tested it out by filming this entire video with iPhone 7.

video:video.video:title: Tinashe on MTV’s First Live Music Show in 20 Years
video:video.video:description: MTV's new live music show 'Wonderland' is their first return to live music programming in 20 years. Headliner Tinashe talks about how the multi-platform broadcast of the show reflects our present media landscape.

video:video.video:title: First Look: Here’s How Tesla Improved its UI and Autopilot
video:video.video:description: One push of a button and 140,000 Tesla owners get a new user interface, improved Autopilot, and some clever new abilities. WIRED takes Tesla's new system for a spin.

video:video.video:title: Grace Helbig, Hannah Hart & Mamrie Hart Show Us The Last Thing on Their Phones
video:video.video:description: Stars of the upcoming film "Dirty 30", Grace Helbig, Hannah Hart, and Mamrie Hart show us the last thing they did on their phones. The Holy Trinity unveils what they last googled, how many alarms they have, and their favorite emojis.

video:video.video:title: Food Myths: Do Carrots Improve Your Eyesight?
video:video.video:description: Your parents always told you to eat your veggies, especially carrots if you want good eyesight. But can they really improve your vision? WIRED takes a look.

video:video.video:title: "You Think That's Gonna Go Right?"
video:video.video:description: John McAfee’s security detail talks about their experiences with him in this clip from 'Gringo: The Dangerous Life of John McAfee'.

video:video.video:title: Tinker Hatfield Draws WIRED's October Cover
video:video.video:description: Nike shoe guru Tinker Hatfield draws WIRED's October cover featuring his design inspirations for the power-lacing HyperAdapt 1.0 shoe.

video:video.video:title: Meet the HyperAdapt, Nike's Awesome New Power-Lacing Sneaker
video:video.video:description: Nike's Tinker Hatfield and Tiffany Beers explain the new power-lacing HyperAdapt 1.0 and demonstrate how to charge the sneakers, and tighten and loosen the laces with the touch of a button.

video:video.video:title: The Glass Frog Isn’t Made of Glass But That Would Be Pretty Cool
video:video.video:description: The glass frog is a BIG fan of transparency, in the sense that you can see all of its internal organs through its belly skin.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - How Orphan Black Creates Convincing Clones
video:video.video:description: Design FX dives into the incredible special effects of BBC America's Orphan Black. Mike Seymour breaks down how the team at Intelligent Creatures and Emmy Award nominated actress Tatiana Maslany work together to create convincing clones; with a combination of visual effects, rotoscoping, and incredible acting ability.

video:video.video:title: Meet the Artist: Tom Sachs
video:video.video:description: Artist Tom Sachs discusses his latest space program--Mission to Europa, Jupiter’s icy moon. His expansive sculpture exhibition will fill Yerba Buena Center for the Arts in San Francisco from the 16th of September until the 15th of January 2017.

video:video.video:title: This Motoring Mimic Can Become Any Car
video:video.video:description: Need a Camaro? A Duesenberg? Maybe a Batmobile? WIRED transportation writer Jack Stewart checks out the Blackbird, the shape-shifting electric vehicle directors use for motoring movie magic.

video:video.video:title: Virtual Boy vs Oculus Rift Throwdown
video:video.video:description: In this episode, watch as we tear down Nintendo's Virtual Boy and the Oculus Rift. Virtual reality of the 90's versus virtual reality of today!

video:video.video:title: Climb Inside Uber's Self-Driving Car—Its Next Big Disruption
video:video.video:description: The ride-sharing giant is in Pittsburgh for its latest big move: the country’s first autonomous taxi service. Select Uber users can now ride in self-driving cars, with humans at the wheel for an emergency.

video:video.video:title: Zachary Quinto Explains How To Hack An Election
video:video.video:description: 'Snowden' star Zachary Quinto goes in-depth on the possibility of a hacked presidential election.

video:video.video:title: Chevy's Electric Car Travels Farther Per Charge Than Tesla's Model S
video:video.video:description: General Motors has promised that the Chevrolet Bolt, its affordable, long-range electric car, would deliver at least 200 miles on a charge and cost no more than $30,000. WIRED put it to the test.

video:video.video:title: Joseph Gordon-Levitt & Shailene Woodley Say Privacy Is No Longer A Human Right
video:video.video:description: 'Snowden' stars Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Shailene Woodley discuss the making of their new movie, and talk about how technology has essentially taken away our right to privacy.

video:video.video:title: The WIRED review: The iPhone 7 and 7 Plus
video:video.video:description: While the iPhone 7 may seem like just a faster, brighter, splash-proof version of the 6s, there are some serious improvements. Here's our take on Apple's latest offering.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Chelsea Handler Answers the Web’s Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: Chelsea Handler hangs with WIRED to answer the internet’s most Googled questions about herself.

video:video.video:title: The Crabs That Stick Camouflage All Over Their Bodies? It’s Called Fashion
video:video.video:description: Meet the decorator and urchin crabs, crafty little critters that don’t just sit around waiting to get eaten. They deck themselves out with some serious outfits.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - Inside Pete’s Dragon's Amazing Visual Effects
video:video.video:description: Design FX dives into the incredible special effects of Pete's Dragon. How were the team at WETA able to make Elliot (the titular dragon) appear invisible? Mike Seymour breaks down the techniques used to accomplish this spectacular effect.

video:video.video:title: The Incredible Bike That’s Rocketing a Paralympian Toward Glory
video:video.video:description: Krige Schabort is gearing up for his ultimate paratriathlon at his sixth and final Paralympics in Rio. WIRED takes a look at the high tech bike that's going to get him over the finish line.

video:video.video:title: Food Myths: Are Apple Cores Poisonous?
video:video.video:description: There are a lot of food myths out there, so WIRED's decided to look into a few. The first: are apple seeds really poisonous?

video:video.video:title: The iPhone 7: More Camera, More Colors, Less Headphone Jack
video:video.video:description: The iPhone 7 is here. It has a great new camera, a bunch of new color options, but let's not talk about the headphone jack.

video:video.video:title: Everything Apple Just Debuted, From the iPhone 7 to a New Watch
video:video.video:description: From a new version of the Apple Watch to the jet black iPhone 7, here's everything the tech giant announced at its latest event.

video:video.video:title: Your First Look at Jupiter’s Gorgeous North Pole
video:video.video:description: The Juno spacecraft has snapped the first photo ever of Jupiter’s north pole, revealing some intriguing surprises.

video:video.video:title: The Biggest Bro of the Insect Kingdom: The Rhino Beetle
video:video.video:description: Rhino beetles love to fight and to hump. They use huge scoops on their heads to joust, launching each other off branches to win the right to mate.

video:video.video:title: Buckle Up for a First-Person View of a Pro Drone Pilot
video:video.video:description: Charpu is one of the best drone pilot's in the world. WIRED spent an afternoon with him capturing some of his craziest drone stunts.

video:video.video:title: These Aren’t Minions. They’re Robots That Swim Around Solving Mysteries
video:video.video:description: Scientists just released robots that look like Minions into the Pacific Ocean. The little bots are on a mission to unravel one of the great mysteries of the sea: what the hell are marine larvae up to?

video:video.video:title: Now You Can Control BB-8 With a Flick of Your Wrist
video:video.video:description: We’re willing to bet your wearable doesn’t come with the power of the Force? Sphero’s launching a special edition of the BB-8 toy that'll allow you to control the little droid with hand gestures.

video:video.video:title: Garmin's New Action Cam Versus GoPro's Hero4
video:video.video:description: Must be action cam season again and now Garmin has stepped into the game with it's Virb Ultra 30. It doesn't do a bad job when matched against the GoPro Hero4.

video:video.video:title: What It Takes to Turn a Vintage Wreck Into a Racecar
video:video.video:description: Dave Hogye spent four and a half years turning a rusted out 1959 Triumph into a beautiful race car. He then risked all that hard work, took it to the track and pushed it full throttle.

video:video.video:title: Inside the Robot-Run Lab of the Future (Do Watch Your Step)
video:video.video:description: Genetics is often just moving tiny amounts of liquid around. So Counsyl, a genetic testing company has hired some robots. Actually, they didn’t just hire them; they built their own to do the work most scientists hate doing.

video:video.video:title: Six Scientists Lived in a Tiny Pod for a Year Pretending They Were on Mars
video:video.video:description: It sounds nuts, and maybe you have to be, but six scientists completed a yearlong NASA-funded Mars simulation in Hawaii, where they lived in a dome in near isolation.

video:video.video:title: Meet One of the World's Best Drone Pilots
video:video.video:description: Carlos “Charpu” Puertolas isn't interested in competitive drone racing, he prefers to fly freestyle in dangerous, abandoned buildings. His tricks and aerial showmanship has earned him notoriety in the drone community.

video:video.video:title: Learn How to Fly Like a Pro From a Master Freestyle Drone Pilot
video:video.video:description: Carlos “Charpu” Puertolas is regarded as one of the best freestyle drone pilots in the world. WIRED spent an afternoon with him in an abandoned oil refinery to get some tips on how to fly drones like a pro.

video:video.video:title: Meet the Many Insects That Insist on Being Sticks and Leaves
video:video.video:description: A surprising number of insects look like sticks and leaves. But nobody created them that way—they’re the product of the wonderful processes of natural selection.

video:video.video:title: Breaking the World Record for Largest Aerial Projection Screen
video:video.video:description: To promote the upcoming MTV Video Music Awards, a pair of helicopters cruised over the Hudson. One towed a 250-foot-wide banner, and a second flew behind it at an angle, beaming video onto the banner from a few hundred feet away.

video:video.video:title: Fresh Beer, as Easy as Wine in a Box
video:video.video:description: The Hopsy HomeTap is a miniature keg fridge that lets you drink brewery-fresh beer from participating local microbreweries.

video:video.video:title: Take a Tour of the Most Tricked-Out Science Ship in America
video:video.video:description: This 238-foot beauty isn’t just oddly comfortable—it comes equipped with some serious tech for some serious oceanography.

video:video.video:title: The First Glimpse of a Sunken WWII Aircraft Carrier
video:video.video:description: Human eyes haven’t seen the USS Independence, which fought ferocious battles in the Pacific Theater, for 65 years. But now, thanks to the wonders of remotely operated vehicles, it’s coming into view off the coast of San Francisco.

video:video.video:title: Meet the 5 Fancy Cars Sold for Millions
video:video.video:description: A single car sold for 18 million dollars at one of the fanciest auto shows in the United States. Here are the five most notable vintage cars on auction at the Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance.

video:video.video:title: Teens Explain How to Flirt on Social Media
video:video.video:description: Teens explain how to use snaps, likes, emojis, and follows to get the attention of a crush.

video:video.video:title: Teens Explain the Rules of Social Media
video:video.video:description: Teens breakdown the new rules of social media posting, following, and deleting comments.

video:video.video:title: No, the Ocean Didn’t Grow Hair. It’s the Garden Eel!
video:video.video:description: The garden eel is harmless and actually pretty cute. But get a bunch of them together and things start looking a wee bit creepy.

video:video.video:title: The Art of Animating Kubo's Epic Opening Scene
video:video.video:description: The first moments of the new animated film Kubo are breathtaking. WIRED spoke to LAIKA animation studio about how they made it all possible.

video:video.video:title: Science of Sport: BMX
video:video.video:description: WIRED explores the science behind what it really takes to be an olympic BMX athlete, featuring Alise Post and Connor Fields.

video:video.video:title: Fitbit Jailbreak Tips and Tricks
video:video.video:description: When you're trying to meet a Fitbit threshold, but you just can't cut the mustard, we've got several cheats that will bring your count up to 10,000 steps with minimal effort.

video:video.video:title: How Tesla's Self-Driving Autopilot Actually Works
video:video.video:description: Exploring everything from the radars and camera to the Mario Kart easter egg, our roadtrip shows Tesla’s autopilot works well—but it's no self-driving wunderkind.

video:video.video:title: How to Pressure-Cook With Steam—and Good-Old Science
video:video.video:description: The pressure cooker. It sounds, well, terrifying. But not only is it a perfectly safe way to cook if you’re not screwing around, thanks to the laws of physics, it’s a perfectly speedy way to cook too.

video:video.video:title: Science of Sport: Track & Field
video:video.video:description: What does it take to be an Olympic sprinter? Power and aggression. WIRED talks to Allyson Felix, Lashawn Merritt, Ashton Eaton, Jarryd Wallace, and Dawn Harper about the science behind the sport, and the mechanics behind propelling their bodies from the blocks to the finish line.

video:video.video:title: Hello, River Dolphin. What’s Up With Your Giant Head?
video:video.video:description: The river dolphin is good at two things: having a giant head and being able to turn that head. That last bit is indeed a skill. We promise.

video:video.video:title: To Save an Endangered Fox, Humans Turned Its Home into a War Zone
video:video.video:description: To save the endangered island fox and its home off the coast of California, scientists went to war on invasive species like feral pigs and aggressive ants.

video:video.video:title: Sausage Party Ain't Great, But It'll Be a Stoner Classic
video:video.video:description: The raunchy animated feature from the minds of Seth Rogen and Jonah Hll unfortunately lives up its name, but there's enough gleeful filth and silliness to guarantee plenty of smoke-filled midnight movie sessions.

video:video.video:title: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story Trailer 2
video:video.video:description: The official trailer for Rogue One: A Star Wars Story, in which a group of unlikely heroes band together on a mission to steal the plans to the Death Star, the Empire’s ultimate weapon of destruction. Rogue One: A Star Wars Story arrives in theaters December 16, 2016.

video:video.video:title: The DEA Chilled Out a Bit and Made It Easier to Study Weed
video:video.video:description: The DEA just made it easier for scientists to get their hands on more of the stickiest of the icky.

video:video.video:title: Meet the Tiny Foxes That Shouldn’t Be Alive
video:video.video:description: A decade ago the tiny island fox was on the brink of extinction. Now, thanks to a radical reordering of its California island ecosystem, the fox is coming off the Endangered Species List.

video:video.video:title: Who Said it? Luke Cage or Nic Cage
video:video.video:description: It’s surprisingly easy to get the two confused. Both are tall badasses known for saying outlandish things. So we threw some quotes at Mike Colter, who plays Luke Cage in Netflix's new series, and asked him to guess who said them—Nic Cage or Luke Cage.

video:video.video:title: Science of Sport: Archery
video:video.video:description: WIRED takes an in-depth look at the science and mathematics behind Olympic Archery with Brady Ellison and Mackenzie Brown.

video:video.video:title: Driving the Karma Revero, The Electric Car That's Back From the Dead
video:video.video:description: We hop behind the wheel of the resurrected Revero—formerly known as the Fisker Karma—to see if the electric car can make its second chance at life a success.

video:video.video:title: Liquids Are So 2015. Here’s How to Package Them in Spheres
video:video.video:description: Liquids. They’re so… liquidy. But our friends at ChefSteps have a quick and easy way to trap them, in beautiful delicious little spheres.

video:video.video:title: Science of Sport: Swimming
video:video.video:description: What does it take to be an Olympic gold medalist? WIRED takes in-depth look at the mechanics behind the athletes featuring Conor Dwyer, Elizabeth Biesel, Matt Grevers, Nathan Adrian, Rayler Clary, and Ryan Lochte.

video:video.video:title: Nokia 3310 vs iPhone 6s Throwdown
video:video.video:description: In this episode, watch as we tear down Nokia's 3310 and the iPhone 6s. We pull them apart, compare them, and give interesting tech, cultural details and statistics.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures - Meet the Agouti, the Giant Yet Lovable Rodent of the Amazon
video:video.video:description: The agouti ain’t no sewer rat: It’s actually a pivotal part of the rainforest ecosystem. Like a weird-looking squirrel, really.

video:video.video:title: Science of Sport: Gymnastics
video:video.video:description: Charlotte Drury, Maggie Nichols, and Aly Raisman talk to WIRED about the skill, precision, and control they employ when performing various Gymnastic moves and when training for the Olympics.

video:video.video:title: The Long-Awaited DB11 Is Aston Martin's Bid for the Digital Age
video:video.video:description: The $212,000 coupe is the first all-new model from a new regime leading the famed British automaker.

video:video.video:title: Here's How to Fight Zika: With More Mosquitoes
video:video.video:description: Scientists in California are breeding and releasing mosquitos into Zika hotspots. While it may seem like they're making matters worse, they are actually releasing a kind of biological trojan horse.

video:video.video:title: See How an Insane 7-Circle Roundabout Actually Works
video:video.video:description: Your first thought upon seeing Swindon's 'magic roundabout' might be: man, the Brits have really lost the plot lately. But this thing—which is actually seven roundabouts in one—has been working for 60 years.

video:video.video:title: DC vs. Marvel: Box Office Battle | Data Attack
video:video.video:description:
Data Attack reveals the history of DC and Marvel films and how they’ve created Hollywood’s biggest franchises.
Animation by Eric Power

video:video.video:title: Science of Food | How to Make Super-Classy Culinary Foam, Even if You Aren’t Classy
video:video.video:description: Nothing says fancy dining quite like a blob of foam. So soothing, such a great mouth feel. And get this: you can easily make it at home, expensive restaurants be damned!

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures | We Can’t Tell if the Sea Pig Is Adorable or Terrifying
video:video.video:description: Meet the bizarre sea pig, a kind of sea cucumber that walks along the sea floor on little squishy feet. Oh, and it shoves dead things into its mouth with tentacles.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Cara Delevingne Answers the Web’s Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: Cara Delevingne, star of Suicide Squad and Luc Besson’s much anticipated Valerian, hangs with WIRED to answer the Internet’s most searched questions about herself.

video:video.video:title: The Fastest Electric Car Ever Isn't a Tesla—It's a Converted Corvette
video:video.video:description: A 2006 Corvette Z06 has been converted to an all electric drivetrain and it just beat the land speed record for an street legal EV at 205.6 mph. You can buy one, but it's gonna cost you.

video:video.video:title: Yi’s 4K Camera Is a GoPro Ripoff That’s Better Than a GoPro
video:video.video:description: GoPro's Hero4 Black costs $500, and the Yi 4K costs $250, which one is better? Not the expensive one.

video:video.video:title: Flight Mode | The Fancy Tech Pilots Use to Keep Your Flight Turbulence-Free
