video:video.video:description: To avoid severe weather pilots used to carry 40 pound briefcases with piles of paperwork and information for their flight. Not anymore.

video:video.video:title: Meet Dyson’s New Roaming Robo-Vac
video:video.video:description: The Dyson 360 Eye has a camera on top that can survey your home’s layout, helping it vacuum every available inch.

video:video.video:title: Werner Herzog on Emoji: ‘Let Them Keep Smiling. I Don’t Care’
video:video.video:description: WIRED asked Werner Herzog, whose new film 'Lo and Behold' examines the information age of the Internet, to weigh in on tech manners.

video:video.video:title: Werner Herzog Takes Us Inside His New Film 'Lo and Behold'
video:video.video:description: Filmmaker Werner Herzog discusses his new film 'Lo and Behold: Reveries of the Connected World' which examines the Internet and the data revolution.

video:video.video:title: Inside the Gigafactory, Where Tesla is Building its Future
video:video.video:description: Tesla's Gigafactory, under construction in Sparks, Nevada, will be the largest building in the world, by footprint, when it's finished. The batteries it produces are crucial to Tesla's plan to make affordable electric vehicles.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - Inside Star Trek Beyond’s Amazing Visual Effects
video:video.video:description: Design FX dives into the incredible special effects of Star Trek Beyond. From the digital construction of the Starship Enterprise all the way down to the extraterrestrials themselves, Mike Seymour takes us into warp drive as he breaks this successful franchise down to its DNA.

video:video.video:title: Science of Food | How to Make a Latte Without Milk or a Fancy Espresso Machine
video:video.video:description: Lactose intolerant folks rejoice! You can make a latte without milk. All you need is a bit of science and some xanthan gum.

video:video.video:title: Star Trek’s Sofia Boutella Shows Us the Last Thing on Her Phone
video:video.video:description: Sofia Boutella, who plays Jayla in Star Trek Beyond, shows us the most recent items on her phone - from texts, to music, to emojis, videos, instagram and more!

video:video.video:title: Hidden Easter Eggs of Legoland
video:video.video:description: Master Builder Robbie McCarthy show us all the hidden secrets of California's LEGOLAND.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures | The Goofy-Looking Bird That Kicks the Bejeezus Out of Snakes
video:video.video:description: Say hello to the secretary bird. It’s a bird of prey, but it ain’t doing no swooping. Instead, it kicks the everloving crap out of its victims.

video:video.video:title: Want to Save the Whales? Start Studying Krill
video:video.video:description: Scientists aboard the NOAA research vessel Fulmar study the marine heath of the waters off San Francisco by sampling water and krill–humpback and blue whales' favorite meal.

video:video.video:title: Catching Comic-Con 2016: Pokémon Go IRL
video:video.video:description: If you think catching Pokemon from your couch is easy, try catching all the cosplayers at Comic Con. You can't catch 'em all!

video:video.video:title: Everything We’re Dying to See at Comic-Con 2016
video:video.video:description: Comic-Con has kicked off in sunny San Diego and boy is there a lot to see.

video:video.video:title: Believe It: Segway’s New ‘Hoverboard’ Is Actually Kinda Cool
video:video.video:description: You know those people you see on guided Segway tours? You know how you laugh at them and swear you’ll never do that? Well, Segway may have the answer to its ‘uncool’ problem with its new MiniPro.

video:video.video:title: Facebook's Grand Plan to Connect Every Corner of the World Takes Flight
video:video.video:description: Facebook’s huge internet-beaming drone finally takes it's first flight and it's all part of the tech giant's plans to provide internet access in remote parts of the world.

video:video.video:title: Flight Mode | What It’s Like to Narrowly Avert Disaster in an $18M Simulator
video:video.video:description: Pilots spend hours in multi-million dollar simulators, preparing for the worst cast scenario. In this episode Flight Mode, WIRED's Jack Stewart gets a taste of what pilots go through.

video:video.video:title: NASA Fact-Checks Star Trek's Starship Enterprise
video:video.video:description: Warp speed, deflector shields, teletransportation-- what's real and what's not in Star Trek? No one better to tell us than NASA's engineers at the Jet Propulsion Lab.

video:video.video:title: Science of Food | Make Your Own Soft Serve With Dry Ice–And Sweet, Sweet Science
video:video.video:description: You might think that you can only get soft serve at the ice cream parlor—not true! Let us and our friends at ChefSteps prove that all it takes is some dry ice and a little science to make your own ice cream at home.

video:video.video:title: How Motorola Made Modular Smartphones a Reality
video:video.video:description: A team within Motorola has been working on a crazy plan: to let users decide how their smartphone should look, and how it should work. The result is called the Moto Z, and it’s about to hit stores.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures | Meet the Teeny-Tiny Creature With a Buzz Saw for a Face
video:video.video:description: May I introduce you to the rotifer, a magical microscopic critter that uses a buzz saw to suck its victims into its face.

video:video.video:title: Rogue One: Celebration Behind the Scenes
video:video.video:description: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story behind the scenes sizzle reel shown at Celebration 2016.

video:video.video:title: Live Social Media Is Going To Be Huge During The Olympics | Breaking Through
video:video.video:description: Social Media and Live are going to be huge during the olympics this year. Watch as Sam Olstein leads a marketing team at GE pioneering new experiences at the 2016 Olympics across all forms of social media.

video:video.video:title: Here’s the Untold Backstory of the Iconic Slimer From Ghostbusters
video:video.video:description: It never made it into the new reboot of ‘Ghostbusters,’ but writer Katie Dippold and director/co-writer Paul Feig definitely wrote a backstory for one of the franchise’s most beloved characters: Slimer.

video:video.video:title: Flight Mode | The Fancy Tech That's Making It Harder for Airlines to Lose Your Luggage
video:video.video:description: Lost luggage is down by 65% thanks to some new tech. Follow the roller coaster ride that your bags make into the bowels of the airport.

video:video.video:title: 4 Things You Need To Know About Lab Grown Meat
video:video.video:description: The four things you need to know about lab grown meat!

video:video.video:title: Science of Food | The Truth About Grilling With Charcoal
video:video.video:description: Few things get grillers more riled up than arguing about gas versus charcoal. Let us and our friends at Chefsteps settle this debate once and for all.

video:video.video:title: How Juno Will Reveal the Secrets of Our Solar System
video:video.video:description: Find out how NASA’s Juno Mission will help unlock the mysteries of our planet and our solar system.

video:video.video:title: GM's RoboGlove Will Turn Workers Into Tool-Slinging Cyborgs
video:video.video:description: GM's building a power-assisted glove that will make spinning a wrench a whole lot easier.

video:video.video:title: More People are Catching Pokemon than Dates on Tinder
video:video.video:description: In just one week Pokemon Go has almost the same number of daily active users as Twitter. So what's got millions of people running around with their phones trying to catch fantastical creatures? Well, it's pretty clever.

video:video.video:title: Apple IIe vs Modern iMac Throwdown
video:video.video:description: In this episode, watch as we tear down Apple’s //e and 27” iMac. We pull them apart, compare them, and give interesting tech, cultural details and statistics.

video:video.video:title: Clever Design Takes Edibles to the Next Level
video:video.video:description: In a weed market flooded with so many edible options, attention to detail and clever design is paramount. Défoncé Chocolatier has created some of the most user friendly cannabis-infused chocolate bars, that look beautiful too.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures | The Bizarre Sea Spider Won’t Bite. We Promise.
video:video.video:description: The sea spider isn’t actually a spider, but it’s genitals are on its legs. Which is nice.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Mr. Robot's Carly Chaikin Answers the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: Carly Chaikin, star of MR. ROBOT, answers the internet’s most searched questions about herself.

video:video.video:title: You’ll Be Eating Crickets Soon. You Have No Choice
video:video.video:description: Want to know how crickets are farmed and turned into powder? Of course you do. You'll be eating the stuff soon enough.

video:video.video:title: The Beauty of Boeing’s 787-9 Dreamliner on Display
video:video.video:description: Watch Boeing maneuver this All Nippon Airways 787-9 Dreamliner through the skies as it practices for the 2016 Farnborough Airshow.

video:video.video:title: Ghostbusters Director Paul Feig Plays ‘Real or Fake Ghost?’
video:video.video:description: Now that he’s made a ‘Ghostbusters’ movie, director Paul Feig should be an expert in spirits. So WIRED asked him about a series of spooks, both real and fake, to see if he could tell us which were based on actual ghost stories and which we totally made up.

video:video.video:title: Flight Mode | The Bunker-Like Vault Where Jet Engines Prove Their Worth
video:video.video:description: Before takeoff, jet engines must prove they're safe, reliable, and capable. In episode two of WIRED's Flight Mode we step into the massive bunkers where engineers test and maintain these mighty beasts, all to keep you up in the air.

video:video.video:title: We Tested A Real-Life Iron Man Glove
video:video.video:description:
A fun look at all the things that are possible when wielding the powerful Iron Man glove.
Iron Man glove designed and built by Patrick Priebe - http://www.laser-gadgets.com/

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Dana Carvey Answers the Web’s Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: Dana Carvey, star of the upcoming film 'The Secret Life of Pets,' answers the internet's most searched questions about himself.

video:video.video:title: How Darpa Is Making Hacking Into a Spectator Sport
video:video.video:description: DARPA, the Department of Defense research arm, is trying to make its biggest hacking challenge into a visually exciting competition, complete with color commentary.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures | The Oddly Shaped Peanut Bug Is Sick of Getting Beat Up, Guys
video:video.video:description: In South America, the peanut bug ambles around with a goofy-ass head. And that’s not its only clever defense against the bullies of the rainforest.

video:video.video:title: NASA Explains How the Juno Probe Got to Jupiter
video:video.video:description: The experts at NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory explain the incredibly precise, solar-powered Juno mission to the radiation-strewn planet Jupiter.

video:video.video:title: Social Exercise: How the Cultish November Project Uses Hugs and Social Media to Get Fit
video:video.video:description: A workout with the social media-powered November Project San Francisco tribe who explain the bounce, dropping verbals, and the dreaded "We Missed You."

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Slow Mo Guys, MatPat, AsapSCIENCE, and Burnie Burns Answer the Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: MatPat, AsapSCIENCE, The Slow Mo Guys and Burnie Burns answer the internet's most searched questions about YouTube, influencers, fame, and of course themselves.

video:video.video:title: Flight Mode | Inside the NASA-Inspired Room That Guides 5,000 Airplanes
video:video.video:description: In the first episode of the new series Flight Mode, WIRED takes you into a wildly complex mission control where Delta monitors thousands of flights 24/7.

video:video.video:title: Giants of the Business World Reveal What #CreativityIs
video:video.video:description: What is creativity to you? In the world of business it's all about bravery and collaboration.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - Roland Emmerich Breaks Down the Visual Effects Used in "Independence Day: Resurgence"
video:video.video:description: Mike Seymour sits down with "Independence Day: Resurgence" director Roland Emmerich and discusses the astonishing visual effects used in his newest picture, as well as the revolutionary new N-Cam system.

video:video.video:title: Anna Kendrick, Aubrey Plaza & Adam DeVine Show Us the Last Thing on Their Phones
video:video.video:description: Aubrey Plaza, Anna Kendrick, and Adam Devine from 'Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates' show us the most recent items on their phones - from texts, to safari pages, to emojis, videos, alarm clocks and more!

video:video.video:title: 'Swiss Army Man' Directors Show Us the Last Thing on Their Phones
video:video.video:description: In ‘Swiss Army Man’ a guy stranded in the wilderness gets by thanks to a corpse and a dying cell phone. The Daniels came to the WIRED office, so we asked them to show us what was on their smartphones.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures | Silly Tree Kangaroo, You’re Not Supposed to Be Up There
video:video.video:description: The tree kangaroo may have shrunken hind legs, but hey, at least it can walk backwards unlike regular roos. Oh, also: It can plummet out of trees and not suffer the consequences.

video:video.video:title: NASA’s Testing Its Biggest Flame Thrower, Er, Rocket Ever
video:video.video:description: If humans are going to get to Mars, they're going to need rockets with some serious liftoff power. NASA’s Space Launch System is the most powerful rocket in the world and engineers are going to blast it, for testing purposes, of course.

video:video.video:title: NASA Sets a Fire in Space—For Science!
video:video.video:description: NASA started a blaze aboard the unmanned Orbital ATK Cygnus cargo vehicle. It’s the Spacecraft Fire Experiment. Seriously, that’s exactly what NASA is calling it.

video:video.video:title: How a Deaf-Run Pizzeria Takes Your Order Over the Phone
video:video.video:description: Mozzeria is a 100 percent deaf owned and operated pizzeria in a crowded San Francisco restaurant scene. So to stay afloat, it relies on a remarkable technology.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - How The Rock Face Swapped with Vine Star Sione in 'Central Intelligence'
video:video.video:description: Mike Seymour goes behind the visual effects in Central Intelligence used to de-age The Rock and Kevin Hart into high school, teenaged versions of themselves. Weta digital puts the The Rock’s face onto Vine star Sione’s body for an amazing locker room shower dance scene you won’t want to miss.

video:video.video:title: Alliance Data Drop Off
video:video.video:description: A video rendering of an electric autonomous shuttle dropping Buckeyes off at work.

video:video.video:title: Now You Can Yell at Siri on Your Mac
video:video.video:description: Siri is the most important feature coming to your Mac this fall, so of course we put it to the test.

video:video.video:title: The Weird-Looking Drone That Inspects Boilers
video:video.video:description: Need to inspect a piping hot boiler? Why send a human in there, when you can send a drone instead.

video:video.video:title: Out of Office with Brent Rose - The Ultimate Liquid Nitrogen Destruction Video
video:video.video:description: Armed with 20 gallons of liquid nitrogen, Brent Rose super freezes objects the Internet has never seen frozen and uses a Phantom high-speed camera to record their destruction in super slo-motion.

video:video.video:title: Narcos | Season 2 - Official Trailer | Netflix
video:video.video:description: Produced by Netflix

video:video.video:title: NASA’s New X-Plane Looks Goofy But Packs Some Serious Tech
video:video.video:description: The X-57 will be essentially like flying a Tesla. It's part of NASA’s goals to reduce fuel use, emissions, and noise with innovative aircraft design.

video:video.video:title: Exclusive Clip: ‘The BFG'
video:video.video:description: Not-so-friendly giant Fleshlumpeater visits the BFG in this exclusive clip from Steven Spielberg’s new movie.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures | Behold the Super Weird Face-to-Face Sex of the Springtail
video:video.video:description: For a tiny arthropod called a globular springtail, life is about being generally spherical and generally pissed-looking.

video:video.video:title: Inside the Massive Factory Where Siemens Builds Trains
video:video.video:description: Inside the massive Siemens train factory near Sacramento, Ca, building one of the most advanced, and fastest, trains in the US.

video:video.video:title: If Robots Take Our Jobs, What Will Be Left for Humans to Do?
video:video.video:description: Speakers at the WIRED Business Conference grapple with how AI will transform the job market.

video:video.video:title: Magic Leap's Next Move? Bringing C-3PO to Your Living Room
video:video.video:description: This video of Star Wars characters C-3PO and R2-D2 recorded through Magic Leap's technology isn't just cool—it also shows the nearly unlimited potential of a new partnership between Lucasfilm and the mixed-reality company.

video:video.video:title: Magic Leap Partners With Lucasfilm’s ILMxLAB
video:video.video:description: Magic Leap, the mixed-reality company, is joining forces with Lucasfilm’s most forward-looking division: xLab.

video:video.video:title: Facebook Messenger Gets an Upgrade
video:video.video:description: Need an Uber? Need to make a restaurant reservation? Facebook wants you to do everything in its new messaging app.

video:video.video:title: iOS 10: All The New Features Coming to Your iPhone
video:video.video:description: Apple's iOS 10 has some cool new features. WIRED's David Pierce runs down the mobile software's updates and overhauls.

video:video.video:title: The Next List: The Future of Business Is Anything But Bleak
video:video.video:description: Tech bubble? What tech bubble. The future looks bright, especially when you sit down to talk with these four people.

video:video.video:title: Check Out Everything Apple Debuted at WWDC 2016
video:video.video:description: Apple kicked its developers' conference off with some big announcements.

video:video.video:title: Hey Thanks Apple: Siri May Now Actually Be Useful
video:video.video:description: Siri's been little more than a slightly sassy sidekick for iPhone users, but now Apple has made some big moves to make the voice assistant work for more people.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures | That Fish That Attaches to Sharks? It's Actually Pretty Righteous
video:video.video:description: It’s called a remora, and you’ve probably seen it before. It attaches to fish and marine mammals all the time. But get this: It doesn’t attach with its mouth. It’s got a suction cup it wears as a hat.

video:video.video:title: How iOS Actually Changed the World
video:video.video:description: With iOS10 on its way, we thought we’d look back at the way iOS changed the world. But the most pivotal thing in iOS history is something Apple got right on its very first try.

video:video.video:title: How ILM Manscaped the Orcs of Warcraft
video:video.video:description: Think orcs don’t have barbers? Think again. Gaelle Morand and her team at Industrial Light & Magic spent hours perfecting the hair on all of Warcraft’s characters. Here’s how they made “Haircraft” happen.

video:video.video:title: Duncan Jones Made Warcraft For Both Gamers and Movie Buffs
video:video.video:description: For gamers, World of Warcraft represents a massive universe in which they’ve spent many hours. But for many moviegoers, WoW’s Azeroth is a completely foreign place they know nothing about. So for his new movie, Warcraft, director Duncan Jones—a gamer himself—had to create a world that would bring in new fans and make long-time WoW players feel like they were coming home. In this interview with WIRED, he explains how he worked with Industrial Light & Magic to make that happen.

video:video.video:title: Inside the Lair of the Custom Sneaker King
video:video.video:description: In the DIY sneaker world, where custom can mean anything from Sharpie swooshes to complex reconstructions, Ferrato offers a unique service: He dreams up new shoe designs and stitches them together from scratch. That kind of artistry comes at a price. Ferrato's shoes start at $1000.

video:video.video:title: Explore a Mysterious Deep Reef That Shouldn’t Exist
video:video.video:description: A new exhibit shows off the undersea creatures who populate one of the most mysterious, poorly understood parts of the ocean.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Lab - Soccer Playing Robot Predicts the Euro Cup Winner
video:video.video:description:
Who better to predict the winner of this year's Euro Cup than a robot created by UCLA's Robotics and Mechanisms Lab (RoMeLa)?
Special thanks to Dr. Dennis Hong and his incredible team at UCLA’s Robotics & Mechanisms Lab. To learn more about RoMeLa visit: http://www.romela

video:video.video:title: The Roots of Dirt | The Design Evolution of the Early Mountain Bike
video:video.video:description: In the 1970's a group of California hippies built a new technology that changed the world. Computers? Nope. They were building the earliest commercial mountain bikes.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - The Cast of Warcraft Answer The Web's Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: Travis Fimmel, Paula Patton, Toby Kebbell, and Robert Kazinsky answer the web's most searched questions about themselves and World of Warcraft.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures | This Bearcat (Yeah, It's Real) Smells Like Popcorn
video:video.video:description: The binturong has a prehensile tail, crazy feet, and excretes a scent that smells like popcorn. Just call it Orville Smellenbacher.

video:video.video:title: Sacramento Is About to Have the Most High-Tech Basketball Stadium
video:video.video:description: When the new Kings basketball stadium is completed this fall, they hope it’ll be so outrageously technologically advanced that it will even wow fans from Silicon Valley.

video:video.video:title: Social Media 101 From The Lonely Island Crew
video:video.video:description: At the top of the list of people who know how to rule social media there are two very important groups: comedians and celebrities. The Lonely Island team—Andy Samberg, Jorma Taccone, and Akiva Schaffer—actually belong to both of those groups. So WIRED asked them for hot tips on how to rule Twitter, Instagram, and Snapchat.

video:video.video:title: Maybe It's Time to Move the Three-Point Line
video:video.video:description: For decades the slam dunk reigned as the number one crowd pleaser in basketball. Not anymore. The three-pointer is the new star but some argue it's ruining the game and want the NBA to move the line further back.

video:video.video:title: Strandbeests: Giant Sculptures That Eat Wind Descend on San Francisco
video:video.video:description: Kinetic sculptor Theo Jansen brings his mesmerizing wind-powered creatures made of PVC-pipe to the San Francisco Exploratorium.

video:video.video:title: Data Attack - How the 3-Pointer Is Changing The NBA
video:video.video:description: The NBA is undergoing a radical shift based on the Moreyball approach and an obsession with Points Per Possession. We take a deeper look at the trend with actual cut-up construction paper.

video:video.video:title: Lo and Behold: Reveries of the Connected World Trailer
video:video.video:description: Werner Herzog's (Grizzly Man, Cave of Forgotten Dreams) new film examines the technologically connected world we have built.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures | Fish Think They're Safe From Birds But the Kingfisher Is Like LOL
video:video.video:description: For a bird called the kingfisher, stealth, dive-bombing and impalement is a way of life.

video:video.video:title: Our Very Own X-Men: Apocalypse Red Band Trailer (Parody)
video:video.video:description: If Deadpool taught Hollywood anything, it’s that audiences want more hard-R superheroes. Wade cursed, you paid, and 20th Century Fox listened. Here’s the (unfortunately not real) trailer for the studio’s much more NSFW X-Men: Apocalypse.

video:video.video:title: The Beautiful Relationship Between Physics and Jazz
video:video.video:description: Stephon Alexander is a theoretical physicist, but he's also a jazz fanatic whose musical obsession has helped him better understand the world of cosmology, quantum gravity and particle physics.

video:video.video:title: The Crazy Plan to Use Swallowable Origami to Fish Batteries Out of Tummies
video:video.video:description: Kids swallow a lot of batteries. But now MIT researchers are developing swallowable origami to fish the nasty foreign objects out.

video:video.video:title: We Drive an All-Electric Ferrari, the Car that Shouldn’t Exist
video:video.video:description: Ferrari boss Sergio Marchionne is on record as saying an electric Ferrari is an obscene concept, but that didn't stop a group of guys in California from turning the 308 GT into an EV.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures | Three-Foot-Wide Coconut Crab Will Eat Your Soul and Maybe Kittens
video:video.video:description: Our childhood hermit crab has a rather more … sizable cousin: the 3-foot-wide, 9-pound coconut crab that can rip coconuts and sometimes, well, kittens to pieces.

video:video.video:title: Out of Office with Brent Rose - HoloLens + NASA = Amazing
video:video.video:description: Brent Rose tries out a new “Mixed Reality” software developed by NASA’s Jet Propulsion Lab. The software allows virtual elements to be merged with the user’s actual environment, creating a world in which real and virtual objects can interact. Brent stress tests the HoloLens and shows us how much the new tech can really do.

video:video.video:title: Google Lets You Use Apps Without Having to Download Them
video:video.video:description: Google wants to give you a way of using an app without actually downloading it. It's called Instant Apps and Google says it'll be available in a few months.

video:video.video:title: Apple Stores Are Getting a Full Makeover
video:video.video:description: Apple's new flagship San Francisco store is a redesign of the brand's shopping experience. Giant glass doors bring the outdoors inside to the new tree-lined Genius Grove where Creative Pros assist with music and photography apps and accessories.

video:video.video:title: Here's Everything New From Google
video:video.video:description: Google made several announcements at its annual developers conference. As expected the tech giant’s progress with Artificial Intelligence is at the core of many it’s innovations

video:video.video:title: Say "Hello" to Allo, Google's New AI-Powered Messaging App
video:video.video:description: Google's new Ai-powered messaging app, Allo, lets you chat with Google while you chat with your friends. It's the first step toward making Google truly conversational.

video:video.video:title: The Largest Plane in the World Stops Traffic in Australia
video:video.video:description: The Antonov An-225 is the biggest plane in the world. It's such a sight that 20,000 people flocked to the Perth airport in Australia to see this thing land.

video:video.video:title: The Independence Day: Resurgence Spaceship Has Its Own Gravity.
video:video.video:description: In the trailer for Independence Day: Resurgence, the alien spacecraft seems to rip buildings from the ground using gravitational force. Is that physically possible? Nope. But that didn't stop us from calculating the mass it would need in order to destroy Earth.

video:video.video:title: What the AI Behind AlphaGo Teaches Us About Humanity
video:video.video:description: When Google's AI beat the world's Go champion 4-1, it stirred a certain sadness in many people. But the reality is the technologies at the heart of AlphaGo are the future. So it's a time to be excited not scared.

video:video.video:title: DIY: How To Burn a Silkscreen and Print at Home
video:video.video:description: Screen printing is the pinnacle of DIY culture. We're going to show you how to make your own design and screen it onto whatever you'd like. You’ll need to block out a few hours, and you'll need to have a design or logo in mind to print.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures | The Vicious Fish With a Strike Like You Wouldn't Believe
video:video.video:description: The frogfish is a vicious hunter that swallows its victims whole, but it doesn’t really bite its prey. By rapidly expanding its mouth to 10 times its normal volume, the predator creates a vacuum that sucks victims in.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Seth Rogen & Rose Byrne Answer The Web’s Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: Seth Rogen and Rose Byrne, stars of upcoming film 'Neighbors 2,' answer the internet’s most searched questions in WIRED's Autocomplete interview.

video:video.video:title: Uncharted 4 Hides A Beautiful Easter Egg
video:video.video:description: Sony's pirate-themed adventure makes multiple references to another classic video game pirate.

video:video.video:title: How They Filmed the Wildest Snowboard Series You’ve Ever Seen
video:video.video:description: The crew behind the snowboarding series Higher TV went to some incredible lengths to get footage of Jeremy Jones plunging down snowy cliffs in the Himalayas, Wyoming and Alaska.

video:video.video:title: Silicon Valley Opens 1-3
video:video.video:description: Three opens from Silicon Valley. Courtesy HBO.

video:video.video:title: The Age of the Hyperloop Has Arrived. Well, for the Most Part
video:video.video:description: Hyperloop One successfully tested its propulsion system in the Nevada desert. It's an important step, but the journey to making the Hyperloop a reality has just begun.

video:video.video:title: Seniors React to Driverless Cars
video:video.video:description:
WIRED takes ten seniors for a ride in a self-driving shuttle around UCSD's campus. How do they feel about this cutting edge technology?
Directed and produced by Jared Neumark Shot by Benji Dell Sound by Kara Johnson Edited by Josh VanBurskirk Special thanks to Serving Seniors and Varden Labs

video:video.video:title: 3 Million LEGO Bricks in One Room
video:video.video:description: Robbie McCarthy and Bill Gowdy, two of LEGO's Master Builders, show us LEGOLAND's model shop packed with more than 3 million bricks in 70 different colors. Robbie also gives us an exclusive look at LEGO's proprietary 3D modeling software.

video:video.video:title: Talking Pictures | Joel Strong's Satirical Stop-Motion Videos
video:video.video:description: Photographer Joel Strong discusses his satirical stop-motion technique used in "Heads of State," which imagines the presidential front-runners as everyday New Yorkers.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures | Hail Hydra, the Incredible Critter That May Be Immortal
video:video.video:description: The hydra's got kind of a jellyfish thing going on, with tentacles it uses to snag prey. But this tiny freshwater creature regenerates itself over and over again.

video:video.video:title: This Startup Wants to Use Drones to Drop Blood, Not Bombs
video:video.video:description: A California startup is testing a fleet of delivery drones in the hope of deploying them to deliver blood in rural Rwanda.

video:video.video:title: This Mer-Bot Can Swim, Grab Stuff, and Looks Like the Jason of the Deep
video:video.video:description: Stanford University's new Ocean One is a humanoid undersea robot designed for deep diving and extreme manipulation, thanks to its haptic feedback controls.

video:video.video:title: Take an Epic Drone Flight Through Seattle's SR-99 Tunnel
video:video.video:description: Washington State's Department of Transportation flew a drone through Seattle's SR-99 tunnel created by the Big Bertha boring machine.

video:video.video:title: Movie Review | Captain America: Civil War
video:video.video:description: Civil War is a rock-’em-sock-’em stand-off that features no fewer than four massive fights and, even at 146 minutes, feels gargantuan but never over-stuffed. It’s a Captain America movie, yes, but it’s more about the struggle between consent and dissent.

video:video.video:title: Make A Cold Beer On a Mountain Top With This Clever Kit
video:video.video:description:
If you're a hiker and a beer fanatic this $50 starter kit from Pat's Backcountry Beverages could make your day. Clever engineering and technology make brews light enough for even extended backpacking trips. Cheers!
TIRED Beer concentrates and the carbonator make brews that can be good, but they aren't great. Then again, you might not care after a long day of hiking.

video:video.video:title: The SFMOMA’s New App Will Forever Change How You Enjoy Museums
video:video.video:description: The renovated SFMOMA is now one of the most considered gallery spaces in the world. But it's not just the museum that got a redesign. The SFMOMA has also reimagined the audio tour experience with it’s new app.

video:video.video:title: Why Women Earn Less Than Men
video:video.video:description:
We’ve all heard about the Gender Pay Gap, but how prevalent is it? Find out how women compare to men in workplace compensation and what we can do about the glass ceiling.
Directed/Produced by Jared Neumark Animated by Yoriko Murakami and Kim Blanchette Shot by Mika Levin Written by Roya Rastegar Edited by Mike Russell

video:video.video:title: Don't Throw Away That Chickpea Water! Make a Cocktail Instead
video:video.video:description: You know the water in a can of chickpeas? Well, it can be used as a viable substitute for egg. That's a food hack worth noting, so yes, we made a pisco sour using 'bean juice'.

video:video.video:title: J.J. Abrams and Lin-Manuel Miranda Rap in Jabba the Hutt’s Language
video:video.video:description: Film director J.J. Abrams and Lin-Manuel Miranda surprised people waiting for tickets to see Miranda's Broadway hit 'Hamilton' with an acoustic version of the new Star Wars cantina song, 'Jabba Flow.'

video:video.video:title: 4-Foot LEGO Super Star Destroyer - How We Smashed It
video:video.video:description: WIRED destroys a massive LEGO Super Star Destroyer.

video:video.video:title: Stormtrooper Figures vs. Actual Lasers!
video:video.video:description: To celebrate Star Wars Day, we brought members of the Empire to FABberz NYC to see how they would fare against a real working laser. May the 4th be with you!

video:video.video:title: The Nostalgist: A Sci-fi Short Based on a Story From the Author of Robopocalypse
video:video.video:description: In the futuristic city of Vanille, with properly tuned ImmerSyst Eyes & Ears the world can look and sound like a paradise. But the life of a father and his young son threatens to disintegrate when the father's device begins to fail.

video:video.video:title: The 2017 Ford F-150 Raptor Is an Off-Road Monster
video:video.video:description: If you thought the civilian version of the Ford F-150 was a bit much, it’s time you met its ripping off-road cousin, the Raptor.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures | The World’s Silkiest Anteater Is Not–I Repeat, Not–Stoned
video:video.video:description: The silky anteater isn't high. It's just tired, because this proficient nocturnal hunter has no business being up during the day.

video:video.video:title: Visit a Roiling Deep-Sea Vent in Glorious VR
video:video.video:description: The promise of virtual reality is that it can transport you to places you’d prefer not to go, like the roiling vents at the bottom of the deepest oceans, where crushing pressures and searing heat make an environment fit only for robots.

video:video.video:title: App Pack | Take Command of the Kitchen With These Cooking Apps
video:video.video:description: There are apps to help you convert measurements from tablespoons to cups, apps that help you balance out your noodle-to-sauce ratio, recipe apps that can offer suggestions of what you should cook tonight based on what's hiding in your fridge. And of course, if you like to cook but hate to shop, there are apps that will have uncooked ingredients delivered to you. All you have to do is bring the heat.

video:video.video:title: Insane 'Swooping' Skydiving Makes Your Tandem Jump Look Lame
video:video.video:description: These skydivers are no ordinary adrenalin junkies. In the National Championships of Canopy Piloting competitors fly swoop in inches above the ground at close to 100 miles per hour. It’s an extremely technical sport that punishes any tiny mistakes.

video:video.video:title: Designers Reimagine the Task Light—And It’s Gorgeous
video:video.video:description: You probably don’t give your lamp much thought when you switch it on. But the San Francisco design firm Box Clever recently spent two years thinking about a lamp perfect for designers.

video:video.video:title: First Look at the New Ninjago Legoland | Giant LEGO NINJAGO Brick Battle!
video:video.video:description: WIRED gets a first look at the brand new Ninjago section of Legoland’s California park. Ninjago at Legoland opens May 5th.

video:video.video:title: The Thrill of Flying a Solar Plane With a Coffin-Sized Cockpit
video:video.video:description: Pilots Bertrand Piccard and André Borschberg show WIRED around the enormous solar-panel covered wings of the Solar Impulse 2 plane and inside its cramped cockpit.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures | This Squid Has One Little Eye and One Giant Eye
video:video.video:description: Hey listen, we’re all lopsided. You’d look weird as hell if you were perfectly symmetrical. But the strawberry squid is really lopsided, with one tiny eye and one giant eye.

video:video.video:title: We Race The Stig in Go Karts (with GoPros)
video:video.video:description: Former Stig, Ben Collins, goes head to head against Wired’s Transportation Editor Alex Davies in a go kart duel.

video:video.video:title: Rolls-Royce's New Droptop Roof Is Gorgeous and Silent
video:video.video:description: The droptop on the new Dawn is the epitome of Rolls-Royce: a robustly engineered system that feels as though it’s not even there.

video:video.video:title: Data Attack - Pets Who Have Won The Internet
video:video.video:description: Looking at cat videos increases your happiness by 28% and decreases anxiety by 33%. Goats and chickens are more viral in Uganda than dogs and cats. Find out all you wanted to know about viral pets on the Internet.

video:video.video:title: Where the Sounds From the World's Favorite Movies Are Born
video:video.video:description: WIRED gets a tour from veteran Foley artist John Roesch of the Skywalker's custom built soundstage. Roesch reveals some of the strangest audio props that were used in films like 'Who Framed Roger Rabbit,' 'Back to the Future' and 'Braveheart’.

video:video.video:title: A New Crop of Marijuana Geneticists Build Better Weed
video:video.video:description: There are thousands of strains of weed. Cracking their genetic codes may be the key to transforming pot from a budding business to a high-flying industry and a cannabis analytics lab is trying to unlock the true potential of weed. Pictures by Preston Gannaway.

video:video.video:title: App Pack - All the Apps You Need to Make This 420 the Best 420 EVAR
video:video.video:description: It's 420, a day of unabashed weed revelry. But it's also 2016, and your regular pot smoking routine just won't cut it. Watch above to get all the apps you'll need to make this 420 the best 420 ever (that is, given it's legal where you are).

video:video.video:title: The Untold Story of Magic Leap, the World's Most Secretive Startup
video:video.video:description: The world's hottest startup isn't located in Silicon Valley–it's in suburban Florida. WIRED explores what Magic Leap's mind-bending technology tells us about the future of virtual reality.

video:video.video:title: AR, VR, MR: Making Sense of Magic Leap and the Future of Reality
video:video.video:description: The age of virtual realty is here but augmented reality and its cousin mixed reality are making strides. WIRED senior editor Peter Rubin breaks down the new platforms.

video:video.video:title: Stanford Is About to Have the Dopest Map Collection on Earth
video:video.video:description: Some would call David Rumsey a cartophile, while others may put it more bluntly and say he’s obsessed. Over 30 years he’s personally accumulated over 150,000 maps and he's just donated them all to Stanford University.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures| The Nudibranch Says, ‘Hey, I’m Super Colorful. So No Touchy'
video:video.video:description: Look at the nudibranch. Beautiful, right? That's its way of saying it will mess you up. You see, the nudibranch packs a punch–in a very unusual way

video:video.video:title: Out of Office with Brent Rose - How to Make VR Porn | OOO with Brent Rose
video:video.video:description: It’s been reported that porn will be one of the biggest content offerings driving demand for VR. But what actually goes into making the porn experience full dimensional and real for the viewer? Brent Rose goes on set of a VR porn production shoot to find out how porn is evolving with new technology. Special thanks to KinkVR.com

video:video.video:title: Exclusive Footage of What It’s Like to See Through Magic Leap
video:video.video:description: An exclusive WIRED clip of what daily computing with Magic Leap technology could be like. Recorded directly through Magic Leap technology.

video:video.video:title: How to Get Out of the Worst Traps in Movie History - NSFW
video:video.video:description: Green Room director Jeremy Saulnier and actor Anton Yelchin play a game with WIRED. We asked them how they’d get out of trapped situations depicted in other films. It gets pretty crude, so this is NSFW.

video:video.video:title: App Pack | These Apps Will Make You a Better Human (Environmentally Speaking)
video:video.video:description: You’re worried about your impact on the environment. Maybe you just want to recycle more, or eat greener. Well, good on you. These handy apps can help.

video:video.video:title: Lux Noctis – How Photographer Reuben Wu Lit Landscape With a Drone
video:video.video:description: Behind the scenes of Reuben Wu's 'Lux Noctis' photographs made with the Phase One camera and Fiilix's new drone-mounted AL250 LED light.

video:video.video:title: Data Attack - Everything You Ever Wanted to Know About Star Wars' BB-8
video:video.video:description:
Here is everything you ever wanted to know about Star Wars' latest beloved droid. BB-8 goes to LAX to greet his very own BB-8 ANA Jet.
ANA Star Wars plane: http://ana-sw.com/

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Eve Answers The Web’s Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: Eve takes WIRED's Autocomplete Interview, answering the most searched questions about herself.

video:video.video:title: A Brain Implant Brings a Quadriplegic’s Arm Back to Life
video:video.video:description: Ian Burkhart is paralyzed from the neck down, but thanks to an array of electrodes implanted in his brain he's able to swipe credit cards and play video games with his own hands.

video:video.video:title: Canon's Spendy New Movie Camera Can Truly See in the Dark
video:video.video:description: Canon's new ME20F-SH has bananas low-light capabilities. We shot some footage to show off its see-in-the-dark skills but be warned it'll cost you over $20K.

video:video.video:title: Hallucination Hunters
video:video.video:description: An exclusive clip of the forthcoming series finale of Children's Hospital on Adult Swim.

video:video.video:title: Moog’s DIY Kit Is a Fantastic Crash Course for Synth Noobs
video:video.video:description: The Werkstatt-01 from Moog Music is a synthesizer you build yourself. It's also a valuable tool for learning how these mystical analog machines work. It'll cost you around $200.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Common Answers The Web’s Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: Common takes WIRED's Autocomplete Interview, answering the most searched questions about him.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures | This Fly Is So Horrifying We Had to Put Cute Baby Goats in This Video
video:video.video:description: Fair warning. This video is about the botfly's horrific larvae, which grow and feed in human flesh. Don't say we didn't warn you.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Ice Cube Answers The Web’s Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: Ice Cube takes WIRED's Autocomplete Interview, answering the world's most searched questions about himself.

video:video.video:title: Learning the Art of Sound Effects Is Weirder Than You Might Think
video:video.video:description: WIRED senior editor Peter Rubin learns the Foley ropes at Lucasfilm's new state-of-the-art sound lab.

video:video.video:title: Meet the Itsy-Bitsy Spider With a Bear Trap for a Mouth
video:video.video:description: Trap-jaw spiders may be tiny but their unusual jaws pack a serious and lightning fast punch. Researchers using high-speed cameras recently discovered how speedy and lethal the spiders' bite can be.

video:video.video:title: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story Trailer
video:video.video:description: Trailer for Rogue One: A Star Wars Story.

video:video.video:title: App Pack | Meditation Apps to Help You Stay Sane
video:video.video:description: Load up your devices with these mediation, mindfulness, and relaxation apps. Hopefully, they’ll help you find some inner peace. Namaste!

video:video.video:title: Ted Cruz Gets a Bronx Welcome
video:video.video:description: The morning after his big win in the Wisconsin primary, Texas Sen. Ted Cruz took his campaign to New York's Bronx borough.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - NASA Astronauts Answer The Web’s Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: NASA astronauts Tim Kopra and Jeff Williams and European Space Agency astronaut Tim Peake are currently living on board the International Space station and answer the internet’s most searched questions in the latest installment of WIRED’s Autocomplete Interview.

video:video.video:title: Forget Apple vs. the FBI: WhatsApp Just Switched on Encryption for a Billion People
video:video.video:description: WhatsApp just made the scope of the Apple-FBI encryption battle look kinda small. WIRED's senior staff writer, Cade Metz, breaks down exactly why this is a big deal.

video:video.video:title: Watch This Timelapse Video of Us Setting Up an HTC Vive
video:video.video:description: The HTC Vive system is meant to deliver what HTC and Valve call “room-size experiences”— that means you’ll need an entire room, and a chunk of time, to get your VR playpen set up.

video:video.video:title: An Inhabitable 'Bouncy Castle' is Headed Into Space
video:video.video:description: On April 8, SpaceX will launch an inflatable, inhabitable bouncy castle to the International Space Station and it may be the start of the first hotel chain in Space.

video:video.video:title: 3D-Printed Egg Could Help Save Endangered Birds
video:video.video:description: Researchers have packed a 3D-printed egg with sensors to gather data about bird incubation so they can better raise endangered chicks.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Autocomplete Interviews - Melissa McCarthy & Kristen Bell Answer The Web’s Most Searched Questions
video:video.video:description: At The Boss junket, Melissa McCarthy and Kristen Bell answer a Google Autocomplete interview together.

video:video.video:title: Meet the Model 3, Tesla's Most Important Car
video:video.video:description: The $35,000 TESLA Model 3 is finally here. It is sleek, quick, more affordable and it's the most important car that Tesla has built.

video:video.video:title: App Pack | 5 DIY Apps for Mastering Your Weekend Projects
video:video.video:description: Doing some home improvement, but you're hoping to avoid a trip to urgent care? These apps will help you with those DIY projects.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures | The Fennec Fox and Its Giant Ears Are Too Cute to Possibly Exist
video:video.video:description: The Fennec fox is the smallest, and arguably the cutest, fox on earth. Its enormous ears make it look like a cartoon character and help it hear prey and keep cool.

video:video.video:title: The iPad Pro: Apple’s Most Powerful Tablet in a Smaller Body
video:video.video:description: Apple wants you to replace your old iPad, and your old laptop, with a new iPad Pro. With a keyboard case, the new Pencil, and all the features from Apple’s largest tablet, could the 9.7-inch Pro be your next computer?

video:video.video:title: Review: Apple’s iPhone SE Is a Small Victory
video:video.video:description: Not everyone loves big phones. In fact Apple sold 30 million 4-inch iPhones in 2015. Now you can buy that small phone without having to sacrifice on performance. The iPhoneSE is small, much more affordable and packed with power.

video:video.video:title: Out of Office with Brent Rose - Is Vaping Really Healthier than Smoking?
video:video.video:description: Vaping is smoking's hottest new trend--just ask Leonardo DiCarpio who was caught puffing on one at the Golden Globes. The industry claims this is a safe alternative to cigarettes, but how much do we really know about the health effects of vaping? From The Vape Shop to USC's Health and Science campus, Brent Rose explores this new trend and searches for answers.

video:video.video:title: Everything You Missed at Silicon Valley Comic Con
video:video.video:description: For the first time ever Silicon Valley hosted its very own Comic Con. It didn't quite measure up to the San Diego incarnation that dominates entertainment headlines every year, but it shows promise.

video:video.video:title: Oculus Rift Review: The Age of VR Has Begun
video:video.video:description: Three years after that first devkit came out it’s showing up at people’s houses starting now. The Oculus Rift proves that this is not a phase. This is the first real step into the world of VR.

video:video.video:title: How Oculus Cracked the Impossible Design of VR
video:video.video:description: The Oculus Rift is now shipping. Four years of intense work led to this moment. WIRED got to look at some of the early prototypes that would have never made it to market.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures | The Pygmy Seahorse Is Pretty Much the Where’s Waldo of the Sea
video:video.video:description: The pygmy seahorse is cute, that much is clear. It’s got amazing camo. Also clear. But the big mystery: How on Earth it changes to so perfectly match its surroundings.

video:video.video:title: App Pack | These Apps Offer Relief During Tax Season
video:video.video:description: Tax season really snuck up on you again, didn't it? You still have until Monday, April 18 to file and pay your taxes, and while that's plenty of time to get all your paperwork in order, you might need a little help with these apps.

video:video.video:title: Some Fish Swim. Weirder Fish Hop. This Fish ​Waddles
video:video.video:description: This cave fish climbs waterfalls—that’s right, it actually walks. It moves one fin in front of the other like an awkward lizard. And that movement could teach us a lot about how our fishy ancestors learned to walk.

video:video.video:title: Silicon Valley Mourns Andy Grove, a Titan of Tech
video:video.video:description: Grove is routinely mentioned as part of the same pantheon that includes Bill Gates, Larry Ellison, and Steve Jobs. And with good reason.

video:video.video:title: 'Silicon Valley' Cast Explains What Real Startups Do (NSFW)
video:video.video:description: Mozido? Nutanix? We gave the Silicon Valley cast the names of real startups and asked them to guess what they do. This is NSFW, so put those headphones on.

video:video.video:title: Why You Should Upgrade to iOS 9.3
video:video.video:description: Beyond fixing flaws, the new iOS 9.3 has some neat features you’ll want to get your paws on ASAP.

video:video.video:title: Apple's iPad Pro May Be Smaller, But It's Packed With Power
video:video.video:description: "Big things getting smaller" was the overarching theme for Apple's latest announcements. The company just launched a 9.7-inch version of the iPad Pro.

video:video.video:title: Up Close and Personal With the New Little iPhone SE
video:video.video:description: The cute little iPhone SE offers the components of the bigger iPhone 6S with a 4-inch screen and a form factor in line with the iPhone 5s.

video:video.video:title: Here's Everything Apple Announced
video:video.video:description: One of Apple's shortest events was all about the small things. Here is everything you need to know about what went down in Cupertino.

video:video.video:title: Just How Rip-Proof Is the New Herschel Bag?
video:video.video:description: Herschel makes cool backpacks and now the company has a new line of bags that they say is rip-proof. How rip-proof? We put it through a battery of tests.

video:video.video:title: Jeff Nichols: The Evolution of a Film Career
video:video.video:description: Writer and director Jeff Nichols takes us through his three previous films and his upcoming film Midnight Special.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures | A Bird Impaling Its Victims Is So Metal I Can't Even Stand It
video:video.video:description: The shrike may look like a songbird but the only tunes it knows are METAL! The cute little bird kills its prey then impales them on spikes.

video:video.video:title: Buckle Up, Space Fans: A New Batch of Pluto Science Is Here
video:video.video:description: Scientists are making even more startling findings from Pluto and its largest moon, Charon.

video:video.video:title: WIRED by Design - Writer and Director Jeff Nichols on Finding a Point of View
video:video.video:description: Jeff Nichols at WIRED by Design, 2014. In partnership with Skywalker Sound, Marin County, CA. To learn more visit: live.wired.com

video:video.video:title: Everything We’re Pretty Sure Has Happened in Divergent So Far
video:video.video:description: Not only have we never seen the Divergent movies, but no one we know has, either. (Seriously—we asked everyone!) So instead, we watched all the trailers we could, and made our best guesses as to what actually happens in these things.

video:video.video:title: Inside the Factory Where Acura Builds the NSX Supercar
video:video.video:description: Acura's NSX hybrid supercar is capable of a blistering 191 mph but to make a car this fast, you have to build it slowly and precisely.

video:video.video:title: Award-Winning Chef Takes on NASA Space Food
video:video.video:description: We brought a renowned Houston chef to NASA's Food Lab so he could try and provide a fine dining experience using only space food.

video:video.video:title: Data Attack - Are You Addicted To Your Phone?
video:video.video:description: On a typical day, the average person checks their phone 85 times. In total, we spend about 5 hours on our phones each day. Here we explore the fine line between normal phone use and device addiction.

video:video.video:title: App Pack | All You Need for a Festive St. Patrick's Day
video:video.video:description: St. Paddy’s Day gives anyone a great excuse to wear green and go drink beer. These apps are just the thing you need to celebrate the foremost patron saint of Ireland.

video:video.video:title: Game of Clouds: Dropbox Declares Independence From Amazon
video:video.video:description: Half-a-billion people store their files on Dropbox. But until recently, those were sitting in Amazon's cloud. Now Dropbox has cut out the middleman and built its own super servers, challenging the internet’s biggest cloud computing companies.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Lab - Top Gun for Astronauts: The Legendary T-38 Jet
video:video.video:description: Two NASA astronauts take us on a tour of the T-38 plane, which can fly faster than the speed of sound and has been used to train astronauts since 1961.

video:video.video:title: "Batman v Superman": The… Rom-Com?
video:video.video:description: We’re not the first people consider a Clark Kent-Bruce Wayne romance, but since we also have a crack video team, we decided to tweak the “Batman v Superman” trailer to see what a rom-com between the two would look like. Behold: “Batman Meets Superman: Dawn of Just Us”!

video:video.video:title: Out of Office with Brent Rose - Riding the New Hendo Hoverboard 2.0 Is Like Levitating the Gnar
video:video.video:description: In 2014, startup Arx Pax made headlines with the Hendo Hoverboard. With some helpful input from Tony Hawk and others, now we have the Hendo Hoverboard 2.0, and Brent Rose just scored the first ride on it.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Movie Review | 10 Cloverfield Lane
video:video.video:description: Like "Cloverfield", the plot of "10 Cloverfield Lane" was very guarded. We won’t spoil anything, but we will tell you that it’s exhilarating—and very fun.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures | The Tarsier Leaps Like a Superhero, Looks Like Yoda
video:video.video:description: Meet the tarsier, the wide-eyed staring contest champ of the animal world. Its eyes have evolved to be so enormous, it can’t even move them in its head. Which means you can say whatever you want to a tarsier and it can’t roll its eyes at you.

video:video.video:title: Don’t Freak Out Over Google’s AI Beating a Go Grandmaster. It’s a Good Thing
video:video.video:description: The match between Google's AlphaGo and a top ranked human player is a way of judging the suddenly rapid progress of artificial intelligence that may show how far these technologies have come—and how far they may go.

video:video.video:title: Captain America: Civil War
video:video.video:description: Captain America: Civil War trailer

video:video.video:title: Tesla's Summon Feature Is Like Knight Rider. Kinda
video:video.video:description: Summon is fundamental to Tesla's goal of making driverless cars—and it won't stay a party trick forever.

video:video.video:title: App Pack | Don’t You Dare Vacation Without These Must-Have Apps
video:video.video:description: Got a vacation coming up this spring? WIRED has all the best apps you'll need for a fuss-free trip.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - The Special Effects Behind Zero Matter in "Agent Carter"
video:video.video:description: We go behind the scenes to show you how visual effects company Double Negative created the dark energy Zero Matter in ABC's "Agent Carter."

video:video.video:title: Everything We Know About MH370 in 170 Seconds
video:video.video:description: Two years ago, Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 disappeared somewhere over the Indian Ocean with 239 people on board. What then grew into humanity's largest, most expensive search operation has also been among its most frustrating and beguiling.

video:video.video:title: Out of Office with Brent Rose - Watch Brent Rose Epically Fail NASA’s Astronaut Test
video:video.video:description: In light of the current open application for new astronauts, Brent Rose heads out to the Johnson Space Center in Houston, Texas, to meet with real astronauts and try out real training facilities–let's see if he has what it takes to make it to space.

video:video.video:title: Wired Movie Review | Whiskey Tango Foxtrot
video:video.video:description: It might seem like a blunder to try to wring comedy out of a very serious conflict, but in Tina Fey's new movie, Whiskey Tango Foxtrot, she walks the line between humor and heart expertly. The film isn’t the whole picture of the war in Afghanistan, but what it does show, it shows in very sharp focus.

video:video.video:title: Behind the Scenes: MythBusters' Final Stunt Plows Through 14 Years of Epic Science
video:video.video:description: A look behind the scenes of the final stunt of the final Mythbusters show. Thanks for all the cool science nerdery, guys!

video:video.video:title: NASA Wants to Make a Supersonic Jet With No Boom
video:video.video:description: The Concorde jet could go Mach 2 but it was so loud that it was banned from flying over land. Now NASA engineers think they have a design that could muffle the boom and might usher in the two-and-half hour New York to LA flight.

video:video.video:title: Boeing's Self-Cleaning Bathroom Would Nuke Germs with UV Rays
video:video.video:description: The plane maker has a prototype bathroom that uses ultraviolet light to zap 99.99 percent of germs in just three seconds.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures | Good Luck Going in the Ocean Ever Again
video:video.video:description: There's a terrifying hunter lurking on the bottom of tropical seas. It's called the bobbit worm, and it can destroy.

video:video.video:title: The On-the-Job Film-Schooling of Jeff Nichols
video:video.video:description: For each of his films, Jeff Nichols gives himself a set of directorial challenges that he wants to master. He's learning the skills that he'll need to someday make a gazillion-dollar blockbuster.

video:video.video:title: 5-Year-Olds Ask an Astronaut What It’s Like to Be in Outer Space
video:video.video:description: Why don’t space shuttles float away? How do you know when to go to sleep? Astronaut Kjell Lindgren answers questions about life in space from a few intrepid kindergartners.

video:video.video:title: Welcome to the Robot Hotel - Please See the Velociraptor for Check-In
video:video.video:description: Tired of having to talk to hotel staff? Welcome to the automated future at Japan's robot hotel.

video:video.video:title: Angela Bassett Answers Your Pressing Google Questions About Angela Bassett
video:video.video:description: “London Has Fallen” actress Angela Bassett is still alive, thank you very much. The Oscar-nominated actress answers the most googled questions about herself, including whether she’s a vegan and if she starred in Michael Jackson’s “Thriller” music video—(hint: No.)

video:video.video:title: The Avegant Glyph is a Movie Theater on Your Face
video:video.video:description: Avegant's Glyph is a personal movie theater, a screen only you can say that you can use to watch movies, play video games, and anything else you want. Just don't expect people not to stare.

video:video.video:title: Gerard Butler Answers Everything You’ve Ever Wondered About Gerard Butler
video:video.video:description: No, he’s not Irish. Yes, he’s still alive. And no, he’s not engaged. “London Has Fallen” star Gerard Butler answers questions to the most common searches about him on the Internet.

video:video.video:title: Behind the Scenes of ‘My Mother’s Wing’
video:video.video:description: Go behind the scenes of the virtual reality film “My Mother’s Wing” with United Nations senior advisor and filmmaker Gabo Arora and his crew.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Lab - Why the Human Body Isn’t Ready to go to Mars…Yet
video:video.video:description: Technologically we may be close to sending astronauts to Mars, but is the human body ready for it? Dr. Camille Alleyne from the International Space Station Program describes how the six to eight month trip to Mars could cause vision impairment, muscle atrophy, and bone density loss, and she explains how scientists plan to counteract those issues.

video:video.video:title: How to Keep Your iPhone’s Security Countermeasure From Obliterating Your Data
video:video.video:description: One of the iPhone’s hallmark security features could leave you locked out if you forget your password too many times. Here’s how to keep your data saved, in case you can't always trust your short-term memory.

video:video.video:title: Message in a Bottle
video:video.video:description: What if you could raise awareness of the oceans’ trash problem by throwing a message in a bottle into the sea? That’s one artist’s mission.

video:video.video:title: Wow! Haha! Angry! Facebook Finally Has Emoji Reactions
video:video.video:description: Facebook just expanded the “Like” button with a feature it calls Reactions---six animated emoji the company hopes will let users to respond with more emotional nuance to the posts in their news feeds.

video:video.video:title: Forget Filters - 19th Century Tintype Photography Still Rules
video:video.video:description: Filters are fun and yes, quick. But as an Oakland tintype portrait photographer proves filters can't come close to the original craft developed in the mid 1800's. It'll cost you around $60 to get your portrait done, that's a bit more than a filter pack, but so worth it.

video:video.video:title: Virgin Galactic's New SpaceShipTwo Puts it Back in the Space Race
video:video.video:description: Virgin Galactic unveiled its new SpaceShipTwo shuttle designed to more safely bring tourists on sub-orbital space flights.

video:video.video:title: Inside the LSD Museum That the DEA Somehow Hasn’t Nuked
video:video.video:description: Welcome to the Institute of Illegal Images, San Francisco's museum of LSD blotter paper art.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - It Took 5 Actors to Create "Deadpool's" Colossus
video:video.video:description: And one was nearly 7 feet tall.

video:video.video:title: The Witch Trailer
video:video.video:description: The Witch follows a Puritan family in 17th century New England as they try to build a life on the edge of a forest believed to be occupied by—yes‐witches.

video:video.video:title: This Room-Size VR Game Makes You Into an Actual Action Hero
video:video.video:description: Thanks to "room-scale" VR, full-body gaming is coming. WIRED's Peter Rubin tries out "Raw Data," a first-person shooter that turns players into jumping, shooting, crouching, katana-slicing action heroes. Your living room will never be the same again.

video:video.video:title: Data Attack - Do You Have a Normal Sex Life?
video:video.video:description: The average person will kiss 21.5 people in their lifetime. And while guys lose their virginities at 16.8 years old, women will hold out a little longer until 17.2 years old. Find out how you stack up between the sheets as we run through the stats of an average sex life, as told with sex dolls.

video:video.video:title: Space Is Hard | There Is No GPS in Space
video:video.video:description: There is no mapping app for deep space, at least not yet. If we're going to explore there we'll need new navigation tools. Here's how NASA is going to keep its rockets on target.

video:video.video:title: Space Is Hard | How NASA Will Science Its Food and Drink for Interplanetary Travel
video:video.video:description: Growing food in space is hard. Keeping a limited supply of water clean and drinkable is no easy task either. Here's how NASA is going to science meals for interplanetary travel.

video:video.video:title: Space Is Hard | The Gear of Exoplanet Exploration
video:video.video:description: When humans touch down on an exoplanet they'll need some new tools—like NASA's prototype mining robot and the Z-2 suit made for Martian hiking trips.

video:video.video:title: How to be the Fastest Man on the Planet: Jesse Owens & “Race”
video:video.video:description: Stephan James, star of the new Jesse Owens biopic “Race,” explains how he prepared to star as the once-fastest man on the planet. Co-star Jason Sudeikis and Owens two daughters also talk about the superstar athlete who broke numerous records and won four gold medals at the controversial 1936 Berlin Olympics.

video:video.video:title: Star Wars Announces Episode VIII in Production
video:video.video:description: Star Wars Announces Episode VIII

video:video.video:title: App Pack | The Best Mobile Apps for Skiing and Snowboarding
video:video.video:description: Hit the slopes with these apps that give you snow forecasts, buddy tracking, and resort maps all at your fingertips.

video:video.video:title: Detection of Gravitational Waves Opens a New Window on the Universe
video:video.video:description: For the first time, scientists have confirmed detection of gravitational waves. The finding not only validates Einstein's theory of relativity but also opens a new window on our knowledge of the universe.

video:video.video:title: Breaking Through - Why a 30-Second, $5 Million Super Bowl Ad Isn’t Enough
video:video.video:description: It was the biggest ad day of the year, but if you thought your company’s 30-second Super Bowl spot was enough, you’re wrong. Digital marketers behind top advertising agency Droga5 explain how a Super Bowl ad is only step one when it comes to today’s 360-degree, digitally innovative marketing campaigns.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - How Designers Created a Nazi-Run World in “The Man in the High Castle”
video:video.video:description: Amazon Studios’ “The Man in the High Castle” take places in an alternate history, set in a post-WWII world where the Axis powers ended up victorious. To create the look of a United States run by Imperial Japan and Nazi Germany, Zoic Studios was tasked with creating difficult visual effects and environment work. Find out how they did it.

video:video.video:title: Bentley Gives the World Its First Ultra-Luxury SUV
video:video.video:description: The Bentley Bentayga sets a new standard of opulence for millionaires and billionaires who demand gobs of power, acres of leather, and the ability to tower over plebeians while fording rivers or scaling dunes.

video:video.video:title: Ted Cruz Says Donald Trump Is Just a Sore Loser
video:video.video:description: About what you said last night ...

video:video.video:title: This is What It’s Like to Race a Drone at Full-Throttle
video:video.video:description: If you’re not crashing, you’re not flying. At least that’s the idea behind the Drone Racing League—a relatively new organization where drone pilots compete by racing high-performance aircrafts through tight and intricate courses. Find out what it’s like to fly one of the technically advanced drones from the pilots who are paving the way.

video:video.video:title: The Super Bowl 2016 Ads Were All About Your Small Screen
video:video.video:description: The Super Bowl is as much about the commercials as it is the football, but this year the ads weren't made for your big TV.

video:video.video:title: This Robo-Roach Might Someday Save Lives
video:video.video:description: Researchers at UC Berkeley have developed a robotic cockroach capable of squeezing through tight spaces. Someday swarms of robo-roaches could be sent into disaster areas like earthquake rubble to search for survivors.

video:video.video:title: App Pack | Apps To Help You Survive and Conquer Valentine's Day
video:video.video:description: Whether you're celebrating Valentine's Day with a long-term partner or just trying to spare your single self a little heartache, there's an app to go along with your plans.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Lab - Meet the NASA Scientist Who Tracks Dangerous Asteroids in Earth’s Orbit
video:video.video:description: As a physicist at NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory, Marina Brozovic studies and measures near-earth asteroids—you know, the ones that can potentially cause catastrophic damage. Watch as Brozovic explains how her team tracks the orbit of these large masses and how NASA would prepare if one were to come barreling towards earth.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Lab - This Asteroid Could’ve Caused an Apocalypse—Now It’s Barely Missing Earth
video:video.video:description: In 2004 scientists discovered a large, near-earth asteroid named Apophis. Initially, it was predicted to impact the earth in 2029, leading to global devastation. Thankfully, it’s now expected to miss. Physicist Marina Brozovic from NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory explains how her team used measurements and statistics to track the potentially catastrophic mass.

video:video.video:title: How to Dismantle a Bridge
video:video.video:description: The Bay Bridge, which links San Francisco and Oakland, is being methodically dismantled, piece by incredibly heavy piece. Here's how 2,500 ton truss supports will be removed.

video:video.video:title: Smart Rings to Rule Them All
video:video.video:description: Until truly great natural-recognition gesture tech catches on and we get RFID chips embedded in our forearms, smart rings could be the closest thing to truly seamless wearable technology.

video:video.video:title: Hacker Lexicon: A Guide to Ransomware, the Scary Hack That’s on the Rise
video:video.video:description: Ransomware is a rising type of malware that locks your keyboard or computer until you pay a ransom, typically in Bitcoin. Find out how the sophisticated hacks happen and learn what you can do to avoid falling victim to them.

video:video.video:title: How To Beat San Francisco's Super Bowl Traffic
video:video.video:description: Car-free urban areas are all the rage. Now San Francisco has one, at least temporarily, thanks to the Super Bowl. WIRED transportation editor Alex Davies looks at the best way to move in a city already snarled with traffic.

video:video.video:title: 3 Valentine’s Day Gifts for the Tech Guy in Your Life | Sponsored Content
video:video.video:description:
Still stumped on what to get your guy for Valentine’s Day? Check out three techie-approved gifts, perfect for any guy on your list.
Brought to you by eBay

video:video.video:title: The Ultimate Valentine’s Day Gift Guide for Women | Sponsored Content
video:video.video:description:
Valentine’s Day is just around the corner. Blogger Christen Rochon breaks down her top three picks for the lucky lady in your life.
Brought to you by eBay

video:video.video:title: App Pack | The Best Mobile Apps for Watching the Super Bowl
video:video.video:description: Load up your phone with some crucial apps that'll help you better enjoy the biggest game of the year.

video:video.video:title: An AR Rock Climbing Game
video:video.video:description: Jon Cheng and the Brooklyn Boulder Gym are working together on a real life video game for rock climbers.

video:video.video:title: Talking Pictures | The Blue Lava of Indonesia
video:video.video:description: Photographer and filmmaker Reuben Wu narrates a selection of his images documenting the amazing blue 'lava" that flows across the sulfurous landscape of Kawah Ijen Crater on Java, Indonesia.

video:video.video:title: Victor Krummenacher Performs "If You Don't Break My Heart, I Don't Stand A Chance"
video:video.video:description: Victor Krummenacher, co-founder and bassist in legendary California rock band Camper Van Beethoven and WIRED managing art director, performs "If You Don't Break My Heart, I Don't Stand A Chance" at WIRED's San Francisco offices.

video:video.video:title: SB 100 - Imagining Football's Future Through The Super Bowl Of 2066
video:video.video:description: As Super Bowl 100 played out in all its enormity last night, Super Bowl 50 looked tiny by comparison, the way the Earth now looks to our colonists in space. And yet it’s instructive to look back on that long-ago spectacle in the San Francisco Bay Area to see just how far the game has come, and society with it.

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Stormtrooper Breakdance
video:video.video:description: Star Wars and hip hop together as they were meant to be. WIRED's Eric Steuer demonstrates how to get original trilogy action figures doing sick headspins.

video:video.video:title: The Electric UScooter Is as Cool as a Push Scooter Can Be
video:video.video:description: Slice through traffic jams aboard the $999 electric UScooter, which cruises at 18 miles per hour, folds for quick storage on a bus, train or under the desk. Yeah, it's a kick scooter but it's the coolest kick scooter on the road.

video:video.video:title: Nice Storm: The Blizzard of 2016 Is a Scientific Classic
video:video.video:description: Winter Storm Jonas is hitting the East Coast hard. Yeah, you’ve heard this before and been burned, but too many forecasts are aligning for this one to be a fluke.

video:video.video:title: The Return of The X-Files
video:video.video:description: More than 20 years after it first made us believers, The X-Files is back—and it's convinced the truth is still out there.

video:video.video:title: Absurd Creatures | The Voracious Fish That Looks Like a Pug and Stings Like a Bee
video:video.video:description: The stargazer spends its entire life looking like it just walked in on something...unseemly. The fish, which ambushes prey from the sea floor, also sports venomous spines and an electric shock.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - Inside the Incredible Visual Effects of “Star Wars: The Force Awakens"
video:video.video:description: Mike Seymour goes behind the visual effects that earned “Star Wars: The Force Awakens” an Oscar nod. See how Industrial Light & Magic crafted complex action sequences, detailed environments, and realistic characters with the help of advanced motion-capture technology and performances from actors like Lupita Nyong’o.

video:video.video:title: SB 100 - Coming Soon for Artificial Intelligence? Coaching Football
video:video.video:description: The application of artificial intelligence to play-calling is already upon us. Last spring, two students at North Carolina State built a model to predict whether an NFL team would pass or run, information that would hugely benefit defensive coordinators.

video:video.video:title: SB 100 - Football Strategy's Radical, Tech-Fueled Revolution Has Begun
video:video.video:description: All those pretty plays designed by Vince Lombardi, Bill Walsh and Bill Belichick, and executed to perfection by Bart Starr, Joe Montana and Tom Brady will, in the future, be digitized and optimized into an ideal gameplan.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Lab - How Realistic Are the Sci-Fi Planets in “Star Wars”?
video:video.video:description: At NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory visualization specialist Robert Hurt breaks down the plausibility of sci-fi planets and galaxies in “Star Wars,” “Star Trek,” and “Alien."

video:video.video:title: WIRED Lab - The NASA Illustrator Who Hides Sci-Fi Easter Eggs in Official Images of Space
video:video.video:description: Visualization specialist at NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory, Robert Hurt, tells us how he balances scientific accuracy and creativity when creating stunning pieces of art that double as realistic depictions of space.

video:video.video:title: King Tides Show Us How Climate Change Will Threaten Coastal Cities
video:video.video:description: Seawall-topping king tides occur when extra-high tides line up with other meteorological anomalies. In the past they were a novelty or a nuisance. Now they hint at the new normal, when sea level rise will render current coastlines obsolete.

video:video.video:title: The Super-Durable and Super-Versatile Tarp
video:video.video:description: WIRED design editor Robbie Gonzales checks out the engineering and many uses of incredibly durable and versatile tarps built for relief agencies.

video:video.video:title: The Coolest Cars from the Detroit Auto Show
video:video.video:description: These are some of coolest cars at the 2016 Detroit Auto Show. The affordable electric Chevy Bolt, Nissan's super-burly Titan Warrior truck, and Chrysler's actually cool hybrid minivan.

video:video.video:title: A Tech-Lover’s Travel Guide | Good As Gold Presented By American Express
