video:video.video:description: People are freaking out about powdered alcohol, but I wasn’t convinced they understood the science behind it. So I tested their concerns. Will it get you crazy drunk? Will people snort it? Watch & see! -Brent

video:video.video:title: Gadget Lab - Digital Amps to Revive Analog Audio Gear
video:video.video:description: Have some old speakers or an unconnected stereo? The Gramofon and the Griffin Twenty make streaming audio a breeze, even if your gear dates to the days of disco.

video:video.video:title: Can You Hate an Actor, But Love Their Work?
video:video.video:description: HATE’S A STRONG word, obviously, but the question still stands. On this week’s episode, WIRED senior editor Peter Rubin and his wife Kelli jump into it. Well, she jumps into it; with Wayward Pines‘ premiere last night, she was reminded all over again that she has a serious problem with Terrence Howard, and she’s inclined to pass on his projects.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Business Conference - Instagram Wants to Make It Easier for You to Find What You Want
video:video.video:description: Instagram wants to make it easier for users to find what they want. Mike Krieger acknowledged that the discovery opportunities for finding new stuff on Instagram is still somewhat limited, but they're developing their search functionality (and explore tab) with Facebook to help users.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Business Conference - Why drones will be much safer than you think
video:video.video:description: At the 2015 Wired Business conference, WIRED Business editor Cade Metz interviews Helen Greiner, the CEO of drone maker CyPhy Works about the future of drones and how they may make the world a safer place.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Business Conference - The Best Pieces of Fan Art Dedicated to Breakout Wattpad Writer Anna Todd
video:video.video:description: At the 2015 Wired Business conference, WIRED editor-at-large Jason Tanz interviews breakout fanfic author Anna Todd, who writes novels entirely on her smartphone then uploads them to Wattpad, a wildly popular digital publishing platform and writers community.

video:video.video:title: 3-D Mapping The World's Coral -- to Save It
video:video.video:description:
Coral reefs are under threat, but measuring the loss has been difficult. To get a better and faster picture of coral health, researchers developed a new incredibly accurate 3D mapping system.
Music - "I Still Really Love You" By Abjo (http://abjo.bandcamp.com/)

video:video.video:title: Unnecessarily Rushed Explanations - Best Music Game of All Time: Elite Beat Agents
video:video.video:description: Elite Beat Agents is based off a Japanese video game for Nintendo DS. But instead of male cheerleaders and Japanese pop songs, the U.S. version relies on “Men In Black”-like agents and good ol’ fashioned American hits from the Jackson 5 and Madonna. Chris Kohler explains why the stateside edition is the best music game of all time.

video:video.video:title: Amy Schumer’s feminist comedy. Going too far or far enough?
video:video.video:description: Wired Senior Editor Peter Rubin and his wife Kelli love TV, movies, and games but don’t always see eye to eye. They both think Amy Schumer’s feminist comedy is bold and important but Peter wants to see her push the envelope even further.

video:video.video:title: Talking Pictures: Skyglow
video:video.video:description: Filmmakers Harun Mehmedinovic and Gavin Heffernan discuss how their quest for dark night skies for time-lapses led to a project imagining what bright cities like Los Angeles could be with visible stars.

video:video.video:title: Out of Office with Brent Rose - Tesla’s Powerwall Home Battery: The Stuff Worth Knowing
video:video.video:description: Elon Musk recently unveiled Tesla Energy and the Powerwall home battery. I'll attempt to cut through the hype and break down the basics. NOTE: One of the most important things we neglected to mention in the video is that a big part of the appeal for this system is not economical, but environmental. It may not be easier on the wallet (at least not yet) but you're powering your home with green energy instead of fossil fuels, and there's a lot to be said for that. -Brent

video:video.video:title: Unnecessarily Rushed Explanations - The Most Important Video Game of All Time: Super Mario Bros.
video:video.video:description: WIRED editor Chris Kohler explains why Super Mario Bros. is the most important video game in history. From rich graphics to expertly composed music to innovative game design, Super Mario Bros. set the standard for what makes a great video game.

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - Giant Star Wars LEGO Super Star Destroyer Shattered
video:video.video:description: What better way to celebrate the upcoming Star Wars Day than by watching a Super Star Destroyer shatter in slow-motion?

video:video.video:title: Design FX - Avengers: Age of Ultron
video:video.video:description: The Avengers return in Age of Ultron. Mike Seymour sat down with the men behind the special effects.

video:video.video:title: Mortal Kombat X
video:video.video:description: Peter and Kelli Rubin love TV, movies, and games but don’t always see eye to eye. Peter and Kelli dig into why they’re drawn to favorite characters in games like Mortal Kombat, which has been thrilling players with grisly fatality wins for more than two decades.

video:video.video:title: White House CTO Megan Smith on the Value of Tech Diversity
video:video.video:description: Jessi Hempel interviews Megan Smith, Chief Technology Officer of the United States, about the historic role women have played as coders, her personal history, and goal for her time in Washington.

video:video.video:title: Nerf's new challenge
video:video.video:description: Nerf is aiming its new shooters at girls. But do kids care about the marketing?

video:video.video:title: Exoskeletons Will Make Work Weightless
video:video.video:description: Ekso Bionics, known for its powered therapeutic exoskeletons, is getting into the construction business with a new exoskeleton suit that makes hefting heavy tools a breeze. WIRED's Adam Rogers suits up for a test drive.

video:video.video:title: Data Attack - The Female Orgasm, Explained with Science Projects
video:video.video:description: The male orgasm is an explosive affair, but the female orgasm? Now, that’s a different story. Find out what’s really going down when a woman gets off.

video:video.video:title: Comedians Go to Virtual Therapy
video:video.video:description: Ellie is the world’s first virtual therapist. Designed to read and analyze body language, vocal patterns, and facial expressions, we introduced her to a few comedians to see if she could handle their sarcasm, jokes, and self-deprecating humor.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - The Avengers Get Voice Acting Wrong
video:video.video:description: Computer-generated characters are looking better every year, but there’s one thing that’s not up to technological snuff: the voices. The new Avengers film is no exception—Angry Nerd explains the problem with having Ultron sound exactly like James Spader instead of an evil robot.

video:video.video:title: The Last Man on Earth is No Hero
video:video.video:description: The Last Man on Earth wraps up its first season on Sunday, and even though Peter and Kelli watched it together, they had completely different experiences.

video:video.video:title: Take Better Smartphone Photos
video:video.video:description: Learn how to use light and position your subjects for stunning smartphone images. Retouch your photos with VSCO Cam, one of the best free photo editing apps.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - HBO: Ignore the Game of Thrones Books
video:video.video:description: Some people are worried that the new season of Game of Thrones will deviate too much from the books. Angry Nerd is worried that it won’t stray far enough. He explains why the brutal plot trims are needed when it comes to the show.

video:video.video:title: "Planetary" Exclusive Clip
video:video.video:description: In this exclusive clip from the new documentary "Planetary," we learn how space travel has affected human beings on a greater scale, allowing us to view the world in which we live, with a completely new perspective.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Issue Preview May 2015 – Unsung Geniuses
video:video.video:description: The Next List. You don’t know them, but you know their work. WIRED presents the unsung geniuses who are shaping the future of business. Also this month: What it takes to create the most nonstop-action-packed movie ever, how Apple created a watch to finally free us from our phones, Ross Ulbricht’s journey from libertarian idealist to savage kingpin and more.

video:video.video:title: First Look: The New PAX Juul E-Cigarette
video:video.video:description: The Juul from PAX might be the slickest e-cig ever with its pocketable design, squared edges, and tiny magnetic USB charging dock. But it might look a bit too much like a puffable memory stick for its own Good.

video:video.video:title: Cardistry: The Juggling of Playing Cards
video:video.video:description: Inside the mesmerizing world of cardistry, the new performance art of manipulating playing cards.

video:video.video:title: Data Attack - The Future of Legal Marijuana Explained with Marijuana
video:video.video:description: Twenty-three states have decriminalized marijuana to some degree. And with privateer holdings investing nearly $82 million in weed startups, the industry is poised to pull in a lucrative—and legal—profit.

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - 36 Tech Gadgets, 2 Days, Total Destruction
video:video.video:description: Go behind the scenes to see how Justin and Erik used nine cameras to film 36 gadgets over two days for season two’s total destruction.

video:video.video:title: Split Screen - Silicon Valley's Gender Gap
video:video.video:description: Peter and Kelli Rubin love TV, movies, and games but don’t always see eye to eye—and the return of Mike Judge's HBO satire is no exception.

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - Oculus Rift vs Samsung Gear VR vs Virtual Boy
video:video.video:description: Some virtual reality headsets are better than others. But which one is actually the toughest? Find out as we give the Oculus Rift DK2, Samsung Gear VR, and Nintendo Virtual Boy a dose of real-world damage.

video:video.video:title: Data Attack - How Tech Companies Avoid Taxes Explained with Magic
video:video.video:description: Publicly traded U.S. tech companies have stashed as much as $530 billion in offshore tax havens. How’d they do it? Find out what magic tricks companies like Google, Apple, and Microsoft have up their sleeves.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Clicking Dislike on the Cyber-Horror Film "Unfriended"
video:video.video:description: The new horror movie “Unfriended” uses a screen-capture format to shape the film’s narrative. But guess what? Using Facebook messages, Skype calls, and Gchats to tell a story isn’t innovative, it’s LAZY! Angry Nerd explains why the cyber-horror flick deserves an IRL “dislike."

video:video.video:title: Split Screen: The Return of Mad Men
video:video.video:description: Peter and Kelli Rubin love TV, movies, and games but don’t always see eye to eye. For Kelli, who worked in advertising, the return of Mad Men is personal. For Peter, it might be the season of Don’s descent.

video:video.video:title: Gadget Lab - Apple’s New MacBook Hands On Review
video:video.video:description: Despite an underpowered processor and only one port, it may herald the future of notebooks.

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - Smash Testing a GoPro
video:video.video:description: Action cams can handle a lot—or so they say. See which camera comes out on top when we put the GoPro Hero4 Silver, Sony HDRAS20/B, and Contour Roam3 up against one another.

video:video.video:title: Unnecessarily Rushed Explanations - The Funniest Video Game of All Time
video:video.video:description: WIRED editor Chris Kohler breaks down why Sam & Max Hit the Road is the funniest video game of all time. What’s not to love about a duo of anthropomorphic “freelance police”?

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Will Netflix’s Daredevil Fly or Flop?
video:video.video:description: If Netflix’s new Daredevil series is anything like Ben Affleck’s Daredevil film, we’re all in trouble. Angry Nerd explains what the latest incarnation needs to get right to make sure the man without fear doesn’t turn into a total flop.

video:video.video:title: The Science of Beautiful Easter Egg Color
video:video.video:description: There’s a lot of science at work in Easter egg coloring. The dye needs an acid, usually vinegar, to bond with the egg’s shell. WIRED experiments to find the perfect Ph for egg color that pops.

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - Easter Candy Destroyed in Slow Mo
video:video.video:description: What better way to celebrate Easter than by destroying a basket of candy, painted eggs, and a giant chocolate bunny? Experience the holiday the Battle Damage way.

video:video.video:title: Steinway Spirio
video:video.video:description: Watch Steinway's first autonomous piano in action.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - 100th Episode Spectacular!
video:video.video:description: Angry Nerd is celebrating 100 episodes of his infamous rants! In honor of the centennial celebration he’s decided to: 1. Party like it’s 1999 and 2. Answer YOUR questions…for better or worse.

video:video.video:title: Huggable Robot Befriends Girl in Hospital
video:video.video:description: Meet Huggable Robot—an app-controlled stuffed animal designed by the MIT Media Lab. Created to help young patients who are fighting cancer, Huggable is operated by an expert Child Life Specialist at Boston Children’s Hospital. See the interactive bear in action, and find out how it’s helping to relieve children’s anxiety while engaging with them on an emotional level.

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - 50-pound Safe Folds iPhone in Half
video:video.video:description: We stack up four popular iPhone cases, including the OtterBox Defender, the Lunatik TAKTIK Extreme, the Griffin Survivor + Catalyst (note: corrected), and the Lifeproof Fre to see which design will actually keep your smartphone safe.

video:video.video:title: WIRED April 2015 Issue Preview - The Plot to Take Down a Tyrant
video:video.video:description:
In the April issue of WIRED, senior writer Andy Greenberg explores how North Korean dissidents are trying to undermine Kim Jong-un—with bootleg copies of Titanic and old episodes of Friends. Also this month: Reimagining the iconic Tucker Torpedo, What’s Inside: Jell-O, inside China’s toxic gadget factories, resurrecting the LA river, the biggest crowdfunding campaign ever, and more.
Music - "By The Roots" - YZ

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - DreamWorks’ New Film “Home” Combines the Worst in CGI Alien Design
video:video.video:description: The new DreamWorks film “Home” commits the worst of all CGI sins. In an attempt to make cute, kid-friendly characters, “Home” ended up with shapeless purple blobs and uninteresting features. What happened to strange and kind of creepy aliens like E.T.?

video:video.video:title: Newest Sex Toy Designs with Jimmyjane's Ethan Imboden
video:video.video:description: Designer and JimmyJane Founder Ethan Imboden at The 2015 Adult Novelty Expo, Las Vegas

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - Video Game Console Wars
video:video.video:description: From Sega Genesis to Playstation 3, Justin and Erik rounded up the most beloved video game consoles of our youth. Everyone has a favorite, but which one is the toughest when it comes to Sega, Nintendo, PlayStation, and Xbox?

video:video.video:title: Survival vs. Pride
video:video.video:description: Survival vs. Pride

video:video.video:title: Varys and Tyrion On 'The War to Come'
video:video.video:description: Varys and Tyrion On 'The War to Come'

video:video.video:title: Out of Office with Brent Rose - Fitness Trackers vs. Smartphones: Why Wearables Win
video:video.video:description: Tech writer Brent Rose debunks a study claiming smartphones are as good as wearables at tracking activity. From the Fitbit Charge HR to the iPhone 6, Brent's stress tests uncover compelling results that demonstrate why wearables with heart rate monitors win.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Marvel vs DC: Who Will Ruin Superhero Movies? Starring Black Nerd Comedy
video:video.video:description: Comic book movies are on the rise, but will it be Marvel or DC that pushes us over the edge? Andre from Black Nerd Comedy pays Angry Nerd another visit to discuss if it’ll be Spider-Man or Fantastic Four that makes us say no more.

video:video.video:title: The Last Mile: Inside San Quentin's Tech Incubator
video:video.video:description: There’s a tech incubator popping up, but it’s not in Silicon Valley—it’s inside San Quentin State Prison. The Last Mile program teaches inmates entrepreneurship skills with the goal that each participant founds a socially conscious, tech-forward company. Award-winning filmmaker Ondi Timoner goes inside the innovative non-profit and follows inmates as they work to craft a business plan, pitch their ideas in front of venture capitalists, and then, transition back into society.

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - iPhone 6 Plus vs. Galaxy Note 4
video:video.video:description: You’re either #TeamiPhone or #TeamGalaxy but at the end of the day only one of the devices can be named the toughest. Find out which phablet comes out on top when Erik and Justin put them up against a toilet.

video:video.video:title: What's Inside - Jell-O
video:video.video:description: It’s as American as apple pie and twice as wobbly, but what’s really inside Jell-O? Aside from collagen, the translucent gelatin sweet treat features collagen, sugar, artificial flavoring, and, oh yeah, chopped-up pig and cow hides soaked in acid.

video:video.video:title: The New Cinderella is Giving Angry Nerd Déjà Vu
video:video.video:description: “Cinderella" has had 13 movie adaptations since 2000. Angry Nerd is getting sick of the déjà vu. Why tarnish yet another animated classic by turning it into a live action film?

video:video.video:title: Design FX - Chappie: Bringing an A.I. Robot to Life
video:video.video:description: Neill Blomkamp's new dystopian sci-fi thriller "Chappie" stars a fully digital A.I. robot as the title character, acted out by Sharlto Copley. Mike Seymour goes behind the scenes of the CG robots.

video:video.video:title: Taking a 'Dronie'
video:video.video:description: Using one of Horizon Hobby's filmmaking drones to take an aerial selfie.

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - Samsung Galaxy Deathmatch
video:video.video:description: Justin and Erik are equal opportunity destroyers. So after testing every generation of the iPhone it only made sense to see how android devices hold up. See what happens when Samsung’s Galaxy S series gets put to the test.

video:video.video:title: What's Inside - Kitty Chow
video:video.video:description: It keeps your cats healthy and happy, but what’s really inside cat food? From soy flour to sulfates to ground-up meat byproducts it’s nothing but the cat’s meow for the little carnivores.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Can Will Forte’s “The Last Man on Earth" Defy the Sci-fi TV Curse?
video:video.video:description: The new Will Forte TV show “The Last Man on Earth” is sort of a funny version of “I Am Legend,” without the vampire zombies. But science fiction comedy has a grim history on American television, as even fans of “Alf,” “Mork & Mindy,” or “3rd Rock from the Sun” would have to admit. Angry Nerd hopes Forte’s approach escapes the curse.

video:video.video:title: Out of Office with Brent Rose - What $500 Can Get You on Magic (Silicon Valley’s Newest Texting-Based Delivery Service)
video:video.video:description: We gave tech writer Brent Rose $500 to stress-test Silicon Valley’s overnight sensation, Magic. From meatballs to medicinal cannabis to Mexican wrestling, see what unfolds when he pushes the new text message-based delivery service.

video:video.video:title: 3D-Printing a Custom Battle Damage Drop-O-Matic
video:video.video:description: Go inside Erik’s workshop to find out how he created a drop-o-matic device for the iPhone Battle Royale challenge using a 3D printer and a whole lot of creativity.

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - iPhone Deathmatch
video:video.video:description: We’ve rounded up every generation of iPhone for the ultimate smartphone face-off. From the iPhone 6 to the original devices that are so old they pre-date numbering, we put each one to the test, including a 2-gallon coffee dunk.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Chappie & the Taxonomy of Movie Robots
video:video.video:description: Movie robots fall into one of three categories: the cutesy ones who do repairs (C3PO), the menacing bad guys designed to inflict pain (Mechagodzilla), and the child-like naifs who learn about the wonders and horrors of the world through experience. Angry Nerd explains why Neill Blomkamp’s new sci-fi flick “Chappie” falls into the third group and he breaks down why we need more movies that cast robots as the wide-eyed outsider.

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - Mac vs PC Ultimate Showdown
video:video.video:description: It’s one of the biggest tech rivalries of all time and we finally put it to the test. See which portable device comes out on top: Apple’s MacBook Air or Microsoft's Surface Pro 3.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - Agent Carter: Creating Movie-Quality Effects on a Weekly TV Schedule
video:video.video:description: In the new series “Agent Carter” Marvel expands its universe to the small screen with help from Industrial Light & Magic. Creating high-quality visual effects was nothing new for the the award-winning team, but working against grueling weekly delivery dates proved to be a monstrous challenge. Mike Seymour finds out how they did it.

video:video.video:title: Time Traveling with Black Nerd Comedy and Angry Nerd
video:video.video:description: It’s 2015 and we’re finally living in the future. At least, according to Marty McFly. This week Angry Nerd hosts Andre from Black Nerdy Comedy to talk about the new flick “Hot Tub Time Machine 2” and the rules of time travel, according to cinema.

video:video.video:title: Game|Life - The Best Video Games of ALL Time
video:video.video:description: WIRED editor Chris Kohler goes head-to-head with SMOSH Games to settle the age-old debate: what are the best video games of all time? From first-person shooters to 2D platforms, see which games are named the best of the best.

video:video.video:title: Craziest Battle Damage Moments from Season 1
video:video.video:description: Hosts Justin and Erik smashed a lot of stuff in season 1. Check out the best highlights, including never-before-seen footage, and get ready because season 2 is going to be bigger and more destructive than ever before.

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - Valentine's Day Destroyed at 1000 Frames Per Second
video:video.video:description: Love is in the air—literally, 15 feet in the air. Erik and Justin get in the Valentine's Day spirit by doing what they do best—smashing stuff, in this case a box of chocolates, a vase of roses, and a bottle of wine.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Why "50 Shades of Grey" Matters to Fanfic
video:video.video:description: Honestly, Angry Nerd probably won’t see Fifty Shades of Grey. But he gets it. He does. Because poorly-written “romance” novels are right in geek culture’s wheelhouse. “Fifty Shades” is just fan-fiction—erotic and “Twilight”-derived and not in space, but fanfic nonetheless. Nerd’s built fan fiction from the ground up, and fan-fiction is what’s behind today’s biggest blockbusters.

video:video.video:title: What's Inside - Instant Hot Chocolate
video:video.video:description: All you notice is the sweet chocolatey taste, but what ingredients are you really consuming when you sip on a mug of instant hot chocolate?

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage F*** Ups!
video:video.video:description: From high five fails to chainsaw mishaps, a few things didn’t make it into the first season of Battle Damage. Go behind the scenes with hosts Justin and Erik to see the hilarious outtakes, including a new “spin-off” called #BattleTampon.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Channing Tatum as a Douchey Elf? No Thanks, “Jupiter Ascending”
video:video.video:description: It’s true that the “Jupiter Ascending” trailer makes the otherwise scrumptious Channing Tatum look like the douchiest elf in all of Middle-Earth. But the troubling part of the movie isn’t the prosthetic ears—it’s the insidious idea that only people fated to do great things can become heroes. Angry Nerd has other ideas about saving the world (again).

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Is SpongeBob Ready to Move from a Pineapple to the Real World?
video:video.video:description: SpongeBob Squarepants is about to upgrade from a television cartoon to a movie cartoon—alongside real, non-cartoon people. It’s a tough combo to pull off. For every “Who Framed Roger Rabbit?” there’s a “Space Jam.” Or “Chipmunks.” Or “Smurfs.” Actually there’s more in the red column. Anyway, Angry Nerd is cautiously optimistic—for now.

video:video.video:title: WIRED February 2015 Issue: Microsoft in the Age of Satya Nadella
video:video.video:description: Restart. In the February issue, Jessi Hempel profiles Satya Nadella and his warm, fuzzy, and slightly bonkers plan to make you care about Microsoft. Plus: How skateboard legend Rodney Mullen became a superstar on the Silicon Valley lecture circuit, where drones are actually delivering stuff—from rescue supplies to pepperoni pizza, Lyft’s new mustache, dumpster diving for fun and profit (lots of profit), and more. Music By Esbe – Float (https://switchy.bandcamp.com/album/bloomsday )

video:video.video:title: Neon Future Sessions - Stan Lee Thinks the World Is Going to Blow Itself Up, Steve Aoki Finds Out Why
video:video.video:description: Comic-book legend Stan Lee sits down with Steve Aoki to talk about the future, science, the origins of Marvel, and why the world just might blow itself up one day.

video:video.video:title: The 7 Most "Liked" Perks at Facebook
video:video.video:description: Working for Facebook comes with a lot more than a cool job title. Check out what this Silicon Valley social media giant has to offer its employees in terms of crazy perks.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - The Trouble with Turning “12 Monkeys” the Movie Into “12 Monkeys” the TV Show
video:video.video:description: The 1995 sci-fi flick “12 Monkeys” is about to become a TV show. This worries Angry Nerd—movies-turned-TV-shows don’t have the best track record. Sure, “Fargo” turned out fine, but let’s not forget the short-lived tragedy “Ferris Bueller”…

video:video.video:title: Design FX - The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies Crowd-Simulation On a Behemoth Scale
video:video.video:description: Weta Digital was behind the striking effects in two of this year's big-franchise films: “Dawn of the Planet of the Apes”—which picked up an Oscar nomination for best visual effects—and “The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies.” Mike Seymour takes an exclusive look at the impressive, large-scale battle sequences that Weta designed for the final installment in The Hobbit trilogy.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - The Most Important Superhero Trends of 2014
video:video.video:description: 2014 was the year comic book movies got a little bit more comic book-y. Angry Nerd counts down the top five happenings, from the return of the super heroines to DC's TV domination.

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - Season 2 Requests! What Do YOU Want to See Get Smashed?
video:video.video:description: Justin and Erik ask fans for their picks on upcoming items to smash.

video:video.video:title: WIRED's Gadget Challenge - Exclusive WIRED Store Walk-Through
video:video.video:description: Can’t make it to the WIRED store in person? Take an exclusive tour of this year’s gadget haven and check out everything the store has to offer with Erik and Justin from Battle Damage.

video:video.video:title: WIRED by Design - A Band's Obsessive Ode to the Compact Disc
video:video.video:description: YACHT at WIRED by Design, 2014. In partnership with Skywalker Sound, Marin County, CA. To learn more visit: live.wired.com

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - 2014’s Most Infuriating TV Moments
video:video.video:description: Some TV shows made us laugh and cry tears of joy this year while others made us want to rip our hair out. Angry Nerd runs down 2014’s top five most frustrating TV moments from "Doctor Who" to "How to Get Away with Murder.”

video:video.video:title: Jeff 1000 - Behind the Scenes of Summer Glau’s New Robot Series
video:video.video:description: “Alphas” co-creator Michael Karnow is behind the new series "Jeff 1000,” which stars Summer Glau and David Arquette. Go behind the scenes and see what it’s really like to work with a robot-turned actor.

video:video.video:title: Jeff 1000 - Meet Jeff: 10' Tall Robot & Hollywood Actor
video:video.video:description: Summer Glau has to attend her ex-boyfriend’s art gallery opening and who better to accompany her than a ten-foot tall robot? Jeff agrees to go and is tasked with one job, but things go haywire when he meets the ex—David Arquette.

video:video.video:title: Jeff 1000 - 9 Questions with David Arquette (Just Don’t Ask About Robots)
video:video.video:description: Things take a turn during a "Jeff 1000” shoot when David Arquette takes time to do a behind-the-scenes interview. Everything starts off smoothly, but the second David is asked about his robot co-star Jeff, all hell breaks loose with David comparing Jeff to a second-rate WALL-E.

video:video.video:title: Jeff 1000 - Pug vs. Giant Robot
video:video.video:description: She’s one of Jeff’s best friends, so when Summer Glau recounts her near-death experience, Jeff is all ears—at least, as much as a robot can be. But when Jeff’s beloved pug Baby Princess continues to interrupt the story, Summer refuses to come second to the tiny dog.

video:video.video:title: Jeff 1000 - Giant Robots Have Feelings, Too
video:video.video:description: During a shoot Jeff can't seem to get his lines quite right. It’s two simple words, but with so many different ways to convey the emotion behind them Jeff and co-star Summer Glau are left pondering the philosophical meaning behind “human alert!"

video:video.video:title: Jeff 1000 - Summer Glau on Having a Robot Best Friend
video:video.video:description: There’s definitely benefits to having friends, but can you have a friend with benefits with one of the parties isn’t actually human? Summer Glau opens up about her close relationship with a 10-foot tall robot.

video:video.video:title: WIRED by Design - A Game Designer Explains the Counterintuitive Secret to Fun
video:video.video:description: Ian Bogost at WIRED by Design, 2014. In partnership with Skywalker Sound, Marin County, CA. To learn more visit: live.wired.com

video:video.video:title: Next Tech - Flying High with DJI’s New Quadcopters
video:video.video:description: DJI’s latest batch of quadcopters lets users get sky-high while capturing hi-definition photography and video. Take a look under the hood of DJI’s Phantom 2 Vision+ and Inspire 1 to see how the technology and advanced features are allowing for a bird’s eye view that was previously reserved for, well, birds.

video:video.video:title: Game|Life - 14 Best Games of 2014 by SMOSH Games
video:video.video:description: WIRED editor Chris Kohler teamed up with SMOSH Games to count down the top 14 video games of 2014. Find out if Titanfall came out ahead of Mario Kart 8, and see which games landed an honorable mention.

video:video.video:title: Game|Life - 2014's Biggest Gaming News by SMOSH Games
video:video.video:description: It was a big year for gamers. Facebook acquired Oculus VR, the Dota 2 Championship went mainstream with a promo on ESPN, and a handful of other game-changing moments rocked the industry. SMOSH Games and WIRED editor Chris Kohler count down the top 5 gaming wins of 2014.

video:video.video:title: WIRED by Design - Designing a Brand to Help Kill Malaria
video:video.video:description: Ije Nwokorie at WIRED by Design, 2014. In partnership with Skywalker Sound, Marin County, CA. To learn more visit: live.wired.com

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - 10 Most Underrated Movies of 2014
video:video.video:description: T.V. may be in a golden era, but that’s no excuse for you to skip out on the best movies of the year. Angry Nerd names the 10 most underrated movies of 2014, including “Only Lovers Left Alive,” “Snowpiercer,” “The Raid 2,” and “Edge of Tomorrow.”

video:video.video:title: WIRED by Design - Capturing The Invisible World of Technology With Graphic Design
video:video.video:description: Carl de Torres at WIRED by Design, 2014. In partnership with Skywalker Sound, Marin County, CA. To learn more visit: live.wired.com

video:video.video:title: Next Tech - Are Organic TVs the Way of the Future?
video:video.video:description: LED screens were once the way of the future, and now OLEDs are ushering in a new wave of television viewing. Featuring organic molecules that illuminate in response to electric currents, OLEDs allow for a thin screen that produces deeper, more detailed images.

video:video.video:title: WIRED's Gadget Challenge - LED Skateboard Battle
video:video.video:description: Erik and Justin try out fitness gadgets that promise to take your workout to the next level. Find out how JayBird’s BlueBuds X headphones, Withing’s Pulse 02 watch, and Sunset’s LED skateboard stack up when they get put to the test.

video:video.video:title: WIRED by Design - Golden Rules for Successful Collaborations, From Star Hotel Designers
video:video.video:description: Commune at WIRED by Design, 2014. In partnership with Skywalker Sound, Marin County, CA. To learn more visit: live.wired.com

video:video.video:title: WIRED by Design - A Photographer's Quest for the Perfect Space Shuttle Shot​
video:video.video:description: Dan Winters at WIRED by Design, 2014. In partnership with Skywalker Sound, Marin County, CA. To learn more visit: live.wired.com

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Nerdiest Animated Holiday Specials
video:video.video:description: It’s that time of the year when networks drop sickly sweet holiday cartoons. When it comes to animated specials Angry Nerd typically loathes them, but will things change when he gets a visit from the Ghost of Christmas Specials Past?

video:video.video:title: Design FX - Once Upon A Time: Inside the Fairytale Sets and Character Animations
video:video.video:description: On ABC’s “Once Upon a Time,” Disney characters like Snow White, the Queen of Hearts, and Peter Pan are set against a modern backdrop. Realistic visual effects bring to life the magic and mystery of Storybrooke—the town they now inhabit. Mike Seymour from fxguide goes behind the stunning FX and animation that are needed to create the fairytale mashup.

video:video.video:title: WIRED's Gadget Challenge - Mind-Controlled Helicopters
video:video.video:description: What happens when you take hi-tech toys and put them into overdrive? Find out, as Justin and Erik test out a brain-controlled helicopter, littleBits circuit modules, and a wheeling app-controlled robot called Ollie.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - "Penguins of Madagascar" & Animated Spin-offs that Rock
video:video.video:description: Animated sequels are nothing compared to their spin-offs. Why watch “Madagascar 4” when the new “Penguins of Madagascar” looks infinitely better and it isn’t bound to the original template? Angry Nerd explains why he’ll take animated spin-offs like “Puss in Boots” to another “Shrek” any day.

video:video.video:title: WIRED by Design - Peek Inside an Alcoholic Archaeologist's Wild New Bar
video:video.video:description: Jennifer Colliau at WIRED by Design, 2014. In partnership with Skywalker Sound, Marin County, CA. To learn more visit: live.wired.com

video:video.video:title: WIRED by Design - How Christina Tosi Redesigned Your Favorite Desserts
video:video.video:description: Christina Tosi at WIRED by Design, 2014. In partnership with Skywalker Sound, Marin County, CA. To learn more visit: live.wired.com

video:video.video:title: The Top 10 Special FX of 2014
video:video.video:description: From the incredible helicarrier crash in “Captain America: The Winter Soldier” to the realistic motion-capture-driven apes in "Dawn of the Planet of the Apes," this year brought us some unbelievable special effects. Mike Seymour from fxguide counts down the top 10 design FX from 2014.

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - Xbox One vs. PS4 Durability Test: Loser Gets the Chainsaw
video:video.video:description: Our friend Jake over at Vsauce3 dared us to put the two biggest gaming consoles up against each other for our first-ever knockout episode. Find out whether the Xbox One or PS4 ends up being the toughest and which one gets the chainsaw in our season finale.

video:video.video:title: WIRED's Gadget Challenge - Can a Hand Vacuum Suck Up a Kiddie Pool of Fruity Pebbles?
video:video.video:description: Erik and Justin test out the most stylish gadgets available at this year’s WIRED Store. See what happens when the two get their hands on a Dyson handheld vacuum, the Ballo stool (a sleeker update to the balance ball chair), and a modern, Bluetooth-controlled gramophone.

video:video.video:title: WIRED by Design - David Chang Shares the Secrets Behind Momofuku's Delicious Success
video:video.video:description: David Chang at WIRED by Design, 2014. In partnership with Skywalker Sound, Marin County, CA. To learn more visit: live.wired.com

video:video.video:title: RetroGrade - When Was the Last Time You Left a Message on an Answering Machine?
video:video.video:description: “Please leave a message after the ….” It’s a phrase we all know, but in 1971 the PhoneMate 400 took voicemail to the next level. Find out why the hi-tech machine changed the answering machine game.

video:video.video:title: Meet the Mapmakers Who Are Changing the NBA
video:video.video:description: From what shots are the most efficient to how defenders alter offense in the post to placing a value on every action on the court, they’re helping bring hoops into the big data era. See here how they do it.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - "Hunger Games" and the Terrible Trend of Turning a Book into Two Movies
video:video.video:description: Why turn one book into one movie, when you can turn it into two? Despite “Mockingjay” being the weakest book in “The Hunger Games” series, movie execs have decided to translate it into a two-part film. Angry Nerd explains why the stretch from one to two is a terrible trend that needs to end.

video:video.video:title: WIRED December 2014: Space, Time, and Multiple Dimensions. A special issue directed by Christopher Nolan.
video:video.video:description: Few Hollywood directors can match Christopher Nolan’s ambition, skill, and mind-bending story sense. For our December issue, the man behind Memento, Inception, the Dark Knight trilogy, and Interstellar brings his formidable talents to WIRED as our guest editor.

video:video.video:title: Game|Life - The Making of the “Atari: Game Over” Documentary with Zak Penn
video:video.video:description: It’s been called the worst video game in history, but could E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial really be the cause of Atari’s downfall? In the new documentary “Atari: Game Over” director Zak Penn follows the rise and fall of the trailblazing video game company, including the game that caused Atari’s demise. Watch as Penn takes us behind the scenes of the documentary and shows us exclusive footage ahead of the November 20 release.

video:video.video:title: WIRED by Design - Designing a Brand That Even Non-Designers Can Work With
video:video.video:description: Natasha Jen at WIRED by Design, 2014. In partnership with Skywalker Sound, Marin County, CA. To learn more visit: live.wired.com

video:video.video:title: RetroGrade - Remember When People Used VHS Players?
video:video.video:description: Watching video on the go just got easier with the portable VHS player Rampage VBP1000. With a built-in dual stereo and a battery life of up to 50 minutes, you can watch (part of a) movie anywhere, anytime.

video:video.video:title: How Animals Can Predict Human Performance
video:video.video:description: Stanford researcher Mark Denny used models from the animal world to examine just how much faster we might get in the future. Here, he explains his work.

video:video.video:title: Look Inside a Lab Hacking Athletic Performance
video:video.video:description: Just down the road from Facebook and Google, Dr. Phil Wagner runs a laboratory dedicated to optimizing the performance of some of the world’s top athletes.

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - Is Killing a BIG JAMBOX Impossible?
video:video.video:description: Viewer Greg Kindra dared us to test the compact sound system, but will it live to jam another day once we’re through with it? Find out what happens when we go old school on a JAMBOX.

video:video.video:title: What's Inside - Kiwi Shoe Polish
video:video.video:description: It contains flammable agents and edible wax, but no kiwis are actually harmed in the making of this shoe polish. Find out what’s inside the shoe care product that’ll keep your wingtips in top form.

video:video.video:title: WIRED by Design - How Metaphors Make Us Love Some Designs and Not Others
video:video.video:description: Michael Hendrix at WIRED by Design, 2014. In partnership with Skywalker Sound, Marin County, CA. To learn more visit: live.wired.com

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Hate to Say It, But "Dumb and Dumber To" Is Destined to Fail
video:video.video:description: The original came out nearly 20 years ago, yet now is when we’re finally getting the follow up to “Dumb and Dumber.” Angry Nerd explains why the new Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels release has already missed the mark in terms of historical relevancy, and why it’s destined to fall victim to the curse of the long-delayed movie sequel.

video:video.video:title: WIRED by Design - Radical Ideas for Reinventing College, From Stanford's D.School
video:video.video:description: Sarah Stein Greenberg at WIRED by Design, 2014. In partnership with Skywalker Sound, Marin County, CA. To learn more visit: live.wired.com

video:video.video:title: The Window - The Alvin Submarine Part 3: Humans vs. Robots and the Future of Deep-Sea Research
video:video.video:description: The technological advances in remotely operated vehicles (R.O.V.) have allowed researchers to uncover new ocean depths, like the 1986 footage of the Titanic by the Alvin submersible. Find out what lies ahead for the future of deep-sea exploration from the scientists who are taking the plunge.

video:video.video:title: WIRED by Design - These Incredible High-Tech Exhibits Are the Future of Museums
video:video.video:description: Jake Barton at WIRED by Design, 2014. In partnership with Skywalker Sound, Marin County, CA. To learn more visit: live.wired.com

video:video.video:title: WIRED by Design - What Power Plant Software Can Learn From Consumer Apps Like iTunes
video:video.video:description: Greg Petroff at WIRED by Design, 2014. In partnership with Skywalker Sound, Marin County, CA. To learn more visit: live.wired.com

video:video.video:title: WIRED by Design - What a Sex Toy Start-Up Taught Ethan Imboden About Design
video:video.video:description: Designer Ethan Imboden at WIRED by Design, 2014. In partnership with Skywalker Sound, Marin County, CA. To learn more visit: live.wired.com

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - Roomba vs. Battle Axe
video:video.video:description: We trust them to clean our floors, but how do they stack up against a battle axe? Angry Nerd dared us to test the vacuuming robot Roomba—see what happens when we put it through a destruction test of viking proportions.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Big Hero 6 is More Than Just a Disney-fied Version of a Marvel Classic
video:video.video:description: When Disney announced the launch of Big Hero 6, Angry Nerd was skeptical it’d turn into another kid-friendly version of Marvel IP. Turns out the House of Mouse was able to adapt the classic comic (albeit with a few major changes) into an entertaining animated feature that’s not just another Disney dud.

video:video.video:title: WIRED by Design - An Aerospace Whiz Shows Off a Space Suit Made for Mars
video:video.video:description: Dava Newman and Gui Trotti at WIRED by Design, 2014. In partnership with Skywalker Sound, Marin County, CA To learn more visit: live.wired.com

video:video.video:title: WIRED by Design - Adam Savage on His Lifelong Obsession With Recreating Movie Props
video:video.video:description: Mythbuster Adam Savage at WIRED by Design, 2014. In partnership with Skywalker Sound, Marin County, CA. To learn more visit: live.wired.com

video:video.video:title: WIRED by Design - Bjarke Ingels Will Make You Believe in the Power of Architecture
video:video.video:description: Architect Bjarke Ingels at WIRED by Design, 2014. In partnership with Skywalker Sound, Marin County, CA. To learn more visit: live.wired.com

video:video.video:title: The Window - The Alvin Submarine Part 2: Incredible Views On-Board the Deep-Sea Vessel
video:video.video:description: The technological upgrades on the U.S. Navy-owned Alvin submersible allow the deep-sea diving vessel to go to new depths. Reaching 98 percent of the sea floor, the submarine is able to explore complex hydrothermal vents and ecosystems.

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - 40" LED T.V. vs. Potato Gun
video:video.video:description: Can a flatscreen withstand a vicious potato gun and a flying soda can? Find out as we put the 40” LED T.V. to the ultimate spuds test.

video:video.video:title: The Window - The Alvin Submarine Part 1: Updating the Deep-Diving Submarine at 50 Years Old
video:video.video:description: It’s the only deep-diving research submersible in the United States, and nearly 50 years after its first expedition it’s getting an upgrade. Take an exclusive tour of the Alvin submarine, and see how the updated vessel is continuing to push the boundaries of deep-water exploration

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Horror Movie Cliches that Deserve to be Slaughtered
video:video.video:description: Angry Nerd is sick of the latest crop of cliché killer movies. Do we really need Michael Bay bringing another Hasbro product to life with “Ouija"? Who asked for the new wannabe “Blair Witch Project” called “Exists”? Angry Nerd explains why the only frightening thing this Halloween is the surplus of crappy horror flicks.

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - Can a GoPro Survive a Golf Club?
video:video.video:description: It’s time to test everyone’s favorite action-camera. The GoPro performs under extreme sports conditions, but how does it hold up against a 9-iron and a powerful swing? Find out, as we take the camera out of its durable case and tee it up for a test of total destruction.

video:video.video:title: WIRED - November 2014 - The Big Heroes of Disney Animation
video:video.video:description: Dinosaur. Treasure Planet. Home on the Range. For years, Disney Animation churned out duds. Then Pixar's masterminds took over and we got blockbusters like Wreck-it-Ralph and Frozen. In the November issue, WIRED senior editor Caitlin Roper talks to Walt Disney and Pixar Animation Studios' Ed Catmull and John Lasseter about their latest film, Big Hero 6, which proves the magic is here to stay. Also this month: what's inside a flu shot; the NBA's money ball moment; the future of AI.

video:video.video:title: Array of Things: A Fitbit for the City
video:video.video:description: The Array of Things project in Chicago, led by the University of Chicago, Argonne National Laboratory, the Computation Institute, and the School of the Art Institute Chicago, is installing hundreds of sensors across the city, in hopes of providing a new breed of data-fueled urban planning.

video:video.video:title: What's Inside - Glow Sticks
video:video.video:description: You can find them on Halloween, at raves, and in the military, but how do the compact, plastic tubes of neon light actually work?

video:video.video:title: Ziba: A Bold Vision for the Future of Postage
video:video.video:description: Signet, created by the design firm Ziba, is a visionary concept for changing the way we send mail.

video:video.video:title: Lim: A Prosthetic That Radically Improves Lives
video:video.video:description: A new company called LIM is radically rethinking the way prosthetics fit the human body, so that wearers of artificial legs can walk farther than ever before.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Will the New U.K. Import “Gracepoint" Join the Ranks of “The Office,” “House of Cards,” and “Shameless”?
video:video.video:description: The British are coming. Can the new crime drama Gracepoint (based on the U.K. hit Broadchurch) find success stateside and join the shortlist of Brit expats that found their footing on red, white, and blue T.V.s, like The Office, House of Cards, and Shameless?

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - The Indestructible Nokia Phone vs Liquid Nitrogen
video:video.video:description: It’s the most requested gadget we’ve received by far and we’ve finally put it to the test. See what happens when the Nokia “Brick” phone goes swimming in a vat of liquid nitrogen.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Why "Dracula: Untold" Will Suck the Blood (and Soul) Out of You
video:video.video:description: The latest victim in the movie studios' quest to take stories we know and love and destroy them with tedious pre-history? Dracula: Untold, which provides us with the unnecessary origin story on how the original vampire became a thirsty bloodsucker, long before the days of Twilight.

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - MacBook Air vs. Karate Kick of Death
video:video.video:description: Apple’s MacBook Air is light and easy to transport, but can it withstand a blow from our stunt performer who holds a black belt in karate? YouTuber @Jackson challenged us to find out—see what happened.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Star Wars Rebels: Strong With the Force, or a Pile of Sith?
video:video.video:description: Star Wars Rebels is Disney’s latest foray into the Star Wars universe, but will this animated installment use the power of the force for good, or take a trip to the dark side? Angry Nerd Chris Baker reviews all of the animated renditions of Star Wars to uncover what worked, and what was a steaming pile of Sith.

video:video.video:title: Neon Future Sessions - Ray Kurzweil & Steve Aoki Talk Technology, the Future & Humanity
video:video.video:description: Steve Aoki talks with famed futurist Ray Kurzweil about how technology will shape our future, in terms of creativity, consciousness, and the coming singularity.

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - Microsoft Zune Torture Test
video:video.video:description: Released in 2006, the Microsoft Zune was intended to be a competitor to Apple’s iPod. It didn’t stand a chance then and it doesn’t stand a chance now. See what happens when we go medieval on this week’s gadget, as recommended by Mark and Todd from Barely Political.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Live - Creating Video Games That Are Easy to Learn, but Difficult to Master
video:video.video:description: Atari founder Nolan Bushnell and game developer Dong Nguyen join author David Kushner to talk about the ingredients for a successful video game and how the industry has transitioned from being a hobby to a full-blown business.

video:video.video:title: What's Inside - Golf Balls
video:video.video:description: Anyone who’s played a round knows that golf isn’t a science, but that’s not the case when it comes to golf balls. The compact, dimpled balls have come along way from goose feathers wrapped in leather—find out what’s inside golf balls.

video:video.video:title: RetroGrade - Skip the Apple Watch, Go for the Casio Timepiece Calculator
video:video.video:description: Apple recently announced its new timepiece, but the tech giant was hardly the first to make a foray into smartwatches. In the early '80s Casio debuted a dual watch-calculator, paving the way for multipurpose, wearable gadgets.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Design, October 2014
video:video.video:description: Thanks to 40 years of increasingly cheap and tiny processors, new software, cheap sensors, and digital manufacturing, we can build products that seemed impossible a decade ago. WIRED has dubbed this new design renaissance Silicon Modern. Our editors collected 10 great exemplars of this movement, encompassing big ideas, inspiring projects, and new forms of expression. Silicon Modern is here, and design will never be the same. Original Composition by Nico Bergmann Recorded at First Voice Studio

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - Want an iPhone 6? Smash Your iPhone 5s with a Safe
video:video.video:description: We've all been there: You dropped your iPhone on the ground and sometimes it shatters into a billion pieces, but sometimes it's completely fine. What happens if you drop a 55-lb safe on top of it? YouTuber KuSh SuDrA dared us to test it, and we did. Find out what happened.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Live - ABC's Dan Harris on How Meditation Can Make You Happier
video:video.video:description: ABC News correspondent and Nightline co-anchor Dan Harris explains how meditation helped him feel better—and how corporations are using it for their workforce, too.​

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - The Equalizer's Awesome Title Sequence & Why '80s T.V. Show Credits Rule
video:video.video:description: The new Denzel Washington crime thriller, The Equalizer, is based on the 1980s show of the same name. And while Angry Nerd doesn't really remember much about the show, he does remember the killer opening title sequence.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - The Maze Runner Exclusive: Building the Mechanical Grievers & Complex Maze Set
video:video.video:description: Based on the hit YA novel of the same name, the upcoming flick The Maze Runner takes place in a post-apocalyptic world. To create the vast maze and relentless mechanical creatures called Grievers, FX experts Method Studios used technical and complicated special FX. Mike Seymour breaks down the tech behind the film.

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - You Asked for It! More Insane Tech Tests
video:video.video:description: You commented, we listened. Find out if your gadget was chosen as one of our next tech tests on Battle Damage.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Live - Creating an International Social Soundtrack with Twitter Amplify
video:video.video:description: Glenn Brown of Twitter Amplify explains how the social media service is giving brands and users a digital megaphone to tweet during broadcasts and major events.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - No, FOX—We Don't Want a Batman Origin Show
video:video.video:description: You know what's not cool? A Batman show that's not about Batman. Yet, that's what we're getting with FOX's upcoming Gotham. The series centers on Bruce Wayne's childhood and features origin stories of the franchise's villains. Sound like a prequel to a prequel? That's because it is.

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - How Fast Can We Spin a $50,000 Camera?
video:video.video:description: Erik and Justin from The Indie Machines show you how they built a fast-moving DIY camera rig to capture all of the action from each destruction test.

video:video.video:title: What's Inside - ​Diaper Cream
video:video.video:description: Hell hath no fury like a baby's bowel movements. Find out what anti-bacterial and moisturizing agents are in triple-paste diaper cream, helping to keep bums healthy and clean-ish.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Live - A Super PAC to End All Super PACs
video:video.video:description: Harvard Law professor Lawrence Lessig calls for a mayday on democracy and explains how he plans to do so with an innovative Kickstarter campaign.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - I Can't Remember Why, But Movies About Amnesia Are Awesome
video:video.video:description: In the upcoming thriller Before I Go to Sleep​, Nicole Kidman stars as a woman who's grappling to remember what happened in her past. The amnesia plot line works, as it does for every film centered around memory loss, because it puts the protagonist on the same level as the viewer. Angry Nerd explains why.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Facial Animation FX
video:video.video:description: Mike Seymour breaks down the tech behind the latest Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles flick, including the facial animation effects. Plus, find out how an improvised, off-camera moment turned into one of the funniest scenes in the movie.

video:video.video:title: The Window - Goodyear Blimp Part 3: From Zeppelin to Goodyear: Discover the History & Future of Airships
video:video.video:description: Blimps have come along way from the Zeppelin days; find out what's in store for the future of Goodyear's new airships.

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - Nintendo Game Boy vs. Sledgehammer
video:video.video:description: It came out in 1989 and was notoriously tough, but can an original Game Boy hold its own against a sledgehammer-wielding body builder?

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Are You Ready for Grant Morrison's New DC Comic Multiversity?
video:video.video:description: It spans 52 parallel universes, featuring characters like a nazi Superman and a vampire Batman. And although you'll need an infographic to keep track of everything, Grant Morrison's new, mind-bending mini-series The Multiversity encompasses everything that's right in the alternate reality comic book world.

video:video.video:title: The Window - Goodyear Blimp Part 2: How Many Pilots Does it Take to Fly the New Goodyear Airship?
video:video.video:description: Find out how the tech, aviation, and design of Goodyear's new airship stack up to its predecessors.

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - We Dropped a 55-lb Anvil On An HP Printer So You Don't Have To
video:video.video:description: It can print, scan, and copy, but can it fly? Find out, when we put an HP all-in-one printer through three extreme destruction tests.

video:video.video:title: WIRED Live - Making Sustainable Housing Better, More Accessible & More Affordable
video:video.video:description: Architect Michelle Kaufmann explains the convergence of technology and building design, and the importance of using software and data to create green, affordable homes for the global population.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Jason Momoa, aka Khal Drogo, Will Make Aquaman Cool
video:video.video:description: Aquaman gets a bad rep as one of more lame superheroes in the DC family, but if there's anyone who can elevate the superhero's cool factor it's Jason Momoa. The Game of Thrones star is reportedly starring as Aquaman in the upcoming Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice flick, and although he doesn't fit the blonde bill, his tough-guy demeanor and hyper-masculine aura will add a new level of cool to the water-dwelling crime-fighter.

video:video.video:title: The Window - Goodyear Blimp Part 1: A New Airship Takes to the Skies
video:video.video:description: We go inside the latest addition to a fleet of lighter-than-air vehicles—the most advanced blimp in the air.

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - Apple iPad vs. Cinder Block
video:video.video:description: Sure, it's got a sleek design and a user-friendly operating system, but just how durable is the Apple iPad? We put the touchscreen gadget through three challenges to find out how much it can really take.

video:video.video:title: Battle Damage - Extreme Tech Tests with The Indie Machines
video:video.video:description: The Indie Machines’ Erik Beck and Justin Johnson are here to destroy your electronics—all in the name of science. Watch as they put each gadget through a 3-part destruction test, like taking a sledgehammer to a Nintendo Game Boy and dropping a cinder block on an iPad.

video:video.video:title: WIRED’s Scott Dadich Takes the ALS Ice Bucket Challenge
video:video.video:description: Watch WIRED editor in chief Scott Dadich take the ALS Ice Bucket Challenge—while doing the math behind how long it would take for every person in the world to have completed the challenge. (Want to check our work? Go to http://wrd.cm/icebucketmath.) Scott's donated to help put an end to ALS. Go to alsa.org to learn how you can help too. Thanks to GQ’s Michael Hainey for the nomination. Scott’s paying it forward: Consider yourselves challenged, Chris Hardwick, Cindi Leive, and Carlton Cuse!

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - It's All In the Details: Giving a 14-Foot Creature a Giant Makeover
video:video.video:description: From the final moldings to the last paint job, find out how the design team added character and life to the giant creature in under two weeks.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Why Body Swapping Is Awesome on TV, But Crappy in Movies
video:video.video:description: BBC America is hedging their bets on Intruders, a new show about a secret society whose members can jump into other people's bodies. And while body swapping is nothing new in the cinematic world, the trope tends to work better on TV, than on film. Angry Nerd explains why.

video:video.video:title: WIRED September 2014 Issue Trailer: Edward Snowden, the Untold Story
video:video.video:description: Award-winning author James Bamford spent three days interviewing Edward Snowden in Moscow. He emerged with an indelible portrait of the elusive whistleblower, one that sheds new light on exactly what led Snowden to decide to leak tens of thousands of top-secret documents. Also in this month's issue: A new scientific effort to understand nutrition and health plus a riveting profile of Sin City auteur Frank Miller.

video:video.video:title: Teen Technorati - Teenage Wunderkinds Explain How They Got Into Cancer Research, Astrophysics & Product Design
video:video.video:description: What inspires a 17-year-old to go into cancer research or a 19-year-old to develop an obsession with astrophysics? Find out, as the 2014 Thiel Fellows explain how they first discovered their passions and why they've decided to turn them into careers.

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - How to Fabricate Alien Fur for a Giant Creature
video:video.video:description: Just how does a giant creature get its realistic, custom fur? Find out, as we break down the process of fur fabrication for this year's massive beast.

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - What's Under the Hood of an Otherworldly Giant Creature?
video:video.video:description: How do you make a 2,000-pound creature move with fluidity and ease? Find out, as we break down the animatronics and mechanics that control the mobility of the giant beast, including nostril flares, mouth movements, and more.

video:video.video:title: The Most Wanted Man in the World: Edward Snowden in His Own Words
video:video.video:description: Dispatched to Moscow, famed portrait photographer Platon captured a never-before-seen side of Edward Snowden for WIRED. In this riveting montage, the elusive whistleblower explains the thinking behind his decision to reveal the extent of domestic surveillance being conducted by US intelligence services.

video:video.video:title: The Most Wanted Man in the World: Behind the Scenes with Edward Snowden
video:video.video:description: It took almost a year to arrange to interview and photograph Edward Snowden in Moscow, where he has sought asylum. Author James Bamford and photographer Platon reflect back on their encounters with the elusive whistleblower.

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - How to Grow Your Own Monster
video:video.video:description: It took nearly 4,000 hours to grow the Giant Creature pieces that were created using 3-D printing. Find out how Stratasys—the company behind the expert rapid prototypes—managed to create one of the biggest projects they've ever worked on.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Why the Best Comic-Book-to-Film Adaptations Are Not Always the Most Faithful
video:video.video:description: When it comes to film adaptations of comic-books, the source material should always be treated as gospel, right? Wrong. Angry Nerd explains why, and shares his concerns for Frank Miller's upcoming Sin City: A Dame to Kill For—which could end up being too faithful for its own good.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - Hercules: Creating Mythical Creatures with Advanced Special Effects
video:video.video:description: In Brett Ratner's new big-budget flick Hercules, the title star portrayed by Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson battles mythical creatures, including a three-headed dog, giant boars and lions, and multi-headed serpents. Mike Seymour shows how the visual effects experts at Double Negative created the complicated, yet lifelike beasts.

video:video.video:title: Teen Technorati - Meet the Teens Who Are About the Change the World
video:video.video:description: They each won $100,000 to change the world. Find out how the 2014 Thiel Fellows are planning to do it—all in under 60 seconds.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - What Makes "Doctor Who" Great Are the Sidekicks, Not the Time Lord
video:video.video:description: Scripts for upcoming episodes of Doctor Who have leaked online, but should you read them before they air? It doesn't matter! The scripts aren't the secret to the Doctor's longevity. It's the companions that make or break any given episode, arc, or season, and Angry Nerd can prove it.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - Game of Thrones: Combining CGI and Live Action to Create the Dragons & Fights Scenes in Season 4
video:video.video:description: In season four of Game of Thrones a combination of CGI and live character action were used to create impressive fight scenes and stunning visual effects. Mike Seymour breaks down the tech behind the hit HBO show.

video:video.video:title: What's Inside - Trojan Tingly Warmth Lubricant
video:video.video:description: What do sex dolls, caulking, and lotion have in common? They all contain active ingredients also found in Trojan's Tingly Warmth Lubricant. Find out what else is inside the slick sex aid.

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - Watch the Giant Creature Marry a Couple & More Highlights from San Diego Comic-Con 2014
video:video.video:description: It's been an eight-week-long marathon to get the Bodock Giant Creature ready for #SDCC2014, and now that the convention is over, it's time to take a look back at the best moments from the event, including the marriage ceremony he officiated.

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - How to Make Monster Sounds with the Click of a Button
video:video.video:description: Wonder how Bodock the Giant Creature and his alien sidekick got their voices? In this episode, we take a trip to Anarchy Post to see how the creature's voice came to life with the help of voice actors and Dehumaniser—a real-time vocal processor for monster sound FX.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Chris Nolan's First Time at Comic-Con, the Interstellar Trailer & Elizabeth Olsen's Mutant Flub
video:video.video:description: Chris Nolan showed up to #SDCC2014 to promote his new sci-fi flick Interstellar and Angry Nerd has a few choice words for him. Watch as he gives Nolan a piece of his mind, talks to a few cosplay fans, and gives advice to the Marvel world.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Luc Besson Can Give Us "Lucy" But Marvel and DC Can't Give Us She-Hulk or Black Widow?
video:video.video:description: Scarlett Johansson stars as the ass-kicking, nearly superhuman protagonist in the new sci-fi action flick Lucy. But while the French—namely the film's writer and director Luc Besson—continue to put out films with strong heroine leads, Marvel and DC seem content to sit on a reservoir of amazing female characters like She-Hulk and Black Widow.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd Blasts Batman and Praises Mad Max: Fury Road at San Diego Comic-Con 2014
video:video.video:description: On location at #SDCC2014, Angry Nerd talks about the new comic-book films he supports (Mad Max: Fury Road) and those he opposes (Ben Affleck's Batman).

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd Takes on the Avengers Cast, Cosplay Superheroes, and More at San Diego Comic-Con 2014
video:video.video:description: Angry Nerd is on location at #SDCC2014, and he's got a bone to pick with cosplay fans waiting to get into the coveted Hall H. Plus, he stops by a signing with the cast of Avengers: Age of Ultron to give Marvel a piece of his mind about the new Ant-Man movie.

video:video.video:title: The Giant Creature Destroys Angry Nerd in Movie Monster Trivia at San Diego Comic-Con 2014
video:video.video:description: Angry Nerd challenges Bodock the Giant Creature to a round of movie monster trivia. Despite Angry Nerd's best efforts to trick the massive beast, Bodock comes out ahead with a few tricks of his own.

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - Alien Cop Car Invades San Diego Comic-Con 2014
video:video.video:description: Why drive a regular cop car when you can patrol the streets in a massive beast? Watch what happens when the San Diego police department upgrades their regular vehicle to Bodock the Giant Creature.

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - The Giant Creature vs. Angry Dogs at San Diego Comic-Con 2014
video:video.video:description: Bodock the Giant Creature tries to make some new friends at #SDCC2014, but ends up making a few enemies instead. Watch what happens when he faces off against two small dogs who aren't afraid of the colossal beast.

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - Watch the Giant Creature Crash Through San Diego Comic-Con 2014
video:video.video:description: San Diego Comic-Con 2014 is underway and it's time for Bodock the Giant Creature to make his public debut. Catch a first-look at his #SDCC2014 reveal.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Brett Ratner's Hercules & Pillaging Story Lines for Big-Budget CGI Films
video:video.video:description: Angry Nerd is hungry for some new material. Instead of force-feeding us cinematic souvlaki with CGI blowouts of Greek-inspired story lines, maybe it's time to look beyond the Peloponnesian lore. And no, Brett Ratner, we will not be entertained with your upcoming Hercules starring Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson.

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - See the Giant Creature Get Ready for Jimmy Kimmel Live
video:video.video:description: How do you transport a 2,000-pound, 14-foot-tall beast? Find out, as the giant creature makes its way from the Stan Winston School facilities to Hollywood for its big debut on Jimmy Kimmel Live.

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - EXCLUSIVE: It’s Alive! Watch Jimmy Kimmel Take the Fully Formed Giant Creature for a Ride Down Hollywood Boulevard
video:video.video:description:
Watch Matt Winston and the crew assemble the giant creature on Hollywood Boulevard before its big reveal on Jimmy Kimmel Live. Plus, watch Kimmel and his sidekick Guillermo take the nearly 14-foot tall, 2,000-pound creature for a ride.
Watch the Kimmel segment here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=plmBWOL5LBw

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - Watch the Full-Body Mechanics of the 2,000-Pound Giant Creature in Action
video:video.video:description: Catch a first-look at the giant creature in action as the team tests out the mechanics of the frame.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - Dawn of the Planet of the Apes: Transforming Human Motion-Capture Performances Into Realistic-Looking Apes
video:video.video:description: In the latest incarnation of Dawn of the Planet of the Apes Andy Serkis and Toby Kebbell deliver human motion-capture performances to help bring the realistic apes to life. Shot with a combination of high-speed cameras, Mike Seymour breaks down the tech behind shooting the motion-capture scenes on location versus on a sound stage.

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - Find Out What it Takes to Sculpt a Giant Dragon-Inspired Character Head
video:video.video:description: Now that the prototype is built, it's time to start constructing the full-scale pieces of the giant creature. In this episode, watch the dragon-like head come to life through an advanced sculpting process, after which it's refined, detailed, and painted for a realistic look.

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - Using 3-D Printing to Build a Small-Scale Figure of a Giant Creature
video:video.video:description: Lead systems engineer Jason Lopes walks us through the process of creating a maquette—a 10 to 18-inch 3-D figure—which gives the team a tangible and highly detailed representation of the creature.

video:video.video:title: Teen Technorati - Genius Teens Unite at the Thiel Foundation's Under 20 Summit
video:video.video:description: It's time for the bi-annual Under 20 Summit, where past, present, and future Thiel Fellows connect with one another and meet with mentors. In this Season 2 finale, the winners of this year's Thiel Fellowship reflect on their progress thus far, and share their goals for the future.

video:video.video:title: Teen Technorati - He's Only 17 Years Old, But He's Well On His Way to Curing Cancer
video:video.video:description: Seventeen-year-old Thomas Hunt isn't old enough to vote, but he's conducting research that may one day cure cancer. Get to know the Thiel Fellow, take a tour of the lab where he's working to help make history, and find out what inspired him to get involved in cancer research.

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - How Do You Scale Up the Design of a Giant Creature?
video:video.video:description: Designer Greg Smith walks us through the process of scaling up the massive beast to see how much volume is needed to create it. After taking photos and videos of the rough frame and superimposing it onto an image of the creature, the team is able to get a better idea of what dimensions they'll need to bring it to life.

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - Watch FX Experts Build the Prototype of a 14-Foot Creature
video:video.video:description: The design phase is over, and now it's time to prove that the 14-foot-tall creature can be built. As the team starts to build the prototype, challenges arise due to the creature's size and scale.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Reboots We Need Way More Than "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles"
video:video.video:description: The upcoming Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles remake is completely unnecessary. Instead of fixing flicks that ain't broke, why not reboot the films that can actually be improved upon?

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - See Which Tricked-Out Giant Creature Will Be Brought to Life At San Diego Comic-Con 2014
video:video.video:description: It's time to choose a concept for this year's giant creature. The only requirements this time around? It needs to be bigger and better, with even more innovative features. Watch as the team at the Stan Winston School and Legacy Effects choose a final design for the massive monster.

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - It’s Back! Watch a Teaser of the Biggest, Baddest Creature Coming to Life for Comic-Con 2014
video:video.video:description: At San Diego Comic-Con 2013, WIRED debuted a giant robot mech. This year, a new version of the larger-than-life beast will be revealed at the ultimate fan convention. Watch a preview of what’s in store for the colossal creature, created in collaboration with the Stan Winston School, Legacy Effects, Stratasys, and WIRED. From design to tech and prototype to finished product, see how the ultimate cosplay creation came to life.

video:video.video:title: What's Inside - Tap Water
video:video.video:description: You can't see it, but there's a lot going on inside a glass of tap water. The faucet aqua is essentially an invisible cocktail of sulfates, resins, varying levels of lead, and so much more. Find out what else is inside.

video:video.video:title: Bonus Content: Could A "Dawn of the Planet of the Apes" Disaster Actually Happen?
video:video.video:description: Now you know what to do if a Planet of the Apes situation occurs, but is an ape takeover actually plausible? Host Quinn Beswick breaks down the likelihood of a primate invasion.

video:video.video:title: How to Survive a Real-Life "Dawn of the Planet of the Apes" Situation
video:video.video:description: Ever wonder what you'd do if a gang of genetically engineered apes took over the planet? Host Quinn Beswick talks to scientists, sociologists, and survivalists for tips on what to do if you find yourself in a real-life Dawn of the Planet of the Apes situation.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Give Me a Standalone Comic-Book Movie or Give Me Death
video:video.video:description: Is it too much to ask for a comic-book flick that doesn't rely on three crappy prequels for the plot to make sense? Let's lose the complicated, interwoven story lines and focus on quality standalone films. Angry Nerd explains why Marvel's new Guardians of the Galaxy gets it just right.

video:video.video:title: Teen Technorati - To Infinity & Beyond: The Fellows Visit NASA & Learn About the Future of Life on the Moon
video:video.video:description: In this episode, Thiel fellow Rebecca Jolitz takes us on a tour of the NASA Ames Research Center, where she worked while attending UC Berkeley. The entire group also pays a visit to lunar transportation company Moon Express for lessons on space, technology, and how to turn the impossible into a reality.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Why Andy Serkis is the Greatest Actor of His Generation
video:video.video:description: He's the maestro of motion capture performance. From Gollum in Lord of the Rings to Caesar in the new Planet of the Apes movies, Andy Serkis is the greatest actor you've never seen. So where is this man's Oscar? The Angry Nerd has words for the Academy—doesn't he, my Precious?

video:video.video:title: RetroGrade - Before Snapchat People Took Videos on This JVC Camcorder
video:video.video:description: The color is striking, but beauty is more than skin-deep with the JVC GR-C7U camcorder. You can record picture and sound in one unit and watch your masterpiece immediately on instant-playback. Watch out, John Hughes—there’s a new era of filmmakers on the horizon.

video:video.video:title: Teen Technorati - Brilliant Teens Shack Up in the Bay Area to Bring Their $100K Ideas to Life
video:video.video:description: A bunch of talented teens all under 20 years old move in together. Sounds like the plot of a new MTV show, but for the winners of the $100,000 Thiel Fellowship, it’s reality. In this episode of Teen Technorati, the fellows give us a tour of their San Francisco and Oakland apartments, where they’re working on their projects and bringing their ideas to life.
