video:video.video:description: "The Mortal Instruments: City of Bones" is giving the Angry Nerd a disease: colonitis. The problem: Movie titles are overusing the colon. At fault: The man who brought us such titles as "Star Wars—Episode II: Attack of the Clones."

video:video.video:title: Codefellas - How to Cheat to Win
video:video.video:description: Nicole accuses Topple of treason and Topple plays the class card. But do average Americans really want to live in world where elites are held to the same standards? We think not.

video:video.video:title: D.I.Y. The Fake TV Wall
video:video.video:description: Want to mount your flat-screen on the wall without sacrificing your security deposit? With some elbow grease, basic construction materials, and a weekend of playing with power tools, you can build a fake wall that the landlord will never even know was there.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Kick-Ass 2 and Real-Life Superheroes in Films
video:video.video:description: With films like Kick-Ass, and now, Kick-Ass 2, cosplay vigilantes have become the new superheroes—in Hollywood's bizarro world! Angry Nerd explains why these everyday crusaders don’t cut it.

video:video.video:title: Codefellas - How to Hack a Telegram
video:video.video:description: Hot on the trail of a devastating computer virus, Topple and Winters burn the midnight oil. Are the North Koreans sending encrypted telegrams or has Kim Jong-un taken up beat poetry?

video:video.video:title: Game|Life - Greg Kasavin Talks on Supergiant's New Game, Transistor
video:video.video:description: Supergiant Games creative director Greg Kasavin talks about his company's upcoming game Transistor, and how he went from writing about games to making them.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - Elysium: Futuristic Effects Exclusive
video:video.video:description: WIRED has an exclusive look at the visual effects of Director Neill Blomkamp's dark futuristic thriller, Elysium. Find out how the artists at "Image Engine" brought the patrolling packs of armed robots to life and turned the real world nirvana of Malibu into the orbiting playground of the space bound elite.

video:video.video:title: Codefellas - How to Kill Your Boss
video:video.video:description: Topple settles into his new role as a cyber-spy, but hold on to your tequila sunrise: a hangover from his swinging '70s past leaves him odd-man-out at the counter-intelligence key party ... until his target conveniently "disappears."

video:video.video:title: Game|Life - Creating Games with a Purpose
video:video.video:description: Game designers Mike Mika and Greg Kasavin talk about how they create video games that are fun to play but also meaningful.

video:video.video:title: Game|Life - Retro Game Showdown
video:video.video:description: Host Chris Kohler and special guest Mike Mika show off their most prized possessions in an epic battle to be named the king of gaming collections.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Depicting Computer Graphics
video:video.video:description: As if the lamestream media didn't have enough problems—dopey, dated graphics and cutaways have become standard visuals for stories about computers. And the Angry Nerd ain't having it. Next time ridiculous images of keyboards, cables, and binary code flash across your TV screen, remember: That's how those shows see you.

video:video.video:title: Codefellas - 25 Reasons the NSA Should Hire Buzzfeed Staffers
video:video.video:description: After Nicole debunks Henry's Buzzfeed logic, he must chose between destroying all electronic music or preserving Downton Abbey.

video:video.video:title: Keep on dancing to Spoon's "Don't You Evah"
video:video.video:description: The robot Keepon (developed by Hideki Kozima and programmed by Marek Michalowski) dancing to the Spoon song, "Don't You Evah."

video:video.video:title: The Window - Tesla Motors Part 3: Electric Car Quality Tests
video:video.video:description: Preorder a Tesla today—but don’t expect to get behind the wheel for another 2-3 months. We go inside Tesla’s rigorous quality testing that each of its vehicles must undergo before hitting the road. From water and drive tests to a 101-point checklist, see the exhaustive inspection these electric beauties go through.

video:video.video:title: September 2013 Issue: The Future of Design
video:video.video:description:
The future of design is upon us. Seamless interactions engineered between your personal tech and the world around you that reduce complexity. Artists that collaborate and cross mediums in realtime, streaming their art from mobile platforms. And a floating internet in the sky that could open the digital world to billions.
Find out how the new designers are changing the way we will experience the future in the September 2013 issue of WIRED.

video:video.video:title: Game|Life - Game Hackers Roundtable
video:video.video:description: Game developers Greg Kasavin of Supergiant Games and Mike Mika of Other Ocean Interactive share the top games they'd most like to hack. Whether for social change or pure fun, see what classic titles each of these game aficionados would most love to change and why.

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - How to Build a Giant Robot Mech: Think Big (7/7)
video:video.video:description: In the CONCLUSION to WIRED's guide to building a 9 foot 9 inch tall walking, talking, mini-cannon totting GIANT ROBOT MECH, the crew from Stan Winston School and Legacy Effects reflect on a job well done. From concept to unveiling at Comic-Con, this was a labor of love, representing 2000+ man hours of work. Rest up guys, because next year ... we are bringing the Mech's BIGGER BROTHER to the show.

video:video.video:title: Trivia Death Match: Angry Nerd vs. Giant Robot Mech
video:video.video:description: WIRED’s Angry Nerd Chris Baker takes on the WIRED robot at Comic Con for a trivia test about all things robot-related. Find out how many rounds you could go with the robot and who wins.

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - How to Test And Launch your Giant Robot Mech (6/7)
video:video.video:description: All systems are online and it's time to test WIRED'S Giant Robot Mech ... just days before its big unveiling at the 2013 San Diego Comic-Con by Adam Savage from MythBusters and Tested. Watch as Stan Winston School and Legacy Effects put the finishing touches on the Big Guy in this penultimate episode of our Geek Week exclusive series.

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - How to Make Tech for a Giant Robot Mech (5/7)
video:video.video:description: The WIRED giant robot mech is STANDING TALL and looking good after it's assembly and paint job ... now it's time to BRING IT TO LIFE with Arduinos, radio controls, servos, lighting effects, voice modulators, and hidden surprises. Watch as Stan Winston School and Legacy Effects put the finishing touches on the mother of all mechs just days before it's big unveiling ...

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - How to Build Parts for a Giant Robot Mech (4/7)
video:video.video:description: It's time to build the armor and weapons for WIRED's giant robot mech and give it a paint job with realistic battle scarring. Watch as Stan Winston School and the artists from Legacy Effects turn our hulking friend into an incredible work of art ... a work of art that you wouldn't want to meet in a dark alley.

video:video.video:title: What's Inside - Strike-Anywhere Matches
video:video.video:description: We break down the science of strike-anywhere matches to see what makes sparks fly.

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - How to Prototype a Giant Robot Mech (3/7)
video:video.video:description: If you thought our finished 9' 9" Giant Robot Mech that stormed Comic Con was impressive, wait until you see the engineering that was required to make it come "alive." In this amazingly detailed part 2 of our "making-of the giant robot mech" series, Stan Winston School and Legacy Effects research and construct a working prototype exoskeleton.

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - How to Design a Giant Robot Mech (2/7)
video:video.video:description: Check out how the experts at Stan Winston School and Legacy Effects came up with the mind blowing design for WIRED's 9 foot 9 inch giant robot mech that stormed this year's San Diego Comic Con. It's a rare chance to see how the biggest practical effects for Hollywood's blockbusters are built.

video:video.video:title: Lockpicking: Kwikset SmartKey
video:video.video:description: Lockpicking: Kwikset SmartKey

video:video.video:title: How to Make a Giant Creature - How to Make a Giant Robot Mech (1/7)
video:video.video:description: WIRED built a giant robot mech in partnership with YouTube, Stan Winston School and Legacy Effects. And now you get to see how we did it. From design to tech, prototype to insanely detailed finished product, you'll find out how to build your very own. Just bring a lot of friends and a ton of parts.

video:video.video:title: What's Inside - Play-Doh
video:video.video:description: Learn the magic formula inside that classic yellow tub. Hint: there’s more to it than flour and water.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Pixar Sells Out With Crappy Sequels
video:video.video:description: Angry Nerd used to love Pixar. Then they got lazy, churning out one tired sequel after another. Has this once shining beacon of creativity totally sold out?

video:video.video:title: Codefellas - Blackmail at 4:20
video:video.video:description: Nicole strikes back with a hefty dose of new-school espionage, but Topple is not to be outdone. Hint: you can't topple Topple 'cuz Topple don't stopple!

video:video.video:title: Jetman vs. Jet Team
video:video.video:description: Jetman vs. Jet Team

video:video.video:title: The Window - Tesla Motors Part 2: How Tesla Motors Builds Electric Cars
video:video.video:description: Tesla Motors is challenging the giants of the global auto industry with all-electric cars—and a new approach to building them. Take a look at their assembly lines, and the philosophy behind them.

video:video.video:title: Game|Life - KLAX Hacker Proposal by Game Designer Mike Mika
video:video.video:description: Years before he hacked Donkey Kong and became an internet sensation, game designer Mike Mika engineered another epic hack that had an even bigger impact on his life.

video:video.video:title: Mr. Know-It-All - Expired Medication: A Dose of Truth
video:video.video:description: Medicine has an expiration stamp—but Is it actually, you know, serious? Or are those sell-by dates just a Big Pharma racket? Mr. Know-It-All gives you a healthy dose of the truth.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Chris Baker Defends His Disapproval of Zynga Board Games
video:video.video:description: Chris Baker got Angry and Nerdy about Zynga making board games out of online games out of board games. Commenters commented. Baker defends his purchase of said games. And gets Angry.

video:video.video:title: Codefellas - Spy vs. Spy
video:video.video:description: After recently discovering Winters is actually his supervisor, Agent Topple mobilizes the full power of the National Security State to neutralize this inconvenient threat on his own security. All while catching up on his “stories,” also known to many as the illegal surveillance of private citizens in the comfort of their own home. This is surprisingly stimulating.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Chris Baker Responds To YouTubers About Despicable Me Super Villain Conspiracy Theory
video:video.video:description: Chris Baker is convinced that Hollywood has gone soft on super villains and responds to comments that either agree with him, or think he looks like one of them.

video:video.video:title: San Diego Comic Con: Recap
video:video.video:description: Wired Senior Editor Peter Rubin and Special Correspondent Cara Santa Maria recap day two of San Diego Comic Con.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - San Diego Comic Con 2013: Bronies
video:video.video:description: You've all been asking Angry Nerd to rant about Bronies, but he's just not going to do it.

video:video.video:title: iJustine Spots Giant Robot at Comic Con 2013
video:video.video:description:
iJustine, one of the biggest personalities on the Web, stumbles on the biggest thing at San Diego Comic Con 2013 -- the "Giant Robot."
It took the mighty minds and resources of WIRED, YouTube, Stan Winston School, Legacy Effects, and Conde Nast Entertainment to create an insanely detailed, one-of-a-kind, 9 foot 9 inch Mech with four arms to usher in the 2013 San Diego Comic Con. And coming soon to YouTube's Geek Week ... a huge mini-series showing how this colossus was built.

video:video.video:title: Hugh Jackman Unleashed at Comic Con
video:video.video:description: Cara Santa Maria interviews Hugh Jackman on location at Comic Con about his new Wolverine movie.

video:video.video:title: San Diego Comic Con 2013: Bizarre Books
video:video.video:description: Special Correspondent Cara Santa Maria scours the Comic Con floor in search of the most bizarre comic books.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - San Diego Comic Con 2013: Chris Baker vs. Godzilla
video:video.video:description: Angry Nerd isn't happy about the upcoming re-boot of the classic 1954 Godzilla, and he tells us all exactly why.

video:video.video:title: San Diego Comic Con 2013: Most Expensive Item at the Con
video:video.video:description: Special Correspondent Cara Santa Maria goes on safari at SDCC 2013 in search of the most expensive item at the con.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - San Diego Comic Con 2013: White House Geek Memo
video:video.video:description: The Angry Nerd vs The White House.

video:video.video:title: San Diego Comic Con 2013: Day 1 Recap
video:video.video:description: Wired Senior Editor Peter Rubin and Special Correspondent Cara Santa Maria recap the jam packed first day of San Diego Comic Con. Featuring the giant Wired Robot, Terry Gilliam's Zero Theorem, Bill Paxton "the only guy who has been killed by the Terminator, a Predator and an Alien," Kit Harington of Game of Thrones and legendary rock star Slash.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - San Diego Comic Con 2013: Cosplay Weapons Check
video:video.video:description: Angry Nerd throws down his rant at Comic Con, he's madder than ever cause this time he can't bring his weapons!

video:video.video:title: Stan Lee vs Giant Robot: Comic Con 2013
video:video.video:description: Comic book legend Stan Lee gets an up close and personal meeting with the giant robot from San Diego Comic Con 2013. It took the mighty minds and resources of WIRED, YouTube, Stan Winston Studios, Legacy Effects, and Conde Nast Entertainment to create an insanely detailed, one-of-a-kind, 9 foot 9 inch Mech with four arms to usher in the 2013 San Diego Comic Con. It is ready to blow your mind. And coming soon to YouTube's Geek Week ... a huge mini-series showing how this colossus was built.

video:video.video:title: Giant Robot Storms San Diego Comic Con 2013
video:video.video:description: It took the mighty minds and resources of WIRED, YouTube, Stan Winston School, Legacy Effects, and Conde Nast Entertainment to create an insanely detailed, one-of-a-kind, 9 foot 9 inch Mech with four arms to usher in the 2013 San Diego Comic Con. And who better to announce it than Adam Savage, of Tested and Mythbusters. It is ready to blow your mind. And coming soon to YouTube's Geek Week ... a huge mini-series showing how this colossus was built.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - Pacific Rim: Designing Destruction Effects Exclusive
video:video.video:description: WIRED breaks down an exclusive clip from "Pacific Rim" with John Knoll, Chief Creative Officer from Industrial Light & Magic, exploring how design decisions affect the success of a blockbuster visual effects shot.

video:video.video:title: Codefellas - The Antisocial Network
video:video.video:description: After an urgent alert from the PRISM program followed by a shocking revelation from Nicole, Agent Topple doesn't not panic.

video:video.video:title: The Window - Tesla Motors Part 1: Behind the Scenes of How the Tesla Model S is Made
video:video.video:description: If founder Elon Musk is right, Tesla Motors just might reinvent the American auto industry—with specialized robots building slick electric cars in a factory straight from the future. That's where the battery-powered Model S is born.

video:video.video:title: Game|Life - Donkey Kong Hacker Dad Mike Mika
video:video.video:description: Game developer Mike Mika reveals how he hacked Donkey Kong for his 3-year-old daughter and became an unlikely hero to thousands.

video:video.video:title: The Window - High-Speed Robots Part 2: Kiva Robots in the Workplace & in our E-commerce Economy
video:video.video:description: Follow a robot as it works its day job—transforming the world of e-commerce by hustling packages around the giant warehouses that propel the modern economy. New robot minions: Welcome to the team.

video:video.video:title: August 2013 Issue: Bill Hader Cheats! (and so can you!)
video:video.video:description: Sneaky tricks! Workarounds! Creative rule-bending! The August 2013 issue of WIRED has BILL HADER and tons of info to outwit the chumps and get what YOU want. PLUS: Inside Neill Blomkamp's incredible new movie Elysium, an eye melting visual guide to Comic-Con Cosplay, and the low down on how to load a massive container ship.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Zynga's Shameful Digital to Board Game Switch
video:video.video:description: Like we weren’t going to notice, Zynga? Turning Words With Friends into a board game does not make it not-Scrabble. Same goes for Hungry Hungry Herd. Angry Nerd takes a stand against the shameless genre crossing of digital games back to board games.

video:video.video:title: Codefellas - How To Hack a Website
video:video.video:description: Nicole finally gets a chance to hack into a personal email, only to find herself in the bowels of Agent Topple's locked messages from the 90s. As imagined, this is unfortunate.

video:video.video:title: Game|Life - E3 Expo - Oculus Rift VR Headset 1080p Version
video:video.video:description: Wired editors Chris Kohler and Peter Rubin experience the new HD 1080p version of the Oculus Rift virtual reality headset at the E3 expo. Watch their reactions and hear their detailed review in this episode of Wired's Game|Life.

video:video.video:title: Game|Life - Gameboy Rarities Appraised
video:video.video:description: Chris Kohler digs into his collection to show off his a couple rarities, and gives some tips on building your own cache of hard-to-find games.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - World War Z: Building a Better Zombie Effects Exclusive
video:video.video:description: WIRED's exclusive behind the scenes look at the making of "World War Z" reveals how the visual effects artists at MPC used massive crowd simulations and hand animation to create the devastating swarming of Jerusalem by a zombie horde.

video:video.video:title: The Window - High-Speed Robots Part 1: Meet BettyBot in "Human Exclusion Zone" Warehouses
video:video.video:description: Get a bots'-eye view of the "human exclusion zone" in a massive warehouse where an army of high-tech robots finds and fulfills up to 30,000 orders a day.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Despicable Me Super Villain Conspiracy Theory
video:video.video:description: Chris Baker is no conspiracy theorist, but finds all these kids' movies where the bad guys turn out to be good guys a tad suspicious. Super villains with a sudden change of heart—or the ultimate scheme to take over the world?

video:video.video:title: What's Inside - Coffee
video:video.video:description: Coffee is the lifeblood of most of our mornings, but do you know what’s actually inside that cup of coffee you’re drinking each day? You’d be surprised.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - Man of Steel: Designing Krypton's Tech Effects Exclusive
video:video.video:description: WIRED and fxguide.com traveled to Wellington, New Zealand for an exclusive look at the work of acclaimed visual effects studio WETA Digital on Man of Steel. In this exclusive video, find out how Krypton's "Liquid Geo" display tech was designed and brought to life.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Chris Baker Responds To YouTubers About Wolverine's Origin Story
video:video.video:description: Chris Baker responds to YouTube comments on his impatience with Wolverine's claws. Here's a hint, folks: Don't tell an Angry Nerd that "it's just a comic book."

video:video.video:title: Game|Life - Jonathan Blow on The Witness Release Date
video:video.video:description: Indie game designer, Jonathan Blow, talks with Peter Rubin and Chris Kohler about the long awaited release date for The Witness and if we can expect to see it out anytime soon.

video:video.video:title: Codefellas - Meet Big Data
video:video.video:description: Agent Topple reveals a few tricks of the pre-digital trade when Winters attempts to explain to him how computers work. Agent Topple is Not Impressed.

video:video.video:title: The Window - Barclays Center Part 3: The Conversion Crew That Transforms the Venue for Events
video:video.video:description: Get up close and personal with the folks behind Barclays Center's spectacular overnight conversions. Learn what it takes for their 40-person crew to radically transform this hi-tech arena from a sold-out concert venue into the Brooklyn Nets' basketball stadium overnight.

video:video.video:title: Codefellas - When Topple met Winters
video:video.video:description: WIRED's new animated series takes you inside the secretive world of a slightly askew NSA, with the eccentric Agent Topple, played by John Hodgman, and his young hacker protégé, Nicole Winters.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Marvel's Interpretation of Wolverine's Origin Story
video:video.video:description: Angry Nerd loves superheroes, but hates RETCONs. He's especially miffed at what Marvel has done to Wolverine's origin story. Find out why Angry Nerd thinks those metallic, foot-long bone claws are not only implausible, but unforgivable.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Chris Baker Responds To YouTubers And Defends His View on Doctor Who
video:video.video:description: Chris Baker responds to a few comments from viewers on his opinion of the latest incarnation of Doctor Who. The Angry Nerd respects people with the temerity to disagree with his opinions. But he respects them angrily.

video:video.video:title: Game|Life - Veronica Belmont and Jonathan Blow on the Future of Gaming
video:video.video:description: Hosts Chris Kohler and Peter Rubin welcome internet star Veronica Belmont and indie game designer Jonathan Blow to discuss the future of game consoles, indie game distribution, and what an Apple TV would mean for gamers and developers alike.

video:video.video:title: July 2013 Issue: NSA Cyberwar Sneak Peek
video:video.video:description: The first shots of the Cyberwars have been fired. Now, NSA Chief General Keith Alexander has built a secret army to take down America's enemies.

video:video.video:title: Game|Life - E3 Wrap Up with Chris Kohler and Peter Rubin
video:video.video:description: Chris Kohler and Peter Rubin wrap-up the major highlights from this year's E3.

video:video.video:title: Mr. Know-It-All - Classical Toddler Music
video:video.video:description: You've heard music is good for your kid’s brain, but does it matter what tunes you spin? Mr. Know-It-All weighs in on the age-old debate: Led Zeppelin or The Wiggles?

video:video.video:title: Game|Life - Veronica Belmont on Fake Geek Girls
video:video.video:description: Veronica Belmont talks to Chris Kohler and Peter Rubin about people accusing others of being fake geek girls and her opinions on trying to keep the “nerd” or “geek” culture exclusive.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - The Apocalypse
video:video.video:description: The world is ending (on TV) and Chris Baker is not a fan of pop culture’s interpretation of it. Why does the cast of NBC's Revolution act like they're stuck in the 18th century instead of a world more closely resembling the industrial revolution 2.0? How does an interspecies alien war in Syfy's Defiance result in cowboys riding motorcycles?

video:video.video:title: The Window - Barclays Center Part 2: Inside on The Catwalk
video:video.video:description: In this episode of The Window, we take you high above the arena floor into the rafters of Barclays Center for a rare view of what it all looks like from the lights.

video:video.video:title: Game|Life - Jonathan Blow on What to Expect from His New Game The Witness
video:video.video:description:
Jonathan Blow, creator of Braid, tells Chris Kohler and Peter Rubin what to expect from his new 3D exploration/puzzle game The Witness.
SPACE INVADERS FOOTAGE (C) TAITO CORPORATION 1978 ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Doctor Who's Regeneration
video:video.video:description: Angry Nerd has a bone to pick with the latest incarnation of Doctor Who. Since when did the Doctor care more about emotional truths than interstellar engineering feats? Angry Nerd thinks this 900-year-old Gallifreyan could use a little more galaxy-saving know-how and a little less bow tie.

video:video.video:title: The Window - Barclays Center Part 1: From Concert Venue to Basketball Arena in 8 Hours
video:video.video:description: Go behind the scenes at one of America's most technologically advanced arenas, as an overnight conversion crew transforms Barclays Center from a sold-out concert venue to a basketball stadium for the Brooklyn Nets in only eight hours.

video:video.video:title: Game|Life - Veronica Belmont on the Future of Gaming
video:video.video:description: Video game royalty, Veronica Belmont, joins hosts Chris Kohler and Peter Rubin in the Game|Life studio. Hear this internet star of Tekzilla, The Sync Up, and Sword & Laser share her views on ColecoVision, BioShock Infinite, and the future of always-online gaming.

video:video.video:title: Design FX - Fast & Furious 6: Explosive Effects Exclusive
video:video.video:description: In this exclusive video from WIRED and Conde Nast Entertainment, find out how director Justin Lin filmed Dominic Toretto's (Vin Diesel's) blazing last minute escape from a massive, crashing and exploding Antonov aircraft for his new #1 blockbuster film "Fast & Furious 6." Don't miss this unbelievable behind the scenes look at the genius work of renowned visual effects house "Double Negative." Huge thanks to our good friends at fxguide.com.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Peter Jackson's The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey-An Analysis
video:video.video:description: Angry Nerd says what's on everyone's mind. The problem with Peter Jackson's The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey is its length. That's right. It's far, far too short.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Can Michael Shannon Trump Terrence Stamp's General Zod?
video:video.video:description:
In the upcoming film, Man of Steel, General Zod will be played by Michael Shannon. Can Shannon trump Terrence Stamp's portrayal of Zod in the 1981 film, Superman II? Angry Nerd is skeptical, obviously.
Photo Credit: General Zod artwork courtesy of Steve Oatney

video:video.video:title: The Window - NYC Eastside Access Part 2: Most Expensive Transportation Project in US History
video:video.video:description: Stirring images of an underground city set the stage for this subterranean journey through East Side Access, the country's largest transportation project. Get a detailed look at the bold vision for this massive railway expansion and learn why it could only happen in New York.

video:video.video:title: Game|Life - Giant Lego X-Wing Fighter Lands in Times Square
video:video.video:description: Lego unveils a massive full-scale replica of Star Wars X-Wing Fighter in Times Square. This 5.3 million brick behemoth weighs in at over 23 tons and is the largest Lego construction ever built in the world. Before the curtain was opened to the public, Game|Life got a behind-the-scenes first hand look at the mother of all Lego projects.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - What Roland Emmerich Can Learn From Superman II
video:video.video:description: Want to know how a real pro steals our nation's seat of power? Roland Emmerich, allow us to introduce you to General Zod.

video:video.video:title: Game|Life - New Xbox One - Design: Exclusive WIRED Video
video:video.video:description: WIRED gets exclusive first-look at the new Xbox One from prototypes to final design. Get a behind the scenes look at the newest Xbox One Kinect sensor, game controller, and console. See what wild designs never made the final cut! This is a special edition of Game|Life, to follow the series go to video.wired.com or subscribe to our channel at youtube.com/WIRED.

video:video.video:title: Game|Life - New Xbox One - TV Integration: Exclusive WIRED Video
video:video.video:description: WIRED gets exclusive first-look at the new Xbox One and its ability to "snap" games, TV/cable, and even Skype. Watch as we demo the newly overhauled voice control, programming guide, and social media integration for the first time! Chat with friends while watching the big game! This is a special edition of Game|Life, to follow the series go to video.wired.com or subscribe to our channel at youtube.com/WIRED.

video:video.video:title: Game|Life - New Xbox One - Kinect: Exclusive WIRED Video
video:video.video:description: WIRED gets exclusive first-look at the new Xbox One and Kinect sensor. Watch as we test the new Kinect with advanced 3D and infrared capabilities. Jumping, punching, and fireballs…even in the dark. This is a special edition of Game|Life, to follow the series go to video.wired.com or subscribe to our channel at youtube.com/WIRED.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Can Star Trek Into Darkness Be Any Good?
video:video.video:description: Angry Nerd explains the “Star Trek Curse,” where every other film is either great or terrible. Can Star Trek: Into Darkness break the curse?

video:video.video:title: Pacific Rim Trailer
video:video.video:description: Pacific Rim Trailer

video:video.video:title: The Window - Series Trailer: How the WIRED World Works
video:video.video:description: The Window is a documentary series about how the world works. We’ll pull back the curtain on the extraordinary places we hear and about, but rarely get to see inside. The Window takes us on a tour of amazing facilities, factories, lab and landmarks—the infrastructure of the WIRED world, as seen through the eyes of the people who work there.

video:video.video:title: The Window - NYC Eastside Access Part 1: Most Expensive Transportation Project in US History
video:video.video:description: Deep under New York City, the Metropolitan Transit Authority is working on the country’s largest and most expensive transportation project. Over 50 years in the making, this $8.24 billion railway will connect the Long Island Rail Road to Grand Central Terminal. Follow Engineer Bill Ury, on an inspection of this massive subterranean project from beneath 38th Street in Manhattan to Sunnyside Yards in Queens.

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Old Trek, New Trek
video:video.video:description: Star Trek films: they don't make ‘em like they used to. With the imminent release of Star Trek: Into Darkness, WIRED’s arbiter of geek culture, Angry Nerd, fumes over Captain Kirk and the Starfleet becoming "typical, blockbuster action heroes" and pines for the franchise’s Golden Age of DIY stunts and primitive charm. Where have you gone, William Shatner?

video:video.video:title: Angry Nerd - Series Trailer
video:video.video:description: A lot of nerds work at Wired, but one of them is very, very angry. Passionate nerd Chris Baker rages from behind his desk against the things in geek culture that just plain don’t make sense.

video:video.video:title: Game|Life - Top Five Video Game Storylines
video:video.video:description: Inspired by the release of Bioshock Infinite, Game|Life hosts Chris Kohler and Peter Rubin share their five favorite video game story lines, from Final Fantasy to The Walking Dead.

video:video.video:title: The Future that Never Happened : Jetpack
video:video.video:description: Where are the jetpacks we were promised? Will Ferrell reveals "The Future That Never Happened" for Wired Magazine.

video:video.video:title: The Future that Never Happened: Foodpill
video:video.video:description: Where are the foodpills we were promised? Will Ferrell reveals "The Future That Never Happened" for Wired Magazine.

video:video.video:title: The Future that Never Happened: Roboservant
video:video.video:description: Where are the Roboservants we were promised? Will Ferrell reveals "The Future That Never Happened" for Wired Magazine.

video:video.video:title: The Future That Never Happened: The Ray Gun
video:video.video:description: Where are the ray guns we were promised? Will Ferrell reveals "The Future That Never Happened" for Wired Magazine.

video:video.video:title: Will Ferrell in The Future That Never Happened
video:video.video:description: What ever happened to food pills, sexbots and ray guns? Will Ferrell reveals "The Future That Never Happened" for Wired Magazine.

video:video.video:title: Sci-Fi Airshow
video:video.video:description: ILM Visual Effects Supervisor Bill George started his career as a model maker for films such as Return of the Jedi and Blade Runner. As the vfx business has turned digital, Bill has kept his model-making dreams alive through the Sci-Fi Airshow.

video:video.video:title: Dangerous Object: Coker V2 Unicycle
video:video.video:description: The Coker V2 Unicycle in action.

video:video.video:title: Welcome to Armageddon, USA
video:video.video:description: In Picher, Oklahoma, the mines closed and the people moved away. Then came the sinkholes, looters, and governmental collapse. To survive, you need optimism -- and a gun.

video:video.video:title: Wake Up, Geek Culture. Time to Die
video:video.video:description: The Angry Nerd bemoans the mainstreaming of Nerd-dom. Everything is ruined.

video:video.video:title: Counterfeit Car Maker
video:video.video:description: Pieced together from scavenged and scratch-built parts in Thailand, these sports car knockoffs look like the real deal, even if they don't run quite the same.

video:video.video:title: Insectophiliac Builds 12-Foot-High Spider-Bot
video:video.video:description: In the rugged backwoods of Vermont, inventor Jaimie Mantzel is constructing a monstrous spiderlike walking bot and shaping every piece by hand.

video:video.video:title: How Four Makers Mastered Their Medium
video:video.video:description: A plastics hobbyist shares how he makes tiny model trains.

video:video.video:title: Open-Source Electronics Pioneer Limor Fried on the DIY Revolution
video:video.video:description: Electronics entrepreneur Limor Fried talks about the business of making makers.

video:video.video:title: Holy Sardines! Its Batman
video:video.video:description: Adam West sat down with WIRED at Comic-Con International in 2011 to discuss his life as Batman.

video:video.video:title: Kiddie Car Racing for Adults
video:video.video:description: Speed, glory, electrical fires: The new Power Racing Series pits overclocked minimobiles in tiny but heated competitions.

video:video.video:title: How to Hatch a Dinosaur
video:video.video:description: Scientists know how to turn a chicken into a dinosaur. What could possibly go wrong?

video:video.video:title: Animal Prosthetics Help Human Amputees Move Again
video:video.video:description: Advanced prosthetics designed for animals from horses to dolphins could one day be put to use for humans.

video:video.video:title: Process: How Tubes of Tofu Become Tofurky
video:video.video:description: Wired gets a private tour of Turtle Island's wind-powered factory, where it cranks out a hero of the vegetarian holiday meal;Tofurky Roast.

video:video.video:title: Engineer Builds Instruments for One-Man Metal Band
video:video.video:description: Tristan Shone designed, prototyped, and machined his "dub machines" and uses them to rage on songs like "Terrorbird."

video:video.video:title: Interview With Jonah Hill on Moneyball
video:video.video:description: Jonah Hill talks about his experiences acting in the new movie "Moneyball", in theaters September 23, 2011.

video:video.video:title: Massive Biometric Project Gives Millions of Indians an ID
video:video.video:description: A massive biometric project in India aims to get millions of impoverished citizens a new form of ID.

video:video.video:title: NASA Tests Robotic Gas Station Attendant for Outer Space
video:video.video:description: See how NASA tests a robotic gas station attendant for outer space.

video:video.video:title: Former McDonald's Honchos Take On Sustainable Cuisine
video:video.video:description: The soon-to-be-chain restaurant Lyfe Kitchen is shooting for responsible, healthy, and delicious fast food.

video:video.video:title: Inside Larry Ellison's Insane Plan to Turn America's Cup Into a TV Spectacle
video:video.video:description: Inside Larry Ellison's Insane Plan to Turn America's Cup Into a TV Spectacle

video:video.video:title: 150 Boomboxes and the Best Dance Party You've Never Been To
video:video.video:description: Find out how Tom and Gary throw a decentralized dance party.

video:video.video:title: How Paul Larsen Reinvented the SailBoat
video:video.video:description: Excitement on open waters.

video:video.video:title: Hot Trend: Tapping the Power of Cold to Lose Weight
video:video.video:description: It's a hot trend. Tapping the power of cold to shed pounds. But will science ever catch up with the hype?

video:video.video:title: Fight Flu With Tobacco
video:video.video:description: How to turn genetically modified plants into a vaccine factory.

video:video.video:title: Inside the Cycleplex: The Weird, Wild World of Google Bikes
video:video.video:description: Corporate bike fleets have become commonplace on sprawling Silicon Valley campuses over the past decade. Apple has campus bikes, as do Facebook, LinkedIn and others. But there’s nothing quite like Google’s.

video:video.video:title: Radiant Rides From Damaged Decks
video:video.video:description: George Rocha, an innovative SF-based skatepark builder, has a beautiful way of salvaging used and broken skateboards. He turns them into entirely new skateboards.

video:video.video:title: Jump Rope Physics
video:video.video:description: Jump Rope Physics

video:video.video:title: Last Reef
video:video.video:description: Last Reef

video:video.video:title: Aaron Swartz Wired Exclusive
video:video.video:description: Aaron Swartz Wired Exclusive

video:video.video:title: Spring Reveals Saturn's Hexagon Jet Stream
video:video.video:description: Spring Reveals Saturn's Hexagon Jet Stream

video:video.video:title: George R. R. Martin "Game of Thrones Cameo Would Be in Season 4, Not 3"
video:video.video:description: On the red carpet , Martin told Wired that his potential cameo would occur not in Season 3, but rather in Season 4 - though he acknowledged that HBO had not yet officially announced the next season of the hugely popular fantasy epic.

video:video.video:title: Jeff Bezos Recovers Apollo Engines
video:video.video:description: Jeff Bezos Recovers Apollo Engines

video:video.video:title: Review: Giant Propel Advanced SL 0
video:video.video:description: Giant claimed its new Propel Advanced SL 0 was the most aerodynamic bike in the world, a claim repeated by the media outlets who reported on it. Big words, but I wanted to test it and see for myself.

video:video.video:title: The Power of Swarms Can Help Us Predict the Future
video:video.video:description: Swarms of bats, birds and locusts may strike fear in the heart of humans, but as scientists are discovering, we all might be following the same patterns of behavior.

video:video.video:title: What Crocs on Treadmills Can Teach Us About Dinosaurs
video:video.video:description: What crocs on treadmills can teach us about dinosaurs.

video:video.video:title: Wired On Tour With Laura Stevenson Pt. 2
video:video.video:description: The Brooklyn indie-folk singer and her band build in a little time for rest and recreation during their second time at the hectic music festival.

video:video.video:title: 3D Printed Speakers Lit With LED
video:video.video:description: Check out these beautiful 3D printed LED speakers. You can't actually buy them, but LumiGeek is working on a board that will let you make you're own.

video:video.video:title: Laura Stevenson - The Move
video:video.video:description: Off the upcoming album Wheel. Out April 23rd.

video:video.video:title: Wired On Tour With Laura Stevenson Pt. 1
video:video.video:description: For this indie-folk band reality is less fart jokes and drug-addled misadventure and more baked goods and early mornings.

video:video.video:title: Maria Del Camino: The Flying Car
video:video.video:description: When Bruce Tomb realized that flying cars weren’t on the imminent horizon, he decided to make his own.

video:video.video:title: Google Chromebook Pixel
video:video.video:description: Google's Chromebook runs only web apps, some of which also work offline. It's a concept you are either OK with or not into at all.

video:video.video:title: Sony Action Cam Demo Footage
video:video.video:description: To test Sony's new POV camera, I strapped it to my editor's head and had him ride around on his bike.

video:video.video:title: The Blacksmith
video:video.video:description: The Blacksmith

video:video.video:title: LED Space Helmet a Hit
video:video.video:description: When Jennifer Mann dressed up for a 'David Bowie costume party', she had no idea her LED space helmet would be such a hit. Now she sells them on ETSY.

video:video.video:title: Twinkle Twinkle Giant Bridge
video:video.video:description: This spring the Bay Bridge, which connects Oakland to San Francisco, will shine, courtesy of more than 25,000 LEDs strung along the vertical wires connecting the deck of the 1.8-mile-long western span to the suspension cables hanging from its towers.

video:video.video:title: The Loudest Soccer Fans on Earth
video:video.video:description: The Loudest Soccer Fans on Earth

video:video.video:title: Watch a Robot Interview Portlandia's Fred Armisen
video:video.video:description: Fred Armisen stopped by the Wired office after the SF Sketchfest tribute to his Peabody Award-winning show Portlandia, and we decided to let our robot Rob-EE do the talking.

video:video.video:title: Guitars Made From Carbon Fiber
video:video.video:description: Wired checks out Tech Shop to see how carbon fiber guitars are made and meet the people making them.

video:video.video:title: What Is Your Favorite Star Wars Memory?
video:video.video:description: With a brand new era of Star Wars content on the way, the Wired staff has been reminiscing about their favorite memories of the saga.

video:video.video:title: Star Wars: Behind the scenes of the WIRED cover shoot
video:video.video:description: Star Wars: Behind the scenes of the WIRED cover shoot

video:video.video:title: Microsoft Surface Windows 8 Pro Review
video:video.video:description: The Surface Pro looks like a tablet, but it's not a mobile device. It's a portable device.

video:video.video:title: Steampunk Robots and Hacked Bugs
video:video.video:description: i-Wei Huang hacks together bit and peices to make beautiful steam powered robots and techno bugs. You may have seen his work before, at his day job Huang develops toys and characters for Skylanders.

video:video.video:title: CES 2013: Orpheus Headphones
video:video.video:description: The Sennheiser Orpheus originally debuted back in 1991. It was designed and sold as a complete system: a table-top stereo tube amplifier, the power supply, an internal DAC, all the cabling, and of course the headphones themselves.

video:video.video:title: CES 2013: Philips uWand
video:video.video:description: An IR camera paired with an accelerometer offer pinpoint precision for selecting onscreen items on your TV set, and also lets you use gestures to swipe through menus.

video:video.video:title: CES 2013: Canon PowerShot N
video:video.video:description: Canon's new Powershot N is a point and shoot camera that lets you share your images with your smartphone.

video:video.video:title: CES 2013: Curved OLED TV
video:video.video:description: Wired finds a curved OLED TV at CES 2013.

video:video.video:title: CES 2013: Samsung T9000 Four-Door Refrigerator
video:video.video:description: The built-in 10-inch tablet, the brain of the appliance, is fun to play with and comes packed with apps. If you're a neat freak, the on-board software can definitely help you keep your fridge organized.

video:video.video:title: CES 2013: Tactus Technology Tactile Touchscreen
video:video.video:description: Tactus Technology has created a haptic touchscreen panel that "rises" to create a three-dimensional keyboard. Writing an e-mail on your tablet? Individual letter keys form small bumps for easier typing.

video:video.video:title: CES 2013: The Fuji X100S Is Faster Than Your Toddler
video:video.video:description: The "S" stands, appropriately, for speed because this camera is fast. Crazy fast. And while the camera's internals got a boost, the X100S still carries the classic body of the X100.

video:video.video:title: CES 2013: Mist-Powered Interactive Display
video:video.video:description: Water mist shoots out of a stand to create a moving, unique display. Your computer or tablet screen is projected onto the display, and you interact with it just as you would with a touchscreen.

video:video.video:title: CES 2013: Eye-Catching Tech at 'Digital Experience'
video:video.video:description: The Gadget Lab staff scoured each jam-packed aisle to discover some of the best gems of 2013, including a gigantic Huawei phone, new LEGO Mindstorms, and a music-controlled back massager. Watch the video above to check it out!

video:video.video:title: Better Than Human
video:video.video:description: Better Than Human

video:video.video:title: Le Whaf Makes Cloudy Cocktails
video:video.video:description: It looks like something from a sci-fi flick, or maybe a meth lab. ButLe Whaf is a device for vaporizing liquids.

video:video.video:title: Most Dangerous Object in the Office: Skike VX Twin Roller Skis
video:video.video:description: Finally, skiing minus all that cold wet snow. With inflatable tires, elaborately adjustable bindings that allow your heels to lift, and optional ski-style poles, Skikes let you replicate cross-country skiing without going outside.

video:video.video:title: First 3-D Printed Record is Amazing
video:video.video:description: The needle drops and a series of high, repetitive whines come from the album. Then a crackling sound, and a muffled guitar riff. Finally, Kurt Cobain's voice - audible, but distant and hollow, like he is singing in a tunnel with a scarf over his mouth.

video:video.video:title: Pacific Rim Interview With Guillermo Del Toro
video:video.video:description: Pacific Rim is Guillermo del Toro's mega-monster vs. mega-mech extravaganza. Wired spoke to del Toro about how he was able to bring these 25 story high creatures to the screen.

video:video.video:title: Tesla Model S: Software Update 4.0
video:video.video:description: Tesla is pushing out one of its most feature-packed updates to Model S owners, with new functions, energy saving settings and --finally -- voice controls.

video:video.video:title: Winter Camp 2012: Wrap Up
video:video.video:description: We spend one last day on the mountain testing skis, snowboards and other winter gear -- and an insane, snow-ready mountain bike.

video:video.video:title: Winter Camp 2012: Day 3
video:video.video:description: After shaking off the soreness of our first day on the slopes, we hit the terrain park to practice our moves.

video:video.video:title: Winter Camp 2012: Day 2
video:video.video:description: On the second day of our Lake Tahoe trip, we tested skis, boards, clothing, helmets -- and each other's patience.

video:video.video:title: Gollum Mo-Cap More Advanced in 'The Hobbit'
video:video.video:description: Wired interviews Andy Serkis, the actor who plays Gollum, about reprising the role, and how far motion capture has come since 'The Fellowship of the Ring'.

video:video.video:title: Winter Camp 2012: Day 1
video:video.video:description: For the snow enthusiast, the first day of the season is more exciting than Christmas morning. And we're about to experience it. Welcome to Wired's 2012 Winter Camp test excursion.

video:video.video:title: Tesla Taxi
video:video.video:description: Damon Lavrinc and Tesla Model S owner Konstantin Othmer are using the Sidecar App to pick up passengers around San Francisco and get their first impressions of the car.

video:video.video:title: Sam Raimi on Oz: The Great And Powerful
video:video.video:description: Sam Raimi latest film Oz: The Great And Powerful is like nothing he's directed before. He tells us why in this Wired interview.

video:video.video:title: Staff Picks: Lamy Dialog 3 Fountain Pen Palladium Finish, Extra Fine Nib
video:video.video:description: WIRED reviews the Lamy Dialog 3 Fountain Pen Pall

video:video.video:title: Iron Man 3: Don Cheadle and Shane Black
video:video.video:description: Don Cheadle and Shane Black discuss Iron Man 3 which is set to be released in May of 2013.

video:video.video:title: Obsessed: Building Enormous Snowmen With the Boss of Frost
video:video.video:description: See how Marc Asperas builds an enormous snowman.

video:video.video:title: Star Wars: Rancho Obi-Wan Tour
video:video.video:description: Take a tour of the largest private collection of Star Wars memorabilia in the known universe. Rancho Obi-Wan has about 300,000 peices in its collection.

video:video.video:title: Alfie Allen on Game of Thrones
video:video.video:description: Alfie Allen talks about his character Theon Greyjoy on the show Game of Thrones.

video:video.video:title: Staff Picks: Moogerfooger MF-108M Cluster Flux
video:video.video:description: WIRED reviews the Moogerfooger MF-1080 Cluster Flux

video:video.video:title: Staff Picks: Isurus I-Evade 434 Hooded Fullsuit
video:video.video:description: WIRED reviews the Isurus I-Evade 434 Hooded Fullsuit
