video:video.video:description: WIRED reviews the Vitamix Professional Series 750

video:video.video:title: Staff Picks: Numark iDJ Pro for iPad
video:video.video:description: WIRED reviews the Numark iDJ Pro for ipad.

video:video.video:title: Staff Picks: Danny Hess Skateboard
video:video.video:description: WIRED reviews the Danny Hess skateboard.

video:video.video:title: Making a Mint
video:video.video:description: Take a look inside of a Candy cane factory.

video:video.video:title: Most Dangerous Object: PET Bottle Launcher
video:video.video:description: Check out the PET Bottle Launcher in action.

video:video.video:title: Staff Picks: White & White Digital LED Clock
video:video.video:description: WIRED reviews the White Digital LED Clock

video:video.video:title: Nokia True Car
video:video.video:description: Cliff Fox, VP of Nokia Location and Commerce, talks about the cameras and lasers of the mapping vehicle.

video:video.video:title: Snowboarding Go-Bag
video:video.video:description: Avid snowboarder and Gadget Lab writer Roberto Baldwin takes us through his go bag to help you stay prepared for a quick getaway on the slopes.

video:video.video:title: Fugitive John McAfee In Hiding
video:video.video:description: A compilation of Joshua Davis' recent conversations with John McAfee. For the past six months Davis has been interviewing McAfee and now Wired is publishing his exclusive thirteen chapter ebook on McAfee.

video:video.video:title: McAfee Says He Is Innocent
video:video.video:description: John McAfee declares his innocence regarding recent murder accusations in an interview with Wired's Joshua Davis.

video:video.video:title: McAfee Declares Innocence
video:video.video:description: John McAfee declares his innocence regarding recent murder accusations in an interview with Wired's Joshua Davis.

video:video.video:title: Cruising in The Bentley
video:video.video:description: Wired goes cruising in The Bentley.

video:video.video:title: Review: Microsoft Surface
video:video.video:description: Surface is proof that Redmond is intent on taking the tablet someplace entirely new and different.

video:video.video:title: Wreck-It Ralph Interview
video:video.video:description: Wreck-It Ralph has Sarah Silverman, John C Reilly and 8-bit characters. Wired finds out what the film is all about.

video:video.video:title: Inside the Mansion -- and Mind -- of Kim Dotcom
video:video.video:description: Inside the Mansion -- and Mind -- of Kim Dotcom

video:video.video:title: Behind-the-Scenes of What's Inside
video:video.video:description: Check out behind the scenes of a What's Inside photo shoot.

video:video.video:title: How To Do Zombie Make-up
video:video.video:description: A quick and easy way to make wounds that will last for hours and hours.

video:video.video:title: The Stamp Mobile: A Crazy Money Marking Contraption
video:video.video:description: Ben Cohen wanted to take on the man. He enlisted the San Francisco maker community, and built a noisy, carnivalesque, vaudeville-style device, full of bright-colored wood and plastic and metal, to drive around the country and stamp slogans on money.

video:video.video:title: What Happens When The Coroner Leaves?
video:video.video:description: Wired spends some time on the job with bioremediation and hoarding experts, Steri-Clean, Inc. This video may disturb some viewers.

video:video.video:title: Anthony Bourdain Gets Revenge With Jiro!
video:video.video:description: Anthony Bourdain's comic book 'Get Jiro' is every chef's fantasy. If a customer puts ketchup on their eggs, and ruins the chef's creation, they lose their head - literally.

video:video.video:title: Americas Cup: Sir Russell Coutts Interview
video:video.video:description: Sir Russell Coutts explains why Oracle's America's Cup boat has gone from 45 feet to 72 feet. How will the new design effect their chance at the title?

video:video.video:title: At 86, Roger Corman is Still Making Movies
video:video.video:description: Roger Corman is a Hollywood legend. He's made over 350 movies in his lifetime, and he's showing no signs of stopping. We asked him about his latest film, and the art of making movies.

video:video.video:title: In Conversation with Yves Behar
video:video.video:description: Wired Design Editor, Mike Senese, sits with renowned Industrial Designer and founder of fuseproject to talk about design and its impact on society.

video:video.video:title: Rian and Nathan Johnson talk Looper
video:video.video:description: A score composed of "instruments" made from sounds collected on New Orleans streets is just one of the elements that distinguishes Looper from your typical sci-fi action flick.

video:video.video:title: Crafting Dystopia in Looper
video:video.video:description: "We were trying to create a really grounded near-future dystopia," Looper director Rian Johnson tells Wired in our video. Joseph Gordon-Levitt explains how to be Bruce Willis.

video:video.video:title: Skylanders: Inside The Magical Tiki Development Room
video:video.video:description: Game|Life gets an up-close look at the making of Skylanders Giants during a tour of Toys For Bob, the Novato, California-based developer, and its Hawaiian-themed offices.

video:video.video:title: New Tesla Model S
video:video.video:description: Tesla is hard at work on a new suspension setup for the Model S that will make the electric sedan even more of a competent handler and a car aimed squarely at enthusiasts.

video:video.video:title: How to Make Brains!
video:video.video:description: Learn how the professionals make brains. We got the recipe from the makers of Resident Evil Redemption. Mmmmm... delicious!

video:video.video:title: Meet the Puppet Masters Behind War Horse
video:video.video:description: Unlike in Steven Spielberg’s world, where (mostly) a horse is a horse, the “Joey” in the stage production of War Horse is a very intricately hand-crafted puppet that takes three puppeteers to operate at all times.

video:video.video:title: Inside the Mind of Rob Zombie
video:video.video:description: The Lords of Salem just got picked up by Anchor Bay Entertainment at TIFF 2012. We asked Zombie about his work as a film director, a musician, and what he plans to do next.

video:video.video:title: Meet the New Lara Croft
video:video.video:description: After years of secrecy, Camilla Luddington is finally able to come clean about the bruises. It seems she is not as clumsly as people thought, she was just getting roughed up playing the Tomb Raider heroine Lara Croft.

video:video.video:title: Chris Daughtry Wants to be a Hero
video:video.video:description: Musician Chris Daughtry lends his voice to 'We Can Be Heroes', a charity to help relieve famine in Africa.

video:video.video:title: Jason Clarke Stars in Lawless
video:video.video:description: Jason Clarke is a bootlegging Bondurant brother in upcoming film Lawless. In the clip, Clarke reveals the working methods of John Hillcoat and Nick Cave and how high the body count will be in the upcoming film.

video:video.video:title: POV Camera Test
video:video.video:description: A side by side comparison of the GoPro HD HERO2, Contour +, and Ion Air Pro Wifi.

video:video.video:title: Witness Protection Gone Wrong
video:video.video:description: Dax Shepard acts, writes and directs 'Hit and Run'. It's a comedy about witness protection gone wrong.

video:video.video:title: Wired Interviews a Copper
video:video.video:description: New BBC series, Copper, focuses on the 5 Points area of NY just after the Civil War. Wired spoke with the star of the new series, Tom Weston-Jones.

video:video.video:title: What the Cluck? Introducing the Vegan Egg Yolk
video:video.video:description: How to make a vegan egg yolk.

video:video.video:title: Obsessed - A DIY Space Suit for the 99 Percent
video:video.video:description: See how Dr. Cameron M. Smith build a spacesuit from parts purchased at the hardware store.

video:video.video:title: H+ - Computer Glitch Wipes Out Civilization
video:video.video:description: H+ is a Sci-Fi thriller from Bryan Singer. Its somewhat plausible storyline brings humanity to a sudden stop when a computer glitch causes human implants to malfunction. This web only series debuts on YouTube on August 8th, 2012.

video:video.video:title: Behind the Scenes at 'Camp Hunger Games'
video:video.video:description: Filming the 'Hunger Games' wasn't as depressing as you might think. The cast tell us what it was like to be on set and a few embarrsing moments between takes.

video:video.video:title: The Super High-Tech Science Gear on the Mars Rover
video:video.video:description: Senior Scientist at The Exploratorium, Paul Doherty, gives us an in depth look at technology used by the Mars Rover Curiosity.

video:video.video:title: Designing the Perfect Engineer in Prometheus
video:video.video:description: Blockbuster film designer and creature creator Neville Page talks about the unlikely influences he used to create the engineer in Prometheus. Page is currently designing elements of Ridley Scott's new Blade Runner.

video:video.video:title: The Work of Naoya Hatakeyama
video:video.video:description: Japanese photographer Naoya Hatakeyama's work explores the co-mingling of science and nature. Hatakeyama's large-scale color photographs often show landscapes in transition, Wired spoke to him during his 'Natural Stories' exhibit at the SF MOMA.

video:video.video:title: Game|Life - Arcade Rarities Galore
video:video.video:description: The Game|Life video crew spent our weekend at California Extreme, an annual show featuring an insane collection of classic video and pinball games from the heyday of the arcade.

video:video.video:title: Young Creature Designers Face Off
video:video.video:description: The judges from the special-effect make-up reality show Face Off discuss with Wired what's in store in season 3, including a their new judge.

video:video.video:title: Most Dangerous Object in the Office: Solowheel Motorized Unicycle
video:video.video:description: Check out the Solowheel Motorized Unicycle in action.

video:video.video:title: How Adam Rogers Can Save Comic-Con -- with Math
video:video.video:description: Hey Comic-Con, if you want to stay in San Diego, listen to what Adam Rogers has to say...

video:video.video:title: RZA is the Man with the Iron Fists
video:video.video:description: RZA talks his love for Kung Fu movies and directorial debut.

video:video.video:title: Avengers: Item 47
video:video.video:description: The creators and actors of the Avenger Short: Item 47, talk about the concept of being outside the avenger universe, yet still being apart of it.

video:video.video:title: Comics Go Digital in the DC World
video:video.video:description: No torn edges here! Digital Design Director, Tim Leong shows us the DC Comics Digital book booth and gives us a peek at the new manner you can read you favorite comics.

video:video.video:title: Battle of the Action Figures - Who Will Win?
video:video.video:description: Senior Editor Adam Rogers takes a look at the action figure displays of both Marvel and DC and asks the question, who made the better battle display?

video:video.video:title: Exclusive: Frankenweenie Gets a New Life on Screen
video:video.video:description: Tim Burton talks about his new film Frankenweenie.

video:video.video:title: Exclusive: Iron Man 3 Costume
video:video.video:description: Wired gets an exclusive look at the Iron Man 3 costume.

video:video.video:title: Dragon Dice - Comic-Con 2012
video:video.video:description: Going analog, Senior Editor Peter Rubin, showcases his favorite game - Dragon Dice.

video:video.video:title: Comic-Con Takes It Outside
video:video.video:description: One of the poor souls who couldn't get a ticket? If you're in the San Diego area, you can still check out the free outdoor festivities. Wired's Digital Design Director shows us a few highlights.

video:video.video:title: Comic-Con 2012 Kevin Smith
video:video.video:description: Kevin Smith talks Comic-Con, pop culture, and mainstreaming online.

video:video.video:title: Doctor Who Cast Stops By The Wired Cafe
video:video.video:description: We chat with the cast of Doctor Who on US response to the show, who they're most excited to see, and much more!

video:video.video:title: Stan Lee Stops By The Wired Cafe
video:video.video:description: We chat with Stan Lee about the characters he helped create and his latest ventures.

video:video.video:title: Wired Cafe Chat With Morgan Spurlock
video:video.video:description: We sat down with Morgan Spurlock to talk his new documentary: Comic-Con Episode IV: A New Hope.Wired video team: Annaliza Savage, producer; John Ross and Mike Ruocco, camera; and Fernando Cardoso, editors.

video:video.video:title: Comic-Con 2012: Small Press Area
video:video.video:description: Indie makers show their goods at Comic-Con 2012.

video:video.video:title: Total Recall - Costumes and Ride
video:video.video:description: Senior Editor Peter Rubin gets an up close look at the new gear Colin Farell and co. uses in the adapted version of "We Can Remember It for You Wholesale"

video:video.video:title: Hurricane Hunters Fly into the Eye of the Storm for Science--and TV
video:video.video:description: Hurricane Hunters Fly into the Eye of the Storm for Science--and TV

video:video.video:title: Most Dangerous Object in the Office: Ara Safety Pro
video:video.video:description: The Ara Safety Pro is like the do-gooder offspring of a fire extinguisher and a smoke grenade. Just pull the pin and toss the 9-pound projectile directly into the blaze.

video:video.video:title: Comic-Con 2012 - Do I Really Need To Check-In My Proton Pack?
video:video.video:description: And we're off! Comic-Con is just starting and if we're to judge by this video, already super awesome! Check out a glimpse of whats to come...

video:video.video:title: Zik Headphones
video:video.video:description: These wireless, noise-canceling headphones from Parrot (yes, the same people who brought you the quad-copter you control with your iPhone) are packed with multiple sensors: capacitive surfaces, different types of microphones and an NFC chip.

video:video.video:title: The Man With The Iron Fists
video:video.video:description: In feudal China, a blacksmith who makes weapons for a small village is put in the position where he must defend himself and his fellow villagers.

video:video.video:title: A Look at the Develpment of Giro Helmets
video:video.video:description: Engineering Manager Rob Wesson, gives us a inside look on Giro's latest helmet design

video:video.video:title: Author Gives Away DeLorean (with Flux Capacitor)
video:video.video:description: Ready Player One author, Ernest Cline, discusses his book, video games, 80s pop culture and a DeLorean giveaway.

video:video.video:title: Awesome Gadgets That Run Off Your Car's Cigarette Lighter
video:video.video:description: Whether you're camping, road-tripping, or simply living in your van, there's no replacement for the convenience of dashboard-powered gadgetry. So sit down with Wired's David Kravets, and enjoy a properly blended margarita.

video:video.video:title: 3 Noise-Cancelling Headphones Tested and Rated
video:video.video:description: We look at a few new pairs of noise-blocking cans -- AKG's K495 NC, the MM 550-X from Sennheiser, and the budget-minded Atmos headphones from Rocketfish.

video:video.video:title: Super Squirtgun Will Soak You
video:video.video:description: Just in time for summer, these new powerful squirtguns from Nerf will get your opponent soaked at long range.

video:video.video:title: Autopia - Magic Mercedes
video:video.video:description: Just when you think the most simplistic, mundane bits of a vehicle can’t be improved, they surprise. Such is with the 2013 Mercedes-Benz SL550 Roadster, which packs more user-facing technology than this week’s latest which packs more user-facing tech

video:video.video:title: E3 2012: Hitman - Absolution
video:video.video:description: Square-Enix offers refined mechanics, accessibility, and a new points system in its latest addition to the Hitman series.

video:video.video:title: E3 2012: Transformers: Fall of Cybertron
video:video.video:description: Transformers: Fall of Cybertron offers an original story, new characters, and all new multiplayer features.

video:video.video:title: E3 2012: Sleeping Dogs
video:video.video:description: Square Enix presents Sleeping Dogs, an open world crime drama set in the city of Hong Kong.

video:video.video:title: E3 2012: The Amazing Spider-Man
video:video.video:description: Swing through Manhattan as Spider-Man with refined controls and new camera angles in The Amazing Spider-Man.

video:video.video:title: E3 2012: Injustice - Gods Among Us
video:video.video:description: Play as your favorite DC superheroes in Netherream Studios' Mortal Kombat style fighting game.

video:video.video:title: E3 2012: Darksiders II
video:video.video:description: Play as Death in this unique action/adventure installment of the Darksiders series.

video:video.video:title: E3 2012: XCOM - Enemy Unknown
video:video.video:description: 2K Games revives its classic strategy role playing game with the release of XCOM: Enemy Unknown.

video:video.video:title: E3 2012: Call of Duty - Black Ops 2
video:video.video:description: Set in 2025, Call of Duty: Black Ops 2 sets you up against terrorists with seriously high tech weapons.

video:video.video:title: E3 2012: Metro - Last Light
video:video.video:description: Defend yourself against mutants as one post apocalyptic Moscow’s last remaining survivors in Metro: Last Light’s crafted single player experience.

video:video.video:title: E3 2012: Rock Band - Blitz
video:video.video:description: In Rock Band: Blitz, Harmonix Music Systems takes away the instruments to present an all-new arcade-style addition to the Rock Band series.

video:video.video:title: Robotic worm crawls through simple obstacle course.
video:video.video:description: Robotic worm crawls through simple obstacle course.

video:video.video:title: Wired Bike Camp: Day 4
video:video.video:description: A look back at the final day of Wired Bike Camp and some footage that was left on the cutting room floor.

video:video.video:title: Wired Bike Camp: Day 3
video:video.video:description: Worng Turns, False Flats, Give Wired Bike Team Some Fresh Challenges

video:video.video:title: How to Build a Trebuchet
video:video.video:description: My son had to build a trebuchet for a school science project. It turned into a case of trial and error -- and error. -- Adam Savage

video:video.video:title: Autopia - Lit Motors C1
video:video.video:description: San Francisco based Lit Motors presents their fully electric motorcycle the C1. Autopia Editor Damon Lavrinc takes a look at a prototype vehicle that may revolutionize how we commute.

video:video.video:title: Adam Savage: Build a Hovercraft With Your Kids
video:video.video:description: Hover your way across the room with this homemade GeekDad hovercraft.

video:video.video:title: Wired Bike Camp: Day 2
video:video.video:description: Through Cows, Wind and Drive-Bys, Wired Bike Team Plows Through All Obstacles.

video:video.video:title: Wired Design at ICFF 2012
video:video.video:description: Wired Design takes a look at the innovative projects at this years ICFF in New York City

video:video.video:title: Wired Bike Camp: Day 1
video:video.video:description: "Hey you guys ride bikes?!" Welcome to Wired Bike Camp: Day 1Wired's Bike Team tackles Nothern California's tough terrain.

video:video.video:title: 3D Printing's Future
video:video.video:description: Ceo of 3DSystems Abe Reichental and a couple of aspiring 3D engineers discuss the future place and capabilities of 3D Printing.

video:video.video:title: 20.06 Most Dangerous Object in the Office: Wicked Lasers Torch
video:video.video:description: 20.06 Most Dangerous Object in the Office: Wicked Lasers Torch. Let's Burn Ants! (No animals were harmed in the making of this video; humans however, were)

video:video.video:title: Make Your Own Action Figure
video:video.video:description: At this year's Maker Faire we found a booth that lets you make your own action figure with 56 cameras and Autodesk software 123D catch. You can also do it with a single camera at: www.123Dapp.com/catch

video:video.video:title: Make Your Own Halo Army
video:video.video:description: These model makers bring their skills to new heights with larger than life wearable armour, which were recently used in a Halo fan film. We find out how they do it.

video:video.video:title: Exclusive: Industrial Light & Magic Makes Hulk Smash!
video:video.video:description: Wired visits Industrial Light & Magic to see how they made the special effects magic behind 'The Avengers.'

video:video.video:title: Cameron Wants You to Adopt 5D
video:video.video:description: James Cameron wants everyone to adopt 5D, a term coined by the film and television industry to describe shooting 2D and 3D simultaneously. We caught up with him at NAB recently and asked him why?

video:video.video:title: How to Become a Master Archer Like Katniss Everdeen
video:video.video:description: Want to survive the Hunger Games? No problem. Here are a few pro tips that will keep you in the game. It's all about getting the right equipment and having the correct form.

video:video.video:title: The M Machine's iPad-Controlled 'M' Machine
video:video.video:description: San Francisco electronic group The M Machine built a giant illuminated "M" to sit on stage while they play. The "M" is controlled by a laptop and iPad during shows.

video:video.video:title: The Making of the Wired DesignLogo at TechShop, SF
video:video.video:description: The Making of the Wired Design Logo at TechShop, SF

video:video.video:title: ferrofluid | High Speed Ferrofluid 2
video:video.video:description: ferrofluid | High Speed Ferrofluid 2

video:video.video:title: Esprit de Corps at SXSW 2012
video:video.video:description: Esprit de Corps brings a Reggae love vibe to SXSW 2012.

video:video.video:title: Gerber Multi-Plier 600 DET
video:video.video:description: The D.E.T. tool, based on the popular Multi-Pler 600 provides the combat operator with a compact one-handed opening multi-tool to deal with a number of battlefield situations.

video:video.video:title: Flosstradamus Reveal Their Secrets
video:video.video:description: Flosstradamus shows Wired how to make electronic music.

video:video.video:title: El-P Drops Cancer for Cure at SXSW
video:video.video:description: EL-P talks about his new album which features Killer Mike, Danny Brown, and Mr. Muthafuckin' eXquire. Cancer for Cure comes out on May 22nd on Fat Possom Records.

video:video.video:title: A True Bionic Limb Remains Far Out of Reach
video:video.video:description: A True Bionic Limb Remains Far Out of Reach

video:video.video:title: Danger Room Video Ops: Spencer Ackerman Zapped by 'Pain Ray'
video:video.video:description: Wired.com senior writer Spencer Ackerman volunteered to step in front of the military's microwave pain ray. The unconventional weapon, known as the Active Denial System, fried Ackerman from 750 meters away without so much as a flash or bang.

video:video.video:title: Rite in the Rain All Weather Notebook
video:video.video:description: A peek at 2 all-weather notebooks from Rite in the Rain.

video:video.video:title: Kinect Makes Yelling At Mass Effect 3 Actually Work
video:video.video:description: Casey Hudson, Executive Producer of the Mass Effect series walks us through the voice-activated controls in Mass Effect 3.

video:video.video:title: Southern Grind Granddaddy
video:video.video:description: Bowie style knife with an overall length of 16-7/8". The blade itself is 11" and has a 5-3/4" black micarta handle with the Southern Grind logo laser etched on the micarta.

video:video.video:title: Most Dangerous Object in the Office: North Face Avalanche Airbag Safety System Backpack
video:video.video:description: No matter the danger&mash;a torrent of gizmos or an avalanche of snow—this North Face system will have your back (Saint Bernard and brandy not included).

video:video.video:title: Galaxy Note Video Review
video:video.video:description: Wired product reviews editor Michael Calore looks at the Galaxy Note from Samsung.

video:video.video:title: First Look: Red Scarlet-X Camera
video:video.video:description: Jon Snyder shot this video on the Red Scarlet-X Camera, a slightly simplified version of the rigs Peter Jackson used to film his Lord of the Rings prequel.

video:video.video:title: Hack, Slash and Chop Your Way to Safety
video:video.video:description: Worried about the impending zombie apocalypse? Well have no fear, Gerber's survival gear is here. We check out two machetes and an axe that will not only help prevent your brains from being digested, but also make camping a whole lot easier.

video:video.video:title: Most Dangerous Object in the Office: Pocket Artillery Mini Cannon
video:video.video:description: Check out the Pocket Artillery Mini Cannon in action.

video:video.video:title: Headphone Wars
video:video.video:description: With so many headphones on the market, it cab be hard to choose. With a price tag of $300+ on some of these headphones, you'd be wise to shop around. We asked Dr. Dre, 50 Cent and Ludacris and a few others to clear up the the matter.

video:video.video:title: Dark Energy Camera Under Construction
video:video.video:description: Dark Energy Camera Under Construction

video:video.video:title: Survive the Zombie Apocalypse
video:video.video:description: Worried about the zombie apocalypse, earthquakes or government take-over? No problem, these guys have everything you need to survive Armageddon.

video:video.video:title: High School Debate at 350 wpm
video:video.video:description: A nerdy high school competition has morphed into a nonsensical exercise in high-speed talking.

video:video.video:title: CES 2012 Reflections
video:video.video:description: As Wired's Gadget Lab reporters prepare for one final day of CES coverage, they take time to reflect on the most noteworthy trends and products they’ve covered at the show so far.

video:video.video:title: CES 2012: 50 Cent Touts SMS Audio's Sync Headphones
video:video.video:description: We talk to 50 Cent about his latest line of headphones, the wireless SMS Syncs. These cans feature a built-in EQ and utilize Kleer technology for wireless audio.

video:video.video:title: CES 2012: The $30,000 iPod Dock
video:video.video:description: The iNuke Boom from Behringer weighs 700 pounds and can pump out an almost illegal amount of decibels.

video:video.video:title: CES 2012: Ion Audio's iPad-Integrated Musical Instruments
video:video.video:description: Ion Audio shows off the Piano Apprentice and Guitar Apprentice at CES Unveiled. These instruments feature an iPad dock and light up keys (or frets) that allow even a tone-deaf novice to learn piano, guitar or even drums.

video:video.video:title: Experiment Aims for Signal Emitted During Birth of Universe
video:video.video:description: A look inside the EBEX project, an experiment designed to detect a faint signal generated just after the birth of the universe. If successful, this signal could be a huge step toward achieving the "holy grail" of physics: a grand unified theory.

video:video.video:title: Most Dangerous Object in the Office: AeroShot Pure Energy
video:video.video:description: A quick powdery blast of vitamin B, niacin, and caffeine courtesy of Breathable Foods could be just the (legal) pick-me-up you need.

video:video.video:title: The Ryan Lochte Scandal Explained in 90 Seconds
video:video.video:description: What led to four major sponsors dropping one of the world's most decorated Olympic swimmers?

video:video.video:title: Most Dangerous Object in the Office: Mo-Tool Ax
video:video.video:description: Brook & Hunter’s Mo-Tool is quite a monstrosity, but you can’t frown on it forever -- it has an ax!

video:video.video:title: DIY Tesla Coils Will Shoot 260-Foot Lightning Bolt
video:video.video:description: Engineer and inventor Greg Leyh tells us about his new Kickstarter project -- constructing two 10-story Tesla coils designed to create a lightning bolt 260 feet long.

video:video.video:title: Sculptor Uses iPhone to Control 40-Foot Woman
video:video.video:description: Marco Cochrane is the sculptor of the 40-foot-high "Bliss Dance" sculpture, created on Treasure Island in the San Francisco Bay. We head to his studio to see how he built this massive, beautiful structure.

video:video.video:title: Most Dangerous Object in the Office: Cyborg Crampons
video:video.video:description: These stainless steel cleats will will grip rock, ice, particleboard—whatever cubicle wall that blocks your path.

video:video.video:title: Wired Interviews Chickensaurus Paleontologist Jack Horner
video:video.video:description: Wired Senior Editor Adam Rogers interviews Regents Professor of Paleontology Jack Horner. Horner argues that chickens are the direct descendants of dinosaurs.

video:video.video:title: Take Your Party to the Park
video:video.video:description: We review two products you can use to put the brakes on your work day no matter where you are -- a travel hammock and a pressurized travel bottle that protects your carbonated beverage of choice.

video:video.video:title: A Tribute to Steve Jobs
video:video.video:description: A Tribute to Steve Jobs

video:video.video:title: Bounce Yourself Into Shape With the Bellicon Trampoline
video:video.video:description: The Bellicon mini trampoline isn't an ordinary trampoline -- it uses individual bungee cords to attach the jumpnig surface to the metal frame, creating an impact-absorbing surface thats great for exercise.

video:video.video:title: Most Dangerous Object in the Office: Lee Production Pot IV Electric Melter
video:video.video:description: Some people use the Lee Production Pot metal melter to make bullets. Wired's editors are pleased with their hand-forged paper clips.

video:video.video:title: Somali Pirates Aboard Yasa Neslihan
video:video.video:description: Producer/Editor: Annaliza Savage Camera: Somali Pirates

video:video.video:title: This Computerized Power Tool Turns You Into a Master Woodworker
video:video.video:description: You may not think of yourself as an excellent craftsman, but the new computer-guided Shaper Origin woodworking tool can change that.

video:video.video:title: Most Dangerous Object in the Office: Supreme Products Pocket Chain Saw
video:video.video:description: Set the office a-chattering when you whip out this 4-ounce human-powered chain saw. Then set that leg on your office chair straight.

video:video.video:title: Justin Timberlake and Amanda Seyfried Talk In Time
video:video.video:description: Stars from Andrew Niccol's latest Sci-Fi thriller explain the plot.

video:video.video:title: Director And Lead Ape Talk About Rise Of Planet of the Apes
video:video.video:description: Andy Serkis and Rupert Wyatt stopped by the Wired Cafe at Comic Con in San Diego to talk about the new film and how it's been updated for today'saudience.

video:video.video:title: Most Dangerous Object in the Office: FlashFog Tiger 1500 X2 Fog Generator
video:video.video:description: A killer party or a killer instinct? A blanket of fog and blinding strobe lights await thieves caught by FlashFog's Tiger.

video:video.video:title: Most Dangerous Object in the Office: Garden Games Outdoor Darts
video:video.video:description: Outdoor Darts isn't for the faint of heart.

video:video.video:title: Most Dangerous Object in the Office: Superior Hiwheel Bicycle
video:video.video:description: Nobody said going retro would be safe. Check out Rideable Bicycle Replicas' 4-foot-high bike, which we've been careering around the office hallways.

video:video.video:title: The Workplace Can Be a Dangerous Place
video:video.video:description: Here at the Wired offices, we take things very seriously. Correction, we take protecting our desk domains and sneak attacking coworkers very seriously, so we decided to put some different office warfare gadgets to the test.

video:video.video:title: Most Dangerous Object in the Office: CRY-AC-3 Liquid Nitrogen Dispenser
video:video.video:description: Fill the CRY-AC-3's canister with liquid nitrogen and pull the trigger. Then just chill.

video:video.video:title: Most Dangerous Object in the Office: Mushroom Box Mini Growing System
video:video.video:description: Check out what happens when you use this DIY kit to grow foodie fungi, or anything else you might want to dream up.

video:video.video:title: Olivia Wilde Wants The World To Be a Better Place
video:video.video:description: Not only is Olivia Wilde a talented actress, she's also an ardent activist. Artists for Peace and Justice is providing relief for Haiti by funding primary and secondary schools. Ms. Wilde says education is the key to alleviating poverty.

video:video.video:title: Ludacris - Not Blowing Smoke - With New Headphones
video:video.video:description: Seems like everyone is bringing out their own line of headphones these day. Entering into the fray is Ludacris. We asked Ludacris about his 'Soul' line of headphones, which come out in Spring 2011.

video:video.video:title: Cal Stadium Quake Retrofit
video:video.video:description: The rift under UC Berkeley's arena has been called a tectonic time bomb. Here's the university's $321 million retrofit plan.

video:video.video:title: Interview with James Cameron
video:video.video:description: James Cameron has been telling stories for decades. Wired.com sat down with him to talk about his pioneering techniques, and why digital effects don't matter as much as storytelling.

video:video.video:title: Most Dangerous Object in the Office: GreenSteam Weed Killer
video:video.video:description: Check out the propane-powered weed killer that blasts 930-degree steam to wipe out most anything in its path.

video:video.video:title: Most Dangerous Object in the Office: Shomer-Tec Sap Cap
video:video.video:description: A pound of tiny metal balls hidden inside Shomer-Tec's normal-looking baseball cap turns it into the ultimate stealth cudgel.

video:video.video:title: Gadget Lab: All About Facebook Home
video:video.video:description: Gadget Lab: All About Facebook Home

video:video.video:title: Dexter to Tie Up Loose Ends This Season
video:video.video:description: The duplicitous Dexter is an excellent serial killer. How will he stay one step ahead of the cops, and himself? David Zayas (Sgt. Angel Batista) tells us what to expect in Dexter, season 5.

video:video.video:title: Dangerous Object: Hallmark Dummy Launcher
video:video.video:description: Hallmark Dummy Launcher is a duck gun used for training hunting dogs. The gun uses blank ammunition to blast a fake duck 50 to 80 yards so the dog can practice retrieving it.

video:video.video:title: Dangerous Object: Red Snap'r Fence Electrifier
video:video.video:description: The Red Snap'r fence electrifier is designed to dispense 5,000 volts to wayward livestock. Wired editors use it to protect their desk accessories.

video:video.video:title: 'Give Zombies a Chance,' Says Walking Dead Creator
video:video.video:description: Robert Kirkman, creator of the Walking Dead comic book series brings zombies to TV. We ask him why he thinks zombies are the new vampires.

video:video.video:title: Freddie Krueger Speaks Out
video:video.video:description: Actor Jackie Earl Haley discusses his role in A Nightmare on Elm Street, the reboot that returned it to its own dark origins. Haley also says playing Rorschach in Watchmen changed his personality.

video:video.video:title: Del Toro Will Make You Afraid of the Dark!
video:video.video:description: Guillermo Del Toro talks about the update of the 70's TV classic 'Don't be Afraid of the Dark'. Since there is no swearing, nudity or graphic violence, Del Toro says the film got an R Rating for being"too scary".

video:video.video:title: Sex is Rough for Thomas Jane in Hung
video:video.video:description: What is it like to play a male prostitute on TV? We asked Thomas Jane from Hung, who says having sex in front of 150 crew members is about as fun as wrapping dead fish.

video:video.video:title: Most Dangerous Object in the Office: Orion Flare Gun
video:video.video:description: Wired staffers contemplate resorting to the black powder and strontium nitrate-filled Orion Flare Gun to get their coworkers' attention.

video:video.video:title: Dangerous Object: Hitachi Spline-Shank Rotary Hammer
video:video.video:description: It's a chore to stand up and crane your neck whenever you want to see what's going on in the world outside your cubicle. But thanks to this mini jackhammer, we don't have that problem anymore.

video:video.video:title: Super Mario Galaxy 2 Trailer
video:video.video:description: Super Mario Galaxy 2 Trailer

video:video.video:title: Splicing Human DNA Leads to 'Terrible, Terrible Things'
video:video.video:description: When two ambitious scientists cross human and animal DNA, a new creature evolves. Director Vincenzo Natali takes horror to places most film makers are afraid to, in his new movie, Splice.

video:video.video:title: Tesla-Powered Band Electrifies Maker Faire
video:video.video:description: Wired.com checks out ArcAttack's musical Tesla-coil performance at Maker Faire 2010.

video:video.video:title: Kin One Is Great for Rich Tweens
video:video.video:description: Kin One Is Great for Rich Tweens

video:video.video:title: Zombie Bashing and Other Apps for the iPad
video:video.video:description: Zombie Bashing and Other Apps for the iPad

video:video.video:title: What is Inside a Winning Battle Bot
video:video.video:description: What is Inside a Winning Battle Bot

video:video.video:title: Diddy and Dre Make Monster Beats
video:video.video:description: Music-industry heavy hitters Dr. Dre, Diddy and Jimmy Iovine, chairman of Interscope-Geffen-A&M, discuss a new line of Beats by Dr. Dre headphones, Diddy Beats.

video:video.video:title: The Spy Next Door Trailer
video:video.video:description: The Spy Next Door Trailer

video:video.video:title: How to Tap a Keg and Master a Perfect Pour
video:video.video:description: The owner of San Francisco's City Beer Store demonstrates how not to look like a schmuck while tapping a keg of beer. To top it off, she shows how to master the perfect pour with just the right amount of foam.

video:video.video:title: How to Build a Kegerator
video:video.video:description: With the right tools and a little time, you too can have cold beer always available in the comfort of your home (or office). Wired.com demonstrates how to build your very own kegerator.

video:video.video:title: Kristen Bell on Robot Emotion in Astro Boy
video:video.video:description: Kristen Bell stopped by the Wired Cafe at Comic-Con to discuss her upcoming lead role as the brand new character 'Cora' in 'Astro Boy'.

video:video.video:title: Street Portrait Photo How To
video:video.video:description: Photographer Clay Enos goes from shooting super heroes on the set of Watchmen to taking random street portraits. He shows us how to do a street-studio portrait session with a sheet of white paper, some tape, and a camera.

video:video.video:title: DJ Deadmau5 Is a Gear Head
video:video.video:description: DJ and producer, Deadmau5 (pronounced Dead Mouse), talks shop with Wired.com. His secret weapon? The Monome.

video:video.video:title: Behind the Scenes with J.J. Abrams
video:video.video:description: Wired magazine teams up with J.J. Abrams for the May issue. Look in on the creative process with J.J. and the edit and design teams.

video:video.video:title: Trip-Hop Pioneer Tricky: Sweet and Naive
video:video.video:description: Tricky, of Massive Attack fame, shows Wired.com the ropes on becoming a musician and producer.

video:video.video:description: Trash Foils Diamond Heist

video:video.video:title: The Toxic Cloud-Emitting Portable Dry Ice Maker
video:video.video:description: The Toxic Cloud-Emitting Portable Dry Ice Maker in action.

video:video.video:title: Chef Ferran Adria of El Bulli
video:video.video:description: Ferran Adria on why the knife is the most essential tool in your kitchen.

video:video.video:title: How To Make Wired Origami
video:video.video:description: Robert Lang explains how to fold the Wired issue 16.07 origami splash page.

video:video.video:title: Clover Coffee Machine
video:video.video:description: Wired.com takes a look at the 'Clover', an $11,000 coffee machine hand-built by Stanford engineers.
